en: In a word-association test, if you said ‘hut’, the first type would produce a string of synonyms, antonyms, and other substitutions:‘cabin’, ‘hovel’, ‘palace’, ‘den’, ‘burrow’.

zh: 另外一类联想即是那些可以和 hut组合在一起，从而形成潜在序列的成分： burnt out（烧掉了）,is a poor little house（是一间小破房）等等。
en: The other type would offer elements which combine with ‘hut’, forming potential sequences: ‘burnt out’, ‘is a poor little house’.

zh: 雅可布森进一步指出，这两类混乱相当于两种修辞手段隐喻和换喻。
en: Jakobson goes on to point out that the two disorders correspond to two figures of speech – metaphor and metonymy.

zh: 有意思的是，人们现在还不清楚人类的心理分析器是否运用这种回溯策略或并行策略来处理歧义，抑或两种策略并用，或用另外的某种策略。
en: Interestingly, it is not established within psycholinguistics whether the human parser uses backtracking or parallelism to deal with ambiguity, or perhaps a combination, or some alternative strategy.

zh: 这对心理语言学家而言仍然是难题。
en: This remains a challenge for psycholinguists.

zh: 而解决这个难题却是很困难的，因为人们通常很容易处理歧义，理解说话人想要表达的意义。我们现在也没有见到很多证据证明人们需要做许多额外的工作来处理其他可能的意义。
en: Figuring this out is difficult because people usually handle ambiguity and arrive at the intended meaning easily, and we do not see much evidence that they are doing lots of extra work to deal with additional possible meanings.

zh: 哈姆雷特正在装疯卖傻，他拒绝“如实地”回答波洛涅斯的问题。
en: Hamlet, who is feigning insanity, refuses to answer Polonius’s questions “in good faith.”

zh: 他违反了某些会话的规约，或者说会话准则。
en: He has violated certain conversational conventions, or maxims of conversation.

zh: 最先讨论这些准则的是英国哲学家H .保罗•格莱斯，因此有时也被称为“格莱斯准则”。
en: These maxims were first discussed by the British philosopher H. Paul Grice and are sometimes called Gricean Maxims.

zh: 新批评家勇敢地打破了伟人文学论；他们坚持，作者写作时的意图即使可以被发现，也与解释他或她的作品毫不相干。
en: The New Critics broke boldly with the Great Man theory of literature, insisting that the author's intentions in writing, even if they could be recovered, were of no relevance to the interpretation of his or her text.

zh: 同样，特定读者的感情反应也不应与诗的意义混为一谈：诗意味着它所意味的东西，并不在乎诗人的意图或者读者由之获得的主观感情。
en: Neither were the emotional responses of particular readers to be confused with the poem's meaning: the poem meant what it meant, regardless of the poet's intentions or the subjective feelings the reader derived from it.

zh: 意义是公开的和客观的，它是携刻在组成文学作品的那些语言之上；意义既不是一个去世已久的作者头脑中的某些被人假定的、幻影般的冲动，也不是一个读者可能附会到他的文字上去的武断的、一己的会解(significance)。
en: Meaning was public and objective, inscribed in the very language of the literary text, not a question of some putative ghostly impulse in a long-dead author's head, or the arbitrary private significances a reader might attach to his words.

zh: 在不合语法规范的失语症患者的言语中，功能词的任务表明，这类词与名词这样的实词在心理上是不同的。
en: The omission of function words in the speech of agrammatic aphasics shows that this class of words is mentally distinct from content words like nouns.

zh: 同样的现象在获得性诵读困难中也有发现。
en: A similar phenomenon has been observed in acquired dyslexia.

zh: 病人能够说出之前用过的语言替换词，但却不合文法，而且根本无法读懂功能词。
en: The patient who produced the semantic substitutions cited previously was also agrammatic and was not able to read function words at all.

zh: 直到几十年前，人们还认为语言“只属于人类——其他事物未必适用”。
en: Until a few decades ago, language was strictly “humans only—others need not apply.”

zh: 而现在，计算机进行语言处理已经司空见惯。
en: Today, it is common for computers to process language.

zh: 计算语言学是语言学和计算机科学的分支学科，研究人类语言和计算机之间的相互作用。
en: Computational linguistics is a subfield of linguistics and computer science that is concerned with the interactions of human language and computers.

zh: 计算语音学和计算音系学关心两件事：第一件事是使用计算机程序把言语信号分析成为语音成分和音位成分。
en: The two sides of computational phonetics and phonology are speech recognition and speech synthesis.

zh: 第二件事是把准确的信号发送到电子扬声器中，这样它就能够清晰地发出该语言的语音并将这些语音组合成语素和词。
en: Speech recognition is the process of analyzing the speech signal into its component phones and phonemes, and producing, in effect, a phonetic transcription of the speech.

zh: 第一件事称为言语识别，第二件事称为言语合成。
en: Further processing may convert the transcription into ordinary text for output on a screen, or into words and phrases for further processing, as in a speech understanding application.

zh: 就神经系统而论，我们现在想要提出的看法是每个稳定平衡都由一个确定条件组合所决定，说得恰当一些，由条件的情境所决定。
en: In the case of the neural system we are trying to suggest each stable poise has been determined by a definite set, or better, context of conditions.

zh: 这个情境的从属关系相当于距离固体某一面的相近性。
en: Membership of this context is what corresponds to nearness to a facet.

zh: 情境的部分恢复促使神经系统作出的反应仿佛出现了实际上并不存在的条件，这就是记忆的基本原理。
en: The partial return of the context causes the system to behave as though conditions were present which are not, and this is what is essential in memory.

zh: 人们阅读不同类型的文字时的神经元活动模式提供了另外的证据。
en: Additional evidence regarding hemispheric specialization is drawn from Japanese readers.

zh: 例如，日语有两套文字。
en: The Japanese language has two main writing systems.

zh: 一套是假名，它以日语的语音系统为基础，每个符号对应着一个音节。
en: One system, kana, is based on the sound system of the language; each symbol corresponds to a syllable.

zh: 最终被揭示的是一个结构的模子，它可以被缩减成一个句子，甚至一个词。
en: What will ultimately be uncovered is a structural ‘matrix’, which can be reduced to a single sentence or even a single word.

zh: 这个模子只能间接地被缩减，并不实际以一个词或一个陈述出现在诗中。
en: The matrix can be deduced only indirectly and is not actually present as a word or statement in the poem.

zh: 诗歌通过这个模子实际的种种表述，即人们熟悉的陈述、套话、引语或习俗的联想等多种形式，与这个模子联系在一起。
en: The poem is connected to its matrix by actual versions of the matrix in the form of familiar statements, clichés, quotations, or conventional associations.

zh: 这些表述被称作“假设纲要”(hypograms)。
en: These versions are called ‘hypograms’.

zh: 我的意思并不是说，文学不稳定是因为价值判断具有“主观性”。
en: I do not mean that it is unstable because value-judgements are 'subjective'.

zh: 根据这种看法，世界分为“外在于彼”的坚固事实——例如中央大车站一一和“内在于此”的任意的价值判断——例如爱吃香蕉或者认为叶芝(Yeats)之诗的语调是从防御性的威赫转为坚韧的屈从。
en: According to this view, the world is divided between solid facts 'out there' like Grand Central station, and arbitrary value-judgements 'in here' such as liking bananas or feeling that the tone of a Yeats poem veers from defensive hectoring to grimly resilient resignation.

zh: 事实是公开的和无可怀疑的，价值则是一己的和无缘无故的。
en: Facts are public and unimpeachable, values are private and gratuitous.

zh: 正如你能看见的那样，索引也许用途有限，因为它是“未经加工的”。
en: A concordance, as you can see, might be of limited usefulness because of its “raw” nature.

zh: 改进索引的一个方法就是使用搭配分析。
en: A way to refine a concordance is through collocation analysis.

zh: 搭配是指两个或多个词在语料库中出现时，它们彼此间的空间距离很小。
en: A collocation is the occurrence of two or more words within a short space of each other in a corpus.

zh: 普罗提诺在讨论人类如何感受神的流溢这个问题时，公然摒弃了把感觉当作印刻在被动心灵上的“痕迹”或“图印”的概念，代之以这样一种看法：心灵是一种行动，一种力量，它“从自身释放出光芒”投射在感知对象上。
en: In discussing the human perception of the divine overflow, Plotinus explicitly rejected the concept of sensations as 'imprints' or (seal-impressions, made on a passive mind, and substituted the view of the mind as an act and power which 'gives a radiance out of its own store' to the objects of sense.

zh: 关于心灵的类似比喻在“剑桥柏拉图主义者”（其实说“普罗提诺主义者”比“柏拉图主义者”更合适）的哲学中尤为流行。他们的著述华兹华斯读过，柯尔律治更是研究精深。
en: Similar metaphors of mind were particularly prevalent in the philosophy of the 'Cambridge Platonists' (more Plotinists, actually, than Platonists) whom Wordsworth had read, and Coleridge had studied intensively.

zh: 批评理论所必须依据的两大支柱便是价值的记述和交流的记述。
en: The two pillars upon which a theory of criticism  must rest are an account of value and an account of communication.

zh: 我们并未充分认识我们的经验中有多大部分采取了现有的形式，因为我们是社会性动物，而且从幼年起便习惯于交流。
en: We do not sufficiently realize how great a part of our experience takes the form it does, because we are social beings and accustomed to communication from infancy.

zh: 我们的思维感受方式中有许多得之于父母和他人，这固然是老生常谈。
en: That we acquire many of our ways of thinking and feeling from parents and others is, of course, a commonplace.

zh: 经济学家追求“效用”，数理哲学家研究“点”和“时”、生物学家探索“生命原理”，他们的奋斗以及心理分析学家对“里比多”和“集体无意识”的探险都是说明问题的实例。
en: The struggles of economists with ‘utility’, of mathematical philosophers with ‘points’ and ‘instants’, of biologists with ‘entelechies’, ‘and the adventures of psycho-analysts with ‘the libido’ and ‘the collective unconscious’ are instances in point.

zh: 目前尤其理论心理学大多是以为我所用的态度去处理相似的怀疑对象。
en: At present theoretical psychology in particular is largely made up of the manipulation of similar suspects.

zh: 判断的行为，表述的关系，直觉意识，直接审视，意志，感觉，臆断，接受，这些不过是为了便于论述而引入的少数几个暂时性的终极概念。
en: The Act of Judgement, the relation of Presentation, Immediate Awareness, Direct Inspection, the Will, Feeling, Assumption, Acceptance, are only a few of the provisional ultimates introduced for convenience of discussion.

zh: 其中有一些可能最后证明是不可缺少的，不过同时它们在严谨的人眼中无 非是方便的符号工具而巳，不能允许以此为据的理论学说与探究园地隔绝开来，而后者可能使我们大有收获。
en: Some of them may in the end prove to be indispensable, but meanwhile they are not, to prudent people, more than symbolic conveniences; theories dependent upon them must not be allowed to shut off from investigation fields which may be fruitful.

zh: 诠释学在德国的最新发展以“接受美学”或“接受理论”而著称。
en: The most recent development of hermeneutics in Germany is known as 'reception aesthetics' or 'reception theory'.

zh: 与加答默尔不同,接受理论并非心无二用地全神贯注于过去 的作品。
en: Unlike Gadamer, it does not concentrate exclusively on works of the past.

zh: 接受理论考察读者在文学中的作用，因而是一个相当新颖的发展形态。
en: Reception theory examines the reader's role in literature, and as such is a fairly novel development.

zh: 我们的思想总是处在一种处境中，因此也总是历史的，尽管这个历史不是外在的、社会的，而是个人的、内向的。
en: Our thinking is always in a situation and is therefore always historical, although this history is not external and social but personal and inward.

zh: 汉斯-格奥尔格·伽达默尔（Hans-Georg Gadamer ）在他的《真理与方法》（1975）中把海德格尔处境的方法运用在文学理论中。他争辩说，文学作品并不是一个完成的东西、一个精心打包的意义束蹦进这个世界的；意义其实取决于解释者的历史处境。
en: It was Hans-Georg Gadamer who, in Truth and Method (1975), applied Heidegger’s situational approach to literary theory.Gadamer argued that a literary work does not pop into the world as a finished and neatly parcelled bundle of meaning; rather meaning depends on the historical situation of the interpreter.

zh: 伽达默尔对“接受理论”产生了影响（见下文关于尧斯的论述）。
en: Gadamer influenced ‘reception theory’ (see Jauss below).

zh: 更大的句法范畴，比如VP，包括在对应点或节点之下所有的句法范畴和词。
en: The larger syntactic categories, such as VP, consist of all the syntactic categories and words below that point, or node, in the tree.

zh: 在上面的PS树中的VP包括句法范畴节点V和NP以及词found，a puppy。
en: The VP in the PS tree above consists of syntactic category nodes V and NP and the words found, a, and puppy.

zh: 因为a puppy可以向上追溯到节点NP，这个成分就是一个名词短语。
en: Because a puppy can be traced up the tree to the node NP, this constituent is a noun phrase.

zh: 尽管格雷马斯无意详尽地列举实例，但是，借助上述手段，他确实把他声称在民间传说中发现的各种独特的结构（意群）区分了出来：1.契约性结构，总的特征是，契约的建立和中止，离异和/或者重新统一等等。就如上面概括的那样。
en: Although Greimas makes no attempt at an exhaustive listing, he does, by the means indicated, proceed to isolate various distinctive structures (syntagmes) which, he claims, can be discerned in folk narrative: 1 Contractual structures (syntagmes contractuels) in which the situation has the overall bearing of the establishing and breaking of contracts, alienation and/or reintegration, etc., as outlined above.

zh: 2.表演性结构，包括艰难的考验，斗争，任务的执行情况等等。3.分离性结构，包括迁移、离别、到达等等。
en: 2 Performative structures (syntagmes performanciels) involving trials, struggles, the performance of tasks etc. 3 Disjunctive structures (syntagmes disjonctionnels) involving movement, departure, arrival etc.

zh: 不过,如果你仔细查看这些首要原则,你就会发现它们好像总能得以”解构”。它们是特定意义系统的产物, 而不是需要依附外部支持的东西，这一点可以得到证明。
en: But if you examine such first principles closely, you can see that they may always experience deconstruction: they can be shown to be products of a particular system of meaning, rather than what props it up from the outside.

zh: 此类原则常常被它们所排斥的东西所界定：它们就是备受结构主义推崇的那种“二元对立组” 中的一部分。
en: First principles of this kind are commonly defined by what they exclude: they are part of the sort of 'binary opposition' beloved of structuralism.

zh: 从好的方面看，语言学家提出的语法是-种解释理论。这种语法为如下事实提供一种解释（根据上面提到的理想化的思路）：一个说某种语言的人，将以某种特定的方式，而不是任何另外的方式来感知、释译、形成或者运用一段话语。
en: In a good sense, the grammar proposed by the linguist is an explanatory theory; it suggests an explanation for the fact that (under the idealization mentioned) a speaker of the language in question will perceive, interpret, form, or use an utterance in certain ways and not in other ways.

zh: 人们还可以寻求另外一种更加深层的解释理论。
en: One can also search for explanatory theories of a deeper sort.

zh: 所有这一切并非没有意义。
en: The whole matter is not without interest.

zh: 我在前面曾讲过，在17世纪的观念和今日的认知心理学及语言学之间存在着惊人的相似。
en: I mentioned earlier that there are striking similarities between the seventeenth-century climate of opinion and that of contemporary cognitive psychology and linguistics.

zh: 其中一点恰好与解释理论的问题有关。
en: One point of similarity has to do with precisely this matter of explanatory theory.

zh: 哲学语法与现行的生成语法很相象，它自觉地形成描述传统的反向；这种描述传统把语法学家的任务仅仅理解为记录和组织语言用法的资料，即一种自然历史。
en: Philosophical grammar, very much like current generative grammar, developed in self-conscious opposition to a descriptive tradition that interpreted the task of the grammarian to be merely that of recording and organizing the data of usage–a kind of natural history.

zh: 在文学研究中，这是诗歌学和解释学的对比。
en: In literary studies, this is a contrast between poetics and hermeneutics.

zh: 诗歌学以已经验证的意义或者效果为起点，研究它们是怎样取得的。
en: Poetics starts with attested meanings or effects and asks how they are achieved.

zh: （是什么使一段文字在一本小说里看起来具有讽刺意味？是什么使我们对某一个人物产生同情？为什么一首诗的结尾会显得含混不清？
en: (What makes this passage in a novel seem ironic? What makes us sympathize with this particular character? Why is the ending of this poem ambiguous?)

zh: ）而解释学则不同，它以文本为基点，研究文本的意义，力图发现新的、更好的解释。
en: Hermeneutics, on the other hand, starts with texts and asks what they mean, seeking to discover new and better interpretations.

zh: 解释学模式是从法律和宗教领域中借鉴的。在这两个领域里，人们试图对具有权威性的法律文本和神圣的宗教文本加以解释，目的是对如何行动做出决定。
en: Hermeneutic models come from the fields of law and religion, where people seek to interpret an authoritative legal or sacred text in order to decide how to act.

zh: (a) Max will chase what?
en: (a) Max will chase what?

zh: (b) Pete has put his bone where?
en: (b) Pete has put his bone where?

zh: (c) You think (that) which dog loves balls?
en: (c) You think (that) which dog loves balls?

zh: 然后 ，根据转换规则“移动wh”，wh短语被移到句子的开头。
en: The wh phrase is then moved to the beginning of the sentence by a transformational rule: Move wh.

zh: 因为我们知道嵌套的wh短语（例如 I wonder who Mary likes 我想知道玛丽喜欢谁）是标补语短语（CPs)，我们可以推导出主句问句 (Who does Mary like ) 也是 CP，如下：CPC S                                                              然后可以把wh短语移动到句子的左边，也就是空缺的标补语（Comp)位置。
en: Because embedded wh phrases (I wonder who Mary likes) are known to be complementizer phrases (CPs), we may deduce that main clause questions (Who does Mary like?) are also CPs, with the following structure (recall that C abbreviates “complementizer”):CPC SThe wh phrase moves to the empty C position at the left periphery of the sentence.

zh: 因此，可以通过如下三个步骤生成wh问句。1 .
en: Thus, wh questions are generated in three steps:1.

zh: 短语结构规则生成CP的d-结构，wh短语在S内处于NP的位置：例句（3a) 中的直接宾语、例句（3b) 中的介词宾语和例句（3c) 中的主语。2.
en: The phrase structure rules generate the CP d-structure with the wh phrase occupying an NP position within the S: direct object in (3a); prepositional object in (3b); and subject in (3c).

zh: “移动Aux”规则移动助动词，附接到与S相邻的位置。3.“移动wh”规则将wh短语移动到Comp的位置。
en: 2. Move Aux adjoins the auxiliary to S. 3. Move wh moves the wh phrase to C.

zh: 对于以上每个例句，说话者都可以通过增加另一个形容词、介词短语或者关系小句，把句子继续造下去。原则上，句子可以永远这样造下去。
en: In each case the speaker could continue creating sentences by adding another adjective, prepositional phrase, or relative clause.In principle, this could go on forever.

zh: 所有语言都有这样一种机制，可以生成无限量的句子。
en: All languages have mechanisms of this sort that make the number of sentences limitless.

zh: 既然事实如此，一种语言的句子就无法按照词典的格式存储在我们的头脑中。
en: Given this fact, the sentences of a language cannot be stored in a dictionary format in our heads.

zh: 更确切地说，句子是由按照一定规则结合起来的离散单位所组成的。
en: Rather, sentences are composed of discrete units that are combined by rules.

zh: 这一规则系统解释了说话者是如何将无限的知识存储在有限的空间—— 我们的脑——之内的。
en: This system of rules explains how speakers can store infinite knowledge in a finite space—our brains.

zh: 符号学的范围当然是极广泛的，从对动物的交流行为的研究（动物符号学〉到诸如对形体交流（人体运动学和近体学）、嗅觉符号（“气昧代码”）、美学 理论和修辞学这类指示系统的分析。
en: The ﬁeld of semiotics is of course enormous, ranging from the study of the communicative behaviour of animals (zoosemiotics) to the analysis of such signifying systems as human bodily communication (kinesics and proxemics), olfactory signs (the ‘code of scents’), aesthetic theory, and rhetoric.

zh: 大体说来，符号学的疆界（如果它有的话）和结构主义接壤：两个学科的兴趣基本上是相同的。从长远看来，两者都应被襄括在第三个容量很大的学科内。它简单地叫作交流。
en: By and large, its boundaries (if it has any) are coterminous with those of structuralism: the interests of the two spheres are not fundamentally separate and, in the long run, both ought properly to be included within the province of a third, embracing discipline called, simply, communication.

zh: 过去十几年中当代理论发展所引发的其他相关问题可以举证如下。
en: Other related effects of developments in contemporary theory over the past decades may be adduced as follows.

zh: 也许最突出的例子是对既定的文学经典理念的解构。文学经典乃是典范之作，它们是从具有显著“文学价值”的“伟大作品”中遴选出来的，任何文学教育没有它们都不能达到完满之境地。
en: Perhaps the most typical example has been the deconstruction of notions of a given literary canon--of an agreed selection of ‘great works’ which are the benchmark for the discrimination of‘literary value’, and without exposure to which no literary education can be complete.

zh: 但精神病就要比这难对付得多，在这种情况下，自我已经不像在神经官能症的情况下那样，还能在某种程度上扼制潜意识欲望，而是在实际上已经完全为潜意识欲望所支配。
en: Much more difficult to cope with, however, is the condition of psychosis, in which the ego, unable as in neurosis partly to repress the unconscious desire, actually comes under its sway.

zh: 如果出现这种情况，自我与外部世界的联系就断裂了，潜意识开始建立一个替代的、妄想的现实。
en: If this happens, the link between the ego and the external world is ruptured, and the unconscious begins to build up an alternative, delusional reality.

zh: 换句话说，精神病患者在关键的地方与现实失去了联系，例如偏执狂和精神分裂症患者那样。神经官能症患者可能出现手臂瘫痪，而精神病患者则可能认为他的手臂已经变成一条象鼻子。
en: The psychotic, in other words, has lost contact with reality at key points, as in paranoia and schizophrenia: if the neurotic may develop a paralysed arm, the psychotic may believe that his arm has turned into an elephant's trunk.

zh: 但精神病就要比这难对付得多，在这种情况下，自我已经不像在神经官能症的情况下那样，还能在某种程度上扼制潜意识欲望，而是在实际上已经完全为潜意识欲望所支配。
en: Much more difficult to cope with, however, is the condition of psychosis, in which the ego, unable as in neurosis partly to repress the unconscious desire, actually comes under its sway.

zh: 如果出现这种情况，自我与外部世界的联系就断裂了，潜意识开始建立一个替代的、妄想的现实。
en: If this happens, the link between the ego and the external world is ruptured, and the unconscious begins to build up an alternative, delusional reality.

zh: 换句话说，精神病患者在关键的地方与现实失去了联系，例如偏执狂和精神分裂症患者那样。神经官能症患者可能出现手臂瘫痪，而精神病患者则可能认为他的手臂已经变成一条象鼻子。
en: The psychotic, in other words, has lost contact with reality at key points, as in paranoia and schizophrenia: if the neurotic may develop a paralysed arm, the psychotic may believe that his arm has turned into an elephant's trunk.

zh: 这当然不是说，焦虑、迫害恐惧以及自我分裂是从马修·向诺德到保尔·德·曼这一时代所特有的经验：整个有文字记载的历史遍布它们的踪迹。
en: This is not of course to argue that anxiety, fear of persecution and the fragmentation of the self are experiences peculiar to the era from Matthew Arnold to Paul de Man: they can be found throughout recorded history.

zh: 有意义的也许是，在这个时代，这类经验以一种新的方式构成了一个系统的知识领域。
en: What is perhaps significant is that in this period such experiences become constituted in a new way as a systematic field of knowledge.

zh: 这个知识领域就是S·弗洛伊德19世纪末在维也纳发展起来的精神分析。
en: That field of knowledge is known as psychoanalysis, developed by Sigmund Freud in late nineteenth- century Vienna; and it is Freud's doctrines that I now want briefly to summarize.

zh: 在第三章我们讲到每个词的句法范畴都储存在我们的心理词典当中。
en: In chapter 3 we discussed the fact that the syntactic category of each word is listed in our mental dictionaries.

zh: 我们现在可以看到这一信息是如何为一种语言的句法所使用的。
en: We now see how this information is used by the syntax of the language.

zh: 在树形图中，词出现在标明该词句法范畴的标记之下。
en: Words appear in trees under labels that correspond to their syntactic category.

zh: 名词上标N, 限定词上标Det , 动词上标V, 等等。
en: Nouns are under N, determiners under Det, verbs under V, and so on.

zh: 布罗卡区受损的病人可能患上布罗卡失语症，这是我们今天所用的命名。
en: Patients with injuries to Broca’s area may have Broca’s aphasia, as it is often called today.

zh: 布罗卡失语症 的特征为言语困难和某种找词困难，但主要是影响病人按句法规则造句的能力。
en: Broca’s aphasia is characterized by labored speech and certain kinds of word-finding difficulties, but it is primarily a disorder that affects a person’s ability to form sentences with the rules of syntax.

zh: 布罗卡失语症最显著的特点之一就是语句的语法缺失，即，语言中经常缺少冠词、介词、代词和助动词，这些被我们现在称之为“ 功能词”的词。
en: One of the most notable characteristics of Broca’s aphasia is that the language produced is often agrammatic, meaning that it frequently lacks articles, prepositions, pronouns, auxiliary verbs, and other grammatical elements that we will call “function words” for now.

zh: 只使用给定的句子，陈述英语较之下列语言的至少三种差异。
en: State at least three differences between English and the following languages, using just the sentence(s) given.

zh: 忽略词汇差异 (即不同的词汇)。
en: Ignore lexical differences (i.e., the different vocabulary).

zh: 例如:泰语: dèg  khon  níi  kamlang  kin.boy  classifier this  progressive  eat“This boy is eating.”mǎa  tua  nán  kin  khâaw.dog  classifier  that  eat  rice“That dog ate rice.”
en: Here is an example:Thai: dèg  khon  níi  kamlang  kin.boy  classifier this  progressive  eat“This boy is eating.”mǎa  tua  nán  kin  khâaw.dog  classifier  that  eat  rice“That dog ate rice.”

zh: 对语素、词、短语和句子的语言学意义的研究叫作语义学。
en: The study of the linguistic meaning of morphemes, words, phrases, and sentences is called semantics.

zh: 语义学的分支学科包括词汇语义学，与词的意义以及词与词之间的意义关系有关；还有 短语或句子语义学，研究的是比词大的句法单位的意义。
en: Subfields of semantics are lexical semantics, which is concerned with the meanings of words, and the meaning relationships amongwords; and phrasal or sentential semantics, which is concerned with the meaning of syntactic units larger than the word.

zh: 而对语境如何影响意义的研究，比如，为什么“这里很冷”这个句子在某种情景下会被解释为“把窗户关上”，则称为语用学。
en: The study of how context affects meaning—for example, how the sentence It’s cold in here comes to be interpreted as “close the windows” in certain situations—is called pragmatics.

zh: 不过文化研究热衷于直接关系的思想。在这种关系中，文化产品就是一种基本社会政治结构的表象。
en: But cultural studies is drawn to the idea of a direct relationship, in which cultural products are the symptom of an underlying socio-political configuration.

zh: 比如英国的开放大学（Open University)开设的“通俗文化”这门课，从1982年到1985年共有五千人学习了这门课，其中有一个单元是关于“电视警察系列剧和法律与秩序”的，它从不断变化的社会政治形势的角度分析了警察系列剧的发展。
en: For example, the ‘Popular Culture’ course of the Open University in Britain, which was taken by some 5,000 people between 1982 and 1985, contained a unit on ‘Television Police Series and Law and Order’, which analysed the development of police series in terms of a changing socio-political situation.

zh: 思想和感情目前会使彼此误入歧途，而六个世纪以前这些情况就不大可能发生。
en: Thought  and  feeling  are  able  to mislead one another at present in ways which were hardly possible  six  centuries  ago.

zh: 倘若这种合二为一的笔法确实再度受人欢迎，我们就需要更纯粹的科学和更纯粹的诗歌的魔力才能把作者与读者的思想感情混合起来。
en: We  need  a  spell  of  purer  science  and purer poetry before the two can again be mixed, if indeed this will  ever  become  once  more  desirable.

zh: 我在第二版中増加了一个讨论艾略特先生诗歌的附识，以便说明我这虽所谓的纯粹性还有一些补充意见是谈论价值的。在第二版中修改了个别枝节问题。
en: In  the  Second  Edition  I added a note on Mr. Eliot’s poetry which will elucidate what I mean  here  by  purity,  and  some  supplementary  remarks  upon Value; in the Third, a few minor improvements have been made.

zh: 像Chomskyan/Chomskyite这种交替形式的冗余性——所有这些形式都符合正常的构词规则—— 可以解释词汇中的一些偶然缺位（又称“词汇缺位”）现象 。
en: The redundancy of alternative forms such as Chomskyan/Chomskyite, all of which conform to the regular rules of word formation, may explain some of the accidental gaps (also called lexical gaps) in the lexicon.

zh: 偶然缺位指合式但并不存在的词。

en: Accidental gaps are well-formed but nonexisting words.

zh: 语言中实际存在的词仅仅是可能的词的一个子集而已。
en: The actual words in a language constitute only a subset of the possible words.

zh: 可数名词可以计数且成为复数——one potato（―个土豆），two potatoes（两个土豆）。
en: Count nouns can be enumerated and pluralized—one potato, two potatoes.

zh: 可数名词前面可以加不定冠词a和量如 many potatoes（许多土豆），但不能加much，不能说*much potato。
en: They may be preceded by the indefinite determiner a, and by the quantifier many as in many potatoes, but not by much, *much potato.

zh: 可数名词前面必须加上某种类型的限定词。
en: They must also occur with a determiner of some kind.

zh: 我们看到，鼻音在英语的辅音中是个区别特征，但是在英语的元音中，它是非区别特征。
en: We have seen that nasality is a distinctive feature of English consonants, but it is a nondistinctive feature for English vowels.

zh: 根据音义之间的任意关系，我们没法预知meat—词以双唇鼻塞音m起首，而 beat—词以双唇口塞音b起首。
en: Given the arbitrary relationship between form and meaning, there is no way to predict that the word meat begins with a nasal bilabial stop [m] and that the word beat begins with an oral bilabial stop [b].

zh: 你知道这个，是因为你学过这些词。
en: You learn this when you learn the words.

zh: 另一方面，在 bean，mean,comb和sing这些词的元音中，鼻音这一特征的值是可以预知的，因为它只出现在鼻辅音前。
en: On the other hand, the nasality feature value of the vowels in bean, mean, comb, and sing is predictable because they occur before nasal consonants.

zh: 当某一类音的某个特征值可以通过规则预知的时候，这个特征就是非区别性的，或是冗余的，或者叫作这一类音的一个可预测特征（这三个术语是等价的）。
en: When a feature value is predictable by rule for a certain class of sounds, the feature is a nondistinctive or redundant or predictable feature for that class.(The three terms are equivalent.)

zh: 因此，鼻音是英语元音的一个冗余特征，但却是英语辅音的一个非冗余（区别性或是音位性的）特征。
en: Thus nasality is a redundant feature in English vowels, but a nonredundant (distinctive or phonemic) feature for English consonants.

zh: 例如，考虑英语的过去时规则，回忆一下，它有两条次规则。
en: Consider, for example, the English past-tense rule and recall that it has two subrules.

zh: 第一条是当一个规则动词以龈塞音（/t/或/d/）结尾时插入一个混元音，例如mated[metəd]。
en: The first inserts a schwa when a regular verb ends in an alveolar stop (/t/ or /d/), as in mated [metəd].

zh: 第二条使得过去时词素/d/在出现于清音前时清化，例如raped[ript]或peaked[pʰikt]。
en: The second devoices the past-tense morpheme /d/ when it occurs after a voiceless sound, as in reaped [ript] or peaked [pʰikt].

zh: 伍尔夫冈·伊塞尔（见下文第52-54页）争辩说，文学文本总是包含着“空白”，只有读者才能填上。
en: Wolfgang Iser (see below, pp. 52–54) argues that literary texts always contain ‘blanks’ which only the reader can fill.

zh: 华兹华斯这首诗的两节之间之所以产生“空白”，是因为两节间的关系没有说明。
en: The ‘blank’ between the two stanzas of Wordsworth’s poem arises because the relationship between the stanzas is unstated.

zh: 阐释的行为要求我们填充这一空白。
en: The act of interpretation requires us to fill this blank.

zh: 大部分人叫作“嘴巴”的，我们语言学工作者称为口腔，以区别于鼻腔。鼻腔包括鼻子、连接鼻子和喉咙的通道，加上鼻窦。
en: What sensible people call "the mouth", linguists call the oral cavity to distinguish it from the nasal cavity, which is the nose and the plumbing that connects it to the throat, plus your sinuses.

zh: 最后还有舌头和嘴唇,它们都能快速运动和改变形状。
en: Finally there are the tongue and the lips, both of which are capable of rapid movement and shape changing.

zh: 以上这些加起来叫声道。
en: All of these together comprise the vocal tract.

zh: 由于同一物种中也具有地域方言，他们与人类语言也很相似。和人类相同，这些方言也是由父母传递给后代。
en: They also resemble human languages in that there are "regional dialects" within the same species, and as with humans, these dialects are transmitted from parents to offspring.

zh: 事实上，研究者们注意到，地域差异在鸣禽中的保存比人类还要好，这是因为它们不会受到广播或电视的影响，而使得地域口音逐渐趋同。
en: Indeed, researchers have noted that dialect differences may be better preserved in songbirds than in humans because there is no homogenization of regional accents due to radio or TV.

zh: 强力诗人们分别或连续采用六种心理防范形式来对付那种“影响的焦虑”(anxiety of influence)。
en: Strong poets cope with the ‘anxiety of influence’ by adopting separately or suc- cessively six psychic defences.

zh: 这些形式以比喻的形式出现在他们的诗歌中，使他们可以从父辈的诗歌中“转脱”出来。
en: These appear in their poetry as tropes which allow a poet to ‘swerve’ from a father’s poems.

zh: 这六种比喻是：反讽、提喻、换喻、夸张/反语、隐喻、再换喻(metalepsis)。
en: The six tropes are irony, synecdoche, metonymy, hyperbole/litotes, metaphor and metalepsis.

zh: 十分著名的论调随举几端，便证明我的断言持之有故。它们出自亚里士多德，朗吉努斯，贺拉斯，布瓦格，德莱顿，艾迪生，华兹华斯，何尔律治卡莱尔，马修•阿诺德以及几位年代较晚的作家。
en: A few specimens of the most famous utterances of Aristotle, Longinus, Horace, Boileau, Dryden, Addison, Wordsworth, Coleridge, Carlyle, Matthew Arnold and some more modern authors, will justify this assertion.

zh: “所有的人都自然而然地从摹仿中获得快感。”“诗歌主要表述的是一般真理”，“它要求热情与疯狂相济为用；魂不附体时我们就化为想象的产物”。
en: ‘All men naturally receive pleasure from imitation.’ ‘Poetry is chiefly conversant about general truth.’‘It demands an enthusiasm allied to madness; transported out of ourselves we become what we imagine.

zh: 迄今为止左右人类历史的一直是劳动的需要；对于弗洛伊德来说，这一严酷的需要意味着我们必须压抑一部分追求快乐和满足的趋向。
en: What has dominated human history to date is the need tolabour; and for Freud that harsh necessity means that we must repress some of our tendencies to pleasure and gratification.

zh: 如果我们不是为了生存而必须工作，我们也许终日倦眠而无所事事。
en: If we were not called upon to work in order to survive, we might simply lie around all day doing nothing.

zh: 每个人都得经受弗洛伊德所谓的“现实原则”对“快乐原则”的压抑，但是某些人甚至整个社会都可能会由于压抑过度而致病。
en: Every human being has to undergo this repression of what Freud named the 'pleasure principle' by the 'reality principle', but for some of us, and arguably for whole societies, the repression may become excessive and make us ill.

zh: “狂欢化”是巴赫金提出的术语，用来说明狂欢节对文学类型形成的影响。
en: ‘Carnivalization’ is the term Bakhtin uses to describe the shaping effect of Carnival on literary genres.

zh: 最早的狂欢化的文学形式是苏格拉底式对话体和梅尼普斯式讽刺体。
en: The earliest carnivalized literary forms are the Socratic dialogue and the Menippean satire.

zh: 苏格拉底式对话体从根源上讲接近口头对话的明快与不隔，在这种对话体中，真理是在不同观点的交流中得以展现，而不是在权威作者的个人独白中被发现。
en: The former is in its origins close to the immediacy of oral dialogue, in which the discovery of truth is conceived as an unfolding exchange of views rather than as an authoritative monologue.

zh: 由于电脑时代的刺激，computer（电脑）、mouse（鼠标）、cookie（网络跟踪器）、cache（高速缓存）、virus（电脑病毒）和bundle（捆绑销售）都是近期语义扩大的例子。
en: More recent broadenings, spurred by the computer age, are computer, mouse, cookie, cache, virus, and bundle.

zh: footage以前是指一定长度的电影或是录像，但现在指任意一段电子视频，比如DVD，也不管其长度究竟能不能用英尺（feet）来衡量了。
en: Footage use to refer to a certain length of film or videotape, but nowadays it means any excerpt from the electronic video media such as DVDs, irrespective of whether its length can be measured in feet.

zh: 这里我们要表达一下与大家不同的意见：我们可以预测，google这个词，虽然现在的意思是“用谷歌搜索引擎搜索”，但以后其意思会扩大到“使用搜索引擎在网上搜索”。
en: Google was broadened first from the name of a company to a verb meaning “to use that company’s search engine on the Internet,” and from there further broadened to simply “search the Internet.”

zh: 在18世纪初，半带神秘色彩的象征学说是美学理论的中心。
en: At the centre of aesthetic theory at the turn of the eighteenth century is the semi-mystical doctrine of the symbol.

zh: 对于浪漫主义，象征确实成为解决一切问题的万应灵药。
en: For Romanticism, indeed, the symbol becomes the panacea for all problems.

zh: 在象征之内，日常生活中无法解决的一系列矛盾冲突——主体与客体，普遍与特殊，感觉与概念，物质与精神，秩序与自发——都可以奇迹般地得到解决。
en: Within it, a whole set of conflicts which were felt to be insoluble in ordinary life — between subject and object, the universal and the particular, the sensuous and the conceptual, material and spiritual, order and spontaneity — could be magically resolved.

zh: 反映物作为批评原型而得到了长期沿用，这表明它作为美学理论的一个出发点，自有其合适性，并能给人以启迪。
en: The long survival of the reflector as archetype demonstrates its aptness and suggestiveness as one point of departure for aesthetic theory.

zh: 然而类比思维法总免不了分类上的呆板性。
en: The endemic disease of analogical thinking, however, is hardening of the categories.

zh: 正如柯尔律治所说，“一切比喻都是跛足的”；所谓相似物其实只是同被喻物部分相象，碰巧适时的类比原型尽管突出了关键之点，但某一事物倘若处在其原始分类以外，那么它的种种特性便难以把握而被置于一边了。
en: For as said,‘No simile runs on all four legs’; analogues are by their nature only partial parallels, and the very sharpness of focus afforded by a happily chosen archetype makes marginal and elusive those qualities of an object which fall outside its primitive categories.

zh: 对脑损伤患者的研究，一直是有关语言和其他认知系统之神经基础的一个主要信息来源。
en: The investigation of individuals with brain damage has been a major source of information regarding the neural basis of language and other cognitive systems.

zh: 有人可能会说，这就像是试图通过观察损坏的汽车发动机来了解它以前是如何工作的。
en: One might suggest that this is like trying to understand how an automobile engine works by looking at a damaged engine.

zh: 这是一个好的类比吗？
en: Is this a good analogy?

zh: 如果是，为什么？
en: If so, why?

zh: 如果不是，又为什么？
en: If not, why not?

zh: 回答时请谈谈为什么一个损坏的系统能够或不能够提供有关正常系统的信息。
en: In your answer, discuss how a damaged system can or cannot provide information about the normal system.

zh: 没人知道语言变化的全部原因。
en: No one knows all the causes of linguistic change.

zh: 有些语音变化是同化的结果，同化是一个使发音变得容易的基本生理过程。
en: Some sound changes result from assimilation, a fundamentally physiological process of ease of articulation.

zh: 其他的语音变化，如“元音大换位”，就更加难以解释。
en: Others, like the Great Vowel Shift, are more difficult to explain.

zh: 语法方面的一些变化可以解释为类推变化，或规则的泛化，使语言变得更有规则，例如用cows代替kine，用waked代替woke。
en: Some grammatical changes are analogic changes, generalizations that lead to more regularity, such as cows instead of kine and waked instead of woke.

zh: 许多文学理论入门都会对各种批评“学派”进行一番描述。
en: Many introductions to literary theory describe a series of ‘schools’ of criticism.

zh: 理论被说成是一系列不能用同一标准衡量的“研究方法”，它们各自都有自己的理论地位和批评责任。
en: Theory is treated as a series of competing ‘approaches’, each with its theoretical positions and commitments.

zh: 但是各种理论介绍所确认的理论流派——结构主义、解构主义、女权主义、心理分析、马克思主义、新历史主义——又有许多相同之处。
en: But the theoretical movements that introductions identify – such as structuralism, deconstruction, feminism, psychoanalysis, Marxism, and new historicism – have a lot in common.

zh: 艺术家的活动天地既可能是想象丰富的直觉世界，也可能是常识世界或科学世界。同一块天地，这种理论可以认为其中有神祇、巫师，妖怪和柏拉图式的理念，那种理论也可以认为这一切均属子虚乌有。
en: It may be maintained that the artists world is that of imaginative intuition, or of common sense, or of natural science; and this world may be held to include, or not to include, gods, witches, chimeras, and Platonic Ideas.

zh: 因此，即使有多种理论一致认为规范作品的首要制约力在于它所表现的世界，这其中也可区分出从崇尚最坚定的 现实主义到推崇最飘渺的理想主义这样迥然不同的流派来。
en: Consequently, theories which agree in assigning to the represented universe the primary control over a legitimate work of art may vary from recommending the most uncompromising realism to the most remote idealism.

zh: 像许多语言一样，俄语名词有一套屈折后缀系统，表示这个名词是主语、宾语、领有者或者是其他语法角色。英语是靠语序来实现这一功能。
en: Like many other languages, Russian has a system of inflectional suffixes for nouns that indicates the noun's grammatical relation—whether a subject, object, possessor, and so on— something English does with word order.

zh: 例如，在英语中，Maxim defends Victor（马克西姆维护维克多）和Victor defends Maxim （维克多维护马克西姆）这两句话意思有别，关键在于词序不同。
en: For example, in English, the sentence Maxim defends Victor means something different from Victor defends Maxim.The order of the words is critical.

zh: 流音[l]和[r]，发音时口腔中有某种程度的阻碍，但还不足以形成真正的收紧或摩擦。
en: Liquids [l] [r] In the production of the sounds [l] and [r], there is some obstruction of the airstream in the mouth, but not enough to cause any real constriction or friction.

zh: 这就是流音。
en: These sounds are liquids.

zh: 前面龈音一节中提到，这两个流音发音方式相当不同，但能放在同一个类中，是因为声学特征相似。
en: They are articulated differently, as described in the earlier alveolar section, but are grouped as a class because they are acoustically similar.

zh: 也因为如此，外国人讲英语时可能会混淆两者。
en: Due to that similarity, foreign speakers of English may confuse the two sounds and substitute one for the other.

zh: 确认人脑的哪些部分负责人类的语言能力，一直是一个核心问题。
en: An issue of central concern has been to determine which parts of the brain are responsible for human linguistic abilities.

zh: 19世纪早期，弗朗兹•约瑟夫 •加尔提出了（脑功能 ）定位理论。该理论认为人类的不同认知能力和行为，都由脑的特定部分所控制。
en: In the early nineteenth century, Franz Joseph Gall proposed the theory of localization, which is the idea that different human cognitive abilities and behaviors are localized in specific parts of the brain.

zh: 从我们现有的脑知识来看，加尔的某些特定的观点还是很滑稽的。
en: In light of our current knowledge about the brain, some of Gall’s particular views are amusing.

zh: 比如，他提出语言能力位于脑前叶位置，因为年轻时他曾注意到他的同学中口才最好、最聪明的人都双眼外突，他认为这反映了他们的脑物质发育过度。
en: For example, he proposed that language is located in the frontal lobes of the brain because as a young man he had noticed that the most articulate and intelligent of his fellow students had protruding eyes, which he believed reflected overdeveloped brain material.

zh: 他还提出了一个被称为“器官学”的伪科学理论，也就是后来为世人所知的颅相学，即通过检查头盖骨上的“隆起”来确定个性特点、智力和其他特征的做法。
en: He also put forth a pseudoscientific theory called “organology” that later came to be known as phrenology, which is the practice of determining personality traits, intellectual capacities, and other matters by examining the “bumps” on the skull.

zh: 但是你越检验沃尔夫的论点，你越觉得没有道理。
en: But the more you examine Whorf's arguments, the less sense they make.

zh: 就拿那个工人和空筒的事来说。
en: Take the story about the worker and the ''empty'' drum.

zh: 沃尔夫认为灾难的原因是因为empty的意思可以是“没有、虚无“或是“里面的东西光了”。这个工人，他的思考方式受到他语言分类的塑造，没有去分辨“原有的用光了”和 “虚无”，所以一丢，轰！
en: The seeds of disaster supposedly lay in the semantics of “empty”, which, Whorf claimed, means both ''without its usual contents'' and ''null and void, empty, inert.'' The hapless worker, his conception of reality molded by his linguistic categories, did not distinguish between the ''drained'' and ''inert'' senses, hence, flick . . . boom!

zh: 但是，等一下，挥发的汽油是看不见的。
en: But wait.Gasoline vapor is invisible.

zh: 与动词一起出现的各种NP是该动词的论元。
en: The various NPs that occur with a verb are its arguments.

zh: 因此，不及物动词有一个论元：主语；及物动词有两个论元：主语和直接宾语；双及物动词有三个论元：主语、直接宾语和间接宾语。
en: Thus intransitive verbs have one argument: the subject; transitive verbs have two arguments: the subject and direct object; ditransitive verbs have three arguments: the subject, direct object, and indirect object.

zh: 一个动词的论元结构是其意义的一部分，包含在它的词条中。
en: The argument structure of a verb is part of its meaning and is included in its lexical entry.

zh: 马克思主义的原理像基督教的教义一样不容易总结，不过马克思有两个著名论述完全可以作为我们讨论问题的出发点。不是人们的意识决定他们的存在，而是相反，人们的社会存在决定他们的意识。
en: The basic tenets of Marxism are no easier to summarize than the essential doctrines of Christianity, but two well-known statements by Marx provide a sufficient point of departure: It is not the consciousness of men that determines their being, but, on the contrary, their social being that determines their consciousness.

zh: 哲学家们只是对世界做出了不同的解释；而重要的是改变这个世界。
en: The philosophers have only interpreted the world in various ways; the point is to change it.

zh: AAE又称作“非裔美国人乡土英语”（African American Vernacular English, AAVE）、“美国黑人英语”（Ebonics）和“黑人英语”（Black English, BE ）。
en: AAE is also called African American Vernacular English (AAVE), Ebonics, and Black English (BE).

zh: 有一部分美国黑人说这种英语，但绝不是全部。
en: It is spoken by some (but by no means all) African Americans.

zh: 这个问题将在第十章讨论。
en: It is discussed in chapter 10.

zh: 其实，只要聋人聚集在一起生活就会发展出一个完整的语言出来，它跟世界上所有口语语言有一样复杂的文法机制。
en: They are found wherever there is a community of deaf people, and each one is a distinct, full language, using the same kinds of grammatical machinery found worldwide in spoken languages.

zh: 例如美国手势语言跟英文或是英国手势语言并不相像。但是它主语和动词的一致性和性系统的用法却很像美国的印地安语言的一支纳瓦霍语与非洲的班图语。
en: For example, American Sign Language (ASL), used by the deaf community in the United States, does not resemble English, or British Sign Language, but relies on agreement and gender systems in a way that is reminiscent of Navajo and Bantu.

zh: The child,a police officer等短语都属于一个句法范畴：名词短语(NP),这是英语和世上其他每种语言都有的句法范畴之一。
en: The child, a police officer, John, and so on belong to the syntactic category noun phrase (NP), one of several syntactic categories in English and every other language in the world.

zh: NP在一个句子中可以充当主语或是宾语。
en: NPs may function as the subject or as an object in a sen- tence.

zh: NP通常都有一个限定词(例如a或the)和一个名词，但是NP也可能同样包含一个专有名词、代词、没有限定词的名字甚至是小句或句子。
en: NPs often contain a determiner (like a or the) and a noun, but they may also consist of a proper name, a pronoun, a noun without a determiner, or even a clause or a sentence.

zh: 这种“话到嘴边”现象(通常称为TOT现象)并不少见。
en: This tip-of-the-tongue phenomenon (often referred to as TOT) is not uncom- mon.

zh: 可设想一下，要是你想要的词儿就是想不起来，你该有多烦心。
en: But if you could rarely find the word you wanted, imagine how frustrated you would be.

zh: 然而这正是许多失语症患者的遭遇，其障碍通常包括严重的命名不能症，也就是没有能力找到想要说的那个词。
en: This is the fate of many aphasics whose impairment involves severe anomia—the inability to find the word you wish to speak.

zh: 另一种实验技术称为“命名任务”，该任务要求受试者大声朗读打印出来的词。
en: Another experimental technique, called the naming task, asks the subject to read aloud a printed word.

zh: （“命名任务”的一种变体也被用来研究失语症患者，要求他们说出图片中物体的名称。
en: (A variant of the naming task is also used in studies of people with aphasia, who are asked to name the object shown in a picture.)

zh: ）受试者朗读像dough (生面团）和steak (牛排）这样拼写不规则的词， 比朗读像doe(雌鹿）和stake(树粧）这样拼写规则的词稍慢一些，但仍然比朗读duff这样捏造的字母串要快。
en: Subjects read irregularly spelled words like dough and steak just slightly more slowly than regularly spelled words like doe and stake, but still faster thaninvented strings like cluff.

zh: 可形式主义者们却常常把情节的理论和陌生化概念联系起来：他们的情节阻碍我们把事件看作典型的、熟悉的。
en: The Formalists, on the other hand, often linked theory of plot with the notion of defamiliarization: the plot prevents us from regarding the incidents as typical and familiar.

zh: 相反，我们常常会不由得感到，绝妙的技巧是如何建构或虚构（制造／伪造）呈现在我们面前的“现实”的。
en: Instead, we are made constantly aware how artifice constructs or forges (makes/counterfeits) the ‘reality’ presented to us.

zh: 在展示诗人或制造者（poiesis）自身而不是模仿（mimesis）现实这点上，形式主义的情节观正如斯特恩所做的那样，预示了后现代主义的自我反身性。
en: In its display of poiesis (‘poet’ = ‘maker’) rather than mimesis (‘copying’ = realism), this looks forward, as does Sterne, to postmodernist self-reflexivity.

zh: 这派新历史主义在一定程度上受阿尔都塞、马歇雷、詹姆逊和伊格尔顿著述的影响，按照勒维森的说法，它既是唯物主义的，又是解构主义的。它调遣“历史的想像”以恢复文学作品的当代意义。这当代意义铭刻了作品形成的基质， 但却不清醒地存在于写成的作品“之内”。
en: Influenced in part by the work of Althusser, Macherey, Jameson and Eagleton, this New Historicism – according to Levinson, ‘at once materialist and deconstructive’ – deploys the ‘historical imagination’ to restore to a literary work those contemporary meanings which inscribe the matrix in which it is shaped, but which are not consciously ‘in’ the work as written.

zh: 什克洛夫斯基称他最引人注目的概念之一为“陌生化”(ostranenie）。
en: Shklovsky called one of his most attractive concepts ‘defamiliarization’ (ostranenie: ‘making strange’).

zh: 他争论说，我们永远也无法保持对事物的新鲜感，那种“常规的”存在要求事物必然在很大的程度上变成“自动的”（他后来使用的概念）。
en: He argued that we can never retain the freshness of our perceptions of objects; the demands of ‘normal’ existence require that they must become to a great extent ‘automatized’ (a later term).

zh: 华兹华斯曾有过天真的幻觉，大自然保持着梦的荣耀和新鲜，然而这种华兹华斯式的幻觉并非人类意识的常态。

en: That Wordsworthian innocent vision through which Nature retains ‘the glory and the freshness of a dream’ is not the normal state of human consciousness.

zh: 有的文本比另一些文本更象“孤儿”，因为不稳定的阅读程式尚不足以给它找个继父。
en: Some texts are more 'orphaned' than others because the conventions of reading are not so ﬁrm as to provide a stepfather.

zh: 例如，阅读一篇政治演说必须具备一定的目的论，把文本看成是某人按照话语程式和有关制度惯例，为了达到某种交流的目的组织而成的。
en: To read a political speech, for example, is to submit to a teleology, to take the text as governed by a communicative end which one reconstructs with the help of the conventions of discourse and of the relevant institutions.

zh: 然而，文学却使文本本身突出，使上述“基本的变迁”和语言独立的产生意义的能力更加自由地发挥作用。
en: But literature, foregrounding the text itself, gives freer play to the 'essential drift' and autonomous productivity of the language.

zh: 大脑由左右两个大脑半球组成，两个半球之间又胼体相连。胼胝体由200万条纤维相互连接而成，能使大脑的左、右两半球相互交流。
en: The brain is composed of cerebral hemispheres, one on the right and one on the left, joined by the corpus callosum, a network of more than 200 million fibers.The corpus callosum allows the two hemispheres of the brain to communicate with each other.

zh: 假如没有这种连接系统，大脑的左右两半球就会各自为政。
en: Without this system of connections, the two hemispheres would operate independently.

zh: 记得我们前面提到一个脑伤的病人，他对or和be这样的功能词有困难,但是对oar和bee这样的内容词却没有困难。
en: Recall, too, that patients with damage to the language areas of the brain have more trouble with function words like "or" and "be" than with content words like "oar" and "bee".

zh: 当每个字都要算钱，例如在打电报或拟报纸的标题时，写的人会把功能词省略掉，希望读的人会依内容词的字序自己把功能词填补上去。
en: When words are expensive, as in telegrams and headlines, writers tend to leave the function words out, hoping that the reader can reconstruct them from the order of the content words.

zh: 但是因为功能词是一个句子短语结构最可靠的线索，所以电报式的语言常常在语意上是不明确的。
en: But because function words are the most reliable clues to the phrase structure of the sentence, telegraphic language is always a gamble.

zh: 贯穿于本章论述的“经验”一词是在宽泛意义上运用的，表示精神上出现的任何反应。
en: Throughout this discussion ‘experience’ will be used in a wide sense to stand for any occurrence in the mind.

zh: 它相当于“精神状态或心理过程”经验这个术语常常不恰当地提示了被动性和意识。不过此处所指的许多“经验”敢就会叫作“行动”而且所带有的某些部分不是有意识的也不是内省所能企及的，不像有意识的部分那么重要。
en: It is equivalent to ‘mental state, or process’.The term has often unfortunate suggestions of passiveness and of consciousness, but many of the ‘experiences’ here referred to would ordinarily be called ‘actions’ and have parts which are not conscious and not accessible to introspection as important as those which are.

zh: 形态规则也许或多或少都具有能产性。英语中将-er加于动词后构成名词，表示“动作者”（一次或习惯性动作），这是一条非常能产的形态规则。大部分英语动词都接受这个后缀，例如：examiner (主考者），exam-taker (参加考试者），analyzer (分析者），lover (爱好者），hunter (猎人）， predictor (预言者）等（尽管拼写不同，-or和-er发音相同，是相同的语素）。
en: The rule that adds an -er to verbs in English to produce a noun meaning “one who does” is a nearly productive morphological rule, giving us examiner, examtaker, analyzer, lover, hunter, and so forth, but fAn introduction to languages full productivity owing to “unwords” like *chairer, which is not “one who chairs.”
Other derivational morphemes fall farther short of productivity.

zh: 文化研究就是探讨我们在多大程度上受文化形式的操纵，以及我们能在多大程度上，或者用哪些方式使文化为其他目的服务，就像人们说的，发挥“能动作用”。
en: Cultural studies ask how far we are manipulated by cultural forms and how far or in what ways we are able to use them for other purposes, exercising‘agency’, as it is called.

zh: （“能动作用”是当前理论的简略提法。该问题是关乎我们在多大程度上可以成为对自己行为负责的主体，以及我们貌似自主的选择在多大程度上受制于我们所不能控制的力量的问题。）
en: (The question of ‘agency’, to use the shorthand of current theory, is the question of how far we can be subjects responsible for our actions and how far our apparent choices are constrained by forces we do not control.)

zh: 费什相信，他对句子的详细解读仅仅是按照有知识的读者很自然的做法进行的。
en: Fish believes that his readings of sentences simply follow the natural practice of informed readers.

zh: 按照他的观点，读者具有“语言能力”，能够内化阅读需要的句法知识和语义知识。
en: In his view a reader is someone who possesses a ‘linguistic competence’, has internalized the syntactic and semantic knowledge required for reading.

zh: 文学文本的“有知识的读者”还具备特别的“文学能力”(即常规文学知识)。
en: The ‘informed reader’ of literary texts has also acquired a specifically ‘literary competence’ (knowledge of literary conventions).

zh: 这种因说话者的社会境况不同而产生的语言差异被称为社会语言变项。
en: Linguistic differences of this sort that vary with the social situation of the speaker are termed sociolinguistic variables.

zh: 例如，使用诸如双重否定这样的非标准形式常常与种族自尊心联系在一起，而后者则是社会语境的一部分。
en: For example, the use of nonstandard forms like double negation is often associated with pride of ethnicity, which is part of the social context.

zh: 许多说奇卡诺英语的人（和说AAE的人）都能说两种方言；他们会根据社会情况使用奇卡诺英语（或AAE）或者SAE。
en: Many Chicano speakers (and speakers of AAE) are bidialectal; they can use either ChE (or AAE) or SAE, depending on the social situation.

zh: 文学改变和强化普通语言，系统地偏离日常言语。
en: Literature transforms and intensifies ordinary language, deviates systematically from everyday speech.

zh: 如果在一个公共汽车站上，你走到我身边，嘴里低吟着“Thou still unravished bride of quietness”（你这尚未被夺走童贞的安静的新娘），那么我立刻就会意识到：文学在我面前。
en: If you approach me at a bus stop and murmur 'Thou still unravished bride of quietness,' then I am instantly aware that I am in the presence of the literary.

zh: 我知道这一点是因为，你的话的肌质(texture)、韵律和音响大大多于从这句话中可以抽取的意义——或者，按照语言学家更为技术性的说法，这句话的能指(signifier)与所指(signified)之间的比例不当。
en: I know this because the texture, rhythm and resonance of your words are in excess of their abstractable meaning — or, as the linguists might more technically put it, there is a disproportion between the signifiers and the signifieds.

zh: 文学理论一直非常关心修辞学，理论家也就修辞手段的性质和功能争论不休。
en: Literary theory has been much concerned with rhetoric, and theorists debate the nature and function of rhetorical figures.

zh: 通常，修辞手段的定义是变换或改动“普通的”用法。举个例子说，“我的爱像一朵红红的玫瑰”，这里用玫瑰不是指花，而是指一种极美丽、极宝贵的东西（这就是比喻手法）。
en: A rhetorical figure has generally been defined as an alteration of or swerve from ‘ordinary’ usage; for instance, ‘My love is a rose’ uses rose to mean not the flower but something beautiful and precious (this is the figure of metaphor).

zh: 或者“秘密坐在其中”，这里使秘密成为一种能动作用，它能坐在其中（这是拟人法）。
en: Or ‘The Secret Sits’ makes the secret an agent capable of sitting (personification).

zh: 通常，修辞手段的定义是变换或改动“普通的”用法。举个例子说，“我的爱像一朵红红的玫瑰”， 这里用玫瑰不是指花，而是指一种极美丽、极宝贵的东西 (这就是比喻手法或者“秘密坐在其中”，这里使秘密成为一种能动作用，它能坐在其中（这是拟人法)。
en: A rhetorical figure has generally been defined as an alteration of or swerve from ‘ordinary’ usage; for instance, ‘My love is a rose’ uses rose to mean not the flower but something beautiful and precious (this is the figure of metaphor).Or ‘The Secret Sits’ makes the secret an agent capable of sitting (personification).

zh: 修辞学家曾经试图把专门的“比喻用语"和涵盖而更广的、间接的“修辞”手段区别开，前者“放弃”或者改变一个字的意义(如用在比喻当中），而后者以字词的排列达到特定的效果。
en: Rhetoricians formerly attempted to distinguish specific ‘tropes’ which ‘turn’ or alter the meaning of a word (as in metaphor) from more miscellaneous ‘figures’ of indirection which arrange words to achieve special effects.

zh: 有时候无知也可以挺有创意。
en: Misconception can sometimes be creative, and nothing in this world both misconceives and creates like a child, as we shall see in chapter 8.

zh: 一个新词可以因为不正确的词汇形态分析而进入语言。
en: A new word may enter the language because of an incorrect morphological analysis.

zh: 举例来说，由于错误地认为-er是施事后缀 ，就从peddler（小贩）派生出peddle（兜售）一词。
en: For example, peddle was derived from peddler on the mistaken assumption that the -er was the agentive suffix.

zh: 这样的词称为逆构词。
en: Such words are called back-formations.

zh: 动词hawk（叫卖），stoke（给炉子添燃料），swindle（诈骗），edit（编辑）都是作为hawker（叫卖的小贩），stoker（司炉），swindler（骗子），editor（编辑）的逆构词而进入英语的。
en: The verbs hawk, stoke, swindle, and edit all came into the language as back-formations—of hawker, stoker, swindler, and editor.

zh: 英语中pea（豌豆）一词由单数的pease（豌豆）派生而来，因为一些说英语的人以为pease（豌豆）是复数形式。
en: Pea was derived from a singular word, pease, by speakers who thought pease was a plural.

zh: 一些语素，比如boy(男孩），desire(欲望），gentle(温柔的）和man(男子），本身就构成词，它们是自由语素。
en: Some morphemes like boy, desire, gentle, and man may constitute words by themselves.These are free morphemes.

zh: 其他的语素，如-ish,-able,-ness,-ly,dis-,trans-,un-,则永远不能靠自己构成词，但总是词的组成部分，它们是词缀，称为黏着语素。
en: Other morphemes like -ish, -ness, -ly, pre-, trans-, and un- are never words by themselves but are always parts of words.These affixes are bound morphemes.

zh: 我们知道每个词缀出现在其他语素的前面还是后面。
en: We know whether each affix precedes or follows other morphemes.

zh: un-，pre-(predetermine“预先决定”，prejudge“预先判断”)，bi-(bipolar“双极的”，bisexual“两性的”）是前缀，它们出现在其他语素的前面。
en: Thus, un-, pre- (premeditate, prejudge), and bi- (bipolar, bisexual) are prefixes.They occur before other morphemes.

zh: 另一些语素只能作为后缀出现在其他语素的后面。
en: Some morphemes occur only as suffixes, following other morphemes.

zh: 里奇（1980）把女性结合描述为一种反抗父权制权力的行动，还提出了“女同性恋连续统一体”（Lesbian continuum）的概念。“通过每个女人的生平和整个历史描述一个广大的连续范围内女人认同的经验”。
en: Rich (1980) depicts woman-bonding as an act of resistance to patriarchal power, and advances the concept of ‘lesbian continuum’ to describe ‘a range – through each woman’s life and throughout history – of woman-identified experience’.

zh: 她的这一概念不仅是性经验，而且是包括家庭关系、朋友关系、政治关系等在内的具有“基本强度的”所有形式的女性经验。
en: Her definition encompasses not simply sexual experience but all forms of ‘primary intensity’ between and among women, including relationships of family, friendship and politics.

zh: 在其他一些女性写作中，女性分析肯定的不是“文本性的性，而是性的文本性”（玛丽·雅可布斯[Mary Jacobus]语）。
en: As with other versions of l’ecriture féminine, gynesis asserts, in Mary Jacobus’s phrase, ‘not the sexuality of the text but the textuality of sex’.

zh: 如此看来，女性分析是这样一种写作，它不特别强调性别特征，而要打乱固定的意义，鼓励超越作者和批评家控制的文本自由嬉戏。
en: This, then, is a kind of writing which is not specifically gendered but disrupts fixed meaning and encourages textual free play beyond authorial or critical control.

zh: 贾尔丹这一与女性批评理论对立的概念对女性批评自以为有意义的核心观念提出了严肃的疑问。
en: Jardine’s opposition to gynocentric feminist theory forms an important questioning of the core concepts which gynocentrism takes to be self-evidently meaningful.

zh: 伍尔夫关于女作家的最有趣的文章之一是《 女人的职业》，在这篇文章中，她说自己的写作 生涯 受到两方面的阻碍。
en: One of Woolf’s most interesting essays about women writers is ‘Professions for Women’, in which she regards her own career as hindered in two ways.

zh: 一是她被主流的女人意识形态所囚禁和束缚。
en: First, she was imprisoned and constrained by the dominant ideologies of womanhood.

zh: 二是表达女性激情的禁忌妨碍她“表达自己身体体验的真实 ”。
en: Second, the taboo about expressing female passion prevented her from ‘telling the truth about [her] own experiences as a body.’

zh: 我们不能排除世界语言同源的可能性，这种观点认为所有语言都来自一个“源语”，有人称之为诺斯特拉提克语。如果不是人为隐藏起来了的话，它就是被埋在了历史的深处。
en: We cannot eliminate the possibility that the entire world’s languages spring ultimately from a single source, an “ur- language” that some have termed Nostratic, which is buried, if not concealed, in the depths of the past.

zh: 对这个饶有兴味的题目感兴趣的读者，可能会想读一下加利福尼亚大学伯克利分校的乔安娜•尼科尔斯教授的著作。
en: Readers interested in this fascinating topic may wish to read the writings of Professor Johanna Nichols of the University of California at Berkeley.

zh: 像Chomskyan/Chomskyite这种交替形式的冗余性——所有这些形式都符合正常的构词规则——可以解释词汇中的一些偶然缺位（又称“词汇缺位”）现象 。
en: The redundancy of alternative forms such as Chomskyan/Chomskyite, all of which conform to the regular rules of word formation, may explain some of the accidental gaps (also called lexical gaps) in the lexicon.

zh: 偶然缺位指合式但并不存在的词。

en: Accidental gaps are well-formed but nonexisting words.

zh: 语言中实际存在的词仅仅是可能的词的一个子集而已。
en: The actual words in a language constitute only a subset of the possible words.

zh: 以这种方式运用规则叫作派生。
en: The application of rules in this way is called a derivation.

zh: 我们已举过好多派生的例子，有复数形式是如何推导出来的，有口元音音位如何变为鼻音的，还有[t]和[d]如何在某种环境下变为闪音的。
en: We have given examples of derivations that show how plurals are derived, how phonemically oral vowels become nasalized, and how /t / and /d/ become flaps in certain environments.

zh: 因而派生以一种明晰的方式既显示出一个语法音系规则的作用，又显示出一个语法中音系规则的作用结果。
en: A derivation is thus an explicit way of showing both the effects and the function of phonological rules in a grammar.

zh: 最后，派生词缀似乎可以分为两类。
en: Finally, derivational affixes appear to come in two classes.

zh: 其中一类增加后缀会引发发音上的细微变化。
en: In one class, the addition of a suffix triggers subtle changes in pronunciation.

zh: 举例来说，把词缀-ity附加到specific (发音是specifik:，最后的字母c发k音)上，得到一个新词specificity (发音是specifisity，最后的字母c发s音)。
en: For example, when we affix -ity to specific (pronounced “specifik” with a k sound), we get specificity (pronounced “specifisity” with an s sound).

zh: 然而，我们已经注意到，可以把句13理解为句14或者句15，但不能理解为句16或句17。
en: However, we have noted that 13 can have the interpretation of 14 or 15, but not of 16 or

zh: 这样，我们看到，在给定的句18的派生句中，只有在句14或者句15—而不是句16或者句17—是句18的底层结构的条件下，才能把T3应用于句18。
en: 17. Thus we can see that T3 can apply to 18 only if either 14 or 15, but not 16 or 17, was the structure underlying 18 in the given derivations of

zh: 然而，象我们刚刚看到的那样，这个并不存在于句18本身。
en: 18. However, this information is not represented in 18 itself, as we have just observed.

zh: 因此，要将T3用于句18，我们必须对句18的派生句有所了解，也就是说，我们必须掌握句18有标记的括注中所没有包含的信息。
en: Therefore, to apply T3 to 18 we must know something about the history of derivation of 18 – we must have information that would not be contained in the labeled bracketing of 18 itself.

zh: 如果我们发明一个形容词pouzy来描写静电对头发产生的效应，你马上就能理解下面这两个句子：“在地毯上走确实pouzified我的头发”，“pouzification的最佳方法就是用气球在你的头上摩擦”。
en: If we invent an adjective, pouzy, to describe the effect of static electricity on hair, you will immediately understand the sentences “Walking on that carpet really pouzified my hair” and “The best method of pouzification is to rub a balloon on your head.”

zh: 这意味着在我们的心理词典中一定有一张派生语素的清单，以及决定它们如何附加到词根或词干上的规则。
en: This means that we must have a list of the derivational morphemes in our mental dictionaries as well as the rules that determine how they are added to a root or stem.

zh: 通过附加派生语素而得到的形式被称为派生词。
en: The form that results from the addition of a derivational morpheme is called a derived word.

zh: 纵观美学理论的发展过程，人们在探讨事物真谛时那种种咬文嚼字的把戏确实已经暴露无遗。
en: It is true that the course of aesthetic theory displays its full measure of the rhetoric and logomachy which seem an inseparable part olE man's discourse about all things that really matter.

zh: 但我们对于艺术哲学的多样性和表面上的混乱现象所表示的许多不满，正是因为我们苛求批评去做其力所不能及的事，而对于批评的许多真正的功能却视而不见。
en: But a good deal of our impatience with the diversity and seeming chaos in philosophies of art is rooted in a demand from criticism for something it cannot do, at the cost of overlooking many of its genuine powers.

zh: 批评不是一门自然科学，甚至连心理科学也算不上，这是我们在今天仍然必须正视的现实结论。
en: We still need to face up to the full consequences of the realization that criticism is not a physical, not even a psychological, science.

zh: 许多文学理论入门都会对各种批评“学派”进行一番描述。
en: Many introductions to literary theory describe a series of ‘schools’ of criticism.

zh: 理论被说成是一系列不能用同一标准衡量的“研究方法”，它们各自都有自己的理论地位和批评责任。
en: Theory is treated as a series of competing ‘approaches’, each with its theoretical positions and commitments.

zh: 但是各种理论介绍所确认的理论流派——结构主义、解构主义、女权主义、心理分析、马克思主义、新历史主义——又有许多相同之处。
en: But the theoretical movements that introductions identify – such as structuralism, deconstruction, feminism, psychoanalysis, Marxism, and new historicism – have a lot in common.

zh: 典型的通用语是一种以大量母语者为基础的语言，母语属于同一语系的人们都有可能学习或使用这种通用语。
en: A lingua franca is typically a language with a broad base of native speakers, likely to be used and learned by persons with different native languages (usually in the same language family).

zh: 然而，历史上常常会出现这样的情形，来自世界某地的传教士和商人到了另一遥远的地区，并且试图与那里的居民进行交谈。在这种情况下，由于双方的接触面非常狭窄，文化也过于悬殊，所以一种语言无法有效地发挥通用语的作用。取而代之的是双方（也可能是多方）以他们的本族语为基础创造出一种词项不多、语法规则不那么复杂的初级通用语。
en: Often in history, however, speakers of mutually unintelligible languages have been brought into contact under specific socioeconomic and political conditions and have developed a language to communicate with one another that is not native to anyone.

zh: 一般来说，许多词项都选自主导语言，该主导语言被称为上层语，另外一种或几种语言则对词库和语法的贡献较少。
以这种方式混杂在一起形成的语言被称作“皮钦语”。
en: Such a language is called a pidgin.

zh: 我们可不可以再把镜头靠近一点，看一下大脑在处理语言时的运作情形呢？
en: Can we zoom in still closer, and locate smaller areas of brain that carry out more circumscribed language tasks?

zh: 这个答案是既“不可以”，也“可以”。
en: The answer is no and yes.

zh: 说“不可以”，是因为大脑中没有更小的一块地区可以赋予语言模型以标签的——至少到现在为止是不能。
en: No, there are no smaller patches of brain that one can draw a line around and label as some linguistic module —— at least, not today.

zh: 但是说“可以”，是因为皮质一定有某一部分专门负责某一种语言任务，因为大脑受伤会导致某些非常特定的语言行为缺失。
en: But yes, there must be portions of cortex that carry out circumscribed tasks, because brain damage can lead to language deficits that are startlingly specific.

zh: 这实在是一个非常诱人的两难问题。
en: It is an intriguing paradox.

zh: 病人的脑损部位是在大脑左半球的后部，现称为“韦尼克区”。
这也就是说，语言的定位偏侧于大脑左半球。
en: Language, then, is lateralized to the left hemisphere, and the left hemisphere appears to be the language hemisphere from infancy on.

zh: 偏侧化是一个术语，用来指被主要定位到脑某一侧的任何一种认知功能。
en: Lateralization is the term used to refer to the localization of function to one hemisphere of the brain.
Figure 2.3 is a view of the left side of the brain that shows Broca’s and Wernicke’s areas.

zh: 如果出现这种情况，自我与外部世界的联系就断裂了，潜意识开始建立一个替代的、妄想的现实。
en: If this happens, the link between the ego and the external world is ruptured, and the unconscious begins to build up an alternative, delusional reality.

zh: 换句话说，精神病患者在关键的地方与现实失去了联系，例如偏执狂和精神分裂症患者那样。神经官能症患者可能出现手臂瘫痪，而精神病患者则可能认为他的手臂已经变成一条象鼻子。
en: The psychotic, in other words, has lost contact with reality at key points, as in paranoia and schizophrenia: if the neurotic may develop a paralysed arm, the psychotic may believe that his arm has turned into an elephant's trunk.

zh: 大脑由左右两个大脑半球组成，两个半球之间又通过胼胝体相连（见图2.1）。胼胝体由200万 条纤维相互连接而成，能使大脑的左、右两半球相互交流。
en: The brain is composed of cerebral hemispheres, one on the right and one on the left, joined by the corpus callosum, a network of more than 200 million fibers (see Figure 2.1).The corpus callosum allows the two hemispheres of the brain to communicate with each other.

zh: 假如没有这种连接系统，大脑的左右两半球就会各自为政。
en: Without this system of connections, the two hemispheres would operate independently.

zh: 片假名用于书写外来词，同时还有与欧洲文字系统中的斜体字相类似的作用。
en: One syllabary, katakana, is used for loan words and for special effects similar to italics in European writing.

zh: 书写本族词则用平假名。
en: The other syllabary, hiragana, is used for native words.

zh: 在同一个词中，平假名语符也可以用表意语符来表示，这些语符称为日语汉字，是从汉语借来的。
en: Hiragana characters may occur in the same word as ideographic characters, which are called kanji, and are borrowed Chinese characters.

zh: 因此，日语的文字系统一部分是词语文字，一部分是音节文字。
en: Thus Japanese writing is part word writing, part syllable writing.

zh: 片假名用于书写外来词，同时还有与欧洲文字系统中的斜体字相类似的作用。
en: One syllabary, katakana, is used for loan words and for special effects similar to italics in European writing.

zh: 书写本族词则用平假名。
en: The other syllabary, hiragana, is used for native words.

zh: 在同一个词中，平假名语符也可以用表意语符来表示，这些语符称为日语汉字，是从汉语借来的。
en: Hiragana characters may occur in the same word as ideographic characters, which are called kanji, and are borrowed Chinese characters.

zh: 这种对于合成的理想自然的主张比较复杂，交待这一说法的人都引证了一个老掉牙的故事，他们这种一致的做法使人们对引经据典这个研究工作的必要条件的态度由冷漠变为厌烦。故事说的是画家雷西斯。
en: Proponents of this somewhat more complex doctrine of the composite ideal refer, with a unanimity which makes indifference to boredom the sine qua non of research, to the old story of the painter Zeuxis who (in Pliny's version), when he desired to represent Juno?

zh: 据普利尼的说法，有一次他想表现米诺的形象，“让人将当地的年轻女子都脱光衣服逐一审视，然后从中选出五个，以便将女人形体中的美妙之处，在他的画像中表现出来”
en: ,‘had the young maidens of the place stripped for examination, and selected five of them, in order to adapt in his picture the most commendable points ia the form of each.

zh: 词汇提取的许多特征可以通过词汇判定实验来检验。
en: Many properties of lexical access can be examined using lexical decision experiments.

zh: 在以下例子中，当前呈现的词和刚刚呈现过的词之间的关系被控制起来。
en: In the following example, the relationship between the current word and the immediately preceding word is manipulated.

zh: 例如，当受试者判定doctor (医生）一词时，倘若刚刚判定的词是 nurse (护士），而不是与doctor语义上毫无关系的词，如flower (花朵），那么前者判定的速度就更快。
en: For example, making a lexical decision on the word doctor will be faster if you just made a lexical decision on nurse than if you just made one on a semantically unrelated word such as flower.

zh: 这种效应称为“语义启动”：我们说mirse—词启动doctor—词。
en: This effect is known as semantic priming: we say that the word nurse primes the word doctor.

zh: 这种效应的成因也许在于语义相关的词处于心理词库的同一区域，因此，当我们听到一个启动词并在心理词库中查寻它时，它附近语义上与之相关的词会被“唤醒”，更容易在短时间内提取.
en: This effect might arise because semantically related words are located in the same part of the mental lexicon, so when we hear a priming word and look it up in the lexicon, semantically related, nearby words are “awakened” and more readily accessible for a few moments.

zh: 前腔音[p] [b] [m] [f] [v] [e] [6] [t] [d] [n] [s] [z]。前腔音调音部位在口腔前部，即齿龈隆骨往前。
en: Anteriors [p] [b] [m] [f] [v] [θ] [ð] [t] [d] [n] [s] [z] Anterior sounds are consonants produced in the front part of the mouth, that is, from the alveolar area forward.

zh: 包括唇音、齿沿音、龈音。
en: They include the labials, the interdentals, and the alveolars.

zh: 语素是一切语言中最小的语言符号。
很多语言都有前缀和后缀，但是，以怎样的方式来组配语素，可能各有方式不同。
en: Many languages have prefixes and suffixes, but languages may differ in how they deploy these morphemes.

zh: 在一种语言当中某个语素是前缀，但是在另一种语言中可能就是后缀，反之亦然。
en: A morpheme that is a prefix in one language may be a suffix in another and vice versa.

zh: 从这些方面着眼来阅读《儿子与情人》的时候，我们就是在为作品构造一个所谓的“潜本文”(sub-text)——一个活动于作品内部的本文，它在暧昧、回避或者过度强调这样一个“症候”点上暴露出来。作为读者的我们能够“写出”这个潜本文，尽管小说本身没有把它写出来。
en: In reading Sons and Lovers with an eye to these aspects of the novel, we are constructing what may be called a 'sub-text' for the work —a text which runs within it, visible at certain 'symptomatic' points of ambiguity, evasion or overemphasis, and which we as readers are able to 'write' even if the novel itself does not.

zh: 一切文学作品都包含一个或几个这样的潜本文。在某种意义上，可以把这种潜本文称为作品本身的“潜意识”。
en: All literary works contain one or more such sub-texts, and there is a sense in which they may be spoken of as the 'unconscious' of the work itself.

zh: 从俄狄浦斯过程中脱颖而出的人的主体是一个分裂的主体，它在意识和潜意识之间受到危险的撕扯；潜意识总是可以转回来折磨这个主体。
en: The human subject who emerges from the Oedipal process is a split subject, torn precariously between conscious and unconscious; and the unconscious can always return to plague it.

zh: 在日常英语中，常用“下意识”一词，而不用“潜意识”，但这是低估潜意识的根本异己性，把它设想为一个在表面下方，离表面很近的地方。
en: In popular English speech, the word 'subconscious' rather than 'unconscious' is often used; but this is to underestimate the radical otherness of the unconscious, imagining it as a place just within reach below the surface.

zh: 它低估了潜意识的极端古怪和不可思议性，潜意识是一个地方又不是一个地方，它对现实完全无动于衷，它不承认逻辑或否定或因果或矛盾，它事实上完全沉缅于欲动的本能表现以及快乐的追求之中。
en: It underestimates the extreme strangeness of the unconscious, which is a place and a non-place, which is completely indifferent to reality, which knows no logic or negation or causality or contradiction, wholly given over as it is to the instinctual play of the drives and the search for pleasure.

zh: 在我看来，研究这些课题的结构主义方法和行为主义方法的基本弱点在于：忠实于肤浅的解释，相信人的心理必定比任何一个已知的生理器官都简单，以及相信最简单的假设必定足以解释所有能观察到的现象。
en: It seems to me that the essential weakness in the structuralist and behaviorist approaches to these topics is the faith in the shallowness of explanations, the belief that the mind must be simpler in its structure than any known physical organ and that the most primitive of assumptions must be adequate to explain whatever phenomena can be observed.

zh: 于是，人们不加论证（或用定义为真的方式)就想当然地以为，语言是一种“习惯结构”或联想的连接网络；或者语言知识只不过是“知道怎祥"的事情，一种可用反应倾向系统来表示的技巧。
en: Thus, it is taken for granted without argument or evidence (or is presented as true by definition) that a language is a “habit structure” or a network of associative connections, or that knowledge of language is merely a matter of “knowing how,” a skill expressible as a system of dispositions to respond.

zh: 据此，语言知识必须通过重复和训练缓慢地发展，其明显的复杂性來自于非常简单的要素的剧增，而不是来自于心理组织的更深层的原理，这种原理就像消化或协调运动的机制那样，是内省方法所无法了解到的。
en: Accordingly, knowledge of language must develop slowly through repetition and training, its apparent complexity resulting from the proliferation of very simple elements rather than from deeper principles of mental organization that may be as inaccessible to introspection as the mechanisms of digestion or coordinated movement.

zh: 一个比喻可能是说明性或者图解性的，它提供了一个具体实例来表明某种关系，不然的话就得用抽象字眼来表述这种关系。
en: A metaphor may be illustrative or diagrammatical, providing a concrete instance of a relation which would otherwise have to be stated in abstract terms.

zh: 这是最为普通的择字或散文中比喻的用法。
en: This is the most common scientific or prose use of metaphor.

zh: 这种用法在情感语言和诗歌中是罕见的；雪莱的诗句“五彩玻璃的穹顶”几乎是脑海里闪现出来的唯一的例证。
en: It is rare in emotive language and in poetry; Shelley’s ‘Dome of many-coloured glass’ is almost the only example which springs to mind.

zh: 短语的高层结构包括助词(INFL) , 它标明时式、情态、时态和否定。
en: The higher levels of phrase structure include auxiliaries (INFL),  which signifies tense, modality, aspect, and negation.

zh: 名词用格来标示，用动词或其他述语在心理词汇中的特征来指定角色的意义。
en: Nouns are marked for case and assigned seman­tic roles by the mental dictionary entry of the verb or other predicate.

zh: 短语可以从深层结构中移出，留下一个空隙或语迹，使它可以形成问句、相关子句、被动句及其他的架构。
en: Phrases can be moved from their deep-structure positions, leaving a gap or "trace," by a structure-dependent movement rule, thereby forming questions, relative clauses, passives, and other widespread constructions.

zh: 然而，这种理论的一个显著的问题就是，说话者知道很多在现实世界中没有所指的词（比如“霍比特人、独角兽、哈利•波特”）。
en: An obvious problem for such a theory, however, is that speakers know many words that have no real-world referents (e.g., hobbits, unicorns, and Harry Potter).

zh: 可是，说话者确实知道这些词语表达的意义。
en: Yet speakers do know the meanings of these expressions.

zh: 与此类似，像of（…… 的）和 by （由、被）这样的功能词以及像 will （将）和may（可能）这样的情态动词，指的是现实世界中的什么实体？
en: Similarly, what real-world entities would function words like “of” and “by”, or “modal verbs” such as “will” or “may” refer to?

zh: 英语已不再是高度屈折化的语言，但它确实还有另外一些屈折变化词尾，例如复数后缀，通常加在某些单数名词上，如boy/boys，cat/cats等等。古英语及中古英丰富的曲折变化详见第十一章。
en: English also has other inflectional endings such as the plural suffix, which is attached to certain singular nouns, as in boy/boys and cat/cats.

zh: 在英语目前所处的历史阶段，一共有8种黏着屈折词缀。
en: In contrast to Old and Middle English, which were more richly inflected languages, as we discuss in chapter 11, modern English has only eight bound inflectional affixes.

zh: 与世界上许多其他语言相比，英语的屈折形态相对较少。
en: Compared to many languages of the world, English has relatively little inflectional morphology.

zh: 有些语言屈折程度非常高。
en: Some languages are highly inflected.

zh: 东非地区广泛使用的斯瓦希里语的动词可以与多种语素一起构成屈折变化，比如说nimepiga这个词（由ni + me + pig + a 构 成）意思是“他打[撞到]了什么东西”。
en: In Swahili, which is widely spoken in eastern Africa, verbs can be inflected with multiple morphemes, as in nimepiga (ni + me + pig + a), meaning “he has hit something.”

zh: 从生物学视角来看，组织水平问题有其独特性，仍然是一个基本问题，正如1974年会议所提出的那样。
en: The question of the level of organization at which unique properties emerge remains a basic question from a biological point of view, as it was at the 1974 conference.

zh: Gallistel的观察结果使我们想到“渠化”。这个概念是60年前沃丁顿引入进化与发展生物学领域的，指“在反应过程中，无论条件发生多小的变化都要调整以获取一个确定结果”的过程。这样才能确保“产生正常结果，即面对无法避免的存在危机时的最佳物种”。
en: Gallistel’s observations recall the concept of “canalization” introduced into evolutionary and developmental biology by C. H. Waddington sixty years ago, referring to processes “adjusted so as to bring about one definite end result regardless of minor variations in conditions during the course of the reaction,” thus ensuring “the production of the normal, that is optimal type in the face of the unavoidable hazards of existence.”

zh: 这个毛病看起来好像跟染色体第11对上的基因有关，这个基因的缺损会造成钙质摄取的不平衡，影响到发展期的大脑、脑壳和内脏。
en: The syndrome seems to be associated with a defective gene on chromosome 11 involved in the regulation of calcium, and it acts in complex ways on the brain, skull, and internal organs during development, though no one knows why it has the effects it does.

zh: 这些孩子的外表看起来彼此非常相像，但与父母都不像。他们都很矮、很瘦、脸很窄、额头很宽、鼻梁很扁、下巴缩进去、虹膜有星状图样、嘴唇很厚。
en: The children have an unusual appearance: they are short and slight, with narrow faces and broad foreheads,  at nasal bridges, sharp chins, star-shaped patterns in their irises, and full lips.

zh: 对非洲的一些民族来说，一个新生儿只是一个kintu, 即一个“东西”， 还不能算是一个muntu，即一个“人”。
en: To some people of Africa, a newborn child is a kintu, a “thing,”not yet a muntu, a“person.”

zh: 只有通过语言的学习，孩子才能成为一个人。
en: Only by the act of learning language does the child become a human being.

zh: 从这一传统来说，我们之所以都能成为“人”，是因为我们至少都掌握了一种语言。
en: According to this tradition, we all become“human”because we all know at least one language.

zh: 然而，“掌握”一种语言，究竟是什么意思呢？
en: But what does it mean to“know”a language?

zh: 在所有语言中, 某些词语和表达的指称完全依赖于话语的情境语境, 只能根据这些情境来理解。
en: In all languages, the reference of certain words and expressions relies entirely on the situational context of the utterance, and can only be understood in light of these circumstances.

zh: 语用学的这个层面称为指示功能(发音为 "dike-sis")。
en: This aspect of pragmatics is called deixis (pronounced “dike-sis”).

zh: 代词是指示的。
en: Pronouns are deictic.

zh: 它们的指称 (或缺乏指称) 最终取决于上下文。下面这样的词语:this person (这个人) these women (这些女人)that man ( 那个男人) those children (那些孩子)也是直指的，因为需要情景信息才能使听话者建立一个指称上的连接来理解其意义。
en: Their reference (or lack of same) is ultimately context dependent.Expressions such asthis person that manthese women those children are also deictic, because they require situational information for the listener to make a referential connection and understand what is meant.

zh: 这些例子说明了人称指示语的用法。
en: These examples illustrate person deixis.

zh: 它们还表明，像this和that这样的指示冠词也是直指的。
en: They also show that the demonstrative articles like this and that are deictic.

zh: 过去的几百年来，人们总是害怕他们创造的东西会比他们聪明、比他们有力量，或使他们失业。
en: For centuries, people have been terrified that their programmed creations might outsmart them, overpower them, or put them out of work.

zh: 这个恐惧在科幻小说中最常出现，从中古世纪犹太人的高伦传说——一个陶土做的泥人，因为把上帝的名字刻在他的嘴里而有了生命，到无所不能的海尔，这是电影《2001年太空漫游》里的电脑。
en: The fear has long been played out in fiction, from the medieval Jewish legend of the Golem, a clay automaton animated by an inscription of the name of God placed in its mouth, to HAL, the mutinous computer of 2001: A Space Odyss.

zh: 但是当50年代工科中一个名为“人工智慧”的分支诞生时,人们感到科幻电影中那些恐怖事情快要成真了。
en: But when the branch of engineering called ''articial intelligence'' (Al) was born in the 1950s, it looked as though fiction was about to turn into frightening fact.

zh: 虽然这是一个非常重要的问题，但现在对此还说不出什么来。
en: Although this is a very important question, there is very little that can be said about it today.

zh: 例如，有人可能会考虑人是怎样获得三维空间的某一概念这样的问题，或者用类似的话说，会考虑一种隐含的“人类行动理论”这样的问题。
en: One might, for example, consider the problem of how a person comes to acquire a certain concept of three-dimensional space, or an implicit “theory of human action,” in similar terms.

zh: 这种研究将会首先试图描写在实际行为底层的隐含理论的特征，然后转向这样一个问题：该理论在给定的时间和可得资料的条件下是如何发展的？即最后所得到的信念系统是如何由所得资料、“启发式程序”以及那些限制和支配所获得的系统的形式的先天图式，这三者间的相互作用所确定的。
en: Such a study would begin with the attempt to characterize the implicit theory that underlies actual performance and would then turn to the question of how this theory develops under the given conditions of time and access to data – that is, in what way the resulting system of beliefs is determined by the interplay of available data, “heuristic procedures,” and the innate schematism that restricts and conditions the form of the acquired system.

zh: 这当然使他和维柯直接联系了起来，这种联系可以从以下两点得到证实：即列维-斯特劳斯的最终目的是要创立关于人的普遍科学而且他的基本信念是“人创造了他们自己，就象他们创造了家畜的种类一样，唯一的区别在于前一过程不那么自觉或主动。
en: This  of  course  links  him  directly with  Vico,  a  connection  confirmed  by  his  ultimate  aim  to  produce  a ‘general  science  of  man’  as  well  as  by  his  basic  conviction  that  ‘men have made themselves to no less an extent than they have made the races of  their  domestic  animals,  the  only  difference  being  that  the  process has  been  less  conscious  or  voluntary’.

zh: 同样的关注使他和马克思的思想也有联系，列维-斯特劳斯用这样一句活承认了这种联系，他说，"马克思的那句名言"人们创造自己的历史，但是他们并不知道他们正在创 造历史’，首先证明了历史的合理性，其次，证明了人类学的合理性。”
en: The  same  concern  also  links him with the thinking of Marx and Lévi-Strauss has acknowledged that connection  in  his  remark  that  ‘the  famous  statement  by  Marx,  “men make their own history, but they do not know that they are making it” justifies first, history, and second, anthropology’ .

zh: 人民性的品质对于美学与政治都具有核心意义。
en: The quality of narodnost’ (‘popularity’) is central to both the aesthetics and the politics.

zh: 任何时代的艺术品，只要能表达一种高层次的社会意识，揭示一个特定时代真实的社会状况和情感，就获得了人民性。
en: A work of art of any period achieves this quality by expressing a high level of social awareness, revealing a sense of the true social conditions and feelings of a particular epoch.

zh: 这样的作品也将具有一种“进步的”面貌，从目前的情形瞥见未来的发展，从劳动人民大众的观点看到社会发展的理想图景。
en: It will also possess a ‘progressive’ outlook, glimpsing the developments of the future in the lineaments of the present, and giving a sense of the ideal possibilities of social development from the point of view of the mass of working people.

zh: 这一过程中存在着避免过早地把文本意义封闭，让文本与一般语言的差异、形式特征和无定性的语义游戏得到最充分的展开这样一种愿望。
en: There is here, however, a desire to avoid premature foreclosure, to allow the text to differentiate itself from ordinary language, to grant maximum scope to the play of formal features and of semantic uncertainties.

zh: 我们非但不去解决理解主题或某人物对某问题的陈述方面的困难，反而故意保留这些困难，而我们的注意力则放在文本组织上，当作对某些其他问题的说明。
en: Instead of attempting to resolve difficulties so as to produce themes or statements by a persona about a particular problem one may seek to preserve those difficulties by organizing the text as an illustration of certain problems.

zh: 这一切的最高层次就是说明语言本身的问题。
en: At the highest level they are problems of language itself.

zh: 叙述的快乐、满足是与欲望相关联的。
en: The pleasure of narrative is linked to desire.

zh: 情节讲述的是欲望和欲望的命运,而叙述本身的发展是受以强烈的“认识欲”的形式出现的欲望驱使的，是想知道的欲望：我们想要发现秘密，想要了解结局，想要掌握真情。
en: Plots tell of desire and what befalls it, but the movement of narrative itself is driven by desire in the form of ‘epistemophilia’, a desire to know: we want to discover secrets, to know the end, to find the truth.

zh: 如果说是这种要主宰一切的“男性”冲动驱使着叙述，驱使着揭晓真相（赤裸裸的真相）的欲望，那么叙述提供给我们的，可以满足那个愿望的知识是不是欲望的结果呢？
en: If what drives narrative is the ‘masculine’ urge to mastery, the desire to unveil the truth (the ‘naked truth’), then what of the knowledge that narrative offers us to satisfy that wish?Is that knowledge itself an effect of desire?

zh: 理论家们要探究关于欲望、故事和知识之间的关系这类问题。
en: Theorists ask such questions about the links between desire, stories, and knowledge.

zh: “现在”这个短语就像Mount-castle所说的“尚未”一样，表达了一种对正常科学发展情况下可能很快会发生的降幅的期待。
en: The phrase “at present,” like Mount-castle’s word “yet,” expresses the expectation that the reduction should take place in the normal course of scientific progress, perhaps soon.

zh: 在物理学和化学领域，这一点从未发生过：所发生的只是几乎毫无变化的化学与不断修正的物理学之间的联合。
en: In the case  of physics and chemistry, it never did: what happened was unification of a virtually unchanged chemistry with a radically revised physics.

zh: 根本没必要补充说，八十年前人们对这些领域的理解及所达到的成就远超当今大脑科学与认知科学。
en: It’s hardly necessary to add that the state of understanding and achievement in those areas eighty years ago was far beyond anything that can be claimed for the brain and cognitive sciences today.

zh: 因此，认定人们已理解的内容会不断发生“降幅”，这并不合适。
en: Hence confidence in “reduction” to the little that is understood is not necessarily appropriate.

zh: 35年前，一个新的科学诞生了，我们称之为“认知科学”。它结合了心理学、电子计算机学、语言学、哲学和神经生物学，试图解释人的智力活动是怎么一回事。
en: Some thirty-five years ago a new science was born.Now called ''cognitive science," it combines tools from psychology, computer science, linguistics, philosophy, and neurobiology to explain the workings of human intelligence.

zh: 自此之后，语言的科学进步神速，我们对于许多语言现象的了解，差不多和我们对照相机或脾脏的功能一样清楚。
en: The science of language, in particular, has seen spectacular advances in the years since.There are many phenomena of language that we are coming to understand nearly as well as we understand how a camera works or what the spleen is for.

zh: 另一套是日语汉字，是一种表意文字，每个符号对应着一个词（详见第十二章对文字的讨论）。
en: The other system, kanji, is ideographic; each symbol corresponds to a word.(More about this in chapter 12 on writing systems.)

zh: 日语汉字的基础不是日语的语音。
en: Kanji is not based on the sounds of the language.

zh: 大脑左半球受损的日本人阅读假名的能力有障碍，而右半球受损的日本人则是阅读日语汉字的能力有障碍。
en: Japanese people with left-hemisphere damage are impaired in their ability to read kana, whereas people with right-hemisphere damage are impaired in their ability to read kanji.

zh: 对正常日语说话者进行的实验也表明，阅读日语汉字时大脑右半球比左半球处理得更准确一些，也更快一些，假名的情况则正好相反。
en: Also, experiments with unimpaired Japanese readers show that the right hemisphere is better and faster than the left hemisphere at reading kanji, and vice versa.

zh: 现在我们可以用带声性、鼻音性、调音部位和调音方式来区别英语中所有的辅音。
en: We are now capable of distinguishing all of the consonant sounds of English via the properties of voicing, nasality, and place and manner of articulation.

zh: 例如，[f]是唇齿清（口）擦音；[n]是龈（带）鼻塞音。
en: For example, [f] is a voiceless, (oral), labiodental fricative; [n] is a (voiced), nasal, alveolar stop.

zh: 括号中的特征一般由于冗余而未被提及。除非特别指出是鼻音之外，其他所有音都是口音；英语中所有鼻音都是带声的。
en: The parenthesized features are usually not mentioned because they are redundant; all sounds are oral unless nasal is specifically mentioned, and all nasals are voiced in English.

zh: A栏中所有黑体元音都重读，元音音素都不一样，B栏中所有黑体元音都没有重读或弱化，而是读混元音[ə]。
en: In column A all the boldfaced vowels are stressed vowels with a variety of vowel phones; in column B the boldfaced vowels are without stress or reducedand are pronounced as schwa [ə].
