zh: 在这些例子中，单词的重音形式由于后缀不同而变化。
en: In these cases the stress pattern of the word varies because of the different suffixes.

zh: 在一种形式里重读的元音在另一种形式里会弱化, 因此发音为 [ə]。
en: The vowel that is stressed in one form becomes reduced in a different form and is therefore pronounced as [ə].

zh: 所有根语素的音位表征包含一个非弱化元音, 如/i/或/e/弱化时发音 [ə]。
en: The phonemic representations of all of the root morphemes contain an unreduced vowel such as /i/ or /e/ that is phonetically [ə] when it is reduced.

zh: 一端是普通的观点，认为语言只是为独立存在的思维提供了名称，为先于它而存在的思维提供了表达方法；另一端是以两位语言学家的名字命名的“萨丕尔——沃尔夫假说”（Sapir-Whorf hypothesis)这两位语言学家认为我们所说的语言决定我们能够思维什么。
en: At one extreme is the common-sense view that language justprovides names for thoughts that exist independently; language offersways of expressing pre-existing thoughts.At the other extreme is the ‘Sapir-Whorf hypothesis’, named after two linguists who claimed that the language we speak determines what we can think.

zh: 比如，沃尔夫提出印第安霍皮族（Hopi）有一种关于时间的概念，在英语里就找不到这种概念。（所以英语就无法表达它！）
en: For instance, Whorf argued that the Hopi Indians have a conception of time that can’tbe grasped in English (and so can’t be explained here!).

zh: 塞擦音[tʃ]和[dʒ]，发音时先成阻，紧接着是一个较慢的除阻，造成了擦音的效果。
en: Affricates [tʃ] [dʒ] These sounds are produced by a stop closure followed immediately by a gradual release of the closure that produces an effect characteristic of a fricative.

zh: 在church（教堂）和judge（判断）两词的起音和收音分别是硬腭清塞擦音和硬腭带塞擦音。
en: The palatal sounds that begin and end the words church and judge are voiceless and voiced affricates, respectively.

zh: 塞擦音不是通音，因为它在开头有阻塞。
en: Affricates are not continuants because of the initial stop closure.

zh: 上面讨论了英语中的音素。
en: We have been discussing the sounds that occur in English.

zh: 有些音素，包括有些塞音，其他语言中也有，而英语没有。
en: A variety of stop consonants occur in other languages but not in English.

zh: 例如玻利维亚和秘鲁的盖丘亚语中有小舌塞音。发音时舌体后部往后伸与小舌接触造成完全闭塞。
en: For example, in Quechua, spoken in Bolivia and Peru, uvular stops occur, where the back of the tongue is raised and moved rearward to form a complete closure with the uvula.

zh: 这里肯定存在着某种普遍的句法原理，排除了60来源于62的可能性，而使我们把61作为60的基础。
en: There must be some general syntactic principle that rules against 62 as possible sources for 60 and that causes us to interpret 60 as based rather on 61.

zh: 罗森堡提出，以上所涉及的是有关省略操作的某种条件—即“删节原理”，它粗略地规定嵌入命题中的主语可以被该命题外最靠近的那个名词短语所删去。这里的“远近”是以1’或2’这样的表征方式所表示的树枝数目来测量的。
en: Rosenbaum suggests that what is involved is a certain condition on deletion operations, an “erasure principle” that prescribes roughly that the subject of an embedded proposition is deleted by the nearest noun phrase outside of this proposition, “nearness” being measured in terms of the number of branches in a representation such as 1'or 2'.

zh: 伊格尔顿在他的文章中进一步探求了晚期资本主义中艺术和商品会合的观念。
en: Eagleton, in his article, further pursues the idea of the convergence of art and commodity in late capitalism.

zh: 马克思对金钱与交换价值的分析包含了“商品拜物教”的概念。
en: Marx’s analysis of money and exchange value included the concept of ‘commodity fetishism’.

zh: 这个概念指的是人的劳动被转化成劳动产品时那个不断神秘化的过程；劳动时间赋予产品的价值被看作产品本身一个独立的、客观的性质。
en: This refers to the mystifying process by which human labour is transposed into its products: the value which labour time bestows upon products is seen as an independent and objective property of the products themselves.

zh: 这种无法看清产品的本质归根结底是社会异化和剥削造成的。
en: This inability to see products for what they are is at the root of social alienation and exploitation.

zh: 洋泾浜的大多数词汇都来自于主流群体的语言。
en: Most of the lexical items of the pidgin come from the language of the dominant group.

zh: 这种语言称为上层语言。
en: This language is called superstrate or lexifier language.

zh: 例如, 英语(种植园主的语言) 是夏威夷洋泾浜英语的上层语言,斯瓦希里语是在东非和中非所讲的各种形式的洋泾浜斯瓦希里语, 以及在马来西亚、新加坡和印尼所讲的巴刹马来语。
en: For example, English (the language of the plantation owners) is the superstrate language for Hawaiian Pidgin English, Swahili for the various forms of Pidgin Swahili spoken in East and Central Africa, and Bazaar Malay for pidgins spoken in Malaysia, Singapore, and Indonesia.

zh: 清音可以是送气的或不送气的。
en: Voiceless sounds may also be aspirated or unaspirated.

zh: 发送气音时除阻后声带还分开一会儿，结果有一股气流冲出。
en: In the production of aspirated sounds, the vocal cords remain apart for a brief time after the stop closure is released, resulting in a puff of air at the time of the release.

zh: 辅音还可按照某些特征组成更大的类，如唇音、舌冠音、前腔音、咝音等。
en: Consonants may be grouped according to certain features to form larger classes such as labials, coronals, anteriors, and sibilants.

zh: 阿尔都塞避免使用诸如“社会体制”、“秩序”之类的术语，因为这些术语暗示了一种具有中心的结构，这个中心决定了所有由它辐射出的部分的形式。
en: Althusser avoids terms such as ‘social system’ and ‘order’, because they suggest a structure with a centre which determines the form of all its emanations.

zh: 他多用的术语则是“社会生成”（social formation）之类，在他看来，这一说法表示一种“无中心的”结构。
en: Instead he talks of the ‘social formation’, which he regards as a ‘decentred’ structure.

zh: 与有生命的机体不同，这样的结构没有主导原则，没有起源的种子，没有总体的统一性。
en: Unlike a living organism this structure has no governing principle, no originating seed, no overall unity.

zh: 当然，社会主义批评和女权主义批评关心发展一些适于其目标的理论和方法：他们考虑写作与性之间的关系或本文与意识形态等问题，而其他一些理论对此并不加以考虑。
en: Socialist criticism and feminist criticism are, of course, concerned with developing theories and methods appropriate to their aims: they consider questions of the relations between writing and sexuality, or of text and ideology, as other theories in general do not.

zh: 他们肯定也会宣称这些理论比其他一些理论具有更强的解释力；因为，假如这些理论并非如此，将其作为理论提出就没有什么意义。
en: They will also want to claim that these theories are more powerfully explanatory than others, for if they were not there would be no point in advancing them as theories.

zh: 但是，如果认为这些批评的特殊性仅在于提出了另外一些可行的理论和方法，那也是错误的。
en: But it would be a mistake to see the particularity of such forms of criticism as consisting in the offering of alternative theories of methods.

zh: 这些批评不同于其他批评是因为它们为自己规定了不同的对象，它们有不同的价值标准、信念和若干目标，并为实现这些目标而制定了不同的战略。
en: These forms of criticism differ from others because they define the object of analysis differently, have different values, beliefs and goals, and thus offer different kinds of strategy for the realizing of these goals.

zh: 西方的马克思主义批评往往是冒险的、令人振奋的，可是作为官方的共产主义“艺术方法”的社会主义现实主义对西方读者来说，就常常是枯燥的、狭隘的了。
en: Marxist criticism written in the West has often been adventurous and exhilarating, but Socialist Realism, as the official Communist ‘artistic method’, seemed drab and blinkered to Western readers.

zh: 前苏联作家联盟（1932-1934）阐发的基本原则采用了列宁革命前提出又在随后的20年代给予解释的某些论述。
en: The doctrines expounded by the Union of Soviet Writers (1932-4) appealed to certain of Lenin’s pre-Revolutionary statements as these were interpreted during the 1920s.

zh: 这些原则涉及了文学的进化、文学对阶级关系的反映以及文学在社会中的作用等主要问题。
en: The theory addressed certain major questions about the evolution of literature, its reflection of class relations and its function in society.

zh: 结构主义人类学家克劳德·列维－施特劳斯在分析俄底浦斯神话时，采用了真正结构主义的语言学模式。
en: Claude Lévi-Strauss, the structuralist anthropologist, analyses the Oedipus myth in a manner which is truly structuralist in its use of the linguistic model.

zh: 他借鉴语言学中的音素和词素，把神话中的单元叫做“神话素”（mytheme）。
en: He calls the units of myth ‘mythemes’ (compare phonemes and morphemes in linguistics).

zh: 这些神话素像基本的语言单元一样根据二元对立的原则结构在一起（见前文）。
en: They are organized in binary oppositions (see above, p. 65) like the basic linguistic units.

zh: 和前一版一样，本书配有细节极为丰富的磁共振成像(MRI)和正电子发射断层成像（PET)的人脑扫描图像。本章还重点介绍了过去儿年间神经语言学研究取得的一些惊人的新成果。
en: As in the previous edition, highly detAn introduction to languageed illustrations of MRI and PET scans of the brain are included, and this chapter highlights some of the new results and tremendous progress in the study of neurolinguistics over the past few years.

zh: 对于语言在人脑中的自主性本书作了细致的论证，以便学生明白如何应用实验证据来支持科学理论。
en: The arguments for the autonomy of language in the human brain are carefully crafted so that the student sees how experimental evidence is applied to support scientific theories.

zh: 脑是人体中最复杂的器官。
en: The brain is the most complex organ of the body.

zh: 它位于颅骨之下，由大约100亿个神经细胞（神经元）和数十亿条将神经细胞相互连接在一起的神经纤维组成。
en: It lies under the skull and consists of approximately 100 billion nerve cells (neurons) and billions of fibers that interconnect them.

zh: 脑的表层是皮质，通常称为“灰质”， 由几十亿个神经元构成。
en: The surface of the brain is the cortex, often called “gray matter,” consisting of billions of neurons.

zh: 我们对付我们不能实现的欲望的一个方法是使之“升华”。弗洛伊德所说的“升华”，指的是把欲望引向为社会更加推崇的目标。
en: One way in which we cope with desires we cannot fulfill is by 'sublimating' them, by which Freud means directing them towards a more socially valued end.

zh: 我们可以通过建造桥梁与大教堂来使我们受挫性欲无意识地得到宣泄。
en: We might find an unconscious outlet for sexual frustration in building bridges or cathedrals.

zh: 对于弗洛伊德来说，文明本身就是依靠这样的升华产生的：驾驭我们的本能并将其转用于这些更高的目标，就创造了文化历史本身。
en: For Freud, it is by virtue of such sublimation that civilization itself comes about: by switching and harnessing our instincts to these higher goals, cultural history itself is created.

zh: 所有这一切并非没有意义。
en: The whole matter is not without interest.

zh: 我在前面曾讲过，在17世纪的观念和今日的认知心理学及语言学之间存在着惊人的相似。
en: I mentioned earlier that there are striking similarities between the seventeenth-centur yclimate of opinion and that of contemporary cognitive psychology and linguistics.

zh: 其中一点恰好与解释理论的问题有关。
en: One point of similarity has to do with precisely this matter of explanatory theory.

zh: 哲学语法与现行的生成语法很相象，它自觉地形成描述传统的反向；这种描述传统把语法学家的任务仅仅理解为记录和组织语言用法的资料，即一种自然历史。
en: Philosophical grammar, very much like current generative grammar, developed in self-conscious opposition to a descriptive tradition that interpreted the task of the grammarian to be merely that of recording and organizing the data of usage – a kind of natural history.

zh: 最后，应该谈一谈诺姆·乔姆斯基。
en: Finally, one should say a word about Noam Chomsky.

zh: 尽管某些结构主义者在他们的后期著作中采用了他的某些术语，生成语法在结构主义的发展过程中却没有发挥什么作用。
en: Although a few structuralists have in their later work adopted some of his terms, generative grammar plays no role in the development of structuralism.

zh: 它所提供的是一种颇具示范性的方法论的陈述，在我们的讨论中，它的重要性正在这里。
en: What it does offer, and what gives it its importance in this discussion, is a methodological statement of exemplary clarity.

zh: 易言之，乔姆斯基的语言理论能使我们了解，结构主义语言学家究竟在干什么，他们的实践有何意义，他们对自己学科所作的叙述为什么会引起误解或令人感到不足。
en: That is to say, Chomsky’s theory of language enables us to see what structural linguists were actually doing, what their practice implied, and how their accounts of their discipline were misleading or insufficient.

zh: 华兹华斯写下了许多最优秀的诗篇，其中包括《序曲》中一些髙潮性诗段。把热情、生命 和相貌强行加诸于自然景色，这种做法是许多浪漫主义大师所共 有的少数几个特点之一。
en: Wordsworth devoted a number of his best poems and the climactic passages of the Prelude, The habitual reading of passion, life, and physiognomy into the landscape is one of the few salient attributes common to most of the major romantic poets.

zh: 与此相应，文学批评也将传统视为一种修辞格的拟人法——即赋予自然对象的真实生命，将其当成最髙的想象力的主要标志，并且几乎认为，想象力本身就足以表达 最佳诗歌。
en: Correspondingly, in literary criticism the valid animation of natural objects, traditionally treated as one form of the rhetorical device of prosopopoeia, or personification now came to be a major index to the sovereign faculty of imagination, and almost in itself a suffcient criterion of the highest poetry.

zh: 我想谈谈所谓的“生物语言学视角”。它于半个世纪前在几个研究生的讨论中成形。这些学生在战后初期受到生物学和数学领域发展成果的极大影响，也包括逐渐在美国为人所知的行为学。
en: I would like to say a few words about what has come to be called “the biolinguistic perspective,”which began to take shape half a century ago in discussions among a few graduate students who were much influenced by developments in biology and mathematics in the early postwar years, including work in ethology that was just coming to be known in the United States.

zh: 埃里克·勒纳伯格就是这些学生之一。他出版于1967年的重要研究成果《语言的生物学基础》仍然是该领域的基本著作。
en: One of them was Eric Lenneberg, whose seminal 1967 study Biological Foundations of Language remains a basic document of the field.

zh: 彼时，相当多的交流活动也在发展中，包括跨领域研讨会和国际学术会议等。
en: By then considerable interchange was proceeding, including interdisciplinary seminars and international conferences.

zh: 影响力最大的当属1974年首届“生物语言学”会议。
en: The most far-reaching one, in 1974, was called, for the first time, “Biolinguistics.”

zh: 该会议上提出的诸多前沿问题至今仍然处于热议之中。
en: Many of the leading questions discussed there remain very much alive today.

zh: 说出来的一个语句，首先是说话人脑/心中的一条信息。
en: A spoken utterance starts as a message in the speaker's brain/mind.

zh: 该信息转换成语言形式并被解读为一条说话指令， 以声学信号的形式出现。
en: It is put into linguistic form and interpreted as articulation commands, emerging as an acoustic signal.

zh: 信号经听话人耳朵的处理后，发送至他的脑/心，在那里得到解读。
en: The signal is processed by the listener’s ear and sent to the brain/mind, where it is interpreted.

zh: 语音科学试图描写世界上所有语言中所用的所有的音。
en: The science of phonetics attempts to describe all of the sounds used in all languages of the world.

zh: 声学语音学关注语音的物理属性；听觉语音学关注听者如何感知语音。发音语音学研究的则是声道如何发出语音，这也是本章的主题。
en: Acoustic phonetics focuses on the physical properties of sounds; auditory phonetics is concerned with how listeners perceive these sounds; and articulatory phonetics—the primary concern of this chapter—is the study of how the vocal tract produces the sounds of language.

zh: 可是，抒情诗则往往可以从整体上去把握，无须涉及历时发展顺序；无须自A至B的运动。格莱麦写道，尤其是现代诗歌，它是“分类系统的散漫显现”。
en: Lyrics, however, may often be grasped as a whole without any reference to temporal development; there need be no movement from A to B. Modern poetry in particular, Greimas writes, is the 'discursive manifestation of a taxonomy'.

zh: 读者所接触的短语或意象，均以原生的、散漫的状态联系在一起，他必须从中提取可用于把文本组织成两两相对类型的种种特征。
en: The reader is faced with phrases or images, linked in rudimentary discursive fashion, from which he must extract features that he can use to organize the text into oppositional classes.

zh: 句子中的NP主语和VP中的论元在语义上以各种方式与动词相关联。
en: The NP arguments in the VP, which include the subject and any objects, are semantically related in various ways to the verb.

zh: 这些关系取决于这个特定动词的意义。
en: The relations depend on the meaning of the particular verb.

zh: 例如，在下面句子中的NP the boy (那个男孩)：(1) The boy rolled a red ball.
en: For example, the NP the boy in the sentence: 1.

zh: （那个男孩(施事)滚动一个红色的球(主位)。
en: The boy (agent) rolled a red ball (theme).

zh: ）是滚动动作的“行使者”又称“施事”，NP a red ball （—个红色的球）是滚动动作的主位，或“经受者”。
en: is the “doer” of the rolling action, also called the agent.The NP a red ball is the theme or the “undergoer” of the rolling action.

zh: 像施事、主位和其他我们马上要提到的关系都称为题元角色。
en: Relations such as agent and theme are called thematic roles.

zh: 言语行为理论告诉我们,人们用语言做事,比如打赌、提出警告,或者提名候选人。
en: The theory of speech acts tells us that people use language to do things such as lay bets, issue warnings, or nominate candidates.

zh: 通过“我提名比尔•史密斯”这句话，你可能就完成了一个提名行为，让比尔•史密斯可以竞选公职。
en: By using the words “I nominate Bill Smith,” you may accomplish an act of nomination that allows Bill Smith to run for office.

zh: “做事”的动词称为施行动词。
en: Verbs that “do things” are called performative verbs.

zh: 在所有这些句子中，说话者是主语(即句子是第一人称)。
en: In all of these sentences, the speaker is the subject (i.e.

zh: 主语通过说这些句子来完成一些别的行为,如挑战、提名或辞职。
en: , the sentences are in first person), who by uttering the sentence is accomplishing some additional action, such as daring, nominating, or resigning.

zh: 此外，所有这些句子都是现在时的肯定陈述句。
en: In addition, all of these sentences are affirmative, declarative, and in the present tense.

zh: 它们是典型的施行句。
en: They are typical performative sentences.

zh: 究其原因也不难：文学作品的形式和篇幅各有不同，而且大多数作品似乎与通常被认为不属于文学作品的东西有更多的相同之处，而与那些被公认为是 学作品的相同之点反倒不多。
en: The reasons are not far to seek: works of literature come in all shapes and sizes and most of them seem to have more incommon with works that aren’t usually called literature than they do with some other works recognized as literature.

zh: 以夏洛蒂·勃朗特的《简爱》为例，它更像是一篇自传，与十四行诗很少有相似之处；而罗勃特·彭斯（Robert Burns)的一首诗“我的爱就像一朵红红的玫瑰”则更像一首民谣，与莎士比亚的《哈姆雷特》也很少有共同之处。
en: Charlotte Brontë’s Jane Eyre, for instance, more closely resembles an autobiography than it does a sonnet, and a poem by Robert Burns – ‘My love is like a red, red rose’ –resembles a folk-song more than it does Shakespeare’s Hamlet.

zh: 那么，诗歌、剧本、小说是否有一些共同的持点使它们与歌谣、对话的文字记录，以及自传区别开来呢？
en: Are there qualities shared by poems, plays, and novels that distinguish them from, say, songs, transcriptions of conversations, and autobiographies?

zh: 时装具有特别复杂的符号意义，可以同时具有社会的、政治的、性的和审美的功能。
en: Fashions are especially complex signs and may possess social, political, erotic and aesthetic functions.

zh: 文学产品同样具有多种功能。
en: The same variability of function can be seen in literary products.

zh: 一篇政治演讲稿、一篇传记、一封信和一件宣传品在不同的社会和时代可能有审美功能，也可能没有审美功能。
en: A political speech, a biography, a letter and a piece of propaganda may or may not possess aesthetic value in different societies and periods.

zh: “艺术”范畴的周边界限总是在变化着，而且总是与某种社会结构发生着动态的关联。
en: The circumference of the sphere of ‘art’ is always changing, and always dynamically related to the structure of society.

zh: 利维斯的各字与“实用批评”和“仔细阅读”紧密相联；他所发表的一些著作堪入本世纪最明敏的、具有开创性的英国文学批评之列。
en: Leavis's name is closely associated with 'practical criticism' and 'close read- ing', and some of his own published work ranks with the most subtle, pioneering English criticism that the century has seen.

zh: “实用批评”这个词值得稍加深入地思考。
en: It is worth pondering this term 'practical criticism' a little further.

zh: 实用批评意味着一种方法，它摒弃辞藻华丽的纯文学空话，完全不惮于分解作品；但是它也假定，只要将注意集中于脱离其文化和历史背景的诗或散文作品，你就可以判断文学的“伟犬性”和“中心性”。
en: Practical criticism meant a method which spurned belle-lettristic waffle and was properly unafraid to take the text apart; but it also assumed that you could judge literary 'great- ness' and 'centrality' by bringing a focused attentiveness to bear on poems or pieces of prose isolated from their cultural and historical contexts.

zh: 史诗中有口头吟诵：诗人直接面对听众。
en: In epic, there is oral recitation: a poet directly confronting the listening audience.

zh: 在戏剧中，剧作家看不到观众，而是由舞台上的角色去叙述。
en: In drama, the author isconcealed from the audience and the characters on stage talk.

zh: 抒情诗的情况最复杂，诗人或唱或吟诵，可以说是背对听众的，“做出自言自语或对其他什么人讲话的样子：也许是对大自然中的一个精灵, 对缪斯，对一位朋友，对一个情人、一个神灵、一个人格化了的抽象事物，或是某个自然的对象”。
en: In lyric–the most complicated case–the poet, in singing or chanting, turns his back on his listeners, so to speak, and ‘pretends to be talking to himself or to someone else: a spirit of Nature, a Muse, a personal friend, a lover, a god, a personified abstraction, or a natural object’.

zh: 我们还可以把小说这个现代体裁加到这三个基本体裁当中去。小说通过一部书与读者交谈——我们将在第六章专门论述这个题目。
en: To these three elementary genres we can add the modern genre of the novel, which addresses the reader through a book–a topic we’ll take up in Chapter 6.

zh: 主要在法国活动的罗马尼亚理论家路西安·哥德曼（Lucien Goldmann）不赞成文本是天才个人的创造的观点，他争辩说，文本的创造是来自特定集团（或阶级）的那种“超个人的精神结构”。
en: Lucien Goldmann, a Romanian theorist based in France, rejected the idea that texts are creations of individual genius and argued that they are based upon ‘trans-individual mental structures’ belonging to particular groups or classes).

zh: 这样的“世界观”处在永恒的建构与消解中，因为拥有这些世界观的社会集团为回应不断变化的现实要不断调整他们关于世界的精神形象。
en: These ‘world-views’ are perpetually being constructed and dissolved by social groups as they adjust their mental image of the world in response to the changing reality before them.

zh: 这样的精神形象在一般社会活动分子的意识中往往不能获得清晰的界定和完全的认识，只有伟大的作家们能够把这样的世界观清晰地凝聚在透明而有机的形中。
en: Such mental images usually remain ill-deﬁned and half-realized in the consciousness of social agents but great writers are able to crystallize world-views in a lucid and coherent form.

zh: 在一些情景中，“乐队排练，我家，6点到8点”是一句提醒，但同样的句子在不同的语境下可能变成警告。
en: In some situations Band practice, my house, 6 to 8 is a reminder, but the same sentence may be a warning in a different context.

zh: 这些我们称之为“隐含的目的”或“说话者意图”——可能是一个提醒、警告、承诺、威胁或别的什么，也就是言语行为的示意语力。
en: We call this underlying purpose of the utterance—be it a reminder, a warning, a promise, a threat, or whatever— the illocutionary force of a speech act.

zh: 因为言语行为的示意语力取决于说话的语境，所以言语行为理论是语用学的一部分。
en: Because the illocutionary force of a speech act depends on the context of the utterance, speech act theory is a part of pragmatics.

zh: 我们可以得出这样的结论，文学是一种可以引起某种关注的言语行为，或者叫文本事件。
en: Literature, we might conclude, is a speech act or textual event that elicits certain kinds of attention.

zh: 它与其他种类的言语行为不同，比如告知信息、提出问题或者做出承诺等。
en: It contrasts with other sorts of speech acts, such as imparting information, asking questions, or making promises.

zh: 大多数情况下是读者发现了那种可以把一些文字定义为文学的语境，从而才把这些文字视为文学，比如他们在一本诗集、一份杂志的某一部分，或者图书馆和书店里看到的那些东西。
en: Most of the time what leads readers to treat something as literature is that they find it in a context that identifies it as literature: in a book of poems or a section of a magazine, library, or bookstore.

zh: 其中一条叫作适量准则说，说话者所提供的话语应按照要求提供信息一一不多也不少。
en: One such maxim, the maxim of quantity, states that a speaker’s contribution to the discourse should be as informative as is required—neither more nor less.

zh: 哈姆雷特在多和少两个方向上都违反了这一原则。
en: Hamlet has violated this maxim in both directions.

zh: 他用“空话，空话，空话”来回答他在读什么这个问题，提供的信息太少。
en: In answering “Words, words, words” to the question of what he is reading, he is providing too little information.

zh: 衍推的概念经常被用来揭示我们关于其他语义关系的知识。
en: The notion of entAn introduction to languagement can be used to reveal knowledge that we have about other meaning relations.

zh: 比如说,不考虑同义反复句和矛盾句，如果两个句子在相同的情况下同时为真或者同时为假，这两个句子就是同义句（或者是释义句）。
en: For example, omitting tautologies and contradictions, two sentences are synonymous (or paraphrases) if they are both true or both false with respect to the same situations.

zh: 像“杰克推迟了会议”和“杰克推后了会议”就是同义句，因为当其中一句为真时，另一句也必然为真；当其中一句为假时，另一句也必然为假。
en: Sentences like Jack put off the meeting and Jack postponed the meeting are synonymous, because when one is true the other must be true; and when one is false the other must also be false.

zh: 中国政府采用了一种罗马字母的拼写系统，称为拼音。现在拼音与汉字系统同时使用，以针对一些特定的目的。
en: The Chinese government has adopted a spelling system using the Roman alphabet called Pinyin, which is now used alongside the regular system of characters.

zh: 城市街道上的许多指示牌既有汉字也有拼音，方便了外国旅游者。
en: By the time of the Summer Olympics of 2008, nearly all public information signs in Beijing, such as the names of streets, parks, restaurants, hotels, and shopping centers, were printed in both systems for the convenience of foreign visitors.

zh: 政府并不想让汉语拼音取代传统的汉字，而是把汉字看作中国文化的一个组成部分。
en: It is not the government’s intent to replace the traditional writing, which is an integral part of Chinese culture.

zh: 此外，对中国人来说，汉字书写是一种艺术—即书法；几千年来的诗歌、文学、历史都保存在古老的文字系统中。
en: To the Chinese, writing is an art—calligraphy—and thousands of years of poetry, literature, and history are preserved in the old system.

zh: 巴尔特没有讨论情节的不稳定性，虽然这个问题已包括在阐释代码的范畴之内。
en: Barthes does not discuss uncertainties of plot, though they do fall within the scope of the hermeneutic code.

zh: 他基本上关注的是身份属性的疑点。
en: He is concerned primarily with mysteries of identity.

zh: 书名往往变成这样的疑团：《米德尔马奇》一直读到第六章，我们才弄清它究竟是一个人，一个家族，一幢宅第，一座城市，还是一个主题隐喻。
en: Titles tend to be enigmas of this kind: it is not until chapter 6 that we know whether Middlemarch is a person, a family, a house, a town or a thematic metaphor.

zh: 我们已经按调音部位描写了几类辅音，但每一类内仍无法互相区别。
en: We have described several classes of consonants according to their place of articulation, yet we are still unable to distinguish the sounds in each class from one another.

zh: 例如[p]跟[b]有什么区别，[b]和[m]又有什么不同？
en: What distinguishes [p] from [b] or [b] from [m]?

zh: 他们都是双唇音。
en: All are bilabial sounds.

zh: 又如，同是龈音的[t]，[d]和[n]之间有什么区别？
en: What is the difference between [t], [d], and [n], which are all alveolar sounds?

zh: 许多对双语现象的早期研究都集中讨论这样一个事实，即双语儿童有时会在同一个句子中混用两种语言。法英双语儿童所说的下列例句就说明了这一点。
en: Much of the early research into bilingualism focused on the fact that bilingual children sometimes mix the two languages in the same sentences, as the following examples from French-English bilingual children illustrate.

zh: 在第一个例子中，一个法语词出现在本该是英语的句子里。
en: In the first example, a French word appears in an otherwise English sentence.

zh: 在其他两个例子中，所用的词都是英语的，然而句法却是法语的。
en: In the other two examples, all of the words are English but the syntax is French.

zh: 那些假借读者思维和感情的混合型写作方式迩渐危及日益认识到两疔之间差别的现代意识。
en: Mixed modes of writing which enlist the reader’s feeling as well as his thinking are becoming dangerous to  the modern  consciousness  with  its  increasing awareness of  the  distinction.

zh: 思想和感情目前会使彼此误入歧途，而六个世纪以前这些情况就不大可能发生，倘若这种合二为一的笔法确实再度受人欢迎，我们就需要更纯粹的科学和更纯粹的诗歌的魔力才能把作者与读者的思想感情混合起来。
en: Thought  and  feeling  are  able  to mislead one another at present in ways which were hardly possible  six  centuries  ago.We  need  a  spell  of  purer  science  and purer poetry before the two can again be mixed, if indeed this will  ever  become  once  more  desirable.

zh: 我在第二版中増加了一个讨论艾略特先生诗歌的附识，以便说明我这虽所谓的纯粹性，还有一些补充意见是谈论价值的。在第二版中修改了个别枝节问题。
en: In  the  Second  Edition  I added a note on Mr. Eliot’s poetry which will elucidate what I mean  here  by  purity,  and  some  supplementary  remarks  upon Value; in the Third, a few minor improvements have been made.

zh: 此外，[a]是紧元音，而 [ӕ]，[ʌ]，当然还有[ə]都 是松元音。
en: Additionally, [a] is a tense vowel as are the diphthongs [aɪ] and [aʊ], but the diphthong [ɔɪ] is lax as are [ӕ], [ʌ], and of course [ə].

zh: 紧元音可以出现于词末：[si]，[se]，[su]，[so]，[pa]表示的是英语词see, say, sue, sew, pa。
en: Tense vowels may occur at the ends of words: [si], [se], [su], [so], [pa], [saɪ], and [haʊ] represent the English words see, say, sue, sew, pa, sigh, and how.

zh: 松元音大多不能出现于词末，因此发音为[sɛ], [sʊ], [sæ], [sʌ]和[sə]的，都不可能是英语词。
en: Lax vowels mostly do not occur at the ends of words; [sɪ], [sɛ], [sʊ], [sæ], [sʌ], and [sə] are not possible words in En glish.

zh: 以上概括的例外是松元音[ɔ]，它可以出现于saw [sɔ]等词中。
en: (The one exception to this generalization is lax [ɔ] and its diphthong [ɔɪ], which occur in words such as [sɔ] (saw) and [sɔɪ] (soy).)

zh: 清音依声带关闭时间分为两类。按照声带关闭时间，清音可分成两类。
en: Voiceless sounds fall into two classes depending on the timing of the vocal cord closure.

zh: 说pit这个词时，在双唇打开p除阻后声带还有一小段时间未关闭。
en: When we say pit, the vocal cords remain open for a very short time after the lips come apart to release the p.

zh: 这样的p叫作送气，因为在喉门关闭之前有一小股空气流出。
en: We call this p aspirated because a brief puff of air escapes before the glottis closes.

zh: 然而，继续追究这个问题是没有意义的。因为，关键的问题并不在于结构语法的“简单性”，而是在于具有短语结构成分并在生成深层结构过程中起作用的转换语法的“简单性”。
en: However, it is pointless to pursue this topic, because what is at stake is not the “simplicity” of phrase structure grammars but rather of transformational grammars with a phrase structure component that plays a role in generating deep structures.

zh: 并且，也绝对不存在“容易计算”或“算法的简单性”这样的数学概念，能够哪怕是含糊地暗示，复合这种概念的系统优于从这种观点的角度认真地考察过的多种自动机——例如，有限状态自动机、线性有界自动机等等。
en: And there is absolutely no mathematical concept of “ease of computation” or “simplicity of algorithm” that even vaguely suggests that such systems may have some advantage over the kinds of automata that have been seriously investigated from this point of view – for example, finite state automata, linear bounded automata, and so on.

zh: 有时，手语使用者需要表达的一个词或概念没有相应的手势。
en: There are occasions when signers need to represent a word or concept for which there is no sign.

zh: 可以举出以下一些例子：新造词、外语词、缩略词、某些专用名词、科技术语，或是演绎手语版莎士比亚戏剧时可能会碰到的一些陈旧的废词。
en: New coinages, foreign words, acronyms, certain proper nouns, technical vocabulary, or obsolete words as might be found in a signed interpretation of a play by Shakespeare are among some of these.

zh: 针对这种情况，ASL提供了一系列手形和动作，用来代表英语字母，使得所有这样的词和概念都能通过手指拼写来表达。
en: For such cases ASL provides a series of hand shapes and movements that represent the letters of the English alphabet, permitting all such words and concepts to be expressed through finger spelling.

zh: 在句子“杰克游泳”中，我们知道“杰克”一词通常被称为专有名词，指的是世界上一件具体的东西，这就是它的指称。
en: In the sentence Jack swims, we know that the word Jack, which is a proper name, refers to a precise object in the world, which is its referent.

zh: 比如说，在上文给出的情景中，“杰克”的指称意义是你的一个朋友，他现在正很高兴地在游泳池里游泳。
en: For instance, in the scenario given earlier, the referential meaning of Jack is the guy who is your friend and who is swimming happily in the pool right now.

zh: 由此我们知道 “杰克”这个名字的意义是它所指的某一个体。
en: Based on this, we conclude that the meaning of the name Jack is the individual it refers to.

zh: 强力诗人们分别或连续采用六种心理防范形式来对付那种 “影响的焦虑”(anxiety of influence)。
en: Strong poets cope with the ‘anxiety of influence’ by adopting separately or suc- cessively six psychic defences.

zh: 这些形式以比喻的形式出现在他们的诗歌中，使他们可以从父辈的诗歌中“转脱”出来。
en: These appear in their poetry as tropes which allow a poet to ‘swerve’ from a father’s poems.

zh: 这六种比喻是：反讽、提喻、换喻、夸张/反语、隐喻、再换喻(metalepsis)。
en: The six tropes are irony, synecdoche, metonymy, hyperbole/litotes, metaphor and metalepsis.

zh: 布鲁姆使用了六个古典词语来表达父辈诗人与子辈诗人之间的六种关系（修正率）：克利纳门（clinamen）、苔莎拉（tessera）、克诺西斯（kenosis）、达门奈扎逊（daemonization）、阿斯克西斯（askesis）、阿波弗拉迪斯（apophrades）。
en: Bloom uses six classical words to describe the six kinds of relationship between the texts of fathers and sons (revisionary ratios): clinamen, tessera, kenosis, daemonization, askesis and apophrades.

zh: 音素与音位并不是不可分的单位。它们由语音特征组成，就像原子组成分子一样。
en: Phones and phonemes are not indissoluble units; they are composed of phonetic features, similar to the way that molecules are composed of atoms.

zh: 因此对于音位/p/, /b/, /m/, 一个更明晰的描写可以由如下的特征矩阵给出。
en: A more explicit description of the phonemes /p/, /b/, and /m/ may thus be given in a feature matrix of the following sort.

zh: 语音科学试图描写世界上所有语言中所用的所有的音。
en: The science of phonetics attempts to describe all of the sounds used in all languages of the world.

zh: 声学语音学关注语音的物理属性；听觉语音学关注听者如何感知语音。发音语音学研究的则是声道如何发出语音，这也是本章的主题。
en: Acoustic phonetics focuses on the physical properties of sounds; auditory phonetics is concerned with how listeners perceive these sounds; and articulatory phonetics—the primary concern of this chapter—is the study of how the vocal tract produces the sounds of language.

zh: 古代以修辞学的观点探讨诗歌的杰出典范是贺拉斯的《诗艺》。理查德•麦基翁说得好:“贺拉斯批评的主要用意是教诗人如何使他的听众端坐到底，如何博得喝采和掌声，如何使罗马听众高兴，又如何使得所有听众高兴，并使自己流芳百世。”
en: The great classical exemplar of the application of the rhetorical point of view to poetry was, of course, the Ars Poetica of Horace, As Richard McKeon points out, ‘Horace's criticism is directed in the main to instruct the poet how to keep his audience in their scats until the end, how to induce cheers and applause, how to please a Roman audience, and by the same token, how to please all audiences and win immortality.’

zh: 价值将会一落千丈,将会出现通俗趣味代替有素养的识别能力的重新估价这样设想可能为时过早。
en: It is perhaps premature to envisage a collapse of values, a transvaluation by which popular taste replaces trained discrimination.

zh: 不过商业作风导致的现象更是千奇百怪:对电影和广播更加不摔的潜势我们至今还莫测高深。有些不大确定而又无疑为数不多的迹象表明，杨销作品姑且比较《泰山》与《她》），杂志上的韵文，壁炉架上的两器制品，科学院里拍的照片，音乐厅的歌曲，郡政会的大搂，烈士纪念碑……品位越来越低。
en: Yet commercialism has done stranger things: we have not yet fathomed the more sinister potentialities of the cinema and the loud-speaker, and there is some evidence uncertain and slight no doubt, that such things as ‘best-sellers’ (compare Tarzan with She), magazine verses, mantelpiece pottery, Academy picture, Music Hall songs, County Council buildings, War Memorials . . . are decreasing in merit.

zh: 有些时候固然出规引人注意的例外情况，这时大众要比专家更加明断，不过通常并非如此。
en: Notable exceptions, in which the multitude are better advised than the experts, of course occur sometimes, but not often.

zh: 在这个传统意义上的文化研究受着两种力量的紧张冲突的驱使，一种要复苏通俗文化，使其成为人民的表述，或者为边缘群体的文化扬声；另一种是对大众文化的研究，认为它是一种意识形态的强压，形成了压制性的意识形态。
en: Cultural studies in this tradition is driven by the tension between the desire to recover popular culture as the expression of the people or give voice to the culture of marginalized groups, and the study of mass culture as an ideological imposition, an oppressive ideological formation.

zh: 一方面，研究通俗文化就是要触及普通人生活中重要的东两——他们的文化——与唯美主义和教授们的文化相对立的文化。
en: On the one hand, the point of studying popular culture is to get in touch with what is important for the lives of ordinary people – their culture – as opposed to that of aesthetes and professors.

zh: 另一方面，又有一种强大的推动力要表明人民是如何被塑造的，或者说是如何被文化力量控制操纵的。
en: On the other, there is a strong impetus to show how people are shaped or manipulated by cultural forces.

zh: 塞音是发音时气流在口腔中被完全阻塞一小段时间（数十毫秒）。
en: Stops are consonants in which the airstream is completely blocked in the oral cavity for a short period (tens of milliseconds).

zh: 塞音意外（以外）的是通音。
en: All other sounds are continuants.

zh: [t]是塞音，[s]是通音。
en: The sound [t] is a stop, but the sound [s] is not, and that is what makes them dif- ferent speech sounds.

zh: 元音鼻化规则是一条同化规则；它使一个音段同化另一个音段，靠的是“复制”或“传递”后继音位的某个特征，使得两个音段更为近似。
en: The vowel nasalization rule is an assimilation rule, or a rule that makes neighboring segments more similar by duplicating a phonetic property.

zh: 同化规则在大部分场合是由调音过程引起的。
en: For the most part, assimilation rules stem from articulatory processes.

zh: 说话时有一种倾向，总想提高调音省力水平，也就是高效地调音。
en: There is a tendency when we speak to increase the ease of articulation.

zh: 改变鼻音性否定语素的调音部位与其后紧接的辅音的调音部位相一致。
en: Change the place of articulation of the nasal negative morpheme to agree with the place of articulation of a following consonant.

zh: 上面描写的这条改变鼻辅音读音的规则可以被称为同位鼻音规则——“同位”指的是相同部位——因为鼻音的调音部位与其后紧接的辅音一致。
en: The rule that changes the pronunciation of nasal consonants as just illustrated is called the homorganic nasal rule—homorganic means “same place”—because the place of articulation of the nasal is the same as for the following consonant.

zh: 同位鼻音规则是世界语言中的一条普遍规则。
en: The homorganic nasal rule is a common rule in the world’s languages.

zh: 从理论上说，日语中所有的词和语素都可以用平假名来书写。
en: In theory, all of Japanese could be written in hiragana.

zh: 但日语有许多同形异义词，如英语lead pipe(铅管）或lead astray(引入歧途）中的lead,而用日语汉字书写可以消除由这种用音节文字书写而造成的歧义，比如英语中的can在He saw that gasoline can explode (can“罐”：他看到汽油罐爆炸。/can“会”：他明白汽油会爆炸。）这一句子中产生的歧义。
en: However, in Japanese, there are many homographs (like lead in “lead pipe” or “lead astray”), and the use of kanji disambiguates a word that might be ambiguous if written syllabically, similar to the ambiguity of can in “He saw that gasoline can explode.”

zh: 这当中的重要人物是美国哲学家朱迪思·巴特勒（Judith Butler）。她的著作《性别的烦恼：女权主义和属性的破坏性》 （Gender Trouble: Feminism and the Subversion of Identity，1990年）、《身体的重要性》（Bodies that Matter，1993年）和《令人兴奋的演说：言语行为的政治》（ Excitable Speech: A Politics of the Speech Act，1997年），在文学和文化领域都颇有影响，尤其在女权主义理论和正在兴起的同性恋研究领域影响很大。
en: The key figure here is the American philosopher Judith Butler, whose books Gender Trouble: Feminism and the Subversion of Identity (1990), Bodies that Matter (1993),and Excitable Speech: A Politics of the Speech Act (1997), have had great influence in the field of literary and cultural studies, particularly in feminist theory, and in the emerging field of gay and lesbian studies.

zh: “同性恋理论”（Queer Theory)最近已被男性同性恋研究领域中的先锋派所采纳。他们在文化理论中的活动与解放男同性恋者的政治运动相联系。
en: The name ‘Queer Theory’ has recently been adopted by the avant-garde of gay studies whose work in cultural theory is linked with political movements for gay liberation.

zh: 它以此作为自己的名称，并且把同性恋者最常遇到的侮辱性语言回敬给社会，即“同性恋！”（Queer!)这个混号。
en: It takes as its own name and throws back at society the most common insult that homosexuals encounter, the epithet ‘Queer!’

zh: 在地图上画出来的、将这些区域区分开来的线叫作同言线。
en: A line drawn on the map to separate the areas is called an isogloss.

zh: 当你跨过一条同言线时，你就是从一个方言区进入了另一个方言区。
en: When you cross an isogloss, you are passing from one dialect area to another.

zh: 有时几条同言线恰好相交，通常发生在政治边界线上，或在河流、山脉这样的自然界线上。
en: Sometimes several isoglosses coincide, often at a political boundary or at a natural barrier such as a river or mountain range.

zh: 语言学家们把这些归类线条称作同言线束。
en: Linguists call these groupings a bundle of isoglosses.

zh: 这样一个同言线束，就能够界定一种地域方言。
en: Such a bundle can define a regional dialect.

zh: 诗歌以其难以琢磨的漫无目标、令人不解的构成方式愚弄或迷惑我们。“roll-rock highroad”是什么意思？
en: Poems doodle or riddle us, in their wayward indirection, their puzzling formulations: what is a ‘rollrock highroad’?

zh: “秘密坐在其中通晓一切”又是什么意思？
en: What of ‘the Secret that sits in the middle and knows’?

zh: 这种特点在童谣或民歌中十分突出。在童谣和民歌中快感是存在于韵律和重叠手法，以及一些稀奇古怪的形象之中的：豌豆粥儿烫，(Pease porridge hot,豌豆粥儿凉， Pease porridge cold,豌豆粥儿在锅里 Pease porridge in the pot,煮了九天九夜长。Nine days old.)
en: Such features are very prominent in nursery rhymes and ballads, where frequently pleasure lies in rhythm, incantation, and strangeness of image: Pease porridge hot,Pease porridge cold,Pease porridge in the pot,Nine days old.

zh: 那种以为人类语言只不过是比在动物世界中见到的某种东西更复杂一些的特例的观点，似乎没有什么实质性内容。
en: There seems to be no substance to the view that human language is simply a more complex instance of something to be found elsewhere in the animal world.

zh: 这就为生物学家提出了—个问题，因为如果情况果真如此，那么，这就是一个真正的“突现”的例子—在一个复杂组织的特定阶段出现不同质的现象。
en: This poses a problem for the biologist, since, if true, it is an example of true “emergence” – the appearance of a qualitatively different phenomenon at a specific stage of complexity of organization.

zh: 对于这一事实的了解—虽然是用完全不同的术语表示的—正是促使许多关注心理本性的人进行经典语言研究的动机。
en: Recognition of this fact, though formulated in entirely different terms, is what motivated much of the classical study of language by those whose primary concern was then the nature of mind.

zh: 无论在古代还是今天，图画文字在世界各地都有发现：非洲各部落、美洲土著（包括美国阿拉斯加和加拿大的因纽特人)、秘鲁的印加人、西伯利亚的尤卡吉尔人（Yukagirian)和大洋洲土著 。
en: Pictographic writing has been found throughout the world, ancient and modern: among Africans, Native Americans including the Inuits of Alaska and Canada, the Incas of Peru, the Yukagirians of Siberia, and the people of Oceania.

zh: 今天，国际通用的道路标志仍使用图画文字，因为并非所有的旅行者都懂当地语言。
en: Pictograms are used today in international road signs, where the native language of the region might not be understood by all travelers.

zh: 这种符号人人都能看懂，因为它们不依赖于任何语言。

en: Such symbols do not depend on words.

zh: 与现代文字不同，每一幅图或图画文字都是所代表事物的直接形象。
en: Unlike modern writing systems, each picture or pictogram is a direct image of the object it represents.

zh: 其符号的形式和意义之间有一种非任意的关系。
en: There is a nonarbitrary relationship between the form and meaning of the symbol.

zh: 不带解说词的连环漫画也属于图画文字—— 即它们直接地表达了所要交流的思想。
en: Comic strips minus captions are pictographic— literal representations of the ideas to be communicated.

zh: 列维-斯特劳斯在论原始人思维的两本重要著作《图腾制度》(1962年）和《野蛮人的思维》（1962年）中，对“零敲碎打”这一术语作了如下定义。
en: The term bricolage is defined in  Lévi-Strauss’ two major works on the primitive mind; Totemism (1962) and The Savage Mind (1962).

zh: 它指的是所谓“原始人”没有文化、没有技术的思想对周围世界作出反应的手段。
en: It refers to the means by which the non-literate, non-technical mind of so-called ‘primitive’ man responds to the world around him.

zh: 这个过程包含一种“具体科学”（和我们“文明的”“抽象的”科学相对立）。这种科学远非缺乏逻辑，事实上，它以和我们不同的逻辑，仔细而精确地把这个丰富多彩的物质界的一分一毫都组合成结构，加以分类和排列。
en: The process involves a ‘science of the concrete’ (as opposed to our ‘civilized’ science of the ‘abstract’) which, far from lacking logic, in fact carefully and precisely orders, classifies and arranges into structures the minutiae of the physical world in all their profusion by means of a ‘logic’ which is not our own.

zh: 一些语言还有外接缀，指的是在同一个词基语素的开头和末尾附加上的语素，有时候也被称为非连续语素。
en: Some languages have circumfixes, morphemes that are attached to a base morpheme both initially and finally.These are sometimes called discontinuous morphemes.

zh: 在美国俄克拉荷马州有一种属于印第安土著马斯科吉语系的奇卡索语，词的否定形式通过前缀ik-和后缀-o共同组成。
en: In Chickasaw, a Muskogean language spoken in Oklahoma, the negative is formed with both a prefix ik- and the suffix -o.

zh: 在加上表示否定的后缀之前，肯定形式末尾的元音会先脱落。
en: The final vowel of the affirmative is dropped before the negative suffix is added.

zh: 皮尔士认为归纳过程对知识获得是无关紧要的。用他的话说：“归纳方法没有创造性，它只能检验一个业已形成的假设。
en: Peirce regarded inductive processes as rather marginal to the acquisition of knowledge; in his words, “Induction has no originality in it, but only tests a suggestion already made.”

zh: ”要理解皮尔士勾画出的唯理主义者心目中的知识获得问题，我们就必须洞察他称之为“外展方法”的秘密；我们就必须弄淸楚，是什么东西“把规则赋予外展方法，因而限制了可接受时假说，皮尔士认为，对外展原理的迫寻把我们引到对天赋观念的研究上，这种天赋观念提供了人类智力的本能结构。
en: To understand how knowledge is acquired, in the rationalist view that Peirce outlined, we must penetrate the mysteries of what he called “abduction,” and we must discover which “gives a rule to abduction and so puts a limit upon admissible hypotheses.”Peirce maintained that the search for principles of abduction leads us to the study of innate ideas, which provide the instinctive structure of human intelligence.

zh: 这里再次显示出，似乎有一种能够解释许多这种事实的普遍原理。
en: It seems, once again, that there is a general principle that accounts for many such facts.

zh: 值得注意的是，在43a中的斜体名词短语包含在另一个名词短语中，即：“for him to understand this lecture”，这也是句子的主语。
en: Notice that in 43a the italicized noun phrase is contained within another noun phrase, namely “for him to understand this lecture,” which is the subject of the sentence.

zh: 然而，在43b中，“外置”规则把短语 “for him to understand this lecture”放到了主语名词短语之外。这样以来，在最终形成的结构中，这个短语根本就不是名词短语。所以，43b中的那个斜体短语就不再包含在名词短语中了。
en: In 43b, however, a rule of extraposition has placed the phrase “for him to understand this lecture” outside of the subject noun phrase, and in the resulting structure this phrase is not a noun phrase at all, so that the italicized phrase in 43b is no longer contained within a noun phrase.

zh: 我们之所以为人，就在于我们有身体，比较特别的是我们有神经系统。更为特别的，是它的比较高级或比较核心的相互协调的那些部分，精神乃是一个冲动系统，这种观点不应称为唯物主义的。
en: The view that we are our bodies, more especially our nervous systems, more especially still the higher or more central coordinating parts of it, and that the mind is a system of impulsesshould not be described as Materialism.

zh: 人们同样不妨称之为唯心主义的在这一方面，两个术语都没有任何科学的、任何严格的象征意义或所指意义。
en: It might equally well be called Idealism.Neither term in this connection has any scientific, any strictly symbolic meaning or reference.

zh: 他继而论述了理应属于判断力领域的美学。三种能力的中间一种；在《纯悴理性批判》和《实践理性批判》里他已经分别就第一和第三种能力作了全面阐述结果他实际是把美学附辑于唯心主义。
en: And he went on to discuss aesthetics as appertaining to the province of judgement, the middle one of these three, the first and last having already occupied him in his two other Critiques of Pure and Practical Reason respectively.

zh: 从此美学在这个构架中一直起着重人的作用。
en: The effect was virtually to annex aesthetics to Idealism, in which fabric it has ever since continued to serve important purposes.

zh: 维克多·什克洛夫斯基（Viktor Shklovsky）、尤里·蒂尼亚诺夫（Yury Tynyanov）和鲍里斯·艾亨鲍姆（Boris Eikhenbaum）是诗歌研究会的杰出代表。
en: Viktor Shklovsky, Yury Tynyanov and Boris Eikhenbaum were prominent in Opojaz.

zh: 形式主义最初的激发力来自未来主义者。第一次世界大战前，未来主义者在艺术领域的努力主要是攻击“颓废的”中产阶级文化，特别是反对诗歌和视觉艺术中痛苦地进行灵魂剖析的象征主义运动。
en: The initial impetus was provided by the Futurists, whose artistic efforts before the First World War were directed against ‘decadent’ bourgeois culture and especially against the anguished soul-searching of the Symbolist movement in poetry and the visual arts.

zh: 这种差别也见于蜜蜂的信递系统。
en: This distinction is also true of the system of communication used by honeybees.

zh: 搜寻食物的工蜂能够回到蜂巢，与它的同伴沟通，告诉它们食物源的位置。
en: A forager bee is able to return to the hive and communicate to other bees where a source of food is located.

zh: 它在蜂巢的立面上跳舞，以这种方式报告食物的位置和质量。
en: It does so by performing a dance on a wall of the hive that reveals the location and quality of the food source.

zh: 第二个测试就是“用代词替代”。
en: The second test is “replacement by a pronoun.”

zh: 代词可以取代自然的词语组合。
en: Pronouns can substitute for natural groups.

zh: 在回答问题“Where did you find a puppy ( 你在哪里找到了一条小狗）？”时，可以说“I found Mm in the park ( 我在公园找到他的）。
en: In answer to the question “Where did you find a puppy?” a speaker can say, “I found him in the park.”

zh: ”像do 这样的词同样可以取代整个谓语found a puppy ,诸如John found a puppy and B ill血f too (约翰找到了一条小狗，比尔也是）。
en: Words such as do can also take the place of the entire predicate found a puppy, as in “John found a puppy and Bill did too.”

zh: 如果一组词可以由一个代词或者像do这样的词替代，那么这组词就组成了一个成分。
en: If a group of words can be replaced by a pronoun or a word like do, it forms a constituent.

zh: 对符号学家来说，大多数文学作品，在发布有关它们自身的信息时，还不断地提示其他文学作品。
en: To the semiotician, most works of literature, in emitting messages that refer to themselves, also make constant reference to other works ofliterature.

zh: 正如米利·克里斯特瓦指出的，任何“文本”都不能完全“脱离”其他文本。
en: As Julia Kristeva has pointed out, no ‘text’ can ever be completely ‘free’ of other texts.

zh: 它将卷入她所谓的所有作品的“文本间性”。
en: It will be involved in what she has termed the intertextuality of all writing.

zh: 因此，从原则上说，文学研究和文化研究之间不必一定存在什么矛盾。
en: In principle, then, there need not be conflict between literary and cultural studies.

zh: 文学研究不会对文化研究批驳的文学对象做出承诺。
en: Literary studies are not committed to a conception of the literary object that cultural studies must repudiate.

zh: 文化研究就是把文学分析的技巧运用到其他文化材料中才得以发展的。
en: Cultural studies arose as the application of techniques of literary analysis to other cultural materials.

zh: 它把文化的手工艺品作为“文本”解读，而不是仅仅把它们作为需要清点的物件。
en: It treats cultural artefacts as ‘texts’ to be read rather than as objects that are simply there to be counted.

zh: 反过来说，如果把文学作为某种文化实践加以研究，把文学作品与其他论述联系起来.文学研究也会有所收获。
en: And, conversely, literary studies may gain when literature is studied as a particular cultural practice and works are related to other discourses.

zh: 理论的作用一直就在于扩大文学作品可以解答的问题范畴，并且把注意力集中在这些作品用了哪些不同方式来抵制那个时代的思想，或者使其变得复杂化。
en: The impact of theory has been to expand the range of questions to which literary works can answer and to focus attention on the different ways they resist or complicate the ideas of their age.

zh: 从根本上说，文化研究因为坚持把文学研究作为一项具有象征意义的研究实践，坚持探究文化作用如何影响并覆盖文学作品，所以它能够把文学研究作为一种复杂的、相互关联的文本现象加以强化。
en: In principle, cultural studies, with its insistence on studying literature as one signifying practice among others, and on examining the culture roles with which literature has been invested, can intensify the study of literature as a complex intertextual phenomenon.

zh: 1725年，意大利著名法学家詹巴蒂斯塔•维柯出版了一本叫《新科学》的书。
en: In 1725 the distinguished Italian jurist Giambattista Vico published a book called The New Science.

zh: 这件事在当时几乎未被人们注意，但是这是一个重大的事件。
en: It was a momentous occasion, although it passed virtually unnoticed at the time.

zh: 因为维柯提出的“科学”正是关于人类社会的科学。
en: For the ‘science’ Vico proposed was nothing less than a science of human society.

zh: 它的典范就是伽利略、培根和牛顿等人的“自然”科学，它的目的旨在向“诸民族的世界”展现这些文艺复兴时期的科学家为探究“自然世界”所获得的成就。
en: Its model was the ‘natural’ science of such men as Galileo, Bacon and Newton, and its aim was to perform for ‘the world of nations’ what these Renaissance scientists had achieved for ‘the world of nature’.

zh: 简单说來，它的目的是构造“人的物理学”。
en: Its goal, in short, was the construction of a ‘physics of man’.

zh: 事实上，有许多严重智障的人有很流畅的语言文法能力，例如精神分裂症、阿兹海默症以及一些自闭症的孩子和一些失语症的人。
en: Fluent grammatical language can in fact appear in many kinds of people with severe intellectual impairments, like schizophrenics, Alzheimer's patients, some autistic children, and some aphasics.

zh: 最近有一个新的症候群被发现出来，就是圣地亚哥一个有话匣子症候群的智障女孩。她的父母在杂志上读到了有关乔姆斯基理论的文章，就打电话到MIT给乔姆斯基，说他应该来看一下他们的女儿，他一定会有兴趣的。
en: One of the most fascinating syndromes recently came to light when the parents of a retarded girl with chatterbox syndrome in San Diego read an article about Chomsky's theories in a popular science magazine and called him at MIT, suggesting that their daughter might be of interest to him.

zh: 韦尼克区受损的病人很难说出呈现在他们面前的物体的名称，在自然口语中还有选词困难。
en: People with damage to Wernicke's area have difficulty naming objects presented to them and also in choosing words in spontaneous speech.

zh: 他们可能犯许多词汇错误(词汇替代)，常常说出一些杂乱语和无意义词，如下例所示:The only thing that I can say again is madder or modder fish sudden fishing sewed into the accident to miss in the purdles.(我能再次说的唯一的事情是茜草鱼或modder鱼，突然捕鱼被缝入了这起会在purdles中错过的事故。)
en: They may make numerous lexical errors (word substitutions), often producing jargon and nonsense words, as in the following example:The only thing that I can say again is madder or modder fish sudden fishing sewed into the accident to miss in the purdles.

zh: 亚里士多德在《诗学》第6节中给情节下过定义，说“情节”（mythos)是对“事件的安排”。
en: In section 6 of the Poetics, Aristotle defines ‘plot’ (‘mythos’) as the ‘arrangement of the incidents’.

zh: “情节”显然与故事不同，故事是情节赖以存在的基础；情节是对构成故事的一系列事件的艺术处理。
en: A ‘plot’ is clearly distinguished from a story upon which a plot may be based.A plot is the artful disposition of the incidents which make up a story.

zh: 希腊悲剧往往以“闪回”开篇，即扼要重复故事中那些被选择作为情节处理的事件之前出现的事件。
en: A Greek tragedy usually starts with a ‘flashback’, a recapitulation of the incidents of the story which occurred prior to those which were selected for the plot.

zh: 对语言事实的注意，揭示出了句子的某些与语音、语义、变体等都有关系的性质。
en: Attention to linguistic fact reveals certain properties of sentences, relating to their sound, their meaning, their deviance, and so on.

zh: 显然，只要我们把自己局限在有关“习惯”、“技巧”、“反应倾向”以及“通过类推”形成句子等含糊的谈论中，我们就永远也不能解释这些事实。
en: Evidently no explanation for these facts will be forthcoming so long as we restrict ourselves to vague talk about “habits” and “skills” and “dispositions to respond,” or about the formation of sentences “by analogy.”

zh: 我们并没有这样的“习惯”—以某种方式来理解句4、句9和句13：读者很难遇到和它们十分类似的句子，但却能理解它们具体的意思。
en: We do not have the “habit” of understanding sentences 4, 9, and 13 in a certain way: it is unlikely that the reader has ever encountered sentences closely resembling these, but he understands them in a highly specific way nevertheless.

zh: 历史上许多关于体裁的理论家一直遵循希腊式分类，把作品根据由谁叙述大至分为三类：诗歌或抒情诗，叙述人为第一人称；史诗或叙事，叙述人以自己的声音出现，但也允许其他角色以自己的声音叙述；还有戏剧，全部对话由角色进行。还有一种分类方法注重叙述人与观众的关系。
en: Historically, many theorists of genre have followed the Greeks, who divided works among three broad classes according to who speaks: poetic or lyric, where the narrator speaks in the first person, epic or narrative, where the narrator speaks in his own voice but allows characters to speak in theirs, and drama, where the characters do all the talking.Another way of making this distinction is to focus on the relation of speaker to audience.

zh: 史诗中有口头吟诵：诗人直接面对听众。
en: In epic, there is oral recitation: a poet directly confronting the listening audience.

zh: 在戏剧中，剧作家看不到观众，而是由舞台上的角色去叙述。
en: In drama, the author is concealed from the audience and the characters on stage talk.

zh: 抒情诗的情况最复杂，诗人或唱或吟诵，可以说是背对听众的，“做出自言自语或对其他什么人讲话的样子：也许是对大自然中的一个精灵, 对缪斯，对一位朋友，对一个情人、一个神灵、一个人格化了的抽象事物，或是某个自然的对象”。
en: In lyric–the most complicated case–the poet, in singing or chanting, turns his back on his listeners, so to speak, and ‘pretends to be talking to himself or to someone else: a spirit of Nature, a Muse, a personal friend, a lover, a god, a personified abstraction, or a natural object’.

zh: 我们还可以把小说这个现代体裁加到这三个基本体裁当中去。小说通过一部书与读者交谈—我们将在第六章专门论述这个题目。
en: To these three elementary genres we can add the modern genre of the novel, which addresses the reader through a book–a topic we’ll take up in Chapter 6.

zh: 说英语的人都知道red(红）、white(白）和blue(蓝）都是颜色词。
en: Speakers of English know that the words red, white, and blue are color words.

zh: 与此类似，lion(狮子）、tiger(老虎）、leopard(豹子）和lynx(猞猁）都是猫科动物。
en: Similarly, lion, tiger, leopard, and lynx are all felines.

zh: 这样成组的词称为“下义词”。
en: Such sets of words are called hyponyms.

zh: 第二语言习得, 或二语习得, 一般指已习得第一语言的人 (成人或儿童) 获得第二语言。
en: The term second language acquisition, or L2 acquisition, generally refers to the acquisition of a second language by someone (adult or child) who has already acquired a first language.

zh: 这也称为先后双语。
en: This is also referred to as sequential bilingualism.

zh: 双语习得指的是 (或多或少地) 同时习得两种语言, 从幼年开始 (或在三岁之前), 也称为同时双语。
en: Bilingual language acquisition refers to the (more or less) simultaneous acquisition of two languages beginning in infancy (or before the age of three years), also referred to as simultaneous bilingualism.

zh: 代词有不同的类型。
en: There are different types of pronouns.

zh: 反身代词是指himself(他自己)和themselves(他们自己)这样的代词。
en: Reflexive pronouns are pronouns such as himself and themselves.

zh: 在英语中，反身代词总是通过回指同一个小句中的NP先行语而获得语义，如下例所示(下画线表示反身代词冋指NP)：
en: In English, reflexive pronouns always depend on an NP antecedent for their meaning and the antecedent must be in the same clause, as illustrated in the following examples:

zh: 迄今为止左右人类历史的一直是劳动的需要；对于弗洛伊德来说，这一严酷的需要意味着我们必须压抑一部分追求快乐和满足的趋向。
en: What has dominated human history to date is the need to labour; and for Freud that harsh necessity means that we must repress some of our tendencies to pleasure and gratification.

zh: 如果我们不是为了生存而必须工作，我们也许终日倦眠而无所事事。
en: If we were not called upon to work in order to survive, we might simply lie around all day doing nothing.

zh: 每个人都得经受弗洛伊德所谓的“现实原则”对“快乐原则”的压抑，但是某些人甚至整个社会都可能会由于压抑过度而致病。
en: Every human being has to undergo this repression of what Freud named the 'pleasure principle' by the 'reality principle', but for some of us, and arguably for whole societies, the repression may become excessive and make us ill.

zh: 对文学专业的学生来说，列维-斯特劳斯的“结构"人类学和由此产生的结构语言学的含义必然是深刻的。
en: For the student of literature, the implications of Lévi-Strauss’s sort of ‘structural’ anthropology and the structural linguistics from which it derives, must be considerable.

zh: 首先，这两门学科的基本概念都为现代人攻击“现实主义”或“自然主义”提供了基础，并因而给予了动力。“现实主义"或“自然主义”的前提是，一件语言艺术作品和它必定要“涉及”的“现实”或“自然”之间存在着明显的一对一的对应。
en: Primarily, the notions fundamental to both disciplines provide a basis for, and so lend power to, the modern attack on ‘realism’ or ‘naturalism’: the presupposition that a transparent ‘one-to-one’ correspondence exists between a work of art in language, and the ‘reality’ or ‘nature’ to which that work of art is presupposed to ‘refer’.

zh: 举一个例子：从广义来讲换喻包含了一个序列或者一个语境中一个成分向另一个成分的转换：我们说一个杯子（cup)，意思是指杯中装的东西（contents）；用赛马场（turf）指赛马（racing）；用一个舰队的数百条帆（sails）指船（ships）。
en: An example: in its broad sense, metonymy involves the shift from one element in a sequence to another, or one element in a context to another: we refer to a cup of something (meaning its contents); the turf (for racing), a ﬂeet of a hundred sails (for ships).

zh: 从根本上讲，换喻的运用要求有一个语境，因此，雅各布森把现实主义与换喻联系了起来。
en: Essentially metonymy requires a context for its operation; hence Jakobson’s linking of realism with metonymy.

zh: 现实主义在讲客体的时候，往往要向读者描述其特征、局部和语境的细节，以便营造一个整体的氛围。
en: Realism speaks of its object by offering the reader aspects, parts, and contextual details, in order to evoke a whole.

zh: 每种没有“内在”为意识的东西都要严格排除。一切现实事物都必须按其呈现于我们心中的面貌而作为纯粹的“现象”来对待，这是我们可以由之开始的唯一确凿材料。
en: Everything not 'immanent' to consciousness must be rigorously excluded; all realities must be treated as pure 'phenomena', in terms of their appearances in our mind, and this is the only absolute data from which we can begin.

zh: 胡塞尔为他的哲学方法赋予“现象学”的名称，即是源于对这一点的坚守。
en: The name Husserl gave to his philosophical method --phenomenology —stems from this insistence.

zh: 现象学就是关于纯粹现象的科学。
en: Phenomenology is a science of pure phenomena.

zh: 格莱麦声称他的程序如下：他以生与死的对立作为基本语义层，然后从全部文本中把这一语义层上的所有限定性修饰语提取出来。
en: Greimas claims that his procedure is as follows: he chooses as his basic isotopy the opposition between life and death and extracts from the corpus all the qualiﬁcations situated on this isotopy.

zh: 把修饰生的语言单元分出，简化为若干组语义素，然后再作一次提取，将出现这些语义素的所有的语境罗列出来。
en: Taking the items which qualify life, one reduces them to a limited set of sememes and then, by a second process of extraction, collects all the contexts in which each of these appears.

zh: 他所进行的是一种最传统的格局分布分析。
en: He is thus undertaking a distributional analysis of the most traditional kind.

zh: 自从此文发表以来，意图在批评中的位置问题引发了许多争论，今天，这种争论仍在继续：卫姆塞特与比尔兹利的立场引起了一些批评流派的共鸣，例如，后结构主义提出了“作者死亡”的观点（见后文）；解构主义提出了将文本从“永在”与“意义”中解放出来的观点。
en: Much critical debate has since raged about the place of intention in criticism, and continues to do so: Wimsatt and Beardsley’s position strikes a chord, for example, with poststructuralist notions of the ‘death of the author’ (see below, pp. 149–50) and with deconstruction’s freeing of the text from ‘presence’ and ‘meaning’.

zh: 但是他们之间的共同点到这儿就停止了，因为，新批评从根本上仍然坚持认为，存在着一个确定的、就本体论来看稳定的“诗本体”，这个诗本体正是它自己的“陈述”的最终仲裁者，因此，一种“客观的”批评是可能进行的。
en: But there the resemblance ends, for the New Critics still basically insist that there is a determinate, ontologically stable ‘poem itself’, which is the ultimate arbiter of its own ‘statement’, and that an ‘objective’ criticism is possible.

zh: 这一观念与解构主义的那种文本可以被多处“移置”，反复不断读解的无限性观念是背道而驰的。

en: This runs quite counter to deconstruction’s notion of the ‘iterability’ of a text in its multiplex ‘positioned’ rereadings.

zh: 有时，习得手语和习得口语之间的相似性令人吃惊。
en: Sometimes the parallels between the acquisition of signed and spoken languages are striking.

zh: ASL中的一些语法语素是语义透明或象似的，就是说，它们的样子就是所表达的意义。例如，表示代词“我”的手势就是说话人指着自己的胸部。
en: For example, some of the grammatical morphemes in ASL are semantically transparent or iconic, that is, they look like what they mean; for example, the sign for the pronoun “I” involves the speaker pointing to his chest.

zh: 在18世纪初，半带神秘色彩的象征学说是美学理论的中心。
en: At the centre of aesthetic theory at the turn of the eighteenth century is the semi-mystical doctrine of the symbol.

zh: 对于浪漫主义，象征确实成为解决一切问题的万应灵药。
en: For Romanticism, indeed, the symbol becomes the panacea for all problems.

zh: 在象征之内，日常生活中无法解决的一系列矛盾冲突——主体与客体，普遍与特殊，感觉与概念，物质与精神，秩序与自发——都可以奇迹般地得到解决。
en: Within it, a whole set of conflicts which were felt to be insoluble in ordinary life — between subject and object, the universal and the particular, the sensuous and the conceptual, material and spiritual, order and spontaneity — could be magically resolved.

zh: 在威廉·卡洛斯·威廉斯的诗歌中，我们看到几乎相反的过程。
en: In William Carlos Williams’s poem, we see the process almost in reverse.

zh: 在这首诗中，“这段书写构成诗歌”亦即“这些词的意义超出它们表面的意思”这一视觉图像信息，把一种新的令人激奋的情境强加于本来会是平平庸庸的一篇写作。同时，那种散发出来的象征符号缺乏我们的文化引导我们去寻找或期望的“诗歌性质”的任何标志。
en: Here the imposition of a new and disturbing status on what would otherwise remain a banal domestic piece of writing is brought about by the visual iconic message which says ‘this passage of writing constitutes a poem’: that is, ‘these words have a significance beyond their overt meaning.’ Meanwhile, the symbolic signs emitted lack any of the indications of ‘poemness’ that our culture leads us to look for andexpect.

zh: 受弗洛伊德影响的两位美国批评家是肯尼斯·伯克(Kenneth Burke)和哈罗德·布鲁姆(Harold Bloom)，他们截然不同。前者调和弗洛伊德、马克思和语言学以创造他自己的有启发性的观点：文学作品是一种象征行为。后者利用弗洛伊德的著作创立了70年代最大胆最有创见的文学理论之一。
en: Two very different American critics indebted to Freud are Kenneth Burke, who eclectically blends Freud, Marx and linguistics to produce his own suggestive view of the literary work as a form of symbolic action, and Harold Bloom, who has used the work of Freud to launch one of the most daringly original literary theories of the past decade.

zh: 以菲勒斯为象征的父亲的存在，教给孩子他必须在家庭中占据一个地位，这个地位由性别差异、排除（他不能作母亲或父亲的情人）和缺失（他必须中止他早期与母亲肉体的联系）所限定。
en: The presence of the father, symbolized by the phallus, teaches the child that it must take up a place in the family which is denned by sexual difference, by exclusion (it cannot be its parent's lover) and by absence (it must relinquish its earlier bonds to the mother's body).

zh: 他渐渐感到，他作为主体的身份，是由他与他周围主体的区别和相似关系所构成的。
en: Its identity as a subject, it comes to perceive, is constituted by its relations of difference and similarity to the other subjects around it.

zh: 随着所有这一切的接受，儿童从想象的领域转向拉康所谓的“象征秩序”：即构成家庭和社会的、事先规定的社会的和性的作用与关系的结构。
en: In accepting all of this, the child moves from the imaginary register into what Lacan calls the 'symbolic order': the pre-given structure of social and sexual roles and relations which make up the family and society.

zh: 用弗洛伊德自己的话来说，儿童已经成功地通过了俄狄浦斯情结的痛苦道路。
文学是一种作者力图提高或更新文学的实践，因此它水远会暗含对文学本身的折射。
en: Literature is a practice in which authors attempt to advance or renew literature and thus is always implicitly a reflection on literature itself.

zh: 不过，我们再次发现这一点同样适用于其他形式。例如，小招贴广告同诗篇一样，它要表达的意思可以是建立在先前这类小招贴广告的基础之上。假如没有“禁止核武器!”“救救鲸鱼!
en: But once again, we find that this is something we could say about other forms: bumper stickers, like poems, may depend for their meaning on prior bumper stickers: ‘Nuke a Whale for Jesus!’ makes no sense without‘No Nukes,’ ‘Save the Whales,’ and ‘Jesus Saves,’ and one could certainly say that ‘Nuke a Whale for Jesus’ is really about bumper stickers.

zh: ”和“耶稣拯救万物!
”等小招贴广告，“为了耶稣，不要用核武器屠杀鲸鱼！
”就没有任何意义。
所以，我们可以肯定地说“为了耶稣，不要用核武器屠杀鲸鱼!
”是关于小招贴广吿的小招贴广吿。最后, 文学的交织性和它的自我折射性并非其本质特征，而是突出语言运用的某些方面和语言再现的某些问題，在其他地方可能也会观察到同样的现象。
en: The intertextuality and self-reflexivity of literature is not, finally, a defining feature but a foregrounding of aspects of language use and questions about representation that may also be observed elsewhere.

zh: 人们用一种楔形的尖笔在黏土做成的泥版上刻写这些符号，这些泥板受沙漠中的烈日炙烤而硬化，成为永久性的记录，远比现代纸张和电子文档更具持久性。
en: They began to produce the symbols of their written language by using a wedge-shaped stylus that was pressed into soft clay tablets.The tablets hardened in the desert sun to produce permanent records that were far hardier than modern paper or electronic documents.

zh: 如果原版的美国独立宣言是用这种方式写成，今天就不再需 要修复和保护。
en: Had the original American Declaration of Independence been written this way, it would not be in need of restoration and preservation.

zh: 这一形式的文字就叫作楔形文字—字面意思就是“楔形的”（该词源自拉丁语cuneus“楔”）。
en: This form of writing is called cuneiform—literally, “wedge- shaped” (from Latin cuneus, “wedge”).

zh: 的确，在所谓scrambling的语言里，格的标记用得更广：冠词、形容词、名词每一个都加上一个格的标记，这样说话的人可以把短语中的字随便散在句子中都没关系(好比说把形容词放在最后以加重语气)，听话的人自己在心中把这些字位置还原。这种在文法上叫做对呼应或谐和。
en: Indeed, in what are called ''scrambling'' languages, case markers are exploited even further: the article, adjective, and noun inside a phrase are each tagged with a particular case marker, and the speaker can scramble the words of the phrase all over the sentence (say, put the adjective at the end for emphasis), knowing that the listener can mentally join them back up.

zh: 这是把连续出现、交错纠缠不清的字意义厘清的第二个解决方法。
en: This process, called agreement or concord, is a second engineering solution (aside from phrase structure itself to the problem of encoding a tangle of interconnected thoughts into strings of words that appear one after the other.

zh: 第一种类型的文本只允许读者成为一种固定意义的消费者；而第二种类型的文本把读者变成生产者。
en: The first type of text allows the reader only to be a consumer of a fixed meaning, while the second turns the reader into a producer.

zh: 第一种类型的文本称为“阅读文本”(readerly, lisible）；第二种称为“写作文本”（writerly, scriptible）。
en: The first type of text is called ‘readerly’ (lisible), the second ‘writerly’ (scriptible).

zh: 第一种文本的目的是供阅读（消费）；第二种文本是供写作（生产）。
en: The first is made to be read (consumed), the second to be written (produced).

zh: 那个阅读的“我”早己是一个“关涉了其他文本的多数”，先锋派文本允许将已经阅读的与这个多数联系起来，从而获得生产种种意义的最大自由。
en: The ‘I’ which reads is ‘already itself a plurality of other texts’ and is allowed by the avant-garde text the maximum liberty to produce meanings by putting what is read in touch with this plurality.

zh: 第一种类型的文本只允许读者成为一种固定意义的消费者；而第二种类型的文本把读者变成生产者。
en: The ﬁrst type of text allows the reader only to be a consumer of a ﬁxed meaning, while the second turns the reader into a producer.

zh: 第一种类型的文本称为“阅读文本”(readerly, lisible）；第二种称为“写作文本（writerly，scriptible）。
en: The ﬁrst type of text is called ‘readerly’ (lisible), the second ‘writerly’ (scriptible).

zh: 第一种文本的目的是供阅读（消费）；第二种文本是供写作（生产）。
en: The ﬁrst is made to be read (consumed), the second to be written (produced).

zh: 法国女性主义深受心理分析的影响，特别是拉康对 弗洛伊德的重新阐释的影响(见第7章)，这样就消 减了迄今为止许多法国女性主义对弗洛伊德的敌视。
en: French feminism has been deeply influenced by psychoanalysis, especially by Jacques Lacan’s reworking of Freud (see Chapter 7), and in this has overcome the hostility towards the latter hitherto shared by many feminists.

zh: 在拉康之前，弗洛伊德的理论特别在美国(参看前文对米利特的论述) 一直被缩减到一种粗糙的生理层面上；女性幼儿看到了男性器官，意识到自己是女性，因为她没有阴茎。
en: Before Lacan, Freud’s theories, especially in the United States (cf. Kate Millett above), had been reduced to a crude biological level: the female child, seeing the male organ, recognizes herself as female because she lacks the penis.

zh: 她蔑视贬低自己，明显地感到一种“ 阴茎忌妒”的痛苦。
en: She defines herself negatively and suffers an inevitable ‘penis envy’.

zh: 在这一点上，研究阅读的心理学家和语言学家达成的共识是，阅读教学必须立足于对字母和语音之间联系的切实了解，而让孩子觉得阅读有趣并且有意义的全语认读活动应作为字母认读法教学的辅助。这一共识也得到很多老师的认可。
en: At this point, the consensus among psychologists and linguists who do research on reading—and a view shared by many teachers—is that reading instruction must be grounded in a firm understanding of the connections between letters and sounds, and that whole-language activities that make reading fun and meaningful for children should be used to supplement phonics instruction.

zh: 从这样的研究出发，目前联邦政府在美国各地推广包含字母认读法在内的阅读课程。
en: Based on such research, the federal government now promotes the inclusion of phonics in reading programs across the United States.

zh: 也就是说，在每一领域中都已表明——在我看来还是很有说服力的，这神方法不仅是不够的，而且从根本上就是错误的。
en: That is, in each case ithas been argued – quite persuasively, in my opinion – that the approach is not only inadequate but misguided in basic and important ways.

zh: 我以为，事情已很清楚了：如果我们还想理解语言的运用和获得，我们就必须抽取出一个认知系统——一个知识和信念的系统——加以独立地研究。该系统形成于儿童早期，并与许多其它因素相互作用，从而确定我们所观察到的各种行为。如果引用一个专业术语，那就是，我们必须把隐藏在行为底层但却并不以任何直接的或简单的方式表现在行为中的“语言能力”系统分离出来，加以研究。
en: It has, I believe, become quite clear that if we are ever to understand how language is used or acquired, then we must abstract for separate and independent study a cognitive system, a system of knowledge and belief, that develops in early childhood and that interacts with many other factors to determine the kinds of behavior that we observe; to introduce a technical term, we must isolate and study the system of linguistic competence that underlies behavior but that is not realized in any direct or simple way in behavior.

zh: 只不过几年以后，人们惊喜地发现，机器翻译和自动摘要也为期不远了。
en: And just a few years later, it was jubilantly discovered that machine translation and automatic abstracting were also just around the corner.

zh: 对于那些寻求用更多的数学公式来表示基本过程的人来说，在50年代前期形成的关于通讯的数学理论提供了一个基本概念一一信息。信息概念能把社会科学和行为科学结合起来，并在概率的基础上，为人的行为提供一个可靠的、令人满意的数学理论，大约与此同时，作为一种独立的研究结果的 自动机理论也发展起来了，使用的也是与信息论密切相关的数学概念。
en: For those who sought a more mathematical formulation of the basic processes, there was the newly developed mathematical theory of communication, which, it was widely believed in the early 1950s, had provided a fundamental concept – the concept of “information” – that would unify the social and behavioral sciences and permit the development of a solid and satisfactory mathematical theory of human behavior on a probabilistic base.At about the same time, the theory of automata developed as an independent study, making use of closely related mathematical notions.

zh: 许多人都利用因特网的搜寻功能来查找信息。
en: Many people use the search features of the Internet to find information.

zh: 典型的做法是，人们输入一个关键词，或许几个关键词，然后不可思议地看见，计算机反馈回来一些网址，其中都包含与那个关键词相关的信息。
en: Typically, one enters a keyword, or perhaps several, and magically the computer returns the location of Web sites that contain information relating to that keyword.

zh: 这个过程就是信息提取的一个例子。
en: This process is an example of information retrieval.

zh: 俚语和行话方面的词典（见第十章）由来已久，多语种词典也是如此。
en: Dictionaries of slang and jargon (see chapter 10) have existed for many years; so have multilingual dictionaries.

zh: 除此以外，如今书店和图书馆的书架上堆满了各种专门为各界人士编写的词典，如生物学家、工程师、农学家、经济学家，艺术家、建筑师 、印刷工人、男女同性恋者、异装癖者、运动员、网球手，等等——只要拥有自己的一套词汇来表达其所思所为，几乎任何群体都在此列。
en: In addition to these, the shelves of bookstores and libraries are now filled with dictionaries written specifically for biologists, engineers, agriculturists, economists, artists, architects, printers, gays and lesbians, transsexuals, runners, tennis players, and almost any group that has its own set of words to describe what they think and what they do.

zh: 我们自己的心理词典大约只包括所有这呰词典的条目中数量较小的一部分。但是，每个词都可以在某人的词库当中找到。
en: Our own mental dictionaries include only a small set of the entries in all of these dictionaries, but each word is in someone’s lexicon.

zh: 考虑到结构语言学强烈的反心理主义立场，这样来评价它似乎有点自相矛盾。
en: It may seem a bit paradoxical to speak of structural linguistics in this way, given its militant anti-psychologism.

zh: 但是如果我们注意到，当代心理学本身—尤其是那些直到几年前还垄断着语言习得和语言运用研究的心理学分支—同样具有这种激烈的反心理主义立场，上述评论就不矛盾了。
en: But the paradox is lessened when we take note of the fact that this militant anti-psychologism is no less true of much of contemporary psychology itself, particularly of those branches that until a few years ago monopolized the study of use and acquisition of language.

zh: 毕竟，我们生活在一个“行为科学”的时代，而非“心理科学”的时代。
en: We live, after all,in the age of “behavioral science,” not of “the science of mind.”

zh: 我不想在此过多地在术语革新上作文章，但我想，近代人在对人和社会的思考中，心甘情愿采取“行为科学”这一标记，是有某种意义的。
en: I do not want to read too much into a terminological innovation, but I think that there is some significance in the ease and willingness with which modern thinking about man and society accepts the designation “behavioral science.”

zh: 根据J·L·奥斯丁的定义，行为性言语应该是陈述本身履行了所指示的行为：例如在“我保证付给你十镑”这句话中，保证行为就是说话行为本身。
en: Performative utterances, as Austin defined them, are statements which themselves accomplish the acts to which they refer: thus in ‘I promise to pay you ten pounds’ the act of promising is the uttering of the sentence.

zh: 谎言并非这一意义上的行为性言语；它们恰好只是虚假的陈述。
en: Lies are not performative in this sense; they are statements which happen to be false.

zh: 它们虽然在文本中具有特殊的作用，然而，作为语言学的论点却给弄混淆了。
en: And though they may well play a privileged role in the text, the linguistic argument is pure obfuscation.

zh: 在20世纪50年代，行为主义支配了现代社会科学，当时所盛行的是华生和史金纳的理论。
en: In the 1950s the social sciences were dominated by behaviorism, the school of thought popularized by John Watson and B. F. Skinner.

zh: 他们认为有关心智的活动，例如 “知道”和“思考”是“不科学的”，而心智和天赋则是脏话。
en: Mental terms like ''know", and ''think'' were branded as unscientific; ''mind" and ''innate", were dirty words.

zh: 他们认为:行为可以藉由研究老鼠按杆，或狗见讯号就流口水所得来的几个简单的刺激-反应定律，就可以解释。
en: Behavior was explained by a few laws of stimulus-response learning that could be studied with rats pressing bars and dogs salivating to tones.

zh: 形式主义者出现于1917年布尔什维克革命之前的俄国。他们在整个20年代都很活跃，直到斯大林主义有效地使其沉默。
en: The Formalists emerged in Russia in the years before the 1917 Bolshevik revolution, and flourished throughout the 1920s, until they were effectively silenced by Stalinism.

zh: 作为一个富有战斗和论争精神的批评团休，他们拒绝此前曾经影响着文学批评的神秘的象征主义理论原则，并且以实践的科学精神把注意转向文学作品本身的物质实在。
en: A militant, polemical group of critics, they rejected the quasi-mystical symbolist doctrines which had influenced literary criticism before them, and in a practical, scientific spirit shifted attention to the material reality of the literary text itself.

zh: 让我们来玩“ 折磨计算机”的游戏。
en: Let’s play “torment the computer.”

zh: 设想有一个相当好的形态分析器。
en: Imagine a fairly good morphological parser.

zh: 输入kindness,它会分析成kind + ness，输入upchuck，它就会分析成up + chuck，但是，如果你输入catsup，而它却分析成cat+s+up，你便会责备它。
en: Give it kindness, it returns kind + ness; give it upchuck, it returns up + chuck, but if you give it catsup and it returns cat + s + up, you will scold it.

zh: 请再想出10个这样可能诱导计算机做出错误分析的词。
en: Think of ten more words that are likely to lead to false analyses.

zh: 后缀-ify 与名词结合也能构成动词： objectify ( 使客观化）， glorify ( 赞美），personify (拟人化）。
en: The suffix -ify conjoined with nouns also forms verbs: objectify, glorify, personify.

zh: 请注意“滑稽龟” 走得更远，他将后缀-cation加于u g lify之上又构成名词uglification, 就像glorification, simplification, falsification, purification 一样。
en: Notice that the Mock Turtle went even further; he added the suffix -cation to uglify and formed a noun, uglification, as in glorification, simplification, falsification, and purification.

zh: 通过使用英语的形态规则，他创造了一个新词。
en: By using the morphological rules of English, he created a new word.

zh: 决定复数语素或是其余语素的语音实现的专有规则叫作形态音位规则。
en: The particular phonological rules that determine the phonetic form of the plural morpheme and other morphemes of the language are morphophonemic rules.

zh: 这些规则与特定语素的发音相关。
en: Such rules concern the pronunciation of specific morphemes.

zh: 因此，复数形态音位的规则仅作用于复数语素而非英语中所有语素。
en: Thus the plural morphophonemic rules apply to the plural morpheme specifically, not to all morphemes in English.

zh: 考虑到这些，一些学者认为英语使用的是一种形态音位正字法，而不仅仅是音位拼写法。
en: These considerations have led some scholars to suggest that in addition to being phonemic, English has a morphophonemic orthography.

zh: 如果要正确地读英语，形态音位的知识必不可少。
en: To read English correctly, morphophonemic knowledge is required.

zh: 英语不同于西班牙语那样正字法只体现音位的语言。
en: This contrasts with a language such as Spanish, whose orthography is almost purely phonemic.

zh: 托多洛夫在题为《如何阅读？》的论文中谈到他称之为“形象化”的功能活动，即把在多层次起作用的某一形象或结构所决定的一部或一组文本，视为一个系统。他援引波利斯·艾亨鲍姆对俄国诗人安娜·阿赫玛托娃的研究的例子：“这首诗作在各个层次上都符合矛盾修饰法的概念……，不仅在文体细节，而且在主题方面都表现出来。”
en: In an essay entitled ‘Comment lire?’ Todorov speaks of an operationcalled ‘figuration’, which consists of taking a text or group of texts as a system determined by a particular figure or structure functioning atvarious levels.He cites as example Boris Eichenbaum’s study of the Russian poet, Anna Akhmatova: ‘at all levels this poetic opus obeys the figure of oxymoron . . . it is reflected not only in stylistic details but also in the subject’.

zh: 结构主义在很多方面与传统的文学批评决裂，在另外很多方面却依然委身于传统的文学批评。
en: Structuralism broke with conventional literary criticism in many ways, while remaining mortgaged to it in many others.

zh: 我们已经看到，结构主义对于语言的专注具有革命性的意义，但是对于语言的专注同时也是学究们摆脱不开的旧东西。
en: Its preoccupation with language was, as we have seen, radical in its implications, but it was at the same time a familiar obsession of academics.

zh: 语言就是一切吗？
en: Was language really all there was?

zh: 关于劳动、性、政治权力又该怎么说呢？
en: What about labour, sexuality, political power?

zh: 这些现实本身也许会被话语难以摆脱地抓住，但是它们却肯定不能被还原为话语。
en: These realities might themselves be inextricably caught up in discourse, but they were certainly not reducible to it.

zh: 第三，女性主义批评家必须重视文学文本的虚构本质，不应沉溺于“激烈的道德主义”中，一味谴责所有男性作家书中的性别歧视（见米利特），赞同所有提出性别问题的女性作家。
en: Third, feminist critics must take account of the fictional nature of literary texts and not indulge in ‘rampant moralism’ by condemning all male authors for the sexism of their books (vide Millett) and approving all women authors for raising the issue of gender.

zh: 文本并没有固定的意义：解释取决于读者的立场与意识形态。
en: Texts have no fixed meanings: interpretations depend on the situation and ideology of the reader.

zh: 无论如何，女性能够而且应该努力施加自己的影响，以确定性别被界定和从文化上再现的方式。
en: Nevertheless, women can and should try to assert their influ- ence upon the way in which gender is defined and represented culturally.

zh: 这一发展的征象出现在“性别研究”（Gender Studies）的崛起与“男同性恋研究”（Gay Studies）和新兴的“人的研究”（Men's Studies）的对话中。“人的研究”建立在女性主义与男同性恋理论的基础上，旨在对人的性行为与生活方式加以批评和重建。
en: Signs of this development have since appeared in the academic rise of Gender Studies and the dialogues in Gay Studies with the emerging discipline of Men’s Studies, which aims to build on feminism and gay theory so as to provide a critique and reconstruction of men’s sexualities and lifestyles.

zh: 对于学术界的这些倾向一些人是心怀忧虑与反对的。在一些领域，男同性恋理论与女性主义仍有争议，甚至有敌对的情形。
en: There has been anxiety over and opposition to both these tendencies, and there remains in some quarters an unsettled, even antagonistic, relationship between gay theory and feminism.

zh: 在性差异中讨论最多的集中在五个要点上：生物学、体验、话语、无意识和社会经济状况。
en: Five main foci are involved in most discussions of sexual difference: biology; experience; discourse; the unconscious; and social and economic conditions.

zh: 强调生理差异胜过社会化作用主要是男人们的论点，目的是让女人们“安分守己”，古老的拉丁俗语说“女人不过是子宫而己”(Tota mulier in utero)是最早确立这种态度的一个证据。
en: Arguments which treat biology as fundamental and which play down socialization have been used mainly by men to keep women ‘in their place’.The old Latin saying ‘Tota mulier in utero’ (‘Women is nothing but a womb’) established this attitude early.

zh: 假如女人的身体就是她的命运，那么，对给予女性的性角色的所有质疑就会极大地违反自然秩序。
en: If a woman’s body is her destiny, then all attempts to question attributed sex-roles will fly in the face of the natural order.

zh: 在文学批评中，哈洛德·布鲁姆（Harold Bloom）对修辞手段的运用格外精彩。
en: In literary criticism Harold Bloom has made spectacular use of tropes.

zh: 尽管他也是耶鲁大学的教授，但他却不像德·曼和哈特曼（见下文）那样主张激烈的文本性，他依然把文学看作一个特定的研究领域。
en: Despite being a Yale professor, he is less radically ‘textual’ than de Man or Geoffrey Hartman (see below), and still treats literature as a special field of study.

zh: 不过，他把修辞格理论、弗洛伊德心理学和希伯来哲学神秘主义结合在一起的做法却显得颇为大胆。
en: However, his combination of the theory of tropes, Freudian psychology and cabbalistic mysticism is a daring one.

zh: 但是，如果说结构主义改变了诗的研究，那么它也使叙事研究革命化了。
en: But if structuralism transformed the study of poetry, it also revolutionized the study of narrative.

zh: 的确，它创造了一门完整的新的文学科学——叙事学。这一方面最有影响的实践者是立陶宛人A·J·格雷马 (A.J.Greimas) ，比利时人 T. 托多洛夫 (Tzvetan Todorov) , 以及法国批评家热拉·若奈特 (Gérard Genette) ，克劳德·布雷门 (Claud e Bremond) 和罗兰·巴尔特 (Roland Barthes)。
en: Indeed it created a whole new literary science -narratology - of which the most influential practitioners have been the Lithuanian A.J. Greimas, the Bulgarian Tzvetan Todorov, and the French critics Gerard Genette, Claude Bremond and Roland Barthes.

zh: 什克洛夫斯基把公认为他在抒情诗方面用得很得力的观念继续应用于小说这个很不相同的结构。
en: Shklovsky goes on to apply the same notion, which admitedly works well with the lyric, to the quite diﬀerent structure of the novel.

zh: 如果说抒情诗就其对象而言，在某种意义上是“静态的”，其影响是瞬间的，并作为单独的统一体是可以把握的，那么，小说对叙述，对时间中的运动所承担的责任则便小说成为骨子是动态的积极的实体。
en: Where the lyric is in a sense ‘static’ in respect of its object, instantaneous in its impact and graspable as a single unity, the novel’s commitment to narrative, to movement in and through time, makes it an essentially dynamic and active entity.

zh: 什克洛夫斯基对此的认识和作出的尝试，使他成为最早尝试建立小说“诗学”的前驱之一，我们以后会看到，正是这种举动对后来的结构主义批评产生了巨大的影响。
en: Shklovsky’s awareness of this, and his attempts to deal with it, constitute one of the ﬁrst attempts at a ‘poetics’ of ﬁction, and it is one which, as we shall see, has greatly inﬂuenced subsequent structuralist criticism.

zh: 叙事学家杰拉德·普林斯（Gerald Prince）提问说，当我们研究小说时，我们为什么要花费那么大的力气区分各类叙述者（全知全能型作者、不可靠作者、隐含的作者等等），而从不问叙述者把话语发送给的那些人有多么不同。
en: The narratologist Gerald Prince asks why, when we study novels, do we take such pains to discriminate between the various kinds of narrator (omniscient, unreliable, implied author, etc.), but never ask questions about the different kinds of person to whom the narrator addresses the discourse.

zh: 普林斯把这些人叫做“叙述接受者”（narratee）。
en: Prince calls this person the ‘narratee’.

zh: 我们绝不能把叙述接受者与读者混为一谈。
en: We must not confuse the narratee with the reader.

zh: 结构主义叙述理论是从某些根本的语言类比中产生的。
en: Structuralist narrative theory develops from certain elementary linguistic analogies.

zh: 句法（句子结构的法则）是叙事学法则的根本模式。
en: Syntax (the rules of sentence construction) is the basic model of narrative rules.

zh: 托多洛夫等人谈论“叙事句法”（narrative syntax）。
en: Todorov and others talk of ‘narrative syntax’.

zh: 句子中最基本的句法法则是主谓之分：“骑士（主语）用剑屠龙（谓语）”。显而易见，这个句子可以是一个事件片段甚至整个故事的核心。
en: The most elementary syntactic division of the sentence unit is between subject and predicate: ‘The knight (subject) slew the dragon with his sword (predicate).’ Evidently this sentence could be the core of an episode or even an entire tale.

zh: 选择行为代码主宰读者对情节的架构。
en: The proairetic code governs the reader's construction of plot.

zh: 阐释代码包括回答逻辑，谜语与解释，悬念与突变。
en: The hermeneutic code involves a logic of question and answer, enigma and solution, suspense and peripeteia.

zh: 这些无疑都是小说的组成部分，两者都可以放在情节结构的范畴中考虑。
en: These are undoubted components of the novel and can both be located in the realm of plot structure.

zh: 实际上，勃里蒙混淆了阐释代码的活动与选择行为代码的活动。
en: Bremond seems, in fact, to have confused the operations of the hermeneutic code with those of the proairetic code.

zh: 后者的成分必须作反时间顺序的界定，而前者的成分则是按顺时间顺序加以识别，犹如对悬念或疑案的期待那样。
en: Elements of the latter must be defined retrospectively, whereas those of the former are recognized prospectively, as a prospect of suspense or mystery.

zh: 如果我们在此对阐释代码再说上几句，我们再回到情节结构的论题时思想准备就会更加充分了。
en: If we say a word about the hermeneutic code we shall be better prepared to return to plot structure proper.

zh: 它没有与“能力” 相对应的概念——在可以用生成语法来表征能力的意义上而言。
en: It has no concept corresponding to “competence,” in the sense in which competence is characterized by a generativegrammar.

zh: 学习理论则一直把自己局限在一个狭隘而不当的关于业已习得的东西的概念上——即刺激-反应的联接系统，联想的网络，行为项目的储备库，习惯的等级结构，或在特化的剌激条件下以特殊方式作出反应的倾向系统。
en: The theory of learning has limited itself to a narrow and surely inadequate concept of what is learned – namely a system of stimulus-response connections, a network of associations, a repertoire of behavioral items, a habit hierarchy, or a system of dispositions to respond in a particularway under specifiable stimulus conditions.5

zh: 就行为心理学在教育和治疗中的应用而论，它也同样地把自己局限在“所习得的东西”这样一个概念上。
en: Insofar as behavioral psychology has been applied to education or therapy, it has correspondingly limited itself to this concept of “what is learned.”

zh: 在这种情况下，我们就能根据一个非常普遍的抽象原理，即在前面讲过的那种循环应用规则原理，来解释感知和发音的某些方面。
