en: At least two things seem to be universal about baby talk: The words that have baby-talk forms fall into certain semantic categories (e.g., food and animals), and the words are phonetically simpler than the adult forms (e.g.
, “tummy” /tʌmi/ for “stomach” /stʌmɪk/).

zh: 然而，没有体裁理论的世界是不可思议的，于经验也不相符合。
en: Nevertheless, a world without a theory of genre is unthinkable, and untrue to experience.

zh: 我们可以区别喜剧和悲剧，即使这些术语不如我们希望的那样精确和独特。
en: We can tell the difference between a comedy and a tragedy, even if those terms are not as precise and as exclusive as we might wish them to be.

zh: 托多罗夫说，如果没有这种理论，“我们仍然是世代相传的偏见的囚徒”。
en: Without such a theory, as Todorov says, ‘we remain the prisoners of prejudices transmitted from century to century’.

zh: 在动词短语的层次——这个谁对谁做了什么的层次——名同所扮演的角色在两个句子中楚一样的，水獭是建水坝的“人”,水坝是被建的东西，但是在IP句子的层次上——这是一个上语一述词关系的层次，一个所宣称的是否正确的层次——名词所扮演的角色是不同的。
en: Down in the verb phrase--the level of who did what to whom--the nouns are playing the same roles in both sentences.Beavers do the building, dams get built.But up at the sentence (IP) level--the level of subject-predicate relations, of what is being asserted to be true of what--they are playing different roles.

zh: 主动句说的是有关水獺的一般性行为，而且是真的。被动句说的是有关水坝的某些一般性情形,而正好是错的（因为有些水坝，Grand Coulee Dam就不是水獭建的)。
en: The active sentence is saying something about beavers in general, and happens to be true; the passive sentence is saying something about dams in general, and happens to be false (since some dams, like the Grand Coulee Dam, are not built by beavers).

zh: 意义不像赫希所设想的那么稳定和明确，即便作者的意义也是一样。它们所以不然的理由是——尽管他不会承认——意义是语言的产物，而这种东西总是让人有些捉摸不定的地方。
en: Meanings are not as stable and determinate as Hirsch thinks, even authorial ones — and the reason they are not is because, as he will not recognize, they are the products of language, which always has something slippery about it.

zh: 要想知道什么可以叫做拥有一个“纯粹”意图或表达一个“纯粹”意义是很困难的：仅仅是由于赫希把意义从语言那里拿开，他才能信赖这样一些怪物。
en: It is difficult to know what it could be to have a 'pure' intention or express a 'pure' meaning; it is only because Hirsch holds meaning apart from language that he is able to trust to such chimeras.

zh: 作者的意图本身就是一篇复杂的“本文”，它像其他任何本文一样，可以加以争辩、翻译和各种不同的解释。
en: An author's intention is itself a complex 'text', which can be debated, translated and variously interpreted just like any other.

zh: 发[d]和[g]时软腭抬起，不让空气从鼻腔流出。而发[n]和M 时软腭垂下，空气从鼻子里流出，等到除阻时，还从口腔流出。
en: The velum is raised in the production of [d] and [g], preventing the air from flowing through the nose, whereas for [n] and [ŋ] the velum is down, allowing the air out through both the nose and the mouth when the closure is released.

zh: 因而[m]，[n]和M是鼻音[b]，[d]，[g]是口音。鼻音和带声这两个语音特征的出现与否可以把所有音素分为四类：带音、清音、鼻音、口音，见表6.3。
en: The sounds [m], [n], and [ŋ] are therefore nasal sounds, and [b], [d], and [g] are oral sounds.The presence or absence of these phonetic features—nasal and voiced—permit the division of all speech sounds into four classes: voiced, voiceless, nasal, and oral, as shown in Table 6.3.

zh: 现在来看比较习性学。有趣的是，比较习性学最早的动机之一是，希望通过“考察关于非人有机体的那种先验的和天赋的工作假说”，就能够说明人类思维的先验形式。
en: Turning to comparative ethology, it is interesting to note that one of its earliest motivations was the hope that through the “investigation of the a priori, of the innate working hypotheses present in subhuman organisms,” it would be possible to shed light on the a priori forms of human thought.

zh: 上述表述引自康瑞德•洛伦兹的一篇早期不为人知的论文。
en: This formulation of intent is quoted from an early and little-known paper by Konrad Lorenz.

zh: 洛伦兹对此观点的进一步表达很像前一时期的皮尔士所作的表达。
en: Lorenz goes on to express views very much like those Peirce had expressed a generation earlier.

zh: 现代理论很少再把修辞手法和比喻用语区别开来，而且甚至对修辞或比喻改变了的，某个词“普通的”或“原有的”意义质疑。
en: Recent theory rarely distinguishes figure from trope and has even questioned the notion of an ‘ordinary’ or ‘literal’ meaning from which figures or tropes swerve.

zh: 就说比喻这个词，它本身是比喻的，还是非比喻的？
en: For example, is the term metaphor itself literalor figurative?

zh: 雅各·德里达在“白色的神话”中证明了对比喻的理论解释看起来是多么不可避免地要依靠比喻。
en: Jacques Derrida, in ‘White Mythology’, shows how theoretical accounts of metaphor seem inevitably to rely on metaphors.

zh: 有些理论家甚至得出了一条自相矛盾的结论，认为语言从根本上说是比喻的，认为我们称为非比喻的语言也包括了比喻手法，而它们的比喻本质是一直被遗忘了。
en: Some theorists have even embraced the paradoxical conclusion that language is fundamentally figurative and that what we call literal language consists of figures whose figurative nature has been forgotten.

zh: 尽管英语并非如此，在一些语言中，名词与标类语素同时出现，它们是能标记词的语义类别的语法语素。
en: In some languages, though not English, nouns occur with classifiers, grammatical morphemes that indicate the semantic class of the noun.

zh: 例如，在斯瓦希里语中，一个具有语义特征[人]的名词，在单数时用前缀m-标记，而复数时用wa-标记，如mtoto（孩子）和watoto（孩子们）。
en: In Swahili a noun that has the semantic feature “human” is prefixed with m- if singular and wa- if plural, as in mtoto (child) and watoto (children).

zh: 另外，具有[人工制品]特征的名词，如bed（床）、chair（椅子）或knife（刀），单数时用标类语素ki标记，复数时用vi标记，比如kiti（椅子）和viti（椅子，复数）。
en: A noun that has the feature “human artifact,” such as bed, chair, or knife, is prefixed with the classifiers ki if singular and vi if plural, for example, kiti (chair) and viti (chairs).

zh: 注意到这样一个极为常见的错误，就可以无所顾虑地强调快感和不快的意义。
en: This very common mistake noted, the signiﬁcance of pleasure and  unpleasure  may  be  insisted  upon  without  misgiving.

zh: 它们是表明我们活动的旺盛程度的最隐微的标志。
en: They are our most delicate signs of how our activities are thriving.

zh: 不过由于最强烈的快乐也可能只表示某个局部的成功，而活动可能大体上是有害的，所以它们是需要十分谨慎地加以解释的标志。
en: But since  even  the  most  intense delight  may  indicate only  a  local success and the activity be generally detrimental, they are signs which need a very wary interpretation.

zh: 这样，酷儿理论就提出了打乱那种在变成女同性恋的表演中扮演中介的身份。

en: In this way, queer theory proposes a disruption of normative sexual identities and a conception of agency linked to the ‘performance’ which installs those identities.

zh: 勃特勒的著述之所以为世人所知，正在于她将“表演性”观念与性或性别身份连接在一起。
en: Butler’s work is known above all for her association of the idea of ‘performativity’ with sexual or gendered identities.

zh: 人们常常用这一观念定位一种能够自由地选择各种身份的戏剧性的自我。
en: Often this is taken to posit a theatrical self, able to freely select from a range of possible identities.

zh: 语言的这套蓝图是儿童在完成语言习得这一任务时带来的天生知识。
en: They are part of the innate blueprint for language that the child brings to the task of acquiring a language.

zh: 儿童必须学习的是某一语言特有的语法知识。
en: What children must learn are the language specific aspects of grammar.

zh: 当出现变异参数时，儿童必须对自己的语言做出正确的选择。
en: Where there are parameters of variation, children must determine the correct choice for their language.

zh: 层级结构也是人类语言的一个基本特征。
en: Hierarchical structure is an essential property of human language.

zh: 词（以及句子）都有组成成分，都通过具体的规则管辖的方式相互关联。
en: Words (and sentences) have component parts, which relate to each other in specific, rule-governed ways.

zh: 尽管粗粗一看，如果不考虑次序，语素un-和-atic都以同样的方式和词根system相联系，但实际情况并非如此。
en: Although at first glance it may seem that, aside from order, the morphemes un- and -atic each relate to the root system in the same way, this is not the case.

zh: 但从定义上说，这两个故事的情节却是一样的。
en: But by definition the two stories have the same plot.

zh: 实际上，勃里蒙混淆了阐释代码的活动与选择行为代码的活动。
en: Bremond seems, in fact, to have confused the operations of the hermeneutic code with those of the proairetic code.

zh: 后者的成分必须作反时间顺序的界定，而前者的成分则是按顺时间顺序加以识别，犹如对悬念或疑案的期待那样。
en: Elements of the latter must be defined retrospectively, whereas those of the former are recognized prospectively, as a prospect of suspense or mystery.

zh: 如果我们在此对阐释代码再说上几句，我们再回到情节结构的论题时思想准备就会更加充分了。
en: If we say a word about the hermeneutic code we shall be better prepared to return to plot structure proper.

zh: 巴尔特没有讨论情节的不稳定性，虽然这个问题已包括在阐释代码的范畴之内。
en: Barthes does not discuss uncertainties of plot, though they do fall within the scope of the hermeneutic code.

zh: 他基本上关注的是身份属性的一点。
en: He is concerned primarily with mysteries of identity.

zh: 书名往往变成这样的疑团：《米德尔马奇》一直读到第六章，我们才弄清它究竟是一个人，一个家族，一幢宅第，一座城市，还是一个主题隐喻。
en: Titles tend to be enigmas of this kind: it is not until chapter 6 that we know whether Middlemarch is a person, a family, a house, a town or a thematic metaphor.

zh: 理论常常是常识性观点的好斗的批评家。并且，它总是力图证明那些我们认为理应如此的常识实际上只是一种历史建构，是一种看来似乎已经很自然的理论，自然到我们甚至不认为它是理论的程度了。
en: Theory is often a pugnacious critique of common-sense notions, and further, an attempt to show that what we take for granted as ‘common sense’ is in fact a historical construction, a particular theory that has come to seem so natural to us that we don’t even see it as a theory.

zh: 由于既批评常识，又探讨可供选择的概念,理论涉及对文学研究中最基本的前提或假设的质疑，即对任何没有结论却可能一直被认为是理所当然的事情提出质疑，比如：意义是什么？
en: As a critique of common sense and exploration of alternative conceptions, theory involves a questioning of the most basic premisses or assumptions of literary study, the unsettling of anything that might have been taken for granted: What is meaning?

zh: 作者是什么？
en: What is an author?

zh: 读的是什么？
en: What is it to read?

zh: “我”或者写作的主体、解读的主体及行为的主体分别是什么？
en: What is the‘I’ or subject who writes, reads, or acts?

zh: 文本与其产生的环境有什么关系？
en: How do texts relate to the circumstances in which they are produced?

zh: 艺术家内在和外在的冲突就在于同这些陈套反应进行斗争，而通俗作家的胜利则在于利用了它们。
en: Against these stock responses the artist’s internal and external conﬂicts  are  fought,  and  with  them  the  popular  writer’s  triumphs are made.

zh: 任何组合这些普通想法的产物，只要达到了态度演变的应有水平或停留点，如果经过合适的宣传，肯定获得成功。
en: Any combination of these general Ideas, hit at the  right  level  or  halting  point  of  development,  is,  if  suitably advertised,  certain  of  success.

zh: 所有艺术门类中的畅销作品都值得极其细微地研究，因为它们客观上示例说明了态度演变的最普通的水平，如果无法解释它们的广泛吸引力，无法言之有据地说明那些鄙视它的人未必是自命行家的道理,任何批评瑝论都不是令人满意的。
en: Best-sellers  in  all  the  arts, exemplifying  as  they  do  the  most  general  levels  of  attitude development, are worthy of very close study.No theory of criticism is satisfactory which is not able to explain their wide appeal and to give clear reasons why those who disdain them are not necessarily snobs.

zh: 例如用于回答一个问题的一组词就是一个成分。
en: For example, the set of words that can be used to answer a question is a constituent.

zh: 所以在回答问题“what did you find（你找到了什么）？”时，说话者可能会回答a puppy（一条小狗），而不是found a（找到一[条]）。
en: So in answer to the question “What did you find?” a speaker might answer a puppy, but not found a.

zh: A puppy可以独立完整存在，而found a不可以。
en: A puppy can stand alone while found a cannot.

zh: 举例说，如果你把职业摔跤和拳击做个比较，你就会发现这里有不同的程式。拳击手被击中时表现得很坦然，而摔跤手却十分痛苦地扭动身体，夸张地扮演各种落入俗套的角色。
en: If you compare professional wrestling with boxing, for instance, you can see that there are different conventions: boxers behave stoically when hit, while wrestlers writhe in agony and flamboyantly enact stereotyped roles.

zh: 在拳击当中，对抗的规则在标明比赛不得超越界限这个意义上说是存在于比赛之外的。而在摔跤比赛中，规则完全是存在于比赛之内的，因为程式扩大了意义的范围，而意义又可以被创造：规则为被打破而存在，公开地被打破，所以“坏蛋”，或者恶棍就可以毫不掩饰地暴露他的邪恶和缺少体育道德， 而观众也会被煽动起充满报复的愤怒情绪。
en: In boxing the rules of the contest are external to the match, in the sense that they designate limits beyond which it must not go, while in wrestling the rules are very much within the match, as conventions that increase the range of meaning that can be produced: rules exist to be violated, quite flagrantly, so that the ‘bad guy’ or villain may dramatically reveal himself as evil and unsporting and the audience be whipped up into vengeful fury.

zh: 如此说来，摔跤提供的首先是一望而知的伦理道德满足感，因为善与恶的对立是清清楚楚的。
en: Wrestling thus provides above all the satisfactions of moral intelligibility, as good and evil are clearly opposed.

zh: [ʃ]和[ʒ]是硬腭擦音，两者在mission[mɪʃən]（任务）和measure[mԑʒər]（量度）中有对立。
en: [ʃ] and [ʒ] are palatal fricatives, and contrast in such pairs as mission [mɪʃən] and measure [mԑʒər].

zh: 气流通过舌头和龈后前腭处产生了摩擦。

en: They are produced with friction created as the air passes between the tongue and the part of the palate behind the alveolar ridge.

zh: 硬腭带擦音从不在英语固有词的开头出现，除了外国借词如genre（文体）。
en: In English, the voiced palatal fricative never begins words except for foreign words such as genre.

zh: 但是，在服装业规范这一更为基础的层次上却 出现了一些严重的、方法论方面的问题。
en: The serious methodological problems arise at the more basic level of the vestimentary code.

zh: 这里，一切符号序列的意义是相同的：标题中所出现的一项，意思就是指这一项正在时兴。
en: Here all sequences have the same meaning: the presence of an item in a caption signiﬁes that it is fashionable.

zh: 符号示义的过程却没有什么可说：时装杂志上登载的照片已经把能指和所指时尚联系起来。
en: And there is little to be said about the process of signiﬁcation: the fact that the picture is presented in a fashion magazine is what connects the signiﬁer and the signiﬁed Mode.

zh: 现在我们可以用带声性、鼻音性、调音部位和调音方式来区别英语中所有的辅音。
en: We are now capable of distinguishing all of the consonant sounds of English via the properties of voicing, nasality, and place and manner of articulation.

zh: 例如 ，[f]是唇齿清（口）擦音；[n]是龈（带 ）鼻塞音。
en: For example, [f] is a voiceless, (oral), labiodental fricative; [n] is a (voiced), nasal, alveolar stop.

zh: 括号中的特征一般由于有冗余性就不说了。除非特别指出是鼻音之外，其他所有音都是口音；英语中所有鼻音都是带声的。
en: The parenthesized features are usually not mentioned because they are redundant; all sounds are oral unless nasal is specifically mentioned, and all nasals are voiced in English.

zh: 辅音还可进一步按调音方式分类。
en: Consonants are further classified according to their manner of articulation.

zh: 可以分为清音或带音、口音或鼻音、长音或短音等。
en: They may be voiced or voiceless, oral or nasal, long or short.

zh: 也可以分为塞音、擦音、塞擦音、流音或滑音。
en: They may be stops, fricatives, affricates, liquids, or glides.

zh: 发带音时声带合拢并振动，发清音时声带打开不振动。
en: During the production of voiced sounds, the vocal cords are together and vibrating, whereas in voiceless sounds they are apart and not vibrating.

zh: 清音可以是送气的或不送气的。
en: Voiceless sounds may also be aspirated or unaspirated.

zh: 发送气音时除阻后声带还分开一会儿，结果有一股气流冲出。
en: In the production of aspirated sounds, the vocal cords remain apart for a brief time after the stop closure is released, resulting in a puff of air at the time of the release.

zh: 辅音还可按照某些特征组成更大的类，如唇音、舌冠音、前腔音、咝音等。
en: Consonants may be grouped according to certain features to form larger classes such as labials, coronals, anteriors, and sibilants.

zh: 在第三章，我们讨论了词典学的性质--词典编纂，梳理了自塞缪尔·约翰逊的第一本词典到最新的牛津英语词典以来的词典学史。
en: In chapter 3 we discussed the nature and history of lexicography—the making of dictionaries—from the first dictionaries of Samuel Johnson to the updated Oxford English Dictionary (OED).

zh: 现在每位词典编纂者都可谓计算词典编纂者。
en: Nowadays every lexicographer is a computational lexicographer.

zh: 在没有电脑的情况下编写词典就如同1755年编写词典时没有羽管笔。
en: Writing a dictionary without a computer makes no more sense today than writing a dictionary without a quill would have made in 1755.

zh: 另一种关系就是一个短语的中心语及其姐妹之间的关系。
en: Another kind of relationship is that between the head of a phrase and its sisters.

zh: 短语的中心语就是其词汇范畴能够确定这个短语的类型的词，也就是名词短语中的名词，或动词短语中的动词等。
en: The head of a phrase is the word whose lexical category defines the type of phrase: the noun in a noun phrase, the verb in a verb phrase, and so on.

zh: 回顾一下上一节提到的PS树，我们看到每个VP都包含一个动词，这就是这个短语的中心语。
en: Reviewing the PS rules in the previous section, we see that every VP contains a verb, which is its head.

zh: VP也可能包含其他范畴，诸如NP或CP，这些姐妹范畴都是补足语；它们使得这个短语的意义变得完整。
en: The VP may also contain other categories, such as an NP or CP.Those sister categories are complements; they complete the meaning of the phrase.

zh: 一个潜在的词由音位构成遵守该语言音位配列规则的序列。
en: A possible word contains phonemes in sequences that obey the phonotactic constraints of the language.

zh: 一个事实上出现的词，是一个潜在的词和某个意义的结合。
en: An actual, occurring word is the union of a possible word with a meaning.

zh: 没有意义的可能词有时候叫作无意义词，有时也指词库中的偶然缺位，或词汇空缺。
en: Possible words without meaning are sometimes called nonsense words and are also referred to as accidental gaps in the lexicon, or lexical gaps.

zh: 因此，像creek 和crude这种“词”都是无意义词，代表了在英语词汇中碰巧产生的缺位。
en: Thus “words” such as creck and cruck are nonsense words and represent accidental gaps in the lexicon of English.

zh: 词汇提取的许多特征可以通过词汇判定实验来检验。
en: Many properties of lexical access can be examined using lexical decision experiments.

zh: 在以下例子中，当前呈现的词和刚刚呈现过的词之间的关系被控制起来。
en: In the following example, the relationship between the current word and the immediately preceding word is manipulated.

zh: 例如，当受试者判定doctor( 医生）一词时，倘若刚刚判定的词是nurse(护士），而不是与doctor语义上毫无关系的词，如flower(花朵），那么前者判定的速度就更快。
en: For example, making a lexical decision on the word doctor will be faster if you just made a lexical decision on nurse than if you just made one on a semantically unrelated word such as flower.

zh: 这种效应称为“语义启动”：我们说nurse一词启动doctor—词。
en: This effect is known as semantic priming: we say that the word nurse primes the word doctor.

zh: 这种效应的成因也许在于语义相关的词处于心理词库的同一区域，因此，当我们听到一个启动词并在心理词库中查寻它时，它附近语义上与之相关的词会被“唤醒”，更容易在短时间内提取。
en: This effect might arise because semantically related words are located in the same part of the mental lexicon, so when we hear a priming word and look it up in the lexicon, semantically related, nearby words are “awakened” and more readily accessible for a few moments.

zh: 这些规则，以及很多类似的规则，着眼于词的意义并且根据句子的句法结构将词组合起来，解释了我们关于句子真值的知识。
en: These rules, and many more like them, account for our knowledge about the truth value of sentences by taking the meanings of words and combining them according to the syntactic structure of the sentence.

zh: 从上面的例子中我们可以很容易地看出歧义是如何产生的。
en: It is easy to see from these examples how ambiguous meanings arise.

zh: 因为一个句子的意义是根据它的层级结构来计算的，不同的树形图有不同的意义——结构歧义一一甚至即使句子的词都相同的时候，例如The boy saw the man with a telescope。
en: Because the meaning of a sentence is computed based on its hierarchical organization, different trees will have different meanings—structural ambiguity—even when the words are the same, as in the example The boy saw the man with a telescope.

zh: 歧义词的出现----词汇歧义----如果与其他句子成分结合，可以使整个句子变得有歧义，例如She can’t bear children (她不能忍受小孩子/她不能生小孩）。
en: The occurrence of an ambiguous word—lexical ambiguity—when it combines with the other elements of a sentence, can make the entire sentence ambiguous, as in She can’t bear children.

zh: 如上所述，一个短语或者句子的意义，其中一部分是它们所包含的词的意义的一个函数。
en: As just discussed, the meaning of a phrase or sentence is partially a function of the meanings of the words it contains.

zh: 与此类似，许多词的意义也是组成这些词的语素（的意义）的一个函数，这一点我们在第三章已经了解到了。
en: Similarly, the meaning of morphologically complex words is a function of their component morphemes, as we saw in chapter 3.

zh: 然而，在词的意（或者“词汇语义”）与句子意义之间有一个基本的区别。
en: However, there is a fundamental difference between word meaning—or lexical semantics—and sentence meaning.

zh: 拉丁语有一套格词尾的复杂系统，这些后缀根据名词和动词的语法关系添加到名词上。
en: Latin had case endings, suffixes on the noun based on its thematic role or its grammatical relationship to the verb.

zh: 现在罗曼语已经找不到这些后缀了（关于语法格更为详尽的讨论，请参见第五章）。
en: These are no longer found in the Romance languages.(See chapter 5 for a more extensive discussion of thematic roles; the terms used by historical linguists are somewhat different than those used by modern semanticists.)

zh: 下面是拉丁语名词lupus（狼）的词尾变化，即各种格的列表：
en: The following is a declension, or list of cases, for the Latin noun lupus, “wolf”:

zh: 所阅读的短文经过精心安排，只包含有学生已经接触过的词汇和结构。学生翻译中的错误教师会当场纠正。
en: Reading passages were carefully constructed to contain only vocabulary and structures to which learners had already been exposed, and errors in translation were corrected on the spot.

zh: 教师会测试学生对语法规则、动词词形变化和词汇的掌握程度。
en: Learners were tested on their mastery of rules, verb paradigms, and vocabulary.

zh: 除了大声朗读自己翻译过来的短文外，学生并不经常使用目标语。
en: The students did not use the target language very much except in reading translated passages aloud.

zh: 尽管接受的刺激贫乏，儿童可以在短时间内毫不费力地习得语言，而且所有儿童、所有语言的发展阶段具有一致性规律。这就说明语言机制是先天的, 幼儿天生就拥有普遍语法（Universal Grammar），以此应对复杂的任务。
en: The ease and rapidity of children’s language acquisition and the uniformity of the stages of development for all children and all languages, despite the poverty of the stimulus they receive, suggest that the language faculty is innate and that the infant comes to the complex task already endowed with a Universal Grammar.

zh: 普遍语法不是像英语或阿拉伯语的语法, 而是代表所有人类语言所遵循的原则。
en: UG is not a grammar like the grammar of English or Arabic, but represents the principles to which all human languages conform.

zh: 语言习得是一个创造性的过程。
en: Language acquisition is a creative process.

zh: 儿童基于语言输入创建文法, 并以普遍语法为指导。
en: Children create grammars based on the linguistic input and are guided by UG.

zh: 因而，居于海德格尔思想中心的不是个别主体而是存在本身。
en: What is central to Heidegger's thought, then, is not the individual subject but being itself.

zh: 西方形而上学传统的错误在于将存在视为某种客观的实体，并使之与主体一刀两断。
en: The mistake of the Western metaphysical tradition has been to see being as some kind of objective entity, and to separate it sharply from the subject.

zh: 海德格尔却力图回到苏格拉底以前的思想，回到主体与对象的二元论尚未展开的时候，并将存在视为包括主体与对象两者之物。
en: Heidegger seeks rather to return to pre-Socratic thought, before the dualism between subject and object opened up, and to regard being as somehow encompassing both.

zh: 我在第二章中讲过，文学再现的力量有赖于它特有的独一和代表性的结合：读者看到的是对哈姆雷特王子，对简·爱，或者对哈克贝利·芬的描述，随着这些描述，他们又可以推论出这些人物遇到的麻烦是有代表性的。
en: The power of literary representations depends, I suggested in Chapter 2, on their special combination of singularity and exemplarity: readers encounter concrete portrayals of Prince Hamlet or Jane Eyre or Huckleberry Finn, and with them the presumption that these characters’ problems are exemplary.

zh: 不过，它们代表什么呢？
en: But exemplary of what?

zh: 小说并没有说。
en: The novels don’t tell.

zh: 于是就需要批评家或理论家们来做这个关于代表性的题目，并且告诉我们某角色代表哪一类人或哪个阶级：哈姆雷特的处境具有“普遍”性吗？
en: It’s the critics or theorists who have to take up the question of exemplarity and tell us what group or class of people the character stands for: Is Hamlet’s condition ‘universal’?

zh: 简·爱的困境在妇女中很常见吗？
en: Is Jane Eyre’s the predicament of women in general?

zh: 第二个测试就是“用代词替代”。
en: The second test is “replacement by a pronoun.”

zh: 代词可以取代自然的词语组合。
en: Pronouns can substitute for natural groups.

zh: 在回答问题“Where did you find a puppy ( 你在哪里找到了一条小狗）？”时，可以说“I found Mm in the park ( 我在公园找到他的）。
en: In answer to the question “Where did you find a puppy?” a speaker can say, “I found him in the park.”

zh: ”像d o 这样的词同样可以取代整个谓语found a p u p p y ,诸如John found a puppy and Bill did too (约翰找到了一条小狗，比尔也是）。
en: Words such as do can also take the place of the entire predicate found a puppy, as in “John found a puppy and Bill did too.”

zh: 如果一组词可以由一个代词或者像do这样的词替代，那么这组词就组成了一个成分。
en: If a group of words can be replaced by a pronoun or a word like do, it forms a constituent.

zh: 前面已经使用了代码这个术语，现在不妨稍稍进一步探讨它的含义。
en: The  term  ‘codes’  has  already  been  used  and  it  is  appropriate  now  to explore its implications a little further.

zh: 我们把我们对世界的经验编成代码，我们从而可以体验这种经验在我们面前一般并不存在处于原始状态的经验。我们知道，上述这些观点直接来自萨皮尔、霍尔夫和列维-斯特劳斯的著作。
en: The notion that we ‘encode’ our experience of the world in order that we may experience it; that there exists, in general, no pristine range of experiences open to us, comes directly,  as  we  have  seen,  from  the  work  of  Sapir,  Whorf  and  Lévi-Strauss.

zh: 声调一般有功能，即能区别词义。
en: Tones generally have a lexical function, that is, they make a difference between words.

zh: 但在某些语言如尼日利亚中西部的埃多语中，声调还有语法功能。
en: But in some languages tones may also have a grammatical function, as in Edo spoken in midwestern Nigeria.

zh: 后接直接宾语的单音节动词上的声调表示动词的时态和及物性。
en: The tone on monosyllabic verbs followed by a direct object indicates the tense and transitivity of the verb.

zh: 夏夫茨伯里在美学方面也一直注重得体、学识、刻意求工、“写作原则”和“艺术真实”这些为贺拉斯所推崇的优点。
en: Shaftesbury's aesthetic emphasis, furthermore, is consistently on the Horatian virtues of decorum, learning, deliberate craftsmanship, 'the rules of writing' and the truth of art.

zh: 因此，他发现莎士比亚“几乎在所有的韵致和整饰方面”都是粗犷的、不一致的、不充分的，他还讥笑那些单凭天才创作的作家，认为只有那些不知诗歌何以如此美妙的无能的读者才会把它们称作“我不知是什么，或我不可理解的东西”。才会认为它们是“一种连艺术家本人也无法解释的魅力或迷人之处”。
en: '  He accordingly finds Shakespeare rude, incoherent, and deficient 'in almost all the graces and ornaments,' ridicules authors who rely on genius alone, and holds that only those feeble readers who respond to the beauties of poetry without knowledge of their cause will term them 'the je ne scay quoy, the unintelligible or the I know not what,' and suppose them (to be a kind of charm or enchantment of which the artist himself can give no account.

zh: 按照朗吉努斯的论述，崇高是激情受到触发时瞬间的产物，而非出于冷静持续的考虑。
en: In Longinus's treatment, sublimity is said to be the product of an inspired moment of passion，rather than of cool and sustained calculation.

zh: 由此可及：（1)风格的这种最高尚的特性只涉及韵文和散文的小段落，而不是“创作中的技巧，合适的秩序或排布”，因为这些“不是一两件小事，而是作品的整体格局的艰苦努力得来的结果”。
en: It follows that: (1)This highest quality of style invests only a short passage of verse and prose, as against 'skill in invention, and due order and arrangement' which emerge 'as the hard-won result not of one thing nor of two, but of the whole texture of the composition.'

zh: 同样因为这个道理，朗吉努斯所举的关于崇高的例子范围也很小，短的只是些词语或句子一“要有光啊，于是有了光”——至长也不过是选自萨福、荷马和德谟西尼斯等人的一些小段落。
en: Accordingly, Longinus' instances of sublimity range only from a single phrase or sentence—'Let there be light, and there was light’—to short passages from Sappho, Homer, and Demosthenes.

zh: （2)这些片断突然对着听者激射而出，带着强度、震撼和光照：“时机一到便闪烁而出”，崇高“有如霹雳，所击之处万物尽散”。
en: (2) This fragment bursts suddenly upon the auditor, with an effect of intensity, shock, and illumination: hashing forth at the right moment,' sublimity 'scatters everything before it like a thunderbolt.'

zh: 例如，德谟'西尼斯的崇高就富有“速度、力量和强度”的特点，“完全可以比作霹雳或闪电”。
en: The sublimity of Demosthenes, for example, is characterized by 'speed, power, and intensity,' and 'may be compared to a thunderbolt or flash of lightning.'

zh: 其他地方都发生了创新变化，而唯有该地区还没有，地域方言的差异便可能产生。
en: Regional dialect differences may also arise when innovative changes occur everywhere but in a particular region.

zh: 与其他方言相比，地域方言可能相对保守。
en: The regional dialect may be conservative relative to other dialects.

zh: 例如在美国阿巴拉契亚山区会发现把it读成hit的情况，这是早期英语中的标准发音，而[h]的脱落则是后来的创新变化。
en: The pronunciation of it as hit, found in the Appalachian region of the United States, was standard in older forms of English.The dropping of the [h] was the innovation.

zh: 在许多不同的情况下，人们能够习得另一种语言。
en: People can acquire a second language under many different circumstances.

zh: 在你开始读初中、高中或大学的时候，你也许已经学会了另一种语言。
en: You may have learned a second language when you began middle school, or high school, or college.

zh: 搬家到一个新的国家往往意味着习得一种新的语言。
en: Moving to a new country often means acquiring a new language.

zh: 另外有些人，他们生活的社区或家庭中说多种语言，因此他们可 能同时习得两种（或更多）语言。
en: Other people live in communities or homes in which more than one language is spoken and may acquire two (or more) languages simultaneously.

zh: 第二语言习得或二语习得这个术语一般指已经习得了母语的人（成人或儿童）再去习得另一种语言。
en: The term second language acquisition, or L2 acquisition, generally refers to the acquisition of a second language by someone (adult or child) who has already acquired a first language.This is also referred to as sequential bilingualism.

zh: 双语语言习得这个术语则是指从婴儿时（或三岁之前）开始同时习得两种语言。
en: Bilingual language acquisition refers to the (more or less) simultaneous acquisition of two languages beginning in infancy (or before the age of three years),also referred to as simultaneous bilingualism.

zh: 人类的语音按照语音属性分类。
en: Human speech sounds fall into classes according to their phonetic properties.

zh: 所有的音素不是辅音，就是元音。而所有辅音不是阻音就是响音。
en: All speech sounds are either consonants or vowels, and all consonants are either obstruents or sonorants.

zh: 辅音在声道中有某种阻碍，阻碍处就定义了它们的调音部位，其中有双唇、唇齿、龈、腭、软腭、小舌、喉门。
en: Consonants have some obstruction of the airstream in the vocal tract, and the location of the obstruction defines their place of articulation, some of which are bilabial, labiodental, alveolar, palatal, velar, uvular, and glottal.

zh: 然而，像吉尼一样，切尔西一直没能把语法发展出来。
en: However, like Genie, Chelsea has not been able to develop a grammar.

zh: 对切尔西的语言脑定位进行的ERP研究显示，她大脑的两个半球对语言做出的反应是相同的。
en: ERP studies of the localization of language in Chelsea’s brain have revealed an equal response to language in both hemispheres.

zh: 换句话说，切尔西的脑也未能表现出语言正常的非对称组织结构。
en: In other words, Chelsea also does not show the normal asymmetric organization for language.

zh: 爱德华·赛义德(Edward Said)的《东方主义》是一本最著名的、最受争议的著作。
en: Said’s Orientalism (1978) is his most celebrated and debated work.

zh: 更全面地说,它和另外两本产生更多争论的 著作《 巴勒斯坦问题》(1980)与《覆盖伊斯兰》(182) 一起构成了一个三部曲,是主要讨论以色列和巴勒斯坦忡突系列著作中的第一本。
en: In a full account, it belongs in a trilogy with the more polemical works, The Question of Palestine (1980) and Covering Islam (1982), the first of a series of writings dealing principally with the Israeli–Palestinian conflict.

zh: 赛义德指出, “ 东方主义 ”占据着三个相互搭接的领域。
en: The phenomenon of ‘Orientalism’, Said reasons, occupies three overlapping domains.

zh: 尽管有上述种种变异，wh短语的移动总要受一定的限制。
en: Despite these variations, wh movement adheres to certain constraints.

zh: 尽管wh短语，如what，who,which boy等，可以插入到任何NP位置，并且从原则上来说，可以自由移动到标补语位置上，但是也有一些具体的例子不允许移动wh短语。
en: Although wh phrases such as what, who, and which boy can be inserted into any NP position, and are then free in principle to move to C, there are specific instances in which wh movement is blocked.

zh: 例如，wh短语无法移出一个关系小句，如 ...the senator that wanted to hire who（想要雇佣谁的那个参议员）中who无法移出，如例句1(b)所示。
en: For example, a wh phrase cannot move out of a relative clause like the senator that wanted to hire who, as in (1b).

zh: 短语结构树同样还表现了一个句子中不同组成部分之间的关系，例如，句子的主语和直接宾语可以从结构上进行定义。
en: Phrase structure trees also show relationships among elements in a sentence.For example, the subject and direct object of the sentence can be structurally defined.

zh: 主语是离树根S最近的，或者说由S直接统制的NP。直接宾语就是离VP最近的，或者说由VP直接统制的NP。
en: The subject is the NP that is closest to, or immediately dominated by, the root S. The direct object is the NP that is closest to, or immediately dominated by, VP.

zh: 分析器是一种计算机程序，它尝试模拟我们称为“心理分析器” 的一种人脑官能。
en: A parser is a computer program that attempts to replicate what we have been calling the “mental parser.”

zh: 与心理分析器一样，计算机中的分析器利用语法把一个短语结构指派给一个词汇串。
en: Like the mental parser, the parser in a computer uses a grammar to assign a phrase structure to a string of words.

zh: 它所利用的短语结构语法和词库与我们在第四章中讨论过的相似。
en: Parsers may use a phrase structure grammar and lexicon similar to those discussed in chapter 4.

zh: 患有难治型癫痫症的病人，可能会通过切断大脑两半球之间的信息交流来进行治疗，即外科医生切开连接两半球的神经纤维网络—胼胝体（见图2.1）。
en: People suffering from intractable epilepsy may be treated by severing communication between their two hemispheres.Surgeons cut through the corpus callosum (see Figure 2.1), the fibrous network that connects the two halves.

zh: 当该信息通道被切断后，“两块脑”之间就没有任何信息交流了。
en: When this pathway is severed, there is no communication between the “two brains.”

zh: 这种分裂脑患者也为语言的偏侧化提供了证据，并有助于理解人脑的对侧功能。
en: Such split-brain patients also provide evidence for language lateralization and for understanding contralateral brain functions.

zh: 由此，我们看到，为了理解叔伯制，我们必须把它看成是一个系统中的一种关系，而为了理解这个系统的结构，必须把系统本身看作是一个整体。
en: Thus we see that in order to understand the avunculate we must treat it as one relationship within a system, while the system itself must be considered as a whole in order to grasp its structure.

zh: 这种结构依赖于四种条件（兄弟，姐妹，父亲和儿子），这四种条件由两对互相联系的对立事物这样联系起来：在两代人中的任一代，总会有一个肯定的关系和一个否定的关系。
en: This structure rests upon four terms (brother, sister, father, and son), which are linked by two pairs of correlative oppositions in such a way that in each of the two generations there is always a positive relationship and a negative one.

zh: 那么，这种结构的本质是什么？它的功能又是什么呢？
en: Now, what is the nature of this structure, and what is its function?

zh: 答案是，这种结构是亲属关系最基本的形式，确切地说它是亲属关系的单位。
en: The answer is as follows: This structure is the most elementary form of kinship that can exist.It is, properly speaking, the unit of kinship.

zh: 第一种或许可以称之为“把任何描述性的抒情短诗看作是一种瞬间的顿悟。
en: The first might be stated as ‘attempt to read any brief descriptive lyric as a moment of epiphany’.

zh: ”如果某个物体或情境成为一首诗的焦点，那么，按照约定俗称的理解，这本身就意味着它十分重要：它是一种强烈感情的“客观对应物”，或是出现即刻的感悟的场合。
en: If an object or situation is the focus of a poem, that implies, by convention, that it is especially important: the ‘objective correlative’ of an intense emotion or the locus of a moment of revelation.

zh: 这尤其适用于意象派诗歌，俳句，或其他短诗，它们通过抒情诗来强调它们的重要性。
en: This applies particularly to imagist poems, haiku and other brief poems which allow the lyric form to assert their importance.

zh: 为了达到俄狄浦斯情结的效果，儿童当然必须首先朦胧地意识到性的区别。
en: For the drama of the Oedipus complex to come about at all, the child must of course have become dimly aware of sexual difference.

zh: 正是父亲的介入象征着这种性的区别；拉康著作中的一个关键术语菲勒斯(phallus)表明了性区别的含义。
en: It is the entry of the father which signifies this sexual difference; and one of the key-terms in Lacan's work, the phallus, denotes this signification of sexual distinction.

zh: 只有在接受了性区别和明显不同的性角色是必然的事情这种观点后，原来一直没有意识到这类问题的儿童才能真正地“社会化”。
en: It is only by accepting the necessity of sexual difference, of distinct gender roles, that the child, who has previously been unaware of such problems, can become properly 'socialized'.

zh: 尧斯（Hans Robert Jauss）是德国“接受”理论（Rezeptionästhetik）的重要成员，他赋予读者导向批评一种历史的维度。
en: Jauss, an important German exponent of ‘reception’ theory (Rezeptionästhetik), gave a historical dimension to reader-oriented criticism.

zh: 他试图在无视历史的俄国形式主义与无视文本的社会理论之间达成一种妥协。
en: He tried to achieve a compromise between Russian Formalism which ignores history, and social theories which ignore the text.

zh: 尧斯写作的年代是社会动荡不安的20世纪60年代末期，他和其他一些人要求对德国文学中古老的经典提出质疑，并且说明这种要求完全是合理的。
en: Writing during a period of social unrest at the end of the 1960s, Jauss and others wanted to question the old canon of German literature and to show that it was perfectly reasonable to do so.

zh: 20世纪初的俄国形式主义者强调批评家应该关心文学的文学性：使其成为文学的文字技巧，包括语言本身的突出和这些技巧“创新立异”的经验。
en: The Russian Formalists of the early years of the twentieth century stressed that critics should concern themselves with the literariness of literature: the verbal strategies that make it literary, the foregrounding of language itself, and the ‘making strange’ of experience that they accomplish.

zh: 形式主义者把注意力从作者引向文字“手段”，声称“手段是文学的唯一英雄”。
en: Redirecting attention from authors to verbal ‘devices’, they claimed that ‘the device is the only hero of literature’.

zh: 我们应该向类似于“这首十四行诗怎么了？”或者“在这本狄更斯所著的书里，什么令人激动的情节降临到小说里？”这样的问题，而不是问“作者在这里说什么？”。
en: Instead of asking ‘what does the author say here?’we should ask something like ‘what happens to the sonnet here?’ or ‘what adventures befall the novel in thisbook by Dickens?’

zh: 语音由唇舌发出......人说话靠的是他所吸入体内尤其是腹腔中的空气。
en: The voice is articulated by the lips and the tongue.. . . Man speaks by means of the air which he inhales into his entire body and particularly into the body cavities.

zh: 当空气通过空间排出时由于颅腔共鸣，便产生一种声音。
en: When the air is expelled through the empty space it produces a sound, because of the resonances in the skull.

zh: 舌头的活动控制了发音。它先把空气聚在咽喉，然后让空气顶开腭、齿的阻碍，把它们压出，于是造成某种有特定音质的声音。
en: The tongue articulates by its strokes; it gathers the air in the throat and pushes it against the palate and the teeth, thereby giving the sound a definite shape.

zh: 假如每次都不让舌头活动以控制发音，说话就不清楚，只能发出很少几个音。
en: If the tongue would not articulate each time, by means of its strokes, man would not speak clearly and would only be able to produce a few simple sounds.

zh: 滑音[j]是一个腭音，发音时舌尖(舌前部不包括舌尖)抬向硬腭，部位跟发beat[bit](打)中的元音i几乎相同。发you [ju] (你)时舌头从[j]很快滑向元音[u]。
en: The glide [j] is a palatal sound; the blade of the tongue (the front part minus the tip) is raised toward the hard palate in a position almost identical to that in producing the vowel sound [i] in the word beat [bit].

zh: 发滑音[w]时,舌后部抬向软腭，同时撮圆嘴唇。
en: The glide [w] is produced by both rounding the lips and simultaneously raising the back of the tongue toward the velum.

zh: 因此它是一个圆唇软腭滑音。
en: It is thus a labio-velar glide.

zh: 虽然儿童听到许多语句，但是他们听到的语言不完整、有噪声而且缺乏组织性。
en: Although children hear many utterances, the language they hear is incomplete, noisy, and unstructured.

zh: 前面说过，儿童导向语基本上是合式的，但是儿童还要接触成人之间的交谈。
en: We said earlier that child-directed speech is largely well formed, but children are also exposed to adult–adult interactions.

zh: 后者包括许多口误、错误的开头、不合语法和不完整的句子，但并不包括哪些语句合式而哪些又不合式的信息。
en: These utterances include slips of the tongue, false starts, ungrammatical and incomplete sentences, and no consistent information as to which utterances are well formed and which are not.

zh: 至此为止，我们在本书中已经考察过的大部分文学理论都可以被认为是对于文学作品的某种二次修正。
en: Most of the literary theory we have examined so far in this book could be considered a form of 'secondary revision' of the literary text.

zh: 在对于“和谐”、“一致”、“深层结构”或者“根本意义”的执着追求中，这类理论为本文补苴罅漏，弭平矛盾，调和分裂，消除冲突。
en: In its obsessive pursuit of 'harmony', 'coherence', 'deep structure' or 'essential meaning', such theory fills in the text's gaps and smooths over its contradictions, domesticating its disparate aspects and defusing its conflicts.

zh: 它这么做就好像是为了让作品更容易被“消费”——为读者铺平道路，使他不会受到任何无法解释的反常现象的干扰。
en: It does this so that the text may be, so to speak, more easily 'consumed' — so that the path is made straight for the reader, who will not be ruffled by any unexplained irregularities.

zh: 大多数人处在这两个极端之间的某个位置上。
en: Most people fall somewhere in the middle.

zh: 成功可能取决于一系列因素，包括年龄、才能、动机，以及你是身在说那种语言的国家，还是仅仅每周花5个上午坐在教室里然后就对该语言的母语者敬而远之。
en: Success may depend on a range of factors, including age, talent, motivation, and whether you are in the country where the language is spoken or sitting in a classroom five mornings a week with no further contact with native speakers.

zh: 因为所有这些原因，许多人包括许多研究L2习得的语言学家都相信，第二语言习得与第一语言习得很不一样。
en: For all these reasons, many people, including many linguists who study L2 acquisition, believe that second language acquisition is something different from first language acquisition.

zh: 这种假设被称为L2习得的“根本差异假说”。
en: This hypothesis is referred to as the fundamental difference hypothesis of L2 acquisition.

zh: 结构主义人类学家克劳德·列维施特劳斯在分析俄底浦斯神话时，采用了真正的结构主义语言学模式。
en: Claude Lévi-Strauss, the structuralist anthropologist, analyses the Oedipus myth in a manner which is truly structuralist in its use of the linguistic model.

zh: 他借鉴语言学中的音素和词素，把神话中的单元叫做“神话素”（可比较语言学中的“音素”和“语素”）。
en: He calls the units of myth ‘mythemes’(compare phonemes and morphemes in linguistics).

zh: 这些神话素像基本的语言单元一样，以二元对立形式组合在一起（见前文第65页）。
en: They are organized in binary oppositions(see above, p. 65) like the basic linguistic units.

zh: 针对这个骗人的过程，巴尔特提出一种文学观，用弗雷德里克·詹姆森的话说，就是高度“习俗化了的活动”。
en: In place of this deceitful process, Barthes offers the notion of literature as what Fredric Jameson calls a highly ‘conventionalized activity’.

zh: 根据这种观点，索绪尔的能指和所指关系又溶进“另一种具有代码性质的符号指示”。因此，文学显示出本质上的二重性。
en: In it, the Saussurean signifier–signified relationship is complicated by ‘another type of  signification which bears on the nature of the code itself.’ In consequence, literature exhibits a fundamental duplicity.

zh: 正如让-米歇尔·拉巴尔特在其2002年的著作中所说的，“发生学研究”是文学研究中与科学关系紧密唯一留存下来的例证。
en: ‘Genetic Criticism’, as Jean-Michel Rabaté (2002) suggests, is the key remaining example of literary study’s relation to science.

zh: 它和历史的方法也有某种亲和性，当然这要看我们如何看待“历史”。
en: It has some affinities, too, with historical method – though much depends then on what we mean by ‘history’.

zh: 尽管“发生学研究”一方面受新历史主义或文化唯物主义以及解构论（用文本差异的具体例证置换“原本”的尊大观念）的影响，可它另一方面也颇像从文本档案馆中钩稽那些潜藏的无可辩驳的事实的研究。
en: For although, on the one hand, ‘genetic criticism’ owes something to New Historicism or Cultural Materialism and to Deconstruction (displacing a reverential notion of the ‘original’ with the material evidence of textual difference), it can also sound like a reassertion of undisputed ‘fact’ anchored in the physical evidence of the textual archive.

zh: 这并非意味着整个海德格尔哲学就是法西斯主义的理论基础。
en: This is not to suggest that Heidegger's philosophy as a whole is no more than a rationale for fascism.

zh: 只是，它像法西斯主义一样，也为现代历史危机提供了一种假想的解决方案。因此，二者具有很多相似的特征。
en: It is to suggest that it provided one imaginary solution to the crisis of modern history as fascism provided another, and that the two shared a number of features in common.

zh: 当语义规则和语境解释确定一个代词与一个NP同指,我们就说这个代词受约束于名词短语先行词。
如果前面的例子中her指 the woman,那么它就是一个受约束代词。
en: In this case her refers to each one of the girls in the class and is said to be bound to every girl.

zh: 反身代词总是受约束性的。
en: Reflexive pronouns are always bound.

zh: 如果一个代词指称话语中没有明确提及的对象，它就被称为自由或者非受约束代词。
en: When a pronoun refers to some entity outside the sentence or not explicitly mentioned in the discourse, it is said to be free or unbound.
So, her in the sentences in (1) and (2) need not be bound to Mary or to every girl and can also refer to some arbitrary girl.

zh: 自由代词的指称最终必须取决于情景语境。
en: The reference of a free pronoun must ultimately be determined by the situational context.

zh: 词义相反的词就是反义词。
en: Words that are opposite in meaning are antonyms.

zh: 反义词分为几种。
en: There are several kinds of antonymy.

zh: 一种是互补反义词对：alive/dead present/absent awake/asleep     活的/死的   在场/缺席     醒着/睡着
en: There are complementary pairs: alive/dead present/absent awake/asleep

zh: 但有一支北美英语的社会方言成为被偏见忽略的牺牲品。
en: There is, however, a social dialect of North American English that has been a victim of prejudicial ignorance.

zh: 这一方言就是非裔美国英语（AAE），由大量非洲后裔的美国人所使用。
en: This dialect, African American English (AAE), is spoken by a large population of Americans of African descent.

zh: 这种英语方言的独特之处因社会、教育和经济等原因而持续存在。
en: The distinguishing features of this English dialect persist for social, educational, and economic reasons.

zh: 随着布拉格学派的著作，术语“结构主义”与“符号学”一词或多或少地混合了。
en: With the work of the Prague school, the term 'structuralism' comes moreor less to merge with the word 'semiotics'.

zh: “符号学”意味着对于符号的系统研究，而这也是文学结构主义者实际进行的工作。
en: 'Semiotics', or 'semiology', means the systematic study of signs, and this is what literary structuralists are really doing.

zh: “结构主义”一词本身表明一种研究方法，它可以被应用于从足球比赛到经济生产方式等完整的对象系列；“符号学”表示一个相当特殊的研究领域，即系统领域。这些系统在一般意义上被看作符号：诗、鸟语、交通信号、病症等等。
en: The word 'structuralism' itself indicates a method of enquiry, which can be applied to a whole range of objects from football matches to economic modes of production; 'semiotics' denotes rather a particular field of study, that of systems which would in an ordinary sense be regarded as signs: poems, bird calls, traffic lights, medical symptoms and so on.
Here are some other terms used to form subclasses of consonantal sounds.

zh: 下面是纯辅音的下位分类，但没有穷尽所有辅音，那需要上完整的语音课才能做到，此处不赘。
en: These are not exhaustive, nor are they mutually exclusive (e.g., the interdentals belong to two subclasses).A full course in phonetics would note further classes that we omit.
Labials [p] [b] [m] [f] [v] [w] [ʍ] Labial sounds are those articulated with the involvement of the lips.

zh: 唇音是用嘴唇来发的，包括双唇音[p][b][m]和唇齿音[f][v]。
en: They include the class of bilabial sounds [p] [b] and [m], the labiodentals [f] and [v], and the labiovelars [w] and [ʍ].

zh: allege(动词): 意指“没有证据的声称”，declarer=subject (宣称的人=主语)，declaration=complement sentence (宣称的话=辅助句)。这里每一项都列出它的定义以及扮演角色的人。
en: allege: verb; means ''to declare without proof "; declarer = subjectdeclaration = complement sentence; Each of these entries lists a definition (in mentalese) of some kind of event, followed by the players that have roles in the event.

zh: 这些项目告诉我们角色扮演者如何被放进句了中—当作主语、受词、介词的受词，和夹在句子中的子句等等。
en: The entry indicates how each role-player may be plugged into the sentence —— as a subject, an object, a prepositional object, an embedded sentence, and so on.

zh: 虽然改写对孩子有潜在的帮助, 但它们的使用方法并不一致。
en: Although recasts are potentially helpful to the child, they are not used in a consistent way.

zh: 对四十名四岁以下儿童的母亲进行的一项研究表明, 儿童不合语法的句子里，只有25%被改写, 而且总的来说,合乎语法的句子与不合语法的句子被改写的比例大同小异。
en: One study of forty mothers of children two to four years old showed that only about 25 percent of children’s ungrammatical sentences are recast and that overall, grammatical sentences were recast as often as bad sentences.

zh: 较之语法，父母更倾向于关注内容正确与否。
en: Parents tend to focus on the correctness of content more than on grammaticality.

zh: 因此, 父母会对许多不合语法的话语忽略不谈, 而会改变许多合乎语法的话语。
en: So parents allow many ungrammatical utterances to “slip by” and change many grammatical utterances.

zh: 一个依赖改写来学习语法的孩子将会非常困惑。
en: A child who relied on recasts to learn grammar would be mightily confused.

zh: “幻想的快感更有益于健康。
en: ‘The pleasures of Fancy are more conducive to health than those of the understanding.

zh: ”“强烈感情的自发流溢，“文字完美，安排完美。”“人处于活动时的整个灵魂，统一性寓于多样性。”
en: ’ ‘The spontaneous overflow of powerful feeling.’ ‘The best words in the best order.’ ‘The whole soul of man in activity.’

zh: 艺术技巧是使事物变得“陌生”，使形式变得困难，是增加感觉的难度和长度，因为感觉过程就是审美目的的本身，因此必须延长。
en: The technique of art is to make objects ‘unfamiliar’, to make forms difficult, to increase the difficulty and length of perception because the process of perception is an aesthetic end in itself and must be prolonged.

zh: 艺术是体验一个事物艺术性的一种方式；事物本身是不重要的。
en: Art is a way of experiencing the artfulness of an object; the object is not important.

zh: （什克洛夫斯基自己的强调）

en: (Lemon and Reis, 1965, p. 12; Shklovsky’s emphasis)

zh: 但是感情转移也使分析者在他们所能介入的有控制的情况下洞察到别人所难以洞察的病人的心理生活。
en: But transference also provides the analyst with a peculiarly privileged insight into the patient's psychical life, in a controlled situation in which he or she can intervene.

zh: （精神分析者自己在受培训过程中也必须接受分析，其原因之一是要让他们能够相当清醒地意识到他们自己的潜意识过程，以便尽可能防止将他们自己的问题“反转移”到他们的病人身上。
en: (One of the several reasons why psychoanalysts must themselves undergo analysis in training is so that they can become reasonably aware of their own unconscious processes, thus resisting as far as possible the danger of 'counter-transferring' their own problems to their patients.)

zh: ）由于这一移情的戏剧效果，以及它为分析者提供的洞察与介入，病人的问题可逐渐按照精神分析场合的情况重新加以解释。
en: By virtue of this drama of transference, and the insights and interventions which it permits the analyst, the patient's problems are gradually redefined in terms of the analytic situation itself.

zh: 不要以为他们的动词都没有时态变化，所以语言太粗糙。这些动词 go, stay, came, 或短语one time不是偶然的英文用字，而是夏威夷克里奧语文法的往常性系统化用法。这些字己经被克里奥语的使用者转化成助词、介词，表示“格”的标记及相关代词。
en: Do not be misled by what look like crudely placed English verbs, such as “go”, “stay”, and “came”, or phrases like “one time”.They are not haphazard uses of English words but systematic uses of Hawaiian Creole grammar: the words have been converted by the creole speakers into auxiliaries, prepositions, case markers, and relative pronouns.

zh: 事实上，一个己经行之有年的语言，它的前置和语尾文法词的由来，例如英文动词的过去式-ed的语尾变化就是来自动词do,He hammered最早以前是He hammer-did。
en: In fact, this is probably how many of the grammatical prefixes and suffixes in established languages arose.For example, the English past­tense ending -ed may have evolved from the verb do: “He hammered” was originally something like “He hammer-did”.

zh: 在印欧语的历史上，形态规则发生了广泛的变化。
en: Extensive changes in morphology have occurred in the history of the IndoEuropean languages.

zh: 拉丁语有一套格词尾的复杂系统，这些后缀根据名词和动词的语法关系添加到名词上。
en: Latin had case endings, suffixes on the noun based on its thematic role or its grammatical relationship to the verb.

zh: 现在罗曼语已经找不到这些后缀了（关于语法格更为详尽的讨论，请参见第五章）。
en: These are no longer found in the Romance languages.(See chapter 5 for a more extensive discussion of thematic roles; the terms used by historical linguists are somewhat different than those used by modern semanticists.)

zh: 伊赛尔的阅读模式基本上是功能主义的：部分必须前后一贯地适应整体。
en: Iser's model of reading is fundamentally functionalist: the parts must be made to adapt coherently to the whole.

zh: 事实上，在这个武断的偏见之后，隐藏着格式塔心理学的影响：一心把相互分离的感觉综合成为可解的整体。
en: Behind this arbitrary prejudice, in fact, lies the influence of Gestalt psychology, with its concern to integrate discrete perceptions into an intelligible whole.

zh: 的确，这一偏见在现代批评家中如此流行，以致很难将之仅仅视为一种理论上的偏爱。它并不比其他任何问题更少争论性。
en: It is true that this prejudice runs so deep in modern critics that it is difficult to see it as just that – a doctrinal predilection, which is no less arguable and contentious than any other.

zh: 当不同的群体说某种语言的方式存在系统性的变异，那么我们就认为每个群体说的是该语言的一种方言。
en: When there are systematic differences in the way groups speak a language, we say that each group speaks a dialect of that language.

zh: 方言是存在系统差异的语言能够相互理解的形式。
en: Dialects are mutually intelligible forms of a language that differ in systematic ways.

zh: 每个讲话者，不论贫富，也无论所属地域或种族，都至少能说一种方言，这就像每个人都能说一种个人方言一样。
en: Every speaker, whether rich or poor, regardless of region or racial origin, speaks at least one dialect, just as each individual speaks an idiolect.

zh: 个体双语能力有不同的程度。
en: There are various degrees of individual bilingualism.

zh: 有些人天生喜欢两种语言的控制，而另一些人经常使用两种语言，熟练程度高，但缺乏以一种或另一种语言为母语或接近母语的人的语言能力。
en: Some people have native-like control of two languages, whereas others make regular use of two languages with a high degree of proficiency but lack the linguistic competence of a native or near native speaker in one or the other language.

zh: 此外，一些双语者可能有口头能力，但不能阅读或写一种或多种语言。
en: Also, some bilinguals may have oral competence but not read or write one or more of their languages.

zh: 美学对象，比如绘画或者文学作品，通过把作用于感官的形式（色彩、声音）和精神的内涵（思想理念）融为一体来实现把物质与精神结合在一起的可能性。
en: Aesthetic objects, such as paintings or works of literature, with their combination of sensuous form (colours, sounds) and spiritual content (ideas), illustrate the possibility of bringing together the material and the spiritual.

zh: 一部文学作品就是一个美学对象，这正是因为文学具有最初使其得以定位，或者说使其得以存在的交流功能。它可以使读者去思考形式与内容之间的内在的关系。
en: A literary work is an aesthetic object because, with other communicative functions initially bracketed or suspended, it engages readers to consider the interrelation between form and content.

zh: 巴尔特的语言模式要求他从一个系统的共时状态中收集一组素材，而时装显然最适合作这样的处理，因为当服装设计师每年推出新的款式时，时装流行款式就会发生明显的变化。
en: Barthes’s linguistic model requires him to collect a corpus of data from a single synchronic state of the system, and fashion, of course, is eminently suitable for such treatment since it changes abruptly once a year when designers bring out their new collections.

zh: 巴尔特把每年发行的《她》和《时装园地》上的解释标题汇集起来，便获得了一组可以把握的素材。他希望，这组素材中能够包括该系统 在这个阶段上的各种不同的可能性。
en: By taking captions from a year’s issues of Elle and Jardin des Modes, Barthes creates a manageable corpus which, he hopes, will contain the diﬀerent possibilities of the system at that stage.

zh: 吉尼的话语中缺乏助动词、冠词、第三人称单数的一致性标记、过去时标记和大部分代词。
en: Genie’s utterances lacked articles, auxiliary verbs like will or can, the third-person singular agreement markers, the past-tense marker-ed, question words like who, what, and where, and pronouns.

zh: 她不能构造类型更为复杂的句子，比如主语和动词位置互换的疑问句（例如：Are you hungry?
en: She had no ability to form more complex types of sentences such as questions (e.g., Are you feeling hungry?

zh: “你饿了吗”）。吉尼是在关键期过后才开始学习语言的，因此不能完全习得英语的语法规则。
en: ).Genie started learning language after the critical period and was therefore never able to fully acquire the grammatical rules of English.

zh: 不合语法的句子表明，要构建一个问句，就要移动位置最高的S的Aux，也就是说把跟在整个第一个NP之后的Aux移位到主语之前，而不是移动句子中出现的第一个助动词。
en: The ungrammatical sentences show that to form a question, the rule that moves Aux singles out the auxiliary dominated by the root S, and not simply the first auxiliary in the sentence.

zh: 我们可以通过如下简化的短语结构树明白这一点。
en: We can see this in the following simplified phrase structure trees.

zh: 一共有两个助动词，一个出现在主语关系小句中，一个出现在主句中。
en: There are two auxiliaries, one in the subject relative clause and the other in the root clause.

zh: 规则能影响的是出现在位置较高的主句中的助动词。
en: The rule affects the auxiliary in the higher main clause.

zh: 但是，一般的看法是，除了诗以外，文学还包括很多其他的东西——例如，包括现实主义和自然主义的作品，它们没有语言上的自我意识，也不以任何引人注目的方式自我炫耀。
en: But literature is usually judged to contain much besides poetry — to include, for example, realist or naturalistic writing which is not linguistically self-conscious or self-exhibiting in any striking way.

zh: 人们有时称某一作品为“优美”作品，正因为它并不过分引人注目，他们欣赏它的简洁平易或笔调稳健。
en: People sometimes call writing 'fine' precisely because it doesn't draw undue attention to itself: they admire its laconic plainness or low-keyed sobriety.

zh: 况且，对于那些总是词藻华丽，但一般并不划为文学的玩笑、足球拉拉歌和口号、报纸标题和广告，我们又该怎么说呢？
en: And what about jokes, football chants and slogans, newspaper headlines, advertisements, which are often verbally flamboyant but not generally classified as literature?

zh: 我常在思考归纳法，它要找的类化不是邻居的语言行为，而是严厉的自然世界。
en: It makes one wonder the more about other inductions, where what is sought is a generalization not about our neighbor's verbal behav­ior but about the harsh impersonal world.

zh: 假如说，我们的心智性质空间跟我们邻居的差不多应是合理，毕竟同样是人，物以类聚。所以在字汇学习上，归纳法的可信度是一个可预见的事。
en: It is reasonable that our [mental] quality space should match our neighbor's, we being birds of a feather; and so the general trustworthiness of induction in the ... learning of words was a put-up job.

zh: 在文艺复兴时期，新兴的中产阶级想要自己的子女说“上层” 阶级的方言。
en: In the Renaissance a new middle class emerged who wanted their children to speak the dialect of the “upper” classes.

zh: 这一愿望使得许多规定语法得以出版。
en: This desire led to the publication of many prescriptive grammars.

zh: 1762年，罗伯特 • 洛思主教写了一部 《英语语法 简论及评注》（A Short Introduction to English Grammar with Critical N otes)。
en: In 1762 Bishop Robert Lowth wrote A Short Introduction to English Grammar with Critical Notes.

zh: 洛思为英语制定了许多新规则，很多规定受到了他个人偏好的影响。
en: Lowth prescribed a number of new rules for English, many of them influenced by his personal taste.

zh: 正如奈维尔·威克菲尔德(Neville Wakefield)评论的那样，这种内爆“导向一个仿作的、非空间的过真实。这里，‘真 实’要由它运动于其间的传媒来界定”。在波德里雅看来，正是这种创造形象的后现代交往技术(特别是电视)激发了跨越后现代表面的大量的形象自我生产。
en: This implosion, as Neville Wakefield comments, leads ‘into the simulated non-space of hyperreality. The “real” is now defined in terms of the media in which it moves.’ It is the image-creating postmodern communication technologies – especially television – which for Baudrillard stimulate this proliferation of self-generating images across the postmodern surface.

zh: 我们不妨以索绪尔所举的例子加以说明：虽然，法语口语中的mouton与英语中的sheep有时可以表示同义，如英语There's a sheep与法语Voila un mouton就是同义语，但是，这两个词在各自的语言系统中却有不同的价值。
en: To use Saussure’s example, although in speech the French mouton and the English sheep may be used with the same signiﬁcation (There’s a sheep being synonymous with Voilà un mouton), the words have diﬀerent values in their respective linguistic systems in that sheep contrasts with mutton while mouton is not deﬁned by a corresponding contrast.

zh: 在英语中sheep与mutton有别，然而法语中的mouton却并不受相应区分的界定。
我们对任何系统进行分析，都需要具体弄清纵组合关系（功能性差异）和横组合关系（组合的可能性）。
en: The analysis of any system will require one to specify paradigmatic relations (functional contrasts) and syntagmatic relations (possibilities of combination).

zh: 后结构主义传到英国并不是通过德里达-拉康-福柯这一条线，而是通过马克思主义理论家路易·阿尔都塞的作品传入的，这点与美国的情况不同。
en: In Britain, unlike the United States, post-structuralism arrived not through Derrida and then Lacan and Foucault but through the work of the Marxist theorist Louis Althusser.

zh: 在阐释英国左派的马克思主义文化中，阿尔都塞把读者引向了拉康的理论，并且激起一场逐渐的变革。正如安东尼•伊斯索普说的，“通过这场变革，后结构主义逐渐占据了 与它的发起文化——马克思主义——相同的空间”。
en: Read within the Marxist culture of the British left, Althusser led his readers to Lacanian theory and provoked a gradual transformation by which, as Antony Easthope puts it, ‘post-structuralism came to occupy much the same space as that of its host culture, Marxism’.

zh: 即使在索绪尔的语言理论中也可以找到后结构主义反叛运动的端倪。
en: It is possible to see the beginnings of a poststructuralist counter- movement even in Saussure’s linguistic theory.

zh: 我们知道，语言表达了语言的体系性特征，是言语这种个人言说或写作的基础性结构。
en: As we have seen, langue is the systematic aspect of language which works as the underpinning structure of parole, the individual instance of speech or writing.

zh: 符号也是两分的：能指和所指犹如一个硬币的两面。
en: The sign is also bipartite: signifier and signified are like two sides of a coin.

zh: 为了满足句子(S)网络中的名词短语弧(NP arc)，整个名词短语网络都被转移了。
en: To satisfy the NP arc in the S network, the entire NP network is traversed.

zh: 在该情况下，名词短语是由一个代词构成的，而这又是由所需要的概念决定的。
en: In this case, the NP is to be a Pronoun, as determined by the concept needed.

zh: 然后这个名词短语弧在句子 网络中就会向下一个节点移动，转移它的系统就在节点2中。
en: The NP arc is then traversed in the S network, and the system is at node 2.

zh: 为了使转移能够完成，必须根据要交流的概念建构一个合适的动词短语，并使得那个概念符合该动词短语的结构，这也可用另一个转移网络来表示。
en: To finish, an appropriate verb phrase must be constructed according to the concept to be communicated.That concept is made to comply with the structure of the VP, which is also expressed as a transition network.

zh: 最终，这种图画文字也开始同时代表概念和表示这一概念的词。
en: Eventually, these pictograms came to represent both the concept and the word for the concept.

zh: 一旦发展到这一步，象形文字就演变为真正的表语文字系统。
en: Once this happened, hieroglyphics became a bona fide logographic writing system.

zh: 通过画谜原理，埃及象形文字也演变成一种音节文字。
en: Through the rebus principle, hieroglyphics also became a syllabic writing system.

zh: 假如“花园步道”的句子耐以用普通常识来避免的话，这个句子应该容易一点。
en: If garden paths can be avoided by common-sense knowledge, this sentence should be much easier.

zh: 证据，不像被告，它只能被检查不能去检查别人，所以不正确的分枝应该是可以避免的。
en: Evidence, unlike defendants, can't examine anything, so the incorrect tree, in which the evidence would be examining something, is potentially avoidable.

zh: 实验证据显示受试者的确可以避免错误，受试者的眼睛跳过这个字，很少停留也很少再回去扫描。
en: People do avoid it: the subjects' eyes hopped through the sentence with little pausing or backtracking.

zh: 但赫希并不认为，既然一部作品的意义与作者写作时意谓的东西相一致，因此本文就只能有一种解释。
en: It does not follow for Hirsch that because the meaning of a work is identical with what the author meant by it at the time of writing, only one interpretation of the text is possible.

zh: 也许有多种不同的有效解释，但它们全都在作者意义所能允许的“典型的期待与可能性的系统”之内活动。
en: There may be a number of different valid interpretations, but all of them must move within the 'system of typical expectations and probabilities' which the author's meaning permits.

zh: 赫希也不否认，一部文学作品对于不同时代的不同人们可能“意味”着不同的东西。
en: Nor does Hirsch deny that a literary work may 'mean' different things to different people at different times.

zh: 但他主张，较为合适的说法是，这是对于作品的“会解”问题而非作品的“本义”问题。
en: But this, he claims, is more properly a matter of the work's 'significance' rather than its 'meaning'.

zh: 但是，批评若依循诗是获取效果的工具这一定义的逻辑，那就要将其讨论的立足点从外界自然逐步转向人性——即诗人的欣赏者一并认为，真实或称盖然性就是与读者的期待的反应保持一致。
en: But progressively criticism, following the logic of the definition of poetry as an instrument for achieving effects, transferred the locus of discussion from external nature to human nature—that of the poet's audience—and interpreted truth or probability as conformity to the expectations or responsiveness of the reader.

zh: 这一转变可以从法文术语中看出来。
en: The French terms indicate this shift.

zh: 诗的基本要求不是levrai，而是le Nraisemblable，即不是真实而是逼真；而“逼真性”，按拉潘的说法，“就是一切与公众意见一致的东西”。
en: The basic requirement is not le vrai, but Uvratsemblable, not verity but verisimilarity; and le vraisemblable,' according to Rapin, 'est tout ce qui est conforms a l'opinion du public.'

zh: 因此在十八世纪的理论进程中，对诗的神奇性的探讨包含了对诗的假象，或者用凯姆斯的话说，“睁眼梦”的心理的十分详尽的分析。
en: In the course of eighteenth-century theory, therefore, the discussion of the poetic marvelous involved an ever more elaborate analysis of the psychology of poetic illusion, or the 'waking dream,' as Kames called it.

zh: 这还不仅是说，似乎我们拥有所谓事实知识这样一种东西，而它们可能会被特定的利害关系和价值判断所歪曲，虽然这种情况当然也是可能的；这种说法也意味着，没有特定的利害关系，我们根本就不会有知识，因为这样一来我们就看不出费心竭力去了解一件事物这种做法的意义何在。
en: It is not just as though we have something called factual knowledge which may then be distorted by particular interests and judgements, although this is certainly possible; it is also that without particular interests we would have no knowledge at all, because we would not see the point of bothering to get to know anything.

zh: 利害关系并非只是危害我们知识的偏见，它构成我们知识的一部分。
en: Interests are constitutive of our knowledge, not merely prejudices which imperil it.

zh: 认为知识应该“免于价值判断”(value-free)这种主张本身就是一个价值判断。
en: The claim that knowledge should be 'value-free' is itself a value-judgement.

zh: 他广为人知的戏剧手法，即“间离效果”，使人想到俄国形式主义的“陌生化”概念（参见第2章第32-34页中有关部分）。
en: His best-known theatrical device, the alienation effect, recalls the Russian Formalists’ concept of ‘defamiliarization’(see Chapter 2, pp. 32-34).

zh: 社会主义现实主义喜欢现实的幻象、形式的统一和“正面的”英雄人物。
en: Socialist Realism favoured realistic illusion, formal unity and ‘positive’ heroes.

zh: 他把自己的现实主义理论称作“反亚里士多德式的”，意在隐晦地抨击其论敌的理论。
en: He called his theory of realism ‘anti-Aristotelian’, a covert way of attacking the theory of his opponents.

zh: 每个正确的观点或许都有不伦不类的相似观点，有时是由于对实际情况认识不清而产生的，有时则是由错误的论调所导致的。
en: Every true view, perhaps, has its crude analogues, due sometimes to a confused perception of the real state of affairs, sometimes to faulty statement.

zh: 往往这些走样的或曲直不分的旁门左道造成了麻烦，正确的观点便不易为人接受。
en: Often these clumsy or mistaken off-shoots are responsible for the difficulty with which the true view gains acceptance.

zh: 好比阴影、反光或回声一样，它们使人莫辨真伪，迷惑不解。
en: Like shadows, reflections, or echoes, they obscure and baffle apprehension.

zh: 用接受理论的术语来说，读者使本身不过是纸页上一串有序的黑色符号链构成的文学作品“具体化”。
en: In the terminology of reception theory, the reader 'concretizes' the literary work, which is in itself no more than a chain of organized black marks on a page.

zh: 没有读者连续不断的积极参与，就没有任何文学作品。
en: Without this continuous active participation on the reader's part, there would be no literary work at all.

zh: 无论接受理论的实践工作看来如何坚实，其实都是由一些“空白”构成的，就像现代物理学中的桌子一样。
en: However solid it may seem, any work for reception theory is actually made up of 'gaps', just as tables are for modern physics.

zh: 尧斯（Hans Robert Jauss）是德国“接受”理论（Rezeptionästhetik）的重要成员，他赋予读者导向批评一种历史的维度。
en: Jauss, an important German exponent of ‘reception’ theory (Rezeption- ästhetik), gave a historical dimension to reader-oriented criticism.

zh: 他试图在无视历史的俄国形式主义与无视文本的社会理论之间达成一种妥协。
en: He tried to achieve a compromise between Russian Formalism which ignores history, and social theories which ignore the text.

zh: 尧斯写作的年代是社会动荡不安的20世纪60年代末期，他和其他一些人要求对德国文学中古老的经典提出质疑，并且说明这种要求完全是合理的。
en: Writing during a period of social unrest at the end of the 1960s, Jauss and others wanted to question the old canon of German literature and to show that it was perfectly reasonable to do so.

zh: 在讨论树形图时，可以说每一个更高的节点统制着下面所有的范畴。
en: In discussing trees, every higher node is said to dominate all the categories beneath it.

zh: VP统制V和NP，还统制Det和N。可以说一个节点直接统制下一级的范畴。VP直接统制V和NP，也就是组成VP的范畴。
en: VP immediately dominates V and NP, the categories of which it is composed.

zh: 直接被同一节点所统制的范畴是姐妹。
en: Categories that are immediately dominated by the same node are sisters.

zh: V和NP就是the child found apuppy的短语结构树中的姐妹。
en: V and NP are sisters in the phrase structure tree of “the child found a puppy.”

zh: 最后，应该谈一谈诺姆•乔姆斯基。
en: Finally, one should say a word about Noam Chomsky.

zh: 尽管某些结构主义者在他们的后期著作中采用了他的某些术语，生成语法学在结构主义的发展过程中却没有发挥什么作用。
en: Although a few structuralists have in their later work adopted some of his terms, generative grammar plays no role in the development of structuralism.

zh: 它所提供的是一种颇具示范性的方法论的陈述，在我们的讨论中，它的重要性正在这里。
en: What it does oﬀer, and what gives it its importance in this discussion, is a methodological statement of exemplary clarity.

zh: 从好的方面看，语言学家提出的语法是-种解释理论。这种语法为如下事实提供一种解释（根据上面提到的理想化的思路）：一个说某种语言的人，将以某种特定的方式，而不是任何另外的方式来感知、释译、形成或者运用一段话语。
en: In a good sense, the grammar proposed by the linguist is an explanatory theory; it suggests an explanation for the fact that (under the idealization mentioned) a speaker of the language in question will perceive, interpret, form, or use an utterance in certain ways and not in other ways.

zh: 人们还可以寻求另外一种更加深层的解释理论。
en: One can also search for explanatory theories of a deeper sort.

zh: 然而，在所有wh短语可移动的语言中（例如：移动疑问短语)，被移动的句子成分会放置到标补语位置。
en: However, in all languages with wh movement (i.e., movement of the question phrase), the question element moves to C (complementizer).

zh: 被移动短语的“落点” 是 由 UG 决定的。
en: The “landing site” of the moved phrase is determined by UG.

zh: 在所有wh短语可移动的语言中，会出现一些变化。
en: Among the wh movement languages, there is some variation.

zh: 在罗曼语中，如意大利语，wh短语的移动和英语一样，但是如果wh短语询问的是介词宾语，那么介词就必须和wh短语一起移动。
en: In the Romance languages, such as Italian, the wh phrase moves as in English, but when the wh phrase questions the object of a preposition, the preposition must move together with the wh phrase.

zh: 相比之下，在英语中，介词可以被“悬置”（即，可以留在原来的位置上）。
en: In English, by contrast, the preposition can be “stranded” (i.e., left behind in its original position).

zh: 有一些句子的谓语里有介词短语，比如：The puppy played in the garden.
en: Some sentences have a prepositional phrase in the predicate.

zh: (小狗在花园里玩耍。）我们可以利用我们的测试来表明in the garden (在花园里）也是一个成分，方法如下：Where did the puppy play?
en: Consider The puppy played in the garden.We can use our tests to show that in the garden is also a constituent, as follows: Where did the puppy play?

zh: In the garden.(独立性测试） The puppy played there.( 小狗在那里玩。
en: In the garden (stand alone) The puppy played there.

zh: 用类似于代词的词替代） In the garden is where the puppy played.(花园里是小狗玩的地方。
en: (replacement by a pronoun-like word)In the garden is where the puppy played.

zh: 作为一个单位移动） It was in the garden that the puppy played.(小狗在那里玩的[地方]是花园。）
en: (move as a unit)It was in the garden that the puppy played.

zh: 人类语言是从更原始的系统中进化而来的这一假设，被波普在他最近发表的题为“云和钟”的Arther Compton讲演中，以有趣的方式进行了发挥。
en: The assumption that human language evolved from more primitive systems is developed in an interesting way by Karl Popper in his recently published Arthur Compton Lecture, “Clouds and Clocks.”

zh: 他试图表明，意志自由和笛卡尔的二元论问题是怎样通过对“进化”的分析而得到解决。
en: He tries to show how problems of freedom of will and Cartesian dualism can be solved by the analysis of this “evolution.”

zh: 我现在并不关心他从这个分析中得出来的哲学结论，而只关心这个基本假设，即存在一种语言进化发展过程，它源于在其他有机体那里发现的较简单的系统。
en: I am not concerned now with the philosophical conclusions that he draws from this analysis, but with the basic assumption that there is an evolutionary development of language from simpler systems of the sort that one discovers in other organisms.

zh: 她对莎士比亚十四行诗、威契菜的剧作《乡下妻子》、丁尼生、乔治·爱略特和狄更斯等人作品的研究阐明了这类作品历史化与祛历史化的矛盾倾向。
en: Her study of Shakespeare’s Sonnets, Wycherley’s play, The Country Wife, Tennyson, George Eliot and Dickens illustrates the paradoxically historicizing and dehistoricizing tendencies of this kind of work.

zh: 此书关于哥特式小说是“恐怖主义和同性恋恐慌”的说法也颇有名。
en: The book is also notable for its discussion of the Gothic as ‘Terrorism and Homosexual Panic’.

zh: 她特别（以弗洛伊德理论为依据）探索了“妄想狂是一种精神病，描画了同性恋恐惧症的机制”。
en: In particular (building on Freud), she explores the theory that ‘paranoia is the psychosis that makes graphic the mechanisms of homophobia’.

zh: 在这些神经官能症背后，精神分析发现植根于个人早期发展中的没有解决的冲突，它们很可能集中在俄狄浦斯阶段。事实上，弗洛伊德把俄狄浦斯情结称为“神经官能症的核心”。
en: Behind these neuroses, psychoanalysis discerns unresolved conflicts whose roots run back to the individual's early development, and which are likely to be focused in the Oedipal moment; indeed Freud calls the Oedipus complex the 'nucleus of the neuroses'.

zh: 一个病人表现出来的神经官能症状一般总是与他或她的心理发展受到阻碍或“固结”的前俄狄浦斯情结期的某一点有联系的。
en: There will usually be a relation between the kind of neurosis a patient displays, and the point in the pre-Oedipal stage at which his or her psychical development became arrested or 'fixated'.

zh: 精神分析的目的就是揭示神经官能症的潜因，从而把病人从他的内心冲突中解脱出来，使折磨病人的症状得到缓解。
en: The aim of psychoanalysis is to uncover the hidden causes of the neurosis in order to relieve the patient of his or her conflicts, so dissolving the distressing symptoms.

zh: 句法规则将词组合成短语，将短语组合成句子。
en: The rules of syntax combine words into phrases and phrases into sentences.

zh: 除此以外，句法规则还规定某一语言的正确词序。
en: Among other things, the rules specify the correct word order for a language.

zh: 例如，英语的结构是主语-动词-宾语（SVO)。
en: For example, English is a Subject–Verb–Object (SVO) language.

zh: 英语 例句1合乎语法，因为词都按照正确的顺序排列；例句2不合语法，因为其词序对英语而言不正确。
en: The English sentence in (1) is grammatical because the words occur in the right order; the sentence in (2) is ungrammatical because the word order is incorrect for English.

zh: （前文说过，句子之前的星号是一项语言学规约，用以表明根据语法规则这个句子不合语法或不合式。）
en: (Recall that the asterisk or star preceding a sentence is the linguistic convention for indicating that the sentence is ungrammatical or ill-formed according to the rules of the grammar.)

zh: 主要根据单一角色的感觉进行视点调节的故事，既可以是第一人称叙述，叙述人讲述他或她想些什么，看到些什么；也可以是第三人称叙述，也就是人们经常说的“第三人称的局限观点”，像小说《梅茜所知道的》里的情景一样。
en: Stories focalized primarily through the consciousness of a single character occur both in first person narration, where the narrator tells what he or she thought and observed, and in third person narration, where it is often called ‘third person limited point of view’, as in What Maisie Knew.

zh: 观点的局限性会产生靠不住的叙述，也就是我们有一种感觉，即通过聚焦的认识不能或不愿像老练的故事读者们那样去理解事件。
en: Unreliable narration can result from limitations of point of view-when we gain a sense that the consciousness through which focalization occurs is unable or unwilling to understand the events as competent story-readers would.

zh: 以上这些以及其他的叙述和聚焦的不同变化形式对于决定小说的整体效果起了很大的作用。
en: These and other variations in narration and focalization do much to determine the overall effect of novels.

zh: *unsystem是一个不可能的词，因为英语中没有一条允许前缀un-附加到名词上的规则。
en: *Unsystem is not a possible word because there is no rule of English that allows un- to be added to nouns.

zh: 某家大型软饮料公司通过广告宣传活动推销名为Uncola (“非可乐”）的产品，通过藐视这条语言学规则成功地吸引了人们的注意力。
en: The large soft-drink company whose ad campaign promoted the Uncola successfully flouted this linguistic rule to capture people’s attention.

zh: 在我们的语言能力中，就包括识别可能和不可能的词的能力。
en: Part of our linguistic competence includes the ability to recognize possible versus impossible words, like *unsystem and *Uncola.

zh: 可能的词是遵循规则的词，不可能的词则不遵循规则。
en: Possible words are those that conform to the rules; impossible words are those that do not.

zh: 一般而言，按发音方式分类，习得语音类别的顺序是：先习得鼻音，然后是滑音、塞音、流音、擦音和塞擦音。
en: In general, the order of acquisition of classes of sounds begins with vowels and then goes by manner of articulation for consonants: nasals are acquired first, then glides, stops, liquids, fricatives, and affricates.

zh: 按发音部位特征区分的自然类，在儿童语句中也是按次序出现：唇音、软腭音、龈音和腭音。
en: Natural classes characterized by place of articulation features also appear in children’s utterances according to a more or less ordered series: labials, velars, alveolars, and palatals.

zh: 所以，mama是许多儿童早期习得的一个词，这并不奇怪。
en: It is not surprising that mama is an early word for many children.

zh: 非鼻塞音，擦音，还有塞擦音组成一个大类，叫作阻音。
en: The non-nasal stops, the fricatives, and the affricates form a major class of sounds called obstruents.

zh: 发非鼻塞音和塞擦音时气流完全阻断，发擦音是部分阻碍。
en: The airstream may be fully obstructed, as in non-nasal stops and affricates, or nearly fully obstructed, as in the production of fricatives.

zh: 擦音是通音性阻音。
发擦音时气流不间断地流出口腔，虽然口腔内的阻碍足以造成构成此类音特点的摩擦。
法语不是重音语言，每个音节的响度、音高和长短都大致相同。
en: French is not a stress-timed language.The syllables have approximately the same loudness, length, and pitch.

zh: 它是一种音节语言。
en: It is a "syllable-timed" language.

zh: 英国人说法语常常会重读一些音节，结果法国人就听到了一种“带英语重读口音”的法语。
en: When native English speakers attempt to speak French, they often stress syllables, so that native French speakers hear French with "an English accent."

zh: 迈克尔·布利斯托尔的《狂欢节与戏剧：文艺复兴时期的英格兰平民文化和作者结构》（1985）采纳巴赫金的“狂欢节”概念，试图提出一种更为开放的文化产出模式。
en: Michael Bristol’s Carnival and Theater: Plebeian Culture and the Structure of Authority in Renaissance England (1985) used Bakhtin’s concept of ‘Carnival’ in order to introduce a more open model of cultural production.

zh: 他提出，布林格拉特和多利莫尔没有能够看出伊丽莎白时代平民文化的活力与力量。
en: He argued that Greenblatt and Dollimore fail to recognize the vitality and power of popular culture in the Elizabethan period.

zh: 巴赫金把“狂欢节”看作与官方文化相对应的“第二种文化”，这种文化在整个中世纪与现代早期由平民大众所推行。
en: Bakhtin regards ‘Carnival’ as a ‘second culture’, which was opposed to the official culture, and which was carried on by the common people throughout the middle ages and well into the early modern period.

zh: 弥尔顿之后，英国文学的敏感性继续分裂为独立的两半：有些诗人能想而不能感，有些诗人能感而不能想。
en: After Milton, the English sensibility continued to dissociate itself into separate halves: some poets could think but not feel, while others could feel but not think.

zh: 英国文学堕落成为浪漫主义和维多利亚风格：“诗的天才”、“个性”和“内心之光”这些异端邪说此时已经根深蒂固，而所有这些都是一个业已丧失集体信仰和堕入漫无目标的个人主义的社会的无政府学说。
en: English literature degenerated into Romanticism and Victorianism: by now the heresies of 'poetic genius', 'personality' and the 'inner light' were firmly entrenched, all anarchic doctrines of a society which had lost collective belief and declined into an errant individualism.

zh: 直到T·S·艾略特出现，英国文学才开始恢复。
en: It was not until the appearance of T. S. Eliot that English literature began to recuperate.

zh: “乐趣”和“满足"在此处都是不恰当的宇眼。
en: Both ‘enjoyment’ and ‘satisfaction’ are unsuitable terms in this connection.

zh: 应该认识到有个遗憾的语言隔阂。
en: An unfortunate linguistic gap must be recognized.

zh: —个活动的充分发挥一般就是它自身的满足。而且，我们从下文可以看到，可能伴随它的快乐是派生性和偶然性的。
en: The full exercise of an activity is commonly its own ‘satisfaction’, and, as we shall see later, what pleasure may accompany it is derivative and incidental.

zh: 总之，类推、模仿、强化都不能解释儿童语言发展，因为它们所依据的(隐性或者显性的)假设是，儿童习得的是一个句子或形式的集合，而不是语法规则的集合。
en: Analogy, imitation, and reinforcement cannot account for language development because they are based on the (implicit or explicit) assumption that what the child acquires is a set of sentences or forms rather than a set of grammatical rules.

zh: 那些假设“语言习得要依赖特意组织的言语输入”的理论过分强调环境的作用，而忽视儿童建立语法的能力。
en: Theories that assume that acquisition depends on a specially structured input also place too much emphasis on the environment rather than on the grammar-making abilities of the child.

zh: 这
类推变化指的是规则的泛化，通过它可以使得需要个别学习和记忆、例外或不规则的语素数目减少。
en: Analogic change is a generalization of rules that reduces the number of excep- tional or irregular morphemes.

zh: 正是通过对plow(犁，单数)/plows(犁，复数)以及vow(誓言，单数)/vows(誓言，复数)的类推，人们才先开始用cows(母牛，复数)作为cow(母牛，单数)的复数，代替原来的kine。
en: It was by analogy to plow/plows and vow/vows that speakers started saying cows as the plural of cow instead of the earlier plural kine.

zh: 事实上，复数规则变得更加泛化了。
en: In effect, the plural rule became more general.

zh: 这就是人们为什么评说“理论'而不是讲那些具体的论 述。
en: This is why people talk about ‘theory’ and not just about particular theories.

zh: 介绍理论比较好的办法是讨论共同存在的问题和共有的主张；讨论那些重大的辩论，但不要把一个“学派”置于另一个“学派”的对立面；讨论各种流派内的明显不同。
en: To introduce theory, it is better to discuss shared questions and claims than to survey theoretical schools.It is preferable to discuss important debates that do not oppose one ‘school’ to another but may mark salient divisions within movements.

zh: 这要比概栝论述不同理论学派的方法好。
研究语言怎样变化、有哪些种变化、为什么变化的语言学分支被称为历史比较语言学。
en: The branch of linguistics that deals with how languages change, what kinds of changes occur, and why they occurred is called historical and comparative linguistics.

zh: 它是“历史的”，因为它研究特定语言的历史。它是“比较的，因为它研究语言之间的关系。
en: It is “historical” because it deals with the history of particular languages; it is “comparative” because it deals with relations among languages.

zh: Jennifer是单数，你说Jennifer is 而不说Jennifer are。
en: "Jennifer" is singular; you say "Jennifer is", not "Jennifer are".

zh: 代词She也是单数，你说She is而不说She are。
en: The pronoun "She" is singular; you say "She is", not "She are".

zh: 但是把She and Jennifer连接在一起时就不是单数而是复数，你说She and Jennifer are而不说She and Jennifer is，所以一个连词可以依它所包含的代词而有不同的数，那么为什么它里面的代词一定要有相同的主法格呢?（Give A1 Got l and l a chance?）
en: But the conjunction "She and Jennifer" is not singular, it's plural; you say "She and Jennifer are", not "She and Jennifer is".So if a conjunction can have a different grammatical number from the pronouns inside it ("She and Jennifer are"), why must it have the same grammatical case as the pronouns inside it ("Give Al Gore and I a chance")?

zh: 作为语言习得的一种模型，连接主义面临一些严重的挑战。
en: As a model of language acquisition, connectionism faces some serious chal- lenges.

zh: 这个模型假设儿童所处环境中的语言有很具体的特性。
en: The model assumes that the language of the child’s environment has very specific properties.

zh: 然而儿童实际接收的言语输入的调查表明，这一假设不符合事实。
en: However, investigation of the input that children actually receive shows that it is not consistent with those assumptions.

zh: 列维-斯特劳斯在他的论原始人思维的两本重要著作，《图腾制度>)(1962年）和《野蛮人的思维:K1962年）中对“零敲碎打”这一术语作了如下定义。
en: The term bricolage is defined in his two major works on the primitive mind; Totemism (1962) and The Savage Mind (1962).

zh: 它指的是所谓“原始人”没有文化、没有技术的思想赖以对周围世界作出反应的手段。
en: It refers to the means by which the non-literate, non-technical mind of so-called ‘primitive’ man  responds  to  the  world  around  him.

zh: 这个过程包含一种“具体科学”（和我们“文明的”“抽象的”科学相对立>。这种科学远非缺乏逻辑，事实上，它以和我们不同的逻辑，仔细而精确地把这个丰富多釆的物质界的一分一毫都组合成结构，加以分类和排列。
en: The  process  involves  a  ‘science  of  the  concrete’  (as  opposed  to  our  ‘civilized’  science  of  the ‘abstract’) which, far from lacking logic, in fact carefully and precisely orders, classifies and arranges into structures the minutiae of the physical world in all their profusion by means of a ‘logic’ which is not our own.

zh: 但这还不是全部。
en: But that's not all.

zh: 我们有领属关系类名词短语，例如（ Melissa’s garden）梅丽莎的花园、the girl’s shoes（这个女孩的鞋）和the man's hat（这个男人的帽子）。
en: We have possessive noun phrases such as Melissa’s garden, the girl’s shoes, and the man's hat.In these structures the possessor NP (e.g., Melissa’s, the girl’s, etc.

zh: 在这些结构中, 领有者名词短语 (如梅丽莎、女孩等) 的起限定作用, 它进一步明确了它的姊妹名词。
en: ) functions as a determiner in that it further specifies its sister noun.

zh: 流音和鼻音也有成音节性，如dazzle[daezl](耀眼）, faker[fekr](伪装者），rhythm[rɪðm](节奏)，button[bʌtn](按钮）([l]，[r]，[m]，[n]下的小竖杠是表不成音节的附加符号）。
en: Liquids and nasals can also be syllabic, as shown by the words dazzle [dӕzl]̩ , faker [fekr]̩ , rhythm [rɪðm̩], and button [bʌtn]̩ .(The diacritic mark under the [l]̩ , [r]̩ , [m̩], and [n]̩ is the notation for syllabic.)

zh: 在这几个成音节的流音和鼻音前插入一个混元音[ə]也显示出这是分离的音节， 即这四个词可以分别标为[dӕzəl]，[fekər],[rɪðəm],[bʌtən]。
en: Placing a schwa [ə] before the syllabic liquid or nasal also shows that these are separate syllables.The four words could be written as [dӕzəl], [fekər], [rɪðəm], and [bʌtən].

zh: 本书就使用这种标写法。
en: We will use this transcription.

zh: 同样，bird，verb等词中的元音有时标写为成音节的[r]，即[brd] 和[vrb]。
en: Similarly, the vowel sound in words like bird and verb are sometimes written as a syllabic r, [brd̩ ] and [vrb̩ ].

zh: 为一致起见，我们用混元音来标写[bərd]和[vərb]。这是用混元音来表示重读元音的仅有的词例。
en: For consistency we shall transcribe these words using the schwa—[bərd] and [vərb]—the only instances where a schwa represents a stressed vowel.

zh: 俄底浦斯的叙事结构取了第一种形式：他破坏了杀父和乱伦的禁忌，因而自我惩罚。
en: The  Oedipus  narrative  has  the  first  structure:  he  violates  the  prohibition against patricide and incest, and punishes himself.

zh: 托多洛夫总括了普洛普、格雷马斯和其他学者的论述。
en: The  work  of  Tzvetan  Todorov  is  a  summation  of  Propp,  Greimas  and others.

zh: 语言的所有句法规则都在他们的叙事幌子下获得了重新陈述主语宾语的行动者法则、谓语表语的表述法则、形容词和副词的功能法则、语气和语体等等。
en: The syntactic rules of language are restated in their narrative guise– rules  of  agency,  predication,  adjectival  and  verbal  functions,  mood  and aspect, and so on.

zh: 沃尔夫的文章一发表后，心理语言学家列能伯格和布朗就指出他的论点中的两个不合理地方。
en: As soon as Whorf's articles appeared, the psycholinguists Eric Lenneberg and Roger Brown pointed out two non sequiturs in his argument.

zh: 第一就是沃尔夫并没有真正去研究阿帕契人，没存任何证据说他真的碰过阿帕契人;他只研究过阿帕契语的文法，所以这使得他的论点变得拐弯抹角—阿帕契人说话说得不一样，所以他们思考不一样。
en: First, Whorf did not actually study any Apaches; it is not clear that he ever met one.His assertions about Apache psychology are based entirely on Apache grammar ——making his argument circular.Apaches speak differently, so they must think differently.

zh: 我们怎么知道他们思考是不一样的？
en: How do we know that they think differently?

zh: 只要去听他们讲话的方式就晓得了！
en: Just listen to the way they speak!

zh: 动词不仅能决定一个句子中论元的数量, 还可以限制其主语和补足语的语义特征。
en: The verb not only determines the number of arguments in a sentence, but it also limits the semantic properties of both its subject and its complements.

zh: 例如，find和sleep要求（s-选择）有生主语。
en: For example, find and sleep require (s-select) animate subjects.

zh: 那个著名的例句colorless green ideas sleep foriously之所以在语义上是 异常的，是因为“思想”（不论是否有颜色）不是有生的。
en: The well-known colorless green ideas sleep furiously is semantically anomalous because ideas (colorless or not) are not animate.

zh: 语言本能的第二个原则是以有限的中介去做无限的应用, 这是洪堡特所说的话。
en: The second trick behind the language instinct is captured in a phrase from Wilhelm Von Humboldt that presaged Chomsky: language "makes infinite use of finite media."

zh: 我们知道这个不足为奇的狗咬人和新闻的人咬狗之间的差异，仅在字序。
en: We know the difference between the forgettable Dog bites man and the newsworthy Man bites dog because of the order in which do man, and bites are combined.

zh: 也就是说，我们用一种码去翻译字序和思维之间的关系。
en: That is, we use a code to translate between orders of words and combinations of thoughts.

zh: 同样，也有些句子总是假的。
en: Similarly, some sentences are always false.

zh: 这类句子称为矛盾。
en: These are called contradictions.

zh: 矛盾句的例子如“圆圈是方的”或“单身汉是已婚的”。
