en: Examples of contradictions are sentences like Circles are square or A bachelor is married.

zh: 如果其中一个句子衍推另一个句子的否定，它们就是矛盾的。
en: Two sentences are contradictory if one entails the negation of the other.

zh: 比如说，“杰克活着”衍推“杰克死了”的否定，也就是说“杰克没有死”。
en: For instance, Jack is alive entails the negation of Jack is dead, namely Jack is not dead.

zh: 同样地，“杰克死了”衍推“杰克活着”的否定，也就是说“杰克没有活着”。
en: Similarly, Jack is dead entails the negation of Jack is alive, namely Jack is not alive.

zh: 心理语言学家辛格顿和纽波特曾经研究过一个九岁的重度听障的男孩西蒙。
en: The psycholinguists Jenny Singleton and Elissa Newport have studied a nine-year-old profoundly deaf boy, to whom they gave the pseudonym Simon, and his parents, who are also deaf.

zh: 西蒙和他的双亲都是聋人，但是他的父母却是到十五六岁青春期的晚期才学手语，因此，他们的手语学得不好。
en: Simon's parents did not acquire sign language until the late ages of   een and sixteen, and as a result they acquired it badly.

zh: 在美国手势语言中，你可以把一个短语移到句子的前面或后面，只要加上一个前置或语尾的标记即可，就跟很多其他的语言—样。在美国手势语言中，把眉毛扬起或把下巴抬起都表示这是句子的主题。
en: In ASL, as in many languages, one can move a phrase to the front of a sentence and mark it with a pre x or su x (in ASL, raised eyebrows and a li ed chin) to indicate that it is the topic of the sentence.

zh: 若干项研究调查了在不同年龄接触美国手语（ASL）的失聪手语使用者习得这种语言的情况。
en: Several studies have investigated the acquisition of American Sign Language (ASL) among deaf signers exposed to the language at different ages.

zh: 尽管所有研究对象使用手语都已超过20年，但从出生到6岁期间接受ASL输入的早学者，在打出和理解复杂手势和手语句方面，比在12岁以后才接触ASL的晚学者要出色得多。
en: Early learners who received ASL input from birth and up to six years of age did much better in the production and comprehension of complex signs and sign sentences than late learners who were not exposed to ASL until after the age of twelve, even though all of the subjects in these studies had used sign for more than twenty years.

zh: 然而，在词汇量或词序知识方面他们的差异却很小。
en: There was little difference, however, in vocabulary or knowledge of word order.

zh: 让我们可能感到遗憾的是，在过去三十年旨在阐明种种理论运动的过程中，这种“实用批评”己经丧尽尊严， 尽管如此，它的功德却是无法抹杀的。它鼓励学界重视文本细读，通过理智和历史的抽象，确立了一种在教室中进行文学研究的民主化精神，在这种民主化氛围中，几乎每一个人都可以在平等的基础上面对一个“盲”文本（这一点在稍后讨论“美国新批评”时还要论及）。
en: Its virtues were, however-and we may yet come to regret its obloquy in the demystifying theoretical initiatives of the past thirty years–that it encouraged attentive close reading of texts and, in its intellectual and historical abstraction, a kind of democratization of literary study in the classroom, in which nearly everyone was placed on an equal footing in the face of a ‘blind’ text–a point we will re-emphasize in the context of American New Criticism.

zh: 1929 年，理查兹离开剑桥，随后定居哈佛，他的影响，特别是通过《实用批评》产生的影响，实实在在地支撑了美国当时正在向同样方向发展的国内学术潮流。
en: Indeed Richards left Cambridge in 1929, later settling at Harvard University, and his influence, particularly through Practical Criticism, substantially underpinned native developments in the States which were moving in similar directions.

zh: 对于康德和其他理论家来说，美学对象具有“无目的的目的性”。
en: Aesthetic objects, for Kant and other theorists, have a ‘purposiveness without purpose’.

zh: 它们的建构具有一种目的性，也就是使其各个部分协调一致以实现某个目的。
en: There is a purposiveness to their construction: they are made so that their parts will work together towards some end.

zh: 但这个目的即为艺术作品本身，是蕴含在作品当中的愉悦，或者是由作品引起的愉悦，而不是某种外在目的。
en: But the end is the work of art itself, pleasure in the work or pleasure occasioned by the work, not some external purpose.

zh: 英语中paparazzo（狗仔）一词指“像狗一样追踪名人的自由职业摄影师”。这个名祖来自电影《甜蜜的生活》中一个新闻摄影师角色——帕帕拉佐（Paparazzo)先生。1997年威尔士王妃戴安娜因为被paparazzi(狗仔队，复数）紧追不舍，结果在一场致命的汽车事故中丧生，在此之前这个词还很少有人知道。
en: The word paparazzo, “a freelance photographer who doggedly pursues celebrities,” was a little-known word until the death of Princess Diana in 1997, who was hounded by paparazzi (plural) before her fatal automobile accident.This eponym comes from the news photographer character Signor Paparazzo in the motion picture La Dolce Vita.

zh: 例如，大脑的布罗卡区受损的病人，可能患上布罗卡失语症，它常造 成患者的句法障碍和语法缺失。
en: For example, lesions in the part of the brain called Broca’s area may suffer from Broca’s aphasia, which results in impaired syntax and agrammatism.

zh: 韦尼克区受损的病人，则可能患上韦尼克失语症，患者说流利但语义异常的话语。更严重的是杂乱性失语症，患者说无意义的语言形式，因此无从理解。
en: Damage to Wernicke’s area may result in Wernicke’s aphasia, in which fluent speakers produce semantically anomalous utterances, or even worse, jargon aphasia, in which speakers produce nonsense forms that make their utterance uninterpretable.

zh: 对其他部位的损伤可能引起命名不能症，是一种患者有找词困难的失语症。
en: Damage to yet different areas can produce anomia, a form of aphasia in which the patient has word-finding difficulties.

zh: 这表明受试者在“命名任务”中能够同时做两件事情。
en: This suggests that people can do two different things in the naming task.

zh: 他们在自己的心理词库中查找这个符号串，如果能够找到（即该符号串是真词），那么他们就能根据储存在词库中的音系表达式发音。
en: They can look for the string in their mental lexicon, and if they find it (i.e., if it is a real word), they can pronounce the stored phonological representation for it.

zh: 另外，他们凭借对某些字母或字母序列（比如gh, oe等）最常见的发音方式的知识，也能够“把它念出来”。
en: They can also “sound it out,” using their knowledge of how certain letters or letter sequences (e.g., “gh,” “oe”) are most commonly pronounced.

zh: 要找到并不存在的词的发音，后者显然是唯一的方法。
en: The latter is obviously the only way to come up with a pronunciation for a nonexisting word.

zh: 热奈特的论文《叙述的世界》（1966）对叙述作了全面的论述，迄今为止，还没有看到比这篇更好的论文。
en: Genette’s essay on ‘Frontiers of Narrative’ (1966) provided an overview of the problems of narration which has not been bettered.

zh: 他通过三个二元对立的命题来思考叙述的理论问题。
en: He considers the problem of narrative theory by exploring three binary oppositions.

zh: 这一个是亚里士多德《诗学》中提出的“叙述与模仿”（diegesis and mimesis；也即英语中的narration and representation）的二元对立，它预设了简单叙述（作者以自己的声音讲述）与直接模仿（作者以一个人物的声音讲述）之间的区别。
en: The first, ‘diegesis and mimesis’ (narrative and representation), occurs in Aristotle’s Poetics and presupposes a distinction between simple narrative (what the author says in his or her own voice as author) and direct imitation (when the author speaks in the person of a character).

zh: 模仿的倾向——将艺术解释为基本上是对世间的模仿——很可能是最原始的美学理论，但“米迈悉斯”（mimesis）被第一次记录在柏拉图对话里时，其含义已经相当繁杂了。苏格拉底说，会话、诗歌、音乐、舞蹈、雕塑，都是模仿。
en: The mimetic orientation—the explanation of art as essentially an imitation of aspects of the universe—was probably the most primitive aesthetic theory，but mimesis is no simple concept by the time it makes its first recorded appearance in the dialogues of Plato, The arts of painting, poetry, music， dancing, and sculpture, Socrates says, are all imitations.

zh: "模仿"是一个关键语词，表示两项事物和他们之间的某种对应。
en: Imitation is a relational term, signifying two items and some correspondence between them.

zh: 黎奥塔则认为，“真理诉求”和这样一种假设的全球化历史的共识是压抑的、站不住脚的。
en: In Lyotard’s view the ‘truth claims’ and assumed consensus of such a universalizing history are repressive and untenable.

zh: 去掉了这个根据，“后现代”科学就追求能够获得最佳表现的技术与商业目的 ：由新的、可以使信息成为政治数量的电脑技术加强的变化。
en: Deprived of these premises, ‘postmodern’ science pursues the technical and commercial aims of optimal performance: a change reinforced by new, computerized technologies which make information a political quantity.

zh: 然而，这种技术专家治国的秩序与那种质疑“标准科学”模式的内在实验驱动力总是格格不入。
en: However, this technocratic order is at odds with an internal experimental drive which questions the paradigms of ‘normal science’.

zh: 雅各布逊是莫斯科语言学小组的领袖，这个形式主义者的小团体成立于1915年。1920年雅各布逊移居布拉格，成为捷克结构主义的主要理论家之一。
en: Jakobson was leader of the Moscow Linguistic Circle, a Formalist group founded in 1915, and in 1920 migrated to Prague to become one of the major theoreticians of Czech structuralism.

zh: 布拉格语言学小组成立于1926年，它一直存在到第二次世界大战的爆发，雅各布逊后来再次迁居，这一次他去了美国。第二次世界大战期间，他在那里遇到法国人类学家克劳·罗维·斯特劳斯。他们的相识是一个知识的联系，大部分现代结构主义就由此发展而来。
en: The Prague Linguistic Circle was founded in 1926, and survived until the outbreak of the Second World War.Jakobson later migrated once more, this time to the United States, where he encountered the French anthropologist Claude Levi-Strauss during the Second World War, an intellectual relationship out of which much of modern structuralism was to develop.

zh: 这一发展的征象出现在“性别研究”（Gender Studies）的崛起与“男同性恋研究”（Gay Studies）和新兴的“人的研究”（Men's Studies）的对话中。“人的研究”建立在女性主义与男同性恋理论的基础上，旨在对人的性行为与生活方式加以批评和重建。
en: Signs of this development have since appeared in the academic rise of Gender Studies and the dialogues in Gay Studies with the emerging discipline of Men’s Studies, which aims to build on feminism and gay theory so as to provide a critique and reconstruction of men’s sexualities and lifestyles.

zh: 对于学术界的这些倾向一些人是心怀忧虑与反对的。在一些领域，男同性恋理论与女性主义仍有争议，甚至有敌对的情形。
en: There has been anxiety over and opposition to both these tendencies, and there remains in some quarters an unsettled, even antagonistic, relationship between gay theory and feminism.

zh: 一些形态规则，尤其是曲折成分，具有能产性，意思是说它们能够加以自由运用，从而将清单中的自由语素和黏着语素组成新词。
en: We have noted that some morphological processes, inflection in particular, are productive, meaning that they can be used freely to form new words from the list of free and bound morphemes.

zh: 后缀-able似乎是这样一个语素，可以和任何动词并联派生出形容词，而其语义则是动词语义和后缀-able语义两者的结合，意思差不多可以表示为“可……的” ，例如：accept + able (可接受的），laugh + able (可笑的），pass + able (过得去的），change + able (可变的），breathe + able (可以呼吸的），adapt + able (能适应的，可改编的）等 等 。后缀-able还被赋予了“适合做”或者“适合被……”的语义。
en: Among derivational morphemes, the suffix -able can be conjoined with any verb to derive an adjective with the meaning of the verb and the meaning of -able, which is something like “able to be” as in accept + able, laugh + able, pass + able, change + able, breathe + able, adapt + able, and so on.

zh: 我们发现-able可以附缀到新产生的动词上面，构成downloadable (可下载的）和faxable( 可传真的）这样的词，这说明这条规则具有能产性。
en: The productivity of this rule is illustrated by the fact that we find -able affixed to new verbs such as downloadable and faxable.

zh: 只有注意到一首诗的成分(即符号)往往与正常的语法和正常的再现的不同，我们才开始真正对这首诗有所反应。诗歌似乎只是间接地确定其意义，并通过这样的方式“威胁文学对现实的再现”。
en: A true response starts by noticing that the elements (signs) in a poem often appear to depart from normal grammar or normal representation: the poem seems to be establishing significance only indirectly and in doing so ‘threatens the literary representation of reality’.

zh: 理解诗的“意义”，只需要普通的语言能力，然而要应对诗歌阅读中经常碰到的”不合语法规范之处“，则需要“文学能力”。（欲更多了解这一术语，参看第4章第75-77页有关卡勒的部分 )。
en: It requires only ordinary linguistic competence to understand the poem’s ‘meaning’, but the reader requires ‘literary competence’ (for more on this term, see Culler, Chapter 4, pp. 75–77) to deal with the frequent ‘ungrammaticalities’ encountered in reading a poem.

zh: 诗歌的随心所欲性中包括了它对理论家自古典时代以来所谓的“崇高”的强烈追求：这是一种超越人类理解能力的关系，激发一神敬畏或强烈的情感，给说话人一种超越人类的感觉。
en: The extravagance of poetry includes its aspiration to what theorists since classical times have called the ‘sublime’: a relation to what exceeds human capabilities of understanding, provokes awe or passionate intensity, gives the speaker a sense of something beyond the human.

zh: 不过这种超验的热烈追求是与修辞手段相联系的，比如呼语法，一种对实际不在场的听众讲话的修辞手段；拟人法，把人类的特点赋予非人类的事物；活现法，让无生命的事物具备讲话的能力。
en: But this transcendent aspiration is linked to rhetorical figures such as apostrophe, the trope of addressing what is not an actual listener, personification, the attribution of human qualities to what is not human, and prosopopoeia, the granting of speech to inanimate objects.

zh: 诗句的最强烈的情感是怎样与这些修辞手段相联系的呢？
en: How can the highest aspirations of verse be linked to such rhetorical devices?

zh: 英语中的 cock-a-doodle-doo是表示公鸡打鸣的拟声词,而芬兰语公鸡打鸣是 kukkokiekuu。在http://www.georgetown.edu/cball/animals/animals.html®这一网址，你可以找到很多语言模仿几十种动物叫声的拟声词。
en: In English cock-a-doodle-doo is an onomatopoeic word whose meaning is the crow of a rooster, whereas in Finnish the rooster’s crow is kukkokiekuu.

zh: 如果你想知道土耳其语模仿火鸡叫声的拟声词，你可以去那里查找。这个词是 glu-glu。
en: Forget gobble gobble when you’re in Istanbul; a turkey in Turkey goes glu-glu.

zh: 一个潜在的词由音位构成遵守该语言音位配列规则的序列。
en: A possible word contains phonemes in sequences that obey the phonotactic constraints of the language.

zh: 一个事实上出现的词，是一个潜在的词和某个意义的结合。
en: An actual, occurring word is the union of a possible word with a meaning.

zh: 没有意义的可能词有时候叫作无意义词，有时也指词库中的偶然缺位，或词汇缺位。
en: Possible words without meaning are sometimes called nonsense words and are also referred to as accidental gaps in the lexicon, or lexical gaps.

zh: 到现在为止我们所考察的派生例子都是只运用了一条音系规则。复数和过去时的例子有些不一样，那是一条规则中的两个部分。
en: All the examples of derivations we have so far considered show the application of just one phonological rule, except the plural and past-tense rules, which are actually one rule with two parts.

zh: 但是，必定还有数条规则作用于一个词的情况。
en: In any event, it is common for more than one rule to apply to a word.

zh: 派生语素有明确的语义内容，在这个意义上它们跟实义词一样，只不过它们本身不是词，前面我们已经看到，把一个派生语素加到一个词基上，就会增加语义。
en: Derivational morphemes have clear semantic content.In this sense they are like content words, except that they are not words.As we have seen, when a derivational morpheme is added to a base, it adds meaning.

zh: 派生词所属的语法类也可能与原词不同，后缀-able和-ly就是这样。
en: The derived word may also be of a different grammatical class than the original word, as shown by suffixes such as -able and -ly.

zh: 如果一个动词加上后缀-able,结果就得到一个形容词，例如desire+able(可取的)。
en: When a verb is suffixed with -able, the result is an adjective, as in “desire + able”.

zh: 此外，亚里士多德在分析美术的同时，也根据模仿对象、模仿媒介和完成模仿的方式——如戏剧的、叙述的或混合的——对艺术作了进一步的区分。
en: Furthermore, in his analysis of the fine arts, Aristotle at once introduces supplementary distinctions according to the objects imitated the medium of imitation and the manner—dramatic, narrative, or mixed, for example—in which the imitation is accomplished.

zh: 他逐一利用了对象、手段、方式上的这些特征从而得以将诗歌与其它艺术样式区分开来，接着再把诗歌划分成各种样式，例如史诗和戏剧、悲剧和喜剧。
en: By successive exploitadon of these distinctions in object, means, and manner, he is able first to distinguish poetry from other kinds of art?and then to differentiate the various poetic genres, such as epic and drama, tragedy and comedy.

zh: 他在着重分析悲剧时，又以同样的方法把整体区分为情节、性格、思想等成分。因此，亚里士多德的批评反认为艺术就是艺术，与政治、人生、道德无关，而且认为诗歌就是诗歌，认为每一种诗都有适合其特性的标准。
en: When he focuses on the genre of tragedy, the same analytic instrument is applied to the discrimination of the parts constituting the individual whole: plot, character, thought, and so on, Aristotle's criticism, therefore, is not only criticism of art as art, independent of statesmanship being, and morality but also of poetry as poetry, and of each kind of poem by the criteria appropriate to its particular nature.

zh: 皮钦语发挥着有用的功能。
en: Pidgins also serve a useful function.

zh: 例如，一个人能在六个月内学会以英语为基础的皮钦语，足以开始接受各种半职业性的培训。
en: For example, it is possible to learn an English-based pidgin well enough in six months to begin many kinds of semiprofessional training.

zh: 如果为了同样的目的学习英语则需要花费10倍的时间。
en: Learning English for the same purpose might take ten times as long.

zh: 在一个存在很多种相互难以理解的语言的地区，皮钦语在将种种异质文化统一起来的过程中发挥着极为重要的作用。
en: In areas with many mutually unintelligible languages, a pidgin can play a vital role in unifying people of different cultures and ethnicities.

zh: 我们也知道婴儿的脑在生下来后改变很大。
en: And we know that babies' brains do change considerably after birth.

zh: 在出生之前，所有的神经细胞已形成，都移走到它们被指定的位置上去了。
en: Before birth, virtually all the neurons (nerve cells) are formed, and they migrate into their proper locations in the brain.

zh: 但是头的大小、脑的重量及大脑皮质（灰质）（在出生的头一年还继续不断快速地生长）的厚度，在这里可以找到支援心智运算的突触。
en: But head size, brain weight, and thickness of the cerebral cortex (gray matter), where the synapses (junctions) subserving mental computation are found, continue to increase rapidly in the year after birth.

zh: 语言偏侧化到大脑左半球的过程，始于生命的早期。
en: Lateralization of language to the left hemisphere is a process that begins very early in life.

zh: 妊娠26周胎儿的大脑左半球中，韦尼克区就清晰可见了。
en: Wernicke’s area is visibly distinctive in the left hemisphere of the fetus by the twenty-sixth gestational week.

zh: 一周大的婴儿大脑左半球显示出对语言有较强的电反应，而其右半球则对音乐有较强的电反应。
en: Infants as young as one week old show a greater electrical response in the left hemisphere to language and in the right hemisphere to music.

zh: 最近对5至12个月大的失聪婴儿和听力正常婴儿的研究表明，婴儿的咿呀语主要出现在大脑左半球。
en: A recent study videotaped the mouths of babies between the ages of five and twelve months when they were smiling and when they were babbling in syllables (producing sequences like mamama or gugugu).

zh: 这样的一个清单是有用的，但计算机好像是在记忆而不是在断定词的发音。该清单中也包含了很大比例的，注入（诸如）ough这样的条目。
en: Such a list is helpful—it is like memorizing rather than figuring out the pronunciations—and encompasses a large percentage of items, including the ough words.

zh: 这是词层面上的拼接合成的基础。
en: This is the basis of word-level concatenative synthesis.

zh: 我们不妨以爱迪生关于天才的区分来开始我们的讨论。这个区分并非由他首创，他只是使这个区分更趋鲜明、更加普及。他把天才分为生就的天才——就是“自然天才”——和造就的天才。
en: We may begin with Addison's distinction, which he did not invent, but sharpened and popularized, between the genius who is born一 the ‘natural genius’一 and the genius who is made.

zh: 自然的天才人物有荷马、平达、写作旧约的那些诗人和莎士比亚，他们是“人中奇才，只凭借自然才华，不需求助于任何技艺和学识，就创造出荣耀当时、流芳后世的作品”。
en: Natural geniuses, a class comprising Homer, Pindar, the Old Testament poets, and Shakespeare, are ‘the prodigies of mankind, who by the mere strength of natural parts, and without any assistance of art or learning, have produced works that were the delight of their own times, and the wonder of posterity.'

zh: 这种因说话者的社会境况不同而产生的语言差异被称为社会语言变项。
en: Linguistic differences of this sort that vary with the social situation of the speaker are termed sociolinguistic variables.

zh: 例如，使用诸如双重否定这样的非标准形式常常与种族自尊心联系在一起，而后者则是社会语境的一部分。
en: For example, the use of nonstandard forms like double negation is often associated with pride of ethnicity, which is part of the social context.

zh: 许多说奇卡诺英语的人（和说AAE的人）都能说两种方言；他们会根据社会情况使用奇卡诺英语（或AAE）或者SAE。
en: Many Chicano speakers (and speakers of AAE) are bidialectal; they can use either ChE (or AAE) or SAE, depending on the social situation.

zh: 最近的神经语言学研究开始显示词汇判定技术的局限性。
en: Recent neurolinguistic research is showing the limits of the lexical decision technique.

zh: 现在人们可以测量受试者做词汇判定实验时的脑电活动，并把脑反应的模式与反应时间的模式进行比较（该技术与第二章提到的事件相 关脑电位ERP相似）。
en: It is now possible to measure electrical brain activity in subjects while they perform a lexical decision experiment, and compare the patterns in brain responses to patterns in RTs.(The technique is similar to the event-related brain potentials mentioned in chapter 2.)

zh: 这类实验得出的结论与反应时间数据相冲突。
en: Such experiments have provided results that directly conflict with the RT data.

zh: 例如，对脑活动的测量表明成对的动词形式（如“教”的原型和过去式teach/taught)在词汇提取的早期阶段发生启动，然而这类成对动词在词汇判定的反应时间上却没有发生启动。
en: For example, measures of brain activity show priming to pairs of verb forms such as teach/taught during the early stages of lexical access, whereas such pairs do not show priming in lexical decision RTs.

zh: 这是因为词汇判定涉及若干个处理阶段，早期阶段中的模式可能被其后阶段中的不同模式所遮蔽。
en: This is because lexical decision involves several stages of processing, and patterns in early stages may be obscured by different patterns in later stages.

zh: 相比之下，脑测量则是持续进行的，因此允许研究者对处理过程的早期和晚期分开进行测量。
en: Brain measures, by contrast, are taken continuously and therefore allow researchers to separately measure early and later processes.

zh: 一些语言还有外接缀，指的是在同一个词基语素的开头和末尾附加上的语素，有时候也被称为非连续语素。
en: Some languages have circumfixes, morphemes that are attached to a base morpheme both initially and finally.These are sometimes called discontinuous morphemes.

zh: 在美国俄克拉荷马州有一种属于印第安土著马斯科吉语系的奇卡索语，词的否定形式 通过前缀ik-和后缀-o共同组成。
en: In Chickasaw, a Muskogean language spoken in Oklahoma, the negative is formed with both a prefix ik- and the suffix -o.

zh: 在加上表示否定的后缀之前，肯定形式末尾的元音会先脱落。
en: The final vowel of the affirmative is dropped before the negative suffix is added.

zh: 通往潜意识的捷径是梦。
en: The 'royal road' to the unconscious is dreams.

zh: 梦特许我们一瞥潜意识的工作。
en: Dreams allow us one of our few privileged glimpses of it at work.

zh: 在弗洛伊德看来，梦基本上是潜意识欲望的象征实现；它们采取象征形式是因为，这些内容如果被直接表现出来，那就足以惊醒我们。
en: Dreams for Freud are essentially symbolic fulfilments of unconscious wishes; and they are cast in symbolic form because if this material were expressed directly then it might be shocking and disturbing enough to wake us up.

zh: 为了让我们获得某些睡眠，潜意识善意地掩盖、缓和和扭曲它们的意义，于是我们的梦就变成了需要破译的象征作品。
en: In order that we should get some sleep, the unconscious charitably conceals, softens and distorts its meanings, so that our dreams become symbolic texts which need to be deciphered.

zh: 所有语言都存在短语结构规则，规定允许哪些d-结构。
en: All languages have phrase structure rules that specify the allowable d-structures.

zh: 所有语言的短语都由中心语和补足语组成，句子都以Aux(或T)为中心语，Aux(或T)指的是有关时态、一致关系和情态有关的信息。
en: In all languages, phrases consist of heads and complements, and sentences are headed by Aux (or T), which is specified for information such as tense, agreement, and modality.

zh: 然而，在不同语言的短语和句子内，词序可能不同。
en: However, languages may have different word orders within the phrases and sentences.

zh: 话说回来，对于某些想要获得一份特定工作或就任一个尊荣职位的人来说，不可否认，标准方言（见第十章的定义）可能是一种更好的方言。
en: Having said all this, it is undeniable that the standard dialect (defined in chapter 10) may indeed be a better dialect for someone wishing to obtain a particular job or achieve a position of social prestige.

zh: 在一个“以言取人”（linguistic profiling) 、歧视少数族群方言使用者的社会中，对于这些使用者来说，与其坐等社会变化，也许还不如先学会优势方言更有必要。
en: In a society where “linguistic profiling” is used to discriminate against speakers of a minority dialect, it may behoove those speakers to learn the prestige dialect rather than wait for social change.

zh: 但是从语言学角度而言，优势方言和标准方言的语法并不高人一等。
en: But linguistically, prestige and standard dialects do not have superior grammars.

zh: 遗传学家认为这基因是显性的，但是不在X染色体上，因为男性和女性得到的几率是一样多。而且在这些个案中，他们的配偶(不论是先生还是太太)都是正常的，但是生下的小孩都有这毛病。
en: The gene is thought to be autosomal (not on the X chromosome) and dominant because the syndrome struck males and females with equal frequency, and in all cases the spouse of an impaired parent, whether husband or wife, was normal.

zh: 假如这个基因是隐性的，那么必须要父母双方都有这个毛病，小孩子才会遗传到这个毛病。
en: If the gene were recessive and autosomal, it would be necessary to have two impaired parents to inherit the syndrome.

zh: 假如它是隐性而且只在X染色体上的话，则只有儿于才会遗传到，女儿只是携带者而已。
en: If it were recessive and on the X chromosome, only males would have it; females would be carriers.

zh: 本世纪关于语言本能最著名的理论是由麻省理工学院的乔姆斯基所提出的，他是第一个揭开语言系统的精密性，也是奠定近代语言学的革命与促使认知科学诞生的最有力人物。
en: In this century, the most famous argument that language is like an instinct comes from Noam Chomsky, the linguist who first unmasked the intricacy of the system and perhaps the person most responsible for the modern revolution in language and cognitive science.

zh: 在20世纪50年代，行为主义支配了现代社会科学，当时所盛行的是华生和史金纳的理论。
en: In the 1950s the social sciences were dominated by behaviorism, the school of thought popularized by John Watson and B. F. Skinner.

zh: 他们认为有关心智的活动，例如 “知道”和“思考”是“不科学的”，而心智和天赋则是脏话。
en: Mental terms like ''know", and ''think'' were branded as unscientific; ''mind" and ''innate" were dirty words.

zh: 1960年代，希利斯·米勒（J.Hillis Miller）深受日内瓦学派现象学批评的影响（见第3章有关部分）。
en: During the 1960s, J. Hillis Miller was deeply influenced by the Geneva School’s ‘phenomenological’ criticism (see Chapter 3, p. 49).

zh: 从1970年代开始，他的著述转而集中对小说做解构批评（尤其是《小说与重复：七部英文小说》，1982）。
en: His work since 1970 has centred on the deconstruction of fiction (especially in Fiction and Repetition: Seven English Novels, 1982).

zh: 这个阶段开始的标志是1970年他采用雅可布森关于隐喻与换喻的理论（见第4章有关文字）讨论狄更斯的一篇精彩论文。
en: This phase was inaugurated with a fine paper on Dickens given in 1970, in which he takes up Jakobson’s theory of metaphor and metonymy (see Chapter 4, pp. 72–3).

zh: 日语有丰富的屈折变化，动词可以有三十多种不同的形式，仅仅使用词语文字并不合适。
en: A word-writing system alone was not suitable for Japanese, which is a highly inflected language in which verbs may occur in thirty or more different forms.

zh: 以经过修改的汉字为基础，学者为日语设计了音节语符，用以表示屈折变化词尾和其他的一些语法语素。
en: Scholars devised syllabic characters, based on modified Chinese characters, to represent the inflectional endings and other grammatical morphemes.

zh: 因此在日语的书写中，日语汉字通常用于表示词根，平假名则用作屈折变化的标记。
en: Thus, in Japanese writing, kanji is commonly used for the verb roots, and hiragana symbols for the inflectional markings.

zh: 另一方面，在 bean，mean, comb和sing这些词的元音中，鼻音这一特征的值是可以预知的，因为它只出现在鼻辅音前。
en: On the other hand, the nasality feature value of the vowels in bean, mean, comb, and sing is predictable because they occur before nasal consonants.

zh: 当某一类音的某个特征值可以通过规则预知的时候，这个特征就是非区别性的，或是冗余的，或者叫作这一类音的一个可预测特征（这三个术语是等价的）。
en: When a feature value is predictable by rule for a certain class of sounds, the feature is a nondistinctive or redundant or predictable feature for that class.(The three terms are equivalent.)

zh: 因此，鼻音是英语元音的一个冗余特征，但却是英语辅音的一个非冗余 （区别性或是音位性的）特征 。
en: Thus nasality is a redundant feature in English vowels, but a nonredundant (distinctive or phonemic) feature for English consonants.

zh: 第一章仍然是对语言一般性研究的简要介绍。
en: Chapter 1 continues to be a concise introduction to the general study of language.

zh: 现在本章除了以更多篇幅讨论手语和动物“语言”之外，还新增了“语言和思维”一节，讨论萨丕尔——沃尔夫假说。事实证明，这些内容学生都很感兴趣，会成为他们主动作进一步探索的动力。
en: It now contains many “hooks” for engaging students in language study, including “Language and Thought,” which takes up the Sapir-Whorf hypothesis; discussions of signed languages; a consideration of animal “languages”; and a treatment of language origins.

zh: 前面提到，塞音是非通音。
en: Stops and affricates belong to the class of noncontinuants.

zh: 发非通音时空气在中完全阻断。
en: There is a total obstruction of the airstream in the oral cavity.

zh: 还包括鼻塞音（虽然空气从鼻子里无间断地流出）和塞擦音。
en: Nasal stops are included although air does flow continuously out the nose.

zh: 所有其他辅音，还有全部元音都是通音，发音时气流无间断地流出嘴巴。
en: All other consonants, and all vowels, are continuants, in which the stream of air flows continuously out of the mouth.

zh: 不必对此深究，我们也能清楚地看到，虽然删节原理具有不少可取之处，并且可能以某种方式涉及到解决这一整套问题的正确方案，但是,仍然有许多证据需要解释。
en: Without pursuing the matter any further, we can see that although the erasure principle has much to recommend and is probably somehow involved in the correct solution to this network of problems, there is much evidence still to be accounted for.

zh: 如在以上所提及的另外一些情况中，存在着许多与决定转换是否可行的条件有关的问题。这些问题仍然难以得到任何近似确切的解答，虽然人们能提出一些有意思的和有启发性的设想，这些设想也构成了对上述问题的总体解答的一部分。
en: As in the other cases mentioned, there are a variety of problems relating to the conditions that determine applicability of transformations, problems that still resist any near-definitive solution, though some interesting and illuminating proposals can be made that seem to go part of the way toward a general solution.

zh: 然而颇具吊诡色彩的是，现代主义对传统现实主义的拒斥反倒把社会主义现实主义推到资产阶级美学的主要监护人的位置上。
en: The modernist rejection of traditional realism paradoxically left Socialist Realism as the leading custodian of bourgeois aesthetics.

zh: 在汤姆·斯托帕（Tom Stoppard）的剧作《拙劣模仿》（1975)中，达达主义诗人查拉抱怨说，“革命真是奇怪得恨，政治上你越是左倾，他们就越愿意他们的艺术更多资产阶级色彩。”
en: In Tom Stoppard’s play Travesties (1975), the Dadaist poet Tzara is made to complain that ‘the odd thing about revolution is that the further left you go politically, the more bourgeois they like their art’.

zh: 深层结构通过一定的心理操作—用现代的术语说就是语法转换—与表层结构相连。
en: The deep structure is related to the surface structure by certain mental operations–in modern terminology, by grammatical transformations.

zh: 每一种语言都可被当做是一种关于声音和意义的特殊关系。
en: Each language can be regarded as a particular relation between sound and meaning.

zh: 这样，从波尔•罗瓦雅尔的理论中可以得出这样合乎逻辑的结论：一种语言的语法必定包含一个规则系统。该规则系统描述了深层结构和表层结构的特征以及二者之间的转换关系。如果要容纳语言运用的创造性的话，该系统还适用于无数对深层-表层结构。
en: Following thePort-Royal theory to its logical conclusions, then, the grammar of alanguage must contain a system of rules that characterizes deep and surface structures and the transformational relation between them, and – if it is to accommodate the creative aspect of language use – that does so over an infinite domain of paired deep and surface structures.

zh: 根据我们提出的研究方法，异议消失了，因为神话本身就提供了自己的上下文。
en: With the method we propose to follow the objection disappears, since the myth itself provides its own context.

zh: 因此，人们不再根据每一个姓名的最终意思去寻找意义，而是根据所有姓名的共同特征去寻找意义。因此，所有假设的意义（很可能始终保持假设）都指的是笔直地走路和笔直地站着的困难。
en: The signiﬁcance is no longer to be sought in the eventual meaning of each name, but in the fact that all the names have a common feature: All the hypothetical meanings (which may well remain hypothetical) refer to difﬁculties in walking straight and standing upright.

zh: 读者读到这里可能会产生异议，结构主义诗学对于批评家的实践似乎并没有提供多少助益。结构主义理论常常采用童话、神话、侦探小说作为例证也许并不是没有意义的。
en: At this point, the reader may well object that structuralist poetics seems to have little to offer the practising critic, and it is perhaps significant that fairy stories, myths and detective stories often feature as examples in structuralist writings.

zh: 这类研究旨在界定文学结构的一般原则，而不是为个别文本提供解释。
en: Such studies aim to define the general principles of literary structure and not to provide interpretations of individual texts.

zh: 时装具有特别复杂的符号意义，可以同时具有社会、功能、色情及审美功能。
en: Fashions are especially complex signs and may possess social, political, erotic and aesthetic functions.

zh: 文学作品同样具有多种功能。
en: The same variability of function can be seen in literary products.

zh: 一篇政治演讲稿、一部传记、一封书信和一件宣传品在不同社会和时代可能有审美功能，也可能没有审美功能。
en: A political speech, a biography, a letter and a piece of propaganda may or may not possess aesthetic value in different societies and periods.

zh: “艺术”范畴的周边界限总是在变化着，而且总是与某种社会结构存在动态关联。
en: The circumference of the sphere of ‘art’ is always changing, and always dynamically related to the structure of society.

zh: 考验心灵的成功与否，就看它是否能够面对眼前的一切,而且作出反应时并不假借无数的逃脱借口，而心灵通常躲避了经验的充分发挥。
en: The test of its success is whether it can face what is before it and respond to it without any of the innumerable subterfuges by which it ordinarily dodges the full development of experience.

zh: 压制和升华同样是我们力求回避那些可能困惑我们的问题的手段。
en: Suppressions and sublimations alike are devices by which we endeavour to avoid issues which might bewilder us.

zh: 悲剧的实质则在于迫使我们体验到没有这些手段时的生活片刻。
en: The essence of tragedy is that it forces us to live for a moment without them.

zh: 当我们有了成功的体验，我们就会发现一般不存在困难。困难过去来自于压制和升华。
en: When we succeed we find, as usual, that there is no difficulty; the difficulty came from the suppressions and sublimations.

zh: 说出来的一个语句，首先是说话人脑/心中的一条信息。
en: A spoken utterance starts as a message in the speaker's brain/mind.

zh: 该信息转换成语言形式并被解读为一条说话指令， 以声学信号的形式出现。
en: It is put into linguistic form and interpreted as articulation commands, emerging as an acoustic signal.

zh: 信号经听话人耳朵的处理后，发送至他的脑/心，在那里得到解读。
en: The signal is processed by the listener’s ear and sent to the brain/mind, where it is interpreted.

zh: 正如我们前面见到的那样，言语链源自说话人，经过一系列复杂的神经-肌肉处理，然后产生代表思想、想法或信息的声学信号。该声学信号传递到听话人那里，他必须对信号解码才能获得与原意相近的信息。
en: As we saw, the speech chain starts with a speaker who, through some complicated set of neuromuscular processes, produces an acoustic signal that represents a thought, idea, or message to be conveyed to a listener, who must then decode the signal to arrive at a similar message.

zh: 目的在于了解说话人如何处理言语的实验，设计起来要难于目的在于了解听话人如何处理言语的实验。
en: It is more difficult to devise experiments that provide information about how the speaker proceeds than to do so for the listener's side of the process.

zh: 客观上有声音产生，主观上则没有声音。
en: Objectively, a sound is produced; subjectively, there is no sound.

zh: 事实上，有一些声音我们听不见，是因为我们的耳朵并不是对所有频率都敏感。
en: In fact, there are sounds we cannot hear because our ears are not sensitive to the full range of frequencies.

zh: 声学语音学只研究语音，所有语音都是正常人耳能听见的声音。
en: Acoustic phonetics is concerned only with speech sounds, all of which can be heard by the normal human ear.

zh: “可悲者”应该和弗洛伊德所谓“被压抑者”相区别。
en: The abject is to be distinguished from the Freudian notion of the repressed.

zh: 克里斯蒂娃运用这个概念讨论了陀斯妥耶夫斯基、普鲁斯特、乔伊斯、博尔赫斯和阿尔托（Artaud)等人的作品，特别用它作为理解法国小说家路易·费迪南·赛利纳 (Louis Ferdinand Celine）作品中反犹信仰的一种方式。
en: Kristeva employs the concept to discuss literary works by Dostoevsky, Proust, Joyce, Borges and Artaud, and,principally, as a way of understanding the anti-Semitic beliefs of the French novelist, Louis Ferdinand Céline.

zh: 她把文学与圣经看作表示可悲者的独特的能指，能够揭示……放散、抽空这种可悲性（《恐怖的权力》）。
en: Literature and the Bible she views as‘privileged signiﬁers’ of the abject, as enacting ‘an unveiling ...a discharge and hollowing out of abjection’ (1982).

zh: 最终，这种图画文字也开始同时代表概念和表示这一概念的词。
en: Eventually, these pictograms came to represent both the concept and the word for the concept.

zh: 一旦发展到这一步，象形文字就演变为真正的表语文字系统。
en: Once this happened, hieroglyphics became a bona fide logographic writing system.

zh: 通过画谜原理，埃及象形文字也演变成一种音节文字。
en: Through the rebus principle, hieroglyphics also became a syllabic writing system.

zh: 如果把诗歌作为一种行为，关键的问题一直是写作诗歌的作者的行为与发言者，或者是在那里朗诵的“声音”的行为之间的关系。
en: For the poem as act, a key question has been the relation between the act of the author who writes the poem and that of the speaker or ‘voice’ that speaks there.

zh: 这是一个错综的问题。
en: This is a complicated matter.

zh: 作者不是去说出一首诗；写作一首诗就是说作者想像他/她自己，或者另外一个声音去朗诵这首诗。
en: The author does not speak the poem; to write it, the author imagines him or herself or another voice speaking it.

zh: 维克多·什 克洛夫斯基(Viktor Shklovsky)、尤里·蒂尼亚诺夫(Yury Tynyanov)和鲍里斯·艾亨鲍姆(Boris Eikhenbaum)是诗歌研究 会的杰出代表。形式主义最初的激发力来自未来主义者。第一次世界大战前,未来主义者在艺术领域的努力主要是攻击 “ 颓废的 ”中产阶级文化, 特别是反对诗歌和视觉艺术中痛苦地进行灵魂剖析的象征主义运动,他们嘲弄诗人们故弄玄虚的做作,譬如,勃留索夫就坚持说诗人是 “神秘精神的卫士”。
en: Viktor Shklovsky, Yury Tynyanov and Boris Eikhenbaum were prominent in Opojaz.The initial impetus was provided by the Futurists, whose artistic efforts before the First World War were directed against ‘decadent’ bourgeois culture and especially against the anguished soul-searching of the Symbolist movement in poetry and the visual arts.They derided the mystical posturing of poets such as Briusov who insisted that the poet was ‘the guardian of the mystery’.

zh: 通过说“我警告你在衣橱里有一个牧羊犬”，你不仅说了些什么，还警告了某人。
en: By saying I warn you that there is a sheepdog in the closet, you not only say something, you warn someone.

zh: 如bet(打赌)、 promise (承诺)、warn (警告)等动词是施行动词。
en: Verbs like bet, promise, warn, and so on are performative verbs.

zh: 在句子(第一人称、现在时)中使用这类动词，会在陈述之外增加一些额外的东西。
en: Using them in a sentence (in the first person, present tense) adds something extra over and above the statement.

zh: 判断一个句子中是否含有施行动词的一个非正式测试，是在句子前面加上I hereby...(我特此)。
en: An informal test to see whether a sentence contains a performative verb is to begin it with the words I hereby.

zh: 这样开头只有施行句听起来是正确的。
en: . . . Only performative sentences sound right when begun this way.

zh: 对比一下I hereby apologize to you (我特此向你道歉)和有些奇怪的I hereby know you (我特此认识你)。
en: Compare I hereby apologize to you with the somewhat strange I hereby know you.

zh: 一般认为前一句是一个道歉的行为。
en: The first is generally taken as an act of apologizing.

zh: 在以上所有给出的例子中，插入hereby(特此)都是可以接受的。
en: In all of the examples given, insertion of hereby would be acceptable.

zh: 面对莎士比亚十四行诗的开头“我心爱的姑娘的眼睛绝不像那太阳”，我们并不去问此话是真是假，而是 问它做了什么，它和这首诗里其他的句子是怎样协调的，以及它与其他行之间的配合是否愉快（给人以快感）。
en: Confronted with the opening of Shakespeare’s sonnet ‘My mistress’ eyes are nothing like the sun’, we ask not whether this utterance is true or false, but what it does, how it fits in with the rest of the poem, and whether it works happily (felicitously) with the other lines.

zh: 可以说这便是精妙语句的一种概念。
en: That might be one conception of felicity.

zh: 但述行语的模式还把我们的注意吸引到能让一句话成为-个承诺，或者成为一句诗的传统程式——比如十四行诗的传统程式。
en: But the model of the performative also directs our attention to the conventions that enable an utterance to be a promise or a poem – the conventions of the sonnet, say.

zh: 因此文学言语的得体就可能包括它与一种体裁的传统程式的关系。
en: The felicitousness of a literary utterance might thus involve its relation to the conventions of a genre.

zh: 我已谈到，对于海德格尔来说，理解完全是历史性的，但这一说法现在需要稍加限定。
en: I have said that understanding for Heidegger is radically historical, but this now needs to be qualified somewhat.

zh: 海德格尔的大作的标题是《存在与时间》而非《存在与历史》；在这两个概念之间存在着重要的区别。
en: The title of his major work is Being and Time rather than Being and History; and there is a significant difference between the two concepts.

zh: 时间在某种意义上是一个比历史更为抽象的概念：它使人联想到的是岁月的流逝或者我体验我个人生命形态的可能方式，而不是民族的斗争，人口的养育杀戮，或国家的建立推翻。
en: 'Time' is in one sense a more abstract notion than history: it suggests the passing of the seasons, or the way I might experience the shape of my personal life, rather than the struggles of nations, the nurturing and slaughtering of populations or the making and toppling of states.

zh: 如果生命这个字眼似乎过于宽泛而朦胧，那么探究它的这种批评技术似乎就相应地过于狭窄。
en: If Life seemed altogether too broad and nebulous a term, the critical techniques for detecting it seemed correspondingly too narrow.

zh: 由于实用批评本身大有成为一种过分实用的专业的危险，从而与一个其所关心者恰是立明的命运的运动不甚相称，所以利维斯主义者们需要用一种“形而上学”来对它进行基础加固，并在芳伦斯的作品中找到了现成的一个。
en: Since practical criticism in itself threatened to become too pragmatic a pursuit for a movement con- cerned with nothing less than the fate of civilization, the Leavisites needed to underpin it with a 'metaphysic', and found one ready to hand in the work of D. H. Lawrence.

zh: 既然生命不是理论体系而是恃殊直觉的问题，你就始终能够站在生命一边，以便攻击他人的体系；但是，既然生命又是象你想象的那么绝对的一种价值，你就同样可以用它来痛打那些鼠目寸光的功利主义者和经验主义者。
en: Since Life was not a theoretical system but a matter of particular intuitions, you could always take your stand on these in order to attack other people's systems; but since Life was also as absolute a value as you could imagine, you could equally use it to lambaste those utilitarians and empiricists who could see no further than their noses.

zh: 最后，极端的实证主义并不见得是一个比较进步、比较人道的教条。
en: Finally, radical empiricism is not necessarily a progressive, humanitarian doctrine.

zh: 人的心智若像一块白板，这是独裁者的梦想。
en: A blank slate is a dictator's dream.

zh: 有一些心理学课本中有提到一些“事实”说：斯巴达和日本武士的母亲在听说他们的儿子战死沙场时会微笑。
en: Some psychology textbooks mention the "fact" that Spartan and samurai mothers smiled upon hearing that their sons fell in battle.

zh: “做事”的动词称为施行动词。
en: Verbs that “do things” are called performative verbs.

zh: 说话者说话时的意图称为示意语力。
en: The speaker’s intent in making an utterance is known as illocutionary force.

zh: 就施行动词而言，示意语力是明确提及的，在其他情况下则必须根据语境来确定。
en: In the case of performative verbs, the illocutionary force is mentioned overtly.In other cases it must be determined from context.

zh: 像《牛津英语词典》或者《韦伯斯特大学词典》这样的词典里写满了词和它们的意义。
en: Dictionaries such as the Oxford English Dictionary (OED) or Webster’s Collegiate Dictionary are filled with words and their meanings.

zh: 词典使用其他的词来给出词的意义，而不是通过某种更基本的词汇。
en: Dictionaries give the meaning of words using other words rather than in terms of some more basic units of meaning, whatever they might be.

zh: 在这个意义上来说，词典提供的只是释义句，而不是意义。
en: In this sense a dictionary really provides paraphrases rather than meanings.

zh: 词典依赖我们关于语言的知识才能让我们理解定义。
en: It relies on our knowledge of the language to understand the definitions.

zh: 如果麦赫勒和拜佛尔的初步结果是正确的，那么，由此就可得出“最后阶段”在智慧发展的最初时期就已完成，在这一阶段里，守恒概念才得到完全的理解。
en: If the preliminary results of Mehler and Bever are correct, then it would follow that the“final stage,”in which conservation is properly understood, was already realized at a very early period of development.

zh: 随后，儿童发展出一种启发式技术，这种技术基本上是可行的，只是在守恒实验的条件下才遭到了失败。
en: Later, the child develops a heuristic technique that is largely adequate but that fails under the conditions of the conservation experiment.

zh: 再往后，他对此技术进行调整并再次在守恒实验中作出正确的判断。
en: Still later, he adjusts this technique successfully and once again makes the correct judgments in the conservation experiment.

zh: 不过读者中的绝大多数人都不太苛求。
en: But the majority of readers are less exigent.

zh: 只要印刷字体清晰易读，使得阅读时习惯的目光移动可以自如地进行，同样由迥然相异的感觉形成的完整反应就会产生。
en: Provided that the print is clear and legible, and allows the habitual eye-movements of reading to be easily performed, the full response arises equally well from widely differing sensations.

zh: 这种情况适合某些人，在目前排版组织节省的状况下，比起遇到较为考究的排版组织，他们就有着确定无疑的优势。
en: Those for whom this is true have, in the present state of economic organization, a decided advantage over the more fastidious.

zh: 这并不证明好的印刷上的考虑可以置于不顾，中国艺术中书法居于首位就表明相反的情况。
en: This does not show that good printing is a negligible consideration; and the primary place of calligraphy in the Chinese arts is an indication to the contrary.

zh: 它只是证明印刷属于艺术的另一个分支。
en: It shows merely that printing belongs to another branch of the arts.

zh: 约翰逊曾这样赞美莎士比亚：有力的笔能驾驭着感受的真理，遏止不住的热情激荡在心里。这并不是溢美之词。约翰逊对《哈姆雷特》以及《李尔王》和《奥赛罗》结尾的几个场景的强烈反应就是证明。
en: Johnson’s praise of Shakespeare-His powerful strokes presiding Truth impressed And unresisted passion stormed the breast－is not empty declamation, as the intensity of Johnson’s response to Hamlet, and to the closing scenes of Lear and Othello, demonstrates.

zh: 至少在抒情诗中，成功地激发读者的情感，被认为是以诗人先此而有的情感状态为前提的。
en: And at least in the lyric forms, the successful evocation of feeling from the reader was held to entail a prior state of feeling in the poet.

zh: 问题是，在斯皮瓦克的使用中，这个被殖民的非精英层是不能说话的。
en: The problem is that this colonized non-elite, in Spivak’s usage, cannot speak.

zh: 这就是说，被压迫者、被消音者从定义上讲就不能说话，不能取得自我合法性，除非不再成为新殖民主义体制下那个被命名的主体。
en: That is to say, the oppressed and silenced cannot, by definition, speak or achieve self-legitimation without ceasing to be that named subject under neo-colonialism.

zh: 但是，假若被压迫的属下不能被西方知识分子讲说——因为这不会改变这样一个重要事实，即他们的地位仍旧如故——自己也不能为自己说话，那么，显而易见，就不会有非殖民主义或反殖民主义话语了。
en: But if the oppressed subalterns cannot be spoken for by Western intellectuals – because this would not alter the most important fact of their position – nor speak for themselves, there can apparently be no non- or anti-colonial discourse.

zh: 在世界上的许多地方，特别是在非洲和亚洲，双语现象（甚至多语现象）是常态。
en: In many parts of the world, especially in Africa and Asia, bilingualism (even multilingualism) is the norm.

zh: 相反，许多欧洲国家（尽管决非所有的）认为自己是单语社会，即使有许多说多种语言的人生活在那儿。
en: In contrast, many Western countries (though by no means all of them) view themselves as monolingual, even though they may be home to speakers of many languages.

zh: 在美国和许多欧洲国家，双语现象常常被视为与移民有关的过渡现象。
en: In the United States and many European countries, bilingualism is often viewed as a transitory phenomenon associated with immigration.

zh: 与大多数双语儿童一样，使用LSQ和法语的双语儿童也会生成含有两种语言词的混合语句。
en: Like most bilingual children, the LSQ-French bilinguals produced mixed utterances that had words from both languages.

zh: 特别有意思的是，这些儿童会发生同时的语言混用。
en: What is especially interesting is that these children showed simultaneous language mixing.

zh: 他们会同时在打出一个LSQ符号的同时说出一个法语词。只有在说一种语言的同时使用一种手语，这种现象才可能出现。
en: They would produce an LSQ sign and a French word at the same time, something that is only possible if one language is spoken and the other signed.

zh: 这一发现对于双语语言习得来说具有普遍意义。
en: However, this finding has implications for bilingual language acquisition in general.

zh: 它表明双语儿童的语言混用并不是因混乱而造成的，而是两种语言的语法同时作用的结果。
en: It shows that the language mixing of bilingual children is not caused by confusion, but is rather the result of two grammars operating simultaneously.

zh: 调音部位、方式相同的语音有可能长短不同。
en: Speech sounds that are identical in their place or manner features may differ in length (duration).

zh: 英语中紧元音一般比松元音长，不过只是稍长一点，大约几十毫秒。
en: Tense vowels are slightly longer than lax vowels, but only by a few milliseconds.

zh: 但在有些语言中长元音可能长出一倍，这能用来区别词义。
en: However, in some languages when a vowel is prolonged to around twice its normal length, it can make a difference between words.

zh: 例如日语中biru[biru]是“建筑”，如果是长i，biiru[bi:ru],那就是“啤酒”了。（形如冒号的：是IPA表示音段长或者音程加倍的符号。）
en: In Japanese the word biru [biru] with a regular i means “building”, but with the i doubled in length as in biiru, spelled phonetically as [biːru], the meaning is “beer” (The colon-like ː is the IPA symbol for segment length or doubling.) In Japanese vowel length can make the difference between two words.

zh: 而在发spit（吐痰）的p时，双唇刚分开，声带就开始振动了。
en: When we pronounce the p in spit, however, the vocal cords start vibrating as soon as the lips open.

zh: 这种音叫作不送气。
en: That p is unaspirated.

zh: 把手掌放在嘴巴前5厘米的地方，然后说pit，你会感觉到一股气流，而说spit的时候就没有气流。
en: Hold your palm about two inches in front of your lips and say pit.You will feel a puff of air, which you will not feel when you say spit.

zh: Tick（嘀嗒）中的t和kin（亲戚）中的k也是送气清塞音，而stick（手杖）中的t和skin（皮）中的k是不送气音。
en: The t in tick and the k in kin are also aspirated voiceless stops, while the t in stick and the k in skin are unaspirated.

zh: 当然,很明显，任何一个有理智的人都会偏好严格的分析和细致的实验。但是，在相当时程度上，我觉得，“行为科学”只不过是对自然科学表面特征的模仿；它的许多科学的特征是通过限制主要研究论题，集中于次要问题而获得的。
en: Obviously any rational person will favor rigorous analysis and careful experiment; but to a considerable degree, I feel, the “behavioral sciences” are merely mimicking the surface features of the natural sciences; much of their scientific character has been achieved by a restriction of subject matter and a concentration on rather peripheral issues.

zh: 这种对论题的缩小如果具有真正的学术意义，那倒也是有理由的。但是，对我们讨论的问题来说，我看不出论题的缩小能带来什么深刻的和有重大意义的结果。
en: Such narrowing of focus can be justified if it leads to achievements of real intellectual significance, but in this case, I think it would be very difficult to show that the narrowing of scope has led to deep and significant results.

zh: 然而，这个单子永远不会完整。
en: However, the list can never be complete.

zh: 新词、新词形式、专有名词、缩写和缩略语不断地添加入语言中，无法预期。
en: New words, new word forms, proper names, abbreviations, and acronyms are constantly being added to the language and cannot be anticipated.

zh: 这个由文字到言语的系统需要给词典未收录的词条制定对话规则，而这些必须是共振峰合成器或连结合成器基于比要说的词更小的单位的产出物。
en: The text-to-speech system requires conversion rules for items not in its dictionary, and these must be output by a formant synthesizer or a concatenative synthesizer based on units smaller than the word if they are to be spoken.

zh: 如果一个词的意义不同于一个词典条目，那它是什么？
en: If the meaning of a word is not like a dictionary entry, what is it?

zh: 这个问题哲学家和语言学家已经争论了几个世纪。
en: This question has been debated by philosophers and linguists for centuries.

zh: 一种理论认为一个词的意义是它的所指，也就是它所指的事物。
en: One proposal is that the meaning of a word or expression is its reference, its association with the object it refers to.

zh: 这个现实世界的对象就称为所指。
en: This real world object is called the referent.

zh: 苔莎拉意味着一种“片断”，暗示前辈诗人的诗作都是片断的材料，要求后辈诗人最终加工完成。
en: Tessera is ‘fragment’: a poet treats the materials of a precursor poem as if they were in pieces, and required the finishing touch of the successor.

zh: 克利纳门（修正率）具有“反讽”的修辞形式（指语言而非思想），叫做“反其道构形”。
en: Clinamen (revisionary ratio) has the rhetorical form of ‘irony’ (the figure of speech, not of thought), and is the psychic defence called ‘reaction-formation’.

zh: 反讽表示说此意彼（不同或相反）。
en: Irony says one thing and means something different (sometimes the opposite).

zh: 其他的修正率与此类似，都是以比喻或心理防范表示的（苔莎拉用提喻，即反对自身，等等）。
en: The other ratios are similarly expressed as both trope and psychic defence (tessera = synecdoche = ‘turning against the Self’, and so on).

zh: 约翰孙的一些同时代人颠倒了这一侧重点，至少是注重了对有形场面的描述，同时更为强调特殊性在创作诗歌佳作中的功用。
en: Some of Johnson's contemporaries reversed this balance, with respect at least to descriptions of the visible scene, and gave greater emphasis to the role of particularity in achieving poetic excellence.

zh: 因此，约瑟夫• 沃顿说，“语言的作用、力量和优越性当然在于创造清晰的、完整的和偶然的意象。”并告诫说:“我认为，即便在著名作家身上，我也可以找出他们在描绘自然时偏离真实、生动和细腻的毛病，以及不厌其烦地絮叨普遍性的毛病。”
en: Thus Joseph Warton said that ‘the use, the force, and the excellence of language, certainly consists in raising, clear, complete, and circumstan Wtinniages’；and warned that ‘I think I can perceive many symptoms, even among writers of eminence， of departing from these true, and lively and minute, representations of Nature, and of dwelling in generalities'.

zh: 强力诗人们分别或连续采用六种心理防范形式来对付那种“影响的焦虑”（anxiety of influence）。
en: Strong poets cope with the ‘anxiety of influence’ by adopting separately or successively six psychic defences.

zh: 这些形式以比喻的形式出现在他们的诗歌中，使他们可以从父辈的诗歌中“转脱”出来。
en: These appear in their poetry as tropes which allow a poet to ‘swerve’ from a father’s poems.

zh: 这六种比喻是：反讽、提喻、换喻、夸张/反语、隐喻、再换喻（ metalepsis）。
en: The six tropes are irony, synecdoche, metonymy, hyperbole/litotes, metaphor and metalepsis.

zh: 弗莱所著的《批评的剖析》是一本研究抒情诗和其他文学体裁的极有价值的指导手册。它称抒情诗的基本构成是咿呀之语和信手拈来的东西,它们的根基是魅力和难以理解。
en: Frye, whose Anatomy of Criticism is an invaluable compendium of thinking about lyric and other genres, calls the basic constituents of lyric babble and doodle, whose roots are charm and riddle.

zh: 诗歌咿呀道来，突出的是语言的非语义特点—声音、韵律、字母的重复一以此创造魅力或重叠：这条棕色的小溪像骏马的鬃毛，—路欢叫，奔腾而下……
en: Poems babble, foregrounding non-semantic features of language-sound, rhythm, repetition of letters-to produce charm or incantation: This darksome burn, horseback brown, His rollrock highroad roaring down .. .

zh: 为了使批评家胜任愉快，维护公认的标准而抵制托尔斯泰式的攻击缩小这些标准与通俗趣味的差距，保护文学艺术而反对清教徒及反常变态者赤裸裸的道镲说教，必须提出一种总体性的价值理论，它将不会停留在“这是好的，那是坏的"一类说法上。
en: To habilitate the critic, to defend accepted standards against Tolstoyan attacks, to narrow the interval between these standards and popular taste, to protect the arts against the crude moralities of Puritans and perverts, a general theory of value, which will not leave the statement ‘This is good, that bad,’ either vague or arbitrary, must be provided.There is no alternative open.

zh: 这类说法不是含糊便是武断，可以说別无选择，价值理论并非是文不对脱离了人们想象中的深入文学艺术本质的探索，因为如果说一种有根有据的价值理论是批评的必要条件那么同样确凿无疑，理 解文学艺术中发生的一切乃是价值理论所需要的，什么是好的？
en: Nor is it such an excursus from the inquiry into the nature of the arts as may be supposed.For if a well-grounded theory of value is a necessity for criticism, it is no less true that an understanding of what happens in the arts is needed for the theory.

zh: ” 和“什么是文学艺术这两个问题是互为照明的。
en: The two problems ‘What is good?’ and ‘What are the arts?’ reflect light upon one another.

zh: 实际上二者缺少任何一个都无法给予充分的解答。
en: Neither in fact can be fully answered without the other.

zh: 现在我们可以进而理顺第一个问题。
en: To the unravelling of the first we may now proceed.

zh: 从历史上说，研究通俗文化的思想和使一个人的成果成为一种政治介入是紧密相联的。
en: Historically, the ideas of studying popular culture and of making one’s work a political intervention are closely linked.

zh: 在六七十年代的英国，研究工人阶级的文化就有一种政治内涵。
en: In Britain in the 1960s and 1970s studying working-class culture had a political charge.

zh: 英国似乎是一个民族文化特征与高雅文化的丰碑连在一起的国家——只要想想莎士比亚和英国文学悠久的传统就知道了——所以研究通俗文化本身就是一种反抗的行为。而在美国就完全不是如此。那是一个常常用反对高雅文化来解释其民族特点的国家。
en: In Britain, where national cultural identity seemed linked to monuments of high culture – Shakespeare and the tradition of English literature, for example – the very fact of studying popular culture was an act of resistance, in a way that it isn’t in the United States, where national identity has often been defined against high culture.

zh: 在中世纪，一种商用语言逐步在地中海诸港口使用开来，该语言主要以演变成为现代意大利语和普罗旺斯语的那种语言为基础。
en: In medieval times, a trade language based largely on the languages that became modern Italian and Provençal came into use in the Mediterranean ports.

zh: 人们称这种语言为通用语，即“佛兰卡语”。
en: That language was called Lingua Franca, “Frankish language.”

zh: 这个术语后来被泛化了，用来指称其他具有相似用途的语言，因此，任何语言都可能成为一种通用语。
en: The term lingua franca was generalized to other languages similarly used.Thus, any language can be a lingua franca.

zh: 从形式表达中很容易可以看出该规则是一条同化规则，因为在[+鼻]音段前发生了[+鼻]变化。
en: It is easy to see in the formal statement of the rule that this is an assimilation rule because the change to [+nasal] occurs before [+nasal] segments.

zh: 语言中的同化规则反映协同发音——语音既可预见（后面的音影响前面的）也可接续（或者说“保留”，即前面的音影响后面的）调音过程来传播语音特征。
en: Assimilation rules in languages reflect coarticulation—the spreading of phonetic features either in the anticipation or in the perseveration (the “hanging on”) of articulatory processes.

zh: 结果使得这个词听起来更流畅一些。
en: The auditory effect is that words sound smoother.

zh: 我们在阿肯语中可以看到一种不同的同化规则。鼻音否定语素在/p/前面表达为/m/，在/t/前面表达为/n/，在/k/前面表达为/ ŋ /（这叫作同位鼻音规则）。
en: We saw a different kind of assimilation rule in Akan, where we observed that the nasal negative morpheme was expressed as [m] before /p/, [n] before /t/, and [ŋ] before /k/.(This is the homorganic nasal rule.)

zh: 在这个例子中，鼻音的调音部位—双唇，龈，软腭—被其后所接辅音的部位所同化。
en: In this case the place of articulation—bilabial, alveolar, velar—of the nasal assimilates to the place of articulation of the following consonant.

zh: 字位（即字母）与音位之间的不规则对应，常被用来作为“为什么约翰尼不会阅读？”的一个原因。
en: The irregularities between graphemes (letters) and phonemes have been cited as one reason “why Johnny can’t read.”

zh: 同形异义词，如lead[lid]和lead[led]，对拼写改革运动起到了推波助澜的作用。
en: Homographs such as lead /lid/ and lead /lɛd/ have fueled the flames of spelling reform movements.

zh: 相同发音的不同拼写、不发音的字母，以及“丢失的字母”，都被认为是英语需要一个新正字法系统的原因。
en: Different spellings for the same sound, silent letters, and missing letters also are cited as reasons that English needs a new orthographic system.

zh: 马克思主义理论认为主体是由阶级地位决定的：它或者从别人的劳动中获利，或者为别人的利润而劳动。
en: Marxist theory sees the subject as determined by class position: it either profits from others’ labour or labours for others’ profit.

zh: 女权主义理论强调社会建构的性角色在把主体制造或他或她所起的作用。
en: Feminist theory stresses the impact of socially constructed gender roles on making the subject what he or she is.

zh: 同性恋理论一直认为异性的主体是在压制同性恋行为的可能性中建构的。
en: Queer theory has argued that the heterosexual subject is constructed through the repression of the possibility of homosexuality.

zh: 同音形词可以造成歧义。
en: Homonyms can create ambiguity.

zh: 下面这个句子：I'll meet you by the bank.
en: The sentence: I’ll meet you by the bank.

zh: (我会在bank边上和你见面。）意义可能是“我会在银行边上和你见面”或者“我会在河岸边上和你见面”。
en: may mean “I’ll meet you by the financial institution” or “I’ll meet you by the riverside.”

zh: “突出”可以有多种办法，包括采用偏离语法或不合语法结构，但对雅各布森而言，最重要的手段是运用非常齐整的语言。
en: Foregrounding may be accomplished in various ways, including the use of deviant or ungrammatical constructions, but for Jakobson the principal technique is the use of highly patterned language.

zh: 他那用以识别诗学功能的语言学标准的著名定义，也由此而来：“诗学功能将同义原则从选择轴投射到组合轴上。”
en: Whence his famous definition of the linguistic criterion by which the poetic function is to be identified: ‘The poetic function projects the principle of equivalence from the axis of selection into the axis of combination’ (‘Linguistics and Poetics’, p. 358).

zh: 苏美尔人首先发明了一套图画文字系统，用以记录商业交易。
en: The Sumerians first developed a pictographic writing system to keep track of commercial transactions.

zh: 这个系统后来又扩大到其他各种用途，最终发展成高度定形（尖头笔写成的）的楔形文字。
en: It was later expanded for other uses and eventually evolved into the highly stylized (and stylus-ized) cuneiform writing.

zh: 通过应用画谜原则，楔形文字概括发展为其他的文字系统。画谜原则指用一个词或音节的符号代表与其读音相同的另一个词或音节。
en: Cuneiform was generalized to other writing systems by application of the rebus principle, which uses the symbol of one word or syllable to represent another word or syllable pronounced the same.

zh: 无论在古代还是今天，图画文字在世界各地都有发现：非洲各部落、美洲土著（包括美国阿拉斯加和加拿大的因纽特人)、秘鲁的印加人、西伯利亚的尤卡吉尔人（Yukagirian)和大洋洲土著。
en: Pictographic writing has been found throughout the world, ancient and modern: among Africans, Native Americans including the Inuits of Alaska and Canada, the Incas of Peru, the Yukagirians of Siberia, and the people of Oceania.

zh: 今天，国际通用的道路标志仍使用图画文字，因为并非所有的旅行者都懂当地语言。
en: Pictograms are used today in international road signs, where the native language of the region might not be understood by all travelers.

zh: 这种符号人人都能看懂，因为它们不依赖于任何语言。

en: Such symbols do not depend on words.

zh: 这种思维的形式在“现代”科技化的思维中并没有很大变化，尽管现代思维往佳总是错误地倾向于仅仅在语言的书面形式下考虑语言这种我们自身经验构成的、“非反映的汇总”。
en: It is a form which does not significantly vary in the case of the ‘modern’ technological mind however much that tends, misleadingly, to think of language, that formative, ‘unreflecting totalization’ of our experience, solely in its written mode.

zh: 我们和“原始人”一样也有那种思维，它原来是一种具有很大威力的、从根本上说是“创造结构的”力量。
en: That mind, which exists in us no less than in ‘primitive’ man, proves to be a fundamentally ‘structuring’ agency of considerable power.

zh: 值得考虑的明显的事实是，它创造结构的能力的最主要的表现之一—图腾制度—并不只是“野蛮人”所从事的事情。
en: And it is worth pondering the evident fact that one of the foremost manifestations of its structuring capacity, totemism, is not simply something in which ‘savages’ engage.

zh: 使用外接缀的语言中，人们更为熟悉是德语。
en: An example of a more familiar circumfixing language is German.

zh: 德语规则动词的过去分词，是通过在动词词根加上前缀ge-和后缀-t构成的。
en: The past participle of regular verbs is formed by adding the prefix ge- and the suffix -t to the verb root.

zh: 给动词词根lieb(爱）加上这样的外接缀，就会生成geliebt(动词“爱”的过去分词，或者用作形容词，意为“心爱的”）。
en: This circumfix added to the verb root lieb “love” produces geliebt, “loved” (or “beloved,” when used as an adjective).

zh: 据我所知，皮尔士在强调对那种限制可能的理论类别的规则的研究上，是独具匠心的。
en: Peirce, to my knowledge, is original and unique in stressing the problem of studying the rules that limit the class of possible theories.

zh: 当然，他的外展概念像洛伦兹的生物先验性概念一样，具有浓厚的康德气味，并且都得自于关乎形式、限度和原理的唯理主义的心理学。这些形式、限度和原理为人类思维提供了“主要支柱和联结关系”，构成了莱布尼兹所说的“我们并非总会意识到的无限知识”的基础。
en: Of course, his concept of abduction, like Lorenz’s biological a priori, has a strongly Kantian flavor, and all derive from the rationalist psychology that concerned itself with the forms, the limits, and the principles that provide “the sinews and connections” for human thought, that underlie “that infinite amount of knowledge of which we are not always conscious,” of which Leibnitz spoke.

zh: 我们之所以为人，就在于我们有身体，比较特别的是我们有神经系统。更为特别的，是它的比较高级或比较核心的相互协调的那 些部分，精神乃是一个冲动系统，这种观点不应称为唯物主义的。
en: The view that we are our bodies, more especially our nervous systems, more especially still the higher or more central coordinating parts of it, and that the mind is a system of impulses should not be described as Materialism.

zh: 人们同样不妨称之为唯心主义的在这一方面，两个术语都没有任何科学的、任何严格的象征意义或所指意义。
en: It might equally well be called Idealism.Neither term in this connection has any scientific, any strictly symbolic meaning or reference.

zh: 与德国的情况不同，英国的浪漫主义批评使用的是两个不同宇宙的类比一作诗与创造宇宙之间的相似性一意在阐明文学创作的过程而非其产品。
en: In English, unlike German romantic criticism, the heterocosmic analogue —the parallel between writing poetry and creating the universe—was used to illuminate the process more chan the product of literary invention.

zh: 直到十九世纪后期，英国批评家们仍在探索这一类比是否完全可能用以支撑这一概念，即现存的诗就是属于其自身的完全自给自足的世界。
en: It remained for English critics later in the century to explore the full possibilities of the parallel as a ground for the concept that the poem-in-being is its own and utterly self-sufficient world.

zh: 关于这一传统做法，有一份文献道出了真谛，那就是A.C.布拉德利发表于1901年的牛津演讲《为诗而诗》。
en: A. C, Bradley's Oxford lecture, Poetry for Poetry's Sake published in 1901, is a revealing document in this tradition.

zh: 这个演讲一方面简要地总结了为艺术而艺术这一审美原则（事实上它已成了为艺术而生活的道德原则）中立足最稳的东西。
en: On the one side, the lecture epitomizes what had been most tenable in the aesthetic doctrine of Art for Art's Sake (which, in its common form, had really been a moral doctrine of Life for Art's Sake).

zh: 另一方面，他在演讲中也表述了后来成为当今某些批评家的中心论点的东西，这些批评家（没有注意到其不一致性）引用了麦克利什的关于诗不表达真实而只是存在的富有诗意的表述，并把它视为真理。
en: On the other side, ic formulates what has since become the central position of present-day critics who (without noticing the incongruity) cite as a truth MacLeish'S poetic statement that a poem does not state truth but simply exists.

zh: 该假说比较温和的一个形式是语言相对论，认为不同的语言对不同的范畴编码，因此说不同语言的人对世界的思考有不同的方式。
en: A weaker form of the hypothesis is linguistic relativism, which says that different languages encode different categories and that speakers of different languages therefore think about the world in different ways.

zh: 比如，不同的语言在色谱上截取颜色的分界点不同。
en: For example, languages break up the color spectrum at different points.

zh: 在印第安纳瓦霍语里，蓝色和绿色是同一个词。
en: In Navaho, blue and green are one word.

zh: 俄语中的深蓝色和天蓝色用不同的词表示，而在英语里，我们需要用dark(深）和sky(天来区别其中的差异。
en: Russian has different words for dark blue (siniy) and light blue (goluboy), while in English we need to use the additional words dark and light to express the difference.

zh: 美国印第安祖尼语不区别黄色和橙色。
en: The American Indian language Zuni does not distinguish between the colors yellow and orange.

zh: 语言在表达方位方面也不尽相同。
en: Languages also differ in how they express locations.

zh: 最后，我们还重新选编了“选读书目”，使所列著作更简明，更新，更容易找到。
en: Finally, the ‘Selected Reading’ sections have again been recast to make them more accessible and up-to-date.

zh: 这里一个显著的改动是增加了许多当代文论基础文本第一版的出版日期，并将它们置于方括号中，这样 就可以使读者看出它们是多早问世的以及它们在后来的种种现代版本中产生的影响。
en: One notable change in these is the inclusion (in square brackets) of dates of first publication for many of the founding texts of contemporary literary theory in order to indicate how much earlier they often are than the modern editions by which they subsequently made their impact.

zh: 出于同样的考虑，那些译入英语的具有原创性的欧陆文本第一版的日期也标示了出来。
en: Equally, the date of translation into English of seminal European texts is included for the same reason.

zh: 这些观念彻底变革了浪漫主义特别是文艺复兴文学。
en: These ideas have revolutionized the study of Romantic and especially Renaissance literature.

zh: 斯蒂芬·格林布拉特（Stephen Greenblatt）、路易·奥格尔（Louis Montrose）、乔纳森·戈德堡（Jonathan Goldberg）、斯蒂芬·奥格尔（Stephen Orgel ）、奥列纳德·坦纳豪斯（Leonard Tennenhouse）之辈新历史主义者探索了伊丽莎白世代文学文本（特别是戏剧、假面剧、田园诗）如何表达都铎王朝的政治关怀，从而生产并更新了支撑其政体的权利话语。
en: New Historicists such as Stephen Greenblatt, Louis Montrose, Jonathan Goldberg, Stephen Orgel and Leonard Tennenhouse explore the ways in which Elizabethan literary texts (especially drama, masque and pastoral) act out the concerns of the Tudor monarchy, reproducing and renewing the powerful discourses which sustain the system.

zh: 他们看出，那个君主政体的王朝正是控制权利结构的中枢。
en: They see the monarchy as the central axis governing the power structure.

zh: 沃尔夫的文章一发表后，心理语言学家列能伯格和布朗就指出他的论点中的两个不合理地方。
en: As soon as Whorf's articles appeared, the psycholinguists Eric Lenneberg and Roger Brown pointed out two non sequiturs in his argument.

zh: 第一就是沃尔夫并没有真正去研究阿帕契人，没存任何证据说他真的碰过阿帕契人;他只研究过阿帕契语的文法，所以这使得他的论点变得拐穹抹角—阿帕契人说话说得不一样，所以他们思考不一样。
en: First, Whorf did not actually study any Apaches; it is not clear that he ever met one.His assertions about Apache psychology are based entirely on Apache grammar ——making his argument circular.Apaches speak differently, so they must think differently.

zh: 我们怎么知道他们思考是不一样的?
en: How do we know that they think differently?

zh: 只要去听他们讲话的方式就晓得了！
en: Just listen to the way they speak!

zh: 新批评其实是在把诗变为崇拜偶像。
en: What New Criticism did, in fact, was to convert the poem into a fetish.

zh: 如果说I.A.理查兹已将作品”非物质化“，使之仅仅成为开向诗人心灵的一扇透明窗户，那么，美国新批评价家们却过分将其重新物质化了，使之看来不像那么一种意义过程却更像某种具有四角和水刷石前脸的建筑物，这可颇有反讽意味。
en: If I. A. Richards had 'dematerialized' the text, reducing it to a transparent window on to the poet's psyche, the American New Critics rematerialized it with a vengeance, making it seem less like a process of meaning than something with four corners and a pebbledash front.

zh: 因为这种诗所抗议的那个社会秩序恰恰充满了这样的”物化“，它们把人、过程和机构统统转变为“东西”。
en: This is ironic, since the very social order against which such poetry was a protest was rife with such 'reifications', transforming people, processes and institutions into 'things'.

zh: 一般来说，可数/不可数的区分对应于离散物体和同质物质之间的差异。
en: Generally, the count/mass distinction corresponds to the difference between discrete objects and homogeneous substances.

zh: 认为这种区别的基础在于人类感知的说法是错误的，因为不同语言看待同一物体的方式可能有所不同。
en: But it would be incorrect to say that this distinction is grounded in human perception, because different lan- guages may treat the same object differently.

zh: 例如，在英语中，hair(头发） 、furniture(家具）和spaghetti(意大利式细面条）是物质名词。
en: For example, in English the words hair, furniture, and spaghetti are mass nouns.

zh: 说服男孩放弃对母亲的乱伦欲望的是父亲的阉割威胁。
en: What persuades the boy-child to abandon his incestuous desire for the mother is the father's threat of castration.

zh: 这一威胁不必明言，但是男孩发现女孩是“阉割过的”以后，他开始想象这是一个也会落到自己头上的威胁。
en: This threat need not necessarily be spoken; but the boy, in perceiving that the girl is herself 'castrated', begins to imagine this as a punishment which might be visited upon himself.

zh: 他因而在一种提心吊胆的顺从中压抑自己的乱伦欲望，使自己顺应“现实原则”，向父亲屈服，与母亲疏远，并且安于一种潜意识的慰解，即：虽然现在他没有希望驱逐父亲占有母亲。但是父亲象征了一个地位，一种可能性，这是他自己将来能够占据和实现的。
en: He thus represses his incestuous desire in anxious resignation, adjusts himself to the 'reality principle', submits to the father, detaches himself from the mother, and comforts himself with the unconscious consolation that though he cannot now hope to oust his father and possess his mother, his father symbolizes a place, a possibility, which he himself will be able to take up and realize in the furture.

zh: 正是这种把文学看成是一种语言，一个自主的、内部连贯的、自我限制的、自我调节的、自我证明的结构的观点，是形式主义批评具有活力的地方，并把它和语言学和人类学中的“结构”运动明显地联系在一起。
en: It is this notion of literature as a kind of langue, an autonomous, internally coherent, self-limiting, self-regulating, self-justifying structure, which centrally animates formalist criticism and links it clearly with ‘structural’ developments in linguistics and anthropology.

zh: 个别的艺术作品就象一种“言语”同它的母系“语言”发生关系，在这种关系中，一方映照另外一方，同时又为另外一方所映照。
en: The individual work of art stands as a sort of parole in relation to its parent langue, a relationship in which each illuminates and is illuminated by the other.

zh: 简言之，规则性或曰约定俗成而不容置疑的结构“规则”的实施，其实是文学艺术永葆青春的原则。
en: In short, conventionality, the operation of tacit unquestioned structural ‘rules’, emerges as the animating principle of literary art.

zh: 不管那种艺术是否自命为“现实主义”，它总是受规则的束缚，这些规则就如象棋规则一样。
en: Whether that art has pretensions towards ‘realism’ or not, it remains as ‘bound’ by conventions which act as rules as much as a game of chess does.

zh: 我们最熟悉的“动机”类型莫过于通常所谓的“现实主义”了。
en: The most familiar type of ‘motivation’ is what we usually call ‘realism’.

zh: 一部作品，无论它是如何在形式上构成的，我么总期望它给我们对于“真实”的某种幻觉。
en: No matter how formally constructed a work may be, we still often expect it to give us the illusion of the ‘real’.

zh: 我们指望文学是“栩栩如生的”，作品中那些与我们预期的现实世界的一般看法不相容的人物或描写很可能令我们恼怒。
en: We expect literature to be ‘life-like’, and may be irritated by characters or descriptions which fail to match our common-sense expectations of what the real world is like.

zh: 赫希眼中牢牢盯住的靶子是海德格尔、加答默尔及其他人的诠释学。
en: The target which Hirsch has firmly in his sights is the hermeneutics of Heidegger, Gadamer and others.

zh: 对他来说，这些思想家关于意义始终是历史性的这一坚决主张打开了通向完全相对主义的大门。
en: For him, the insistence of these thinkers that meaning is always historical opens the door to complete relativism.

zh: 根据这种相对主义的论点，一部文学作品能在星期一意谓一种东西，星期五意谓另一种东西。
en: On this argument, a literary work can mean one thing on Monday and another on Friday.

zh: 我们可以了解前一个时代的档案馆，那是因为我们已经与它距离遥远，与它完全不同。
en: We can understand an earlier archive only because we are utterly different and remote from it.

zh: 例如，当我们阅读文艺复兴时代的文学时，我们常常可以看到它在文辞运用上的华丽丰赡。
en: For example, when we read the literature of the Renaissance, we often notice the richness and exuberance of its verbal play.

zh: 福柯在《事物的秩序》中阐明，相似性在这个时代所有知识领域中成为核心的结构法则。
en: In The Order of Things, Foucault shows that in this period resemblance played a central role in the structure of all knowledges.

zh: 每一件事都与别一件事相互回应；没有一件事可以独立于别一件事之外。
en: Everything echoed everything else; nothing stood on its own.

zh: 我们从约翰·邓恩（John Donne）的诗歌中可以清晰而生动地看出这点。邓恩的思绪从不停留在一个客体上，而是来往穿梭于精神与物质、人与神、宇宙与个人之间。
en: We see this vividly in the poetry of John Donne, whose mind never rests on an object but moves back and forth from spiritual to physical, human to divine, and universal to individual.

zh: 文字的听觉形象属于最为明显的精神经历。
en: Auditory images of words are among the most obvious of mental happenings.

zh: 对大多数人说来，读得很慢的任何一行诗句或散文在想象中默不作声地听起来仿佛跟朗读时的情形一样。
en: Any line of verse or prose slowly read, will, for most people, sound mutely in the imagination somewhat as it would if read aloud.

zh: 可是读者会产生的形象声音与实际声音之间的相似程度则千变万化。
en: But the degree of correspondence between the image-sounds, and the actual sounds that the reader would produce, varies enormously.

zh: 和许多人发出文字声音的情形相比之下，他们能够以更大的灵敏度和辨別力去想象文字声音。
en: Many people are able to imagine word-sounds with greater delicacy and discrimination than they can utter them.

zh: 有趣的是，在同样的年龄阶段，儿童手语者也会犯同样的错误。
en: Interestingly, at this same age signing children make this same error.

zh: 他们在表示“你”时常常手指着自己，而表示“我”时却手指着听话人。
en: They will point to themselves when they mean “you” and point to the addressee when they mean “I.”

zh: 尽管这些特定手势的意义是透明或象似的，但正在习得ASL的儿童还是会犯这种错误，这是因为儿童手语者（与成人手语者一样）把这些代词当作语言符号，而不仅仅是指点的手势。
en: Children acquiring ASL make this error despite the transparency or iconicity of these particular signs, because signing children (like signing adults) treat these pronouns as linguistic symbols and not simply as pointing gestures.

zh: 象征融合了动与静、混乱内容与有机形式，心灵与世界。
en: The symbol fused together motion and stillness, turbulent content and organic form, mind and world.

zh: 它的物质形体是绝对精神真理的媒介，认识这一真理的是直接的直觉而非任何艰苦的批评分析过程。
en: Its material body was the medium of an absolute spiritual truth, one perceived by direct intuition rather than by any laborious process of critical analysis.

zh: 就此而论，象征以一种不容怀疑的方式使这样的真理与心灵接触：或者你看见它，或者你看不见它。
en: In this sense the symbol brought such truths to bear on the mind in a way which brooked no question: either you saw it or you didn't.

zh: 象征是非理性主义的基石，是对合理的批评探究的事先破坏，这些东西自此以后就一直猖獗于文学理论之中。
en: It was the keystone of an irrationalism, a forestalling of reasoned critical enquiry, which has been rampant in literary theory ever since.

zh: 象征是统一之物；因此，解剖象征——把它拆开来研究它的活动机制——几乎就像试图分析三位一体一样亵渎神灵。
en: It was a unitary thing, and to dissect it — to take it apart to see how it worked — was almost as blasphemous as seeking to analyse the Holy Trinity.

zh: 象征的所有不同部分都各在自己的从属地位上为了共同利益而自发地一起进行工作。因此，象征，或文学作品本身，在整个19世纪和20世纪一直作为人类社会本身的一个理想模式出现是毫不奇怪的。
en: All of its various parts worked spontaneously together for the common good, each in its subordinate place; and it is therefore hardly surprising to find the symbol, or the literary artefact as such, being regularly offered throughout the nineteenth and twentieth centuries as an ideal model of human society itself.

zh: 感觉到的对立面的最终和解，被列维-斯特劳斯看成是神话和图腾崇拜的目的，它当然也是"哲学”思维的目的。
en: Reconcilement of perceived opposites has been seen to be the aim of myth and totemism: it is of course also the aim of ‘philosophical’ thought.

zh: 他说，哲学家的思维和印第安人表现在图腾体系和神话中的思维显示出相同的愿望，“以完整的形式了解现实的两方面……连续和中断”。
en: Both the philosopher’s thinking, and that of the Indian, manifested in totemic systems and myths, show the same desire, says Lévi-Strauss, ‘to apprehend in a total fashion the two aspects of reality . . . continuous and discontinuous’.

zh: 碰巧，在称之为象征主义的文学运动中，关于时间的这种相同的“对立”的和解成为诸如T·S•艾略特这些诗人刻意追求的东西。
en: It happens that, in respect of the literary movement called Symbolism, reconcilement of the same ‘opposition’ with regard to time formed a central preoccupation of poets such as T. S. Eliot.

zh: 米尔说，诗歌“体现在各种象征之中。不论情感以何种形态存在于诗人心中，这些象征总能尽可能准确地把它表现出来”。这一论述是休姆理论的先声，也为从波德莱尔到托·斯·艾略特的象征主义者的创作实践奠定了理论基础。
en: Poetry, said Mill, in a phrasing which anticipates T. E. Hulme and lays the theoretical groundwork for the practice of symbolists from Baudelaire through T. S. Eliot, embodies 'itself' in symbols, which are the nearest possible representations of the feeling in the exact shape in which it exists in the poet's mind.

zh: 有意思的是，人们现在还不清楚人类的心理分析器是否运用这种回溯策略或并行策略来处理歧义，抑或两种策略并用，或用另外的某种策略。
en: Interestingly, it is not established within psycholinguistics whether the human parser uses backtracking or parallelism to deal with ambiguity, or perhaps a combination, or some alternative strategy.

zh: 这对心理语言学家而言仍然是难题。
en: This remains a challenge for psycholinguists.

zh: 而解决这个难题却是很困难的，因为人们通常很容易处理歧义，理解说话人想要表达的意义。我们现在也没有见到很多证据证明人们需要做许多额外的工作来处理其他可能的意义。
en: Figuring this out is difficult because people usually handle ambiguity and arrive at the intended meaning easily, and we do not see much evidence that they are doing lots of extra work to deal with additional possible meanings.

zh: 刁钻的语言学家必须含辛茹苦多年才能找到困扰人类的心理分析器的例子，比如，我们前面讨论过的花园小径句。
en: Fiendish linguists must toil long and hard to come up with examples like the garden path sentences discussed earlier that confuse the human parser.

zh: 本书的探讨将表明，许多概念对于澄清艺术的性质和标准都极有裨益。然而这些概念并非获自对审美事实的简单考察，而似乎是从那些有益的类比物中发掘出来的。这些类比物的属性由于隐喻性的转义而成了艺术作品所固有的属性。
en: As this inquiry will indicate, a number of concepts most rewarding in clarifying the nature and criteria of art were not found simply in the examination of aesthetic facts, but seem to have emerged from the exploration of serviceable analogues, whose properties were, by metaphorical transfer, predicated of a work of art.

zh: 据此，从新古典主义批评到浪漫主义批评的变迁，可以初步表述为批评术语中典型隐喻的根本变化。
en: From this point of view the shift from neo-classic criticism to romantic criticism can be formulated, in a preliminary way, as a radical alteration in the typical metaphors of critical discourse.

zh: 但我认为值得强调的是，尽管这个观点还有缺陷，但它仍是一个应该认真对待的观点，在其结论中没有任何荒谬之处。
en: I think it is important to stress that, with all its gaps and deficiencies, it is an argument that must be taken seriously.There is nothing at all absurd in the conclusion.

zh: 据我看，在西方思想发展的那一特定时期，很有可能产生一种至今并不存在的心理科学。这 种心理学从对人类知识和信念的各种体系的表征问題出发，从这些知识和信念得以组织起来的槪念和隐藏在这些知识和信念底层的原理着手，只有这样，它才进一歩去研究这些系统是如何从一些先天构造和机体——环境相互作用的总和中发展形成的。
en: It seems to me quite possible that at that particular moment in the development of Western thought there was the possibility for the birth of a science of psychology of a sort that still does not exist, a psychology that begins with the problem of characterizing various systems of human knowledge and belief, the concepts in terms of which they are organized and the principles that underlie them, and that only then turns to the study of how these systems might have developed through some combination of innate structure and organism – environment interaction.

zh: 这种心理学与如下的一种研究人的智慧的方法是冲突的。该方法首先在先验的基琎上假定某种特殊的机制，并宣称，这种机制必定就是位于所有的知识和信念莸得过程的底层的东西。
en: Such a psychology would contrast rather sharply with the approach to human intelligence that begins by postulating, on a priori grounds, certain specific mechanisms that, it is claimed, must be those underlying the acquisition of all knowledge and belief.

zh: 请考虑行走问题:显然，在“目的性”最一般的意义上讲，行走是有目的的。
en: Consider walking: clearly,walking is purposive behavior, in the most general sense of “purposive.”

zh: 亊实上，在刚才定义的意义上讲，行走也是“有句法的”，就象卡尔·莱什（Karl Lashley）很久以前在讨论行为的顺次秩序问题时所指出的那样——我在第一章中曾提到过此。
en: Walking is also “syntactic” in the sense just defined, as, in fact, Karl Lashley pointed out a long time ago in his important discussion of serial order in behavior, to which I referred in the first lecture.4

zh: 不仅如此，行走肯定是可以报告信息的。例如，我可以通过我行走的速度和强度来表明我对达到某一目标的兴趣。
en: Furthermore, it can certainly be informative; for example, I can signal my interest in reaching a certain goal by the speed or intensity with which I walk.

zh: 例如，英语的结构是主语-动词-宾语（SVO)。
en: For example, English is a Subject–Verb–Object (SVO) language.

zh: 英语例句1合乎语法，因为词都按照正确的顺序排列；例句2不合语法，因为其词序对英语而言不正确。
en: The English sentence in (1) is grammatical because the words occur in the right order; the sentence in (2) is ungrammatical because the word order is incorrect for English.

zh: （前文说过，句子之前的星号是一项语言学规约，用以表明根据语法规则这个句子不合语法或不合式。）
en: (Recall that the asterisk or star preceding a sentence is the linguistic convention for indicating that the sentence is ungrammatical or ill-formed according to the rules of the grammar.)

zh: 关于语言习得的心理机制有各种各样的说法。
en: There have been various proposals concerning the psychological mechanisms involved in acquiring a language.

zh: 早期的语言习得理论深受行为主义——20世纪50年代盛行的一个心理学派——的影响。
en: Early theories of language acquisition were heavily influenced by behaviorism, a school of psychology prevalent in the 1950s.

zh: 顾名思义,行为主义关注的是可以直接观察到的人的行为，而不是支持这些行为的心理系统。
en: As the name implies, behaviorism focused on people’s behaviors, which are directly observable, rather than on the mental systems underlying these behaviors.

zh: 因此，他的“后理论”其实是“更多的理论”，在一种更宏伟、更负责的层面上，向后现代主义逃避的那些更大的问题敞开胸怀。这些问题包括道德、形而上学、爱情、生物学、宗教与革命、恶、死亡与苦难、本质、普遍性、真理、客观性与无功利性等。
en: ‘After theory’ therefore means more theory, on a grander and more responsible scale, open to the large questions postmodernism has shied away from: of morality and metaphysics, love, biology, religion and revolution, evil, death and suffering, essences, universals, truth, objectivity and disinterestedness.

zh: 这就是说，他这个宏大的新构想既包含了一种拓展的马克思主义，也包含了对自由主义某些原则的重新评价。
en: This new project embraces, that is to say, both an expanded Marxism and a revaluation of some of the keystones of liberalism.

zh: 以“The happy boy eats ice cream.
en: Take the sentence “The happy boy eats ice cream”.

zh: ”为例，它的开头是以3个字放在一起，组成—个单位，我们叫它名词短语-the happy boy。
en: It begins with three words that hang together as a unit, the noun phrase “the happy boy”.

zh: 在英文里，名词短语（NP)是由名词(N)前面加一个冠词或限定词 (略写为det),与任何数目的形容词(A)所组成的。
en: In English a noun phrase (NP) is composed of a noun (N), sometimes preceded by an article or ''determiner'' (abbreviated ''det'') and any number of adjectives (A).

zh: 在语言学上箭头表示由什么组成，括弧表示可用可不用，星号表示随便你要用几次。我讲这些符号的意思是说，上面这些讯息只要用几个符号就可很正确地表达出来了。你可以不必去管这些符号，只要看我们如何转译句子。
en: In the standard notation of linguistics, an arrow means ''consists of,'' parentheses mean ''optional," and an asterisk means ''as many of them as you want,'' but I provide the rule just to show that all of its information can be captured precisely in a few symbols; you can ignore the notation and just look at the translation into ordinary words below it.

zh: 某些动词，例如think（认为），选择句子作为补足语，例如I think that Sam won the race （我认为山姆赢得了赛跑）。
en: Some verbs, such as think, select a sentence complement, as in “I think that Sam won the race.”

zh: 其他的动词，例如tell（告诉），选择一个NP和一个句子作为补足语，例如I told Sam that Michael was on his bicycle（我告诉山姆迈克尔骑在自行车上）；然而还有其他动词，例如feel（觉得）或是选择一个AdjP或是选择一个句子作为补足语（斜体是补足语）：They felt strong as oxen.
en: Other verbs, like tell, select an NP and a sentence, as in “Itold Sam that Michael was on his bicycle”; yet other verbs like feel select either an AdjP or a sentence complement.(Complements are italicized.)

zh: （他们觉得自己体壮如牛。）
en: Paul felt strong as an ox.

zh: They feel that they can win.（他们觉得他们能臝。）
en: He feels that he can win.

zh: 对于词的内部结构和构词规则的研究，就是形态学。
en: The study of the internal structure of words, and of the rules by which words are formed, is morphology.

zh: 这个词本身就由两个语素构成： morph +ology。
en: This word itself consists of two morphemes, morph + ology.

zh: 后缀-ology意思是“ 关于……的科学” 或者指“ 有关……的知识分支” 。因此，形态学的意义就是“ 关于词汇形式的科学” 。
en: The suffix -ology means “science of” or “branch of knowledge concerning.”Thus, the meaning of morphology is “the science of (word) forms.”

zh: 另一常见的批评是，弗洛伊德“把什么东西都归结为性”——用术语说，他是一个“泛性论者”。
en: Another common criticism is that Freud 'brings everything down to sex' — that he is, in the technical term, a 'pan-sexualist'.

zh: 这当然是站不住脚的：弗洛伊德是一位非常彻底的二元论思想家，甚至无疑有些过分，而且总是把自我保存的“自我本能”等非性力量与性欲动对立起来。
en: This is certainly untenable: Freud was a radically dualistic thinker, no doubt excessively so, and always counterposed to the sexual drives such non-sexual forces as the 'ego-instincts' of self-perservation.

zh: 泛性论指责的合理成份在于，弗洛伊德认为性足以成为人类生活的中心，成为我们一切活动的一个构成部分；但这并不是性还原论。
en: The seed of truth in the pan-sexualist charge is that Freud regarded sexuality as central enough to human life to provide a component of all our activities; but that is not a sexual reductionism.

zh: 以为存在着一种单一的“标准”语言，一种由所有社会成员同等分享的通货，这是一种错觉。
en: The idea that there is a single 'normal' language, a common currency shared equally by all members of society, is an illusion.

zh: 任何实际语言都由极为复杂的各种话语所组成，这些话语由于使用者的阶级、地区、性别身份等等的不同而互有区别。它们不可能被整整齐齐地结合成一个单独的、纯粹的语言共同体。
en: Any actual language consists of a highly complex range of discourses, differentiated according to class, region, gender, status and so on, which can by no means be neatly unified into a single homogeneous linguistic community.

zh: 米利特借鉴了科学中区分“性”与“性别”的重要观点:“性”是生理决定的特征；而“性别”则是一个心理学概念，它指文化上要求的性别身份。她和其他女性主义者一起抨击那些把文化上习得的“女性”特征（被动性等）看作是“自然”属性的社会科学家。
en: Millett borrows from social science the important distinction between ‘sex’ and ‘gender’, where sex is determined biologically but ‘gender’ is a psychological concept which refers to culturally acquired sexual identity, and she and other feminists have attacked social scientists who treat the culturally learned ‘female’ characteristics (passivity, etc.) as ‘natural’.

zh: 她认识到，女人同男人一样会使这些态度永久化，而在控制与从属的不平等与压抑关系中扮演这些性角色，她则称之为“性政治”。
en: She recognizes that women as much as men perpetuate these attitudes, and the acting-out of these sex-roles in the unequal and repressive relations of domination and subordination is what Millett calls ‘sexual politics’.

zh: “修辞”是古代表示说服艺术的一个经典术语。
en: ‘Rhetoric’ is the classical term for the art of persuasion.

zh: 德·曼关注的是修辞学论文中常常提到的“修辞格”( tropes）的理论。“修辞格”允许作家说一样事，但却指另一样事：以一个符号代替另一个（ 隐喻）、把一个链条中符号的意义从一个移至另一个上（换喻）等。
en: De Man is concerned with the theory of ‘tropes’which accompanies rhetorical treatises. ‘Figures of speech’ (tropes) allow writers to say one thing but mean something else: to substitute one sign for another (metaphor), to displace meaning from one sign in a chain to another (metonymy), and so on.

zh: 不要求学生们去解释这些范例，像我们现在解释文学作品一样去找出它们“到底是关于什么的”。
