en: More frequently, lingua francas serve as trade languages.

zh: 在东非居住着数百个村庄，每个村庄都说他们自己的语言，但这一地区的许多非洲人至少学习了某种斯瓦希里语作为他们的第二语言。几乎在每个市场都使用这种通用语，大家都听得懂。
en: East Africa is populated by hundreds of villages, each speaking its own language, but most Africans of this area learn at least some Swahili as a second language, and this lingua franca is used and understood in nearly every marketplace.

zh: 尼日利亚也存在类似的情况，豪萨语是那里的通用语。
en: A similar situation exists in Nigeria, where Hausa is the lingua franca.

zh: 在英语和其他语言中，还有许多别的同化规则的例子。
en: There are many assimilation rules in English and other languages.

zh: 前面说到，英语的规则名词复数后缀，带声的/z/，在清音后面变成/s/，与此类似的，英语的规则动词过去时后缀，带声的/d/，在清音后面变成/t/。
en: Recall that the voiced /z/ of the English regular plural suffix is changed to [s] after a voiceless sound, and that similarly the voiced /d/ of the English regular past-tense suffix is changed to [t] after a voiceless sound.

zh: 这些都是带音被同化的例子。
en: These are instances of voicing assimilation.

zh: 同音形词意义不同，但发音相同，而拼写则可能相同，也可能不同。
en: Homonyms are words that have different meanings but are pronounced the same, and may or may not be spelled the same.

zh: （当拼写相同时，它们是同形异义词，但当同形异义词发音不同时，比如pussy“猫咪”意思是“感染”或“猫”，它们被称为“同义词”，而不是同音异义词。）
en: (They’re homographs when spelled the same, but when homographs are pronounced differently like pussy meaning “infected” or pussy meaning “kitten,” they are called heteronyms rather than homonyms.)

zh: 她对莎士比亚十四行诗、威契菜的剧作《乡下妻子》、丁尼生、乔治·爱略特和狄更斯等人作品的研究阐明了这类作品历史化与祛历史化的矛盾倾向。
en: Her study of Shakespeare’s Sonnets, Wycherley’s play, The Country Wife, Tennyson, George Eliot and Dickens illustrates the paradoxically historicizing and dehistoricizing tendencies of this kind of work.

zh: 此书关于哥特式小说是“恐怖主义和同性恋恐慌”的说法也颇有名。
en: The book is also notable for its discussion of the Gothic as ‘Terrorism and Homosexual Panic’.

zh: 她特别(以弗洛伊德理论为依据)探索了“妄想狂是一种精神病，描画了同性恋恐惧症的机制” 。
en: In particular (building on Freud), she explores the theory that ‘paranoia is the psychosis that makes graphic the mechanisms of homophobia’.

zh: 此外，一方面，在那些与英国保持密切联系的殖民者身上，可以反映出英国英语的变化;另一方面，英国英语的早期形式则仍被保留在向西拓展的美国人中间，因为他们与大西洋彼岸的交流中断了。
en: In addition, the colonists who maintained close contact with England reflected the changes occurring in British English, while earlier forms were preserved among Americans who spread westward and broke communication with the Atlantic coast.

zh: 对地域方言的研究产生了方言地图集，采用方言地图标明了话语中具有特殊方言特点的各个地区。
en: The study of regional dialects has produced dialect atlases, with dialect maps showing the areas where specific dialect characteristics occur in the speech of the region.

zh: 每一个地区用称为同言线的线条标出边界。
en: A boundary line called an isogloss delineates each area.

zh: 这几段文字幽默的基础在于几对不同的同音形词：flower(花（和flour（面粉），还有ground的两个意义。
en: The confusion and humor is based on the different sets of homonyms: flower and flour and the two meanings of ground.

zh: 爱丽丝说的ground意义是grind（磨）的过去时，而白女王则把ground理解成“土地”了。
en: Alice means ground as the past tense of grind, whereas the White Queen is interpreting ground to mean “earth.”

zh: 第二段文字则是tale和tail这两个同音形词造成了误会。
图画文字和表意文字的区别并不总是一清二楚的。
en: The difference between pictograms and ideograms is not always clear.

zh: 表意文字倾向于不太直接地代表所指事物，我们必须通过学习才能明白某个特定表意文字的意义。
en: Ideograms tend to be less direct representations, and one may have to learn what a particular ideogram means.

zh: 而图画文字则更为直观。
en: Pictograms tend to be more literal.

zh: 例如，由一个黑色圆圈在中间加一条横穿其间的红斜杠组成的“严禁停车”符号，是一个表意文字，它以抽象方式表示“严禁停车”这一概念。
en: For example, the no parking symbol consisting of a black letter P inside a red circle with a slanting red line through it is an ideogram.It represents the idea of no parking abstractly.

zh: 同一个符号如果由一辆正在被拖走的车辆来表示，就比较直观，更像一幅图画文字。
en: A no parking symbol showing an automobile being towed away is more literal, more like a pictogram.

zh: 在有外接缀的语言中，词根就是外接缀所包裹的词汇形式。举例来说，奇卡索语ik-chokm-o中的chokm就是词根。
en: In languages that have circumfixes, the root is the form around which the circumfix attaches, for example, the Chickasaw root chokm in ikchokmo (“he isn’t good”).

zh: 在有中缀的语言中，词根是指中缀加入其中的词汇形式。比如，邦托克语f-um-ikas中的fikas就是词根。
en: In infixing languages the root is the form into which the infix is inserted; for example, fikas in the Bontoc word fumikas (“to be strong”).

zh: 在9世纪和10世纪期间，斯堪的纳维亚入侵者最终在不列颠群岛上定居下来，并在英语中留下了痕迹。
en: During the ninth and tenth centuries, Scandinavian raiders, who eventually settled in the British Isles, left their traces in the English language.

zh: 代词they(他们，主格），their(他们的，属格）和them(他们，宾格）是外来词，来源于古斯堪的纳维亚语，即现代丹麦语、挪威语和瑞典语的前身。
en: The pronounsthey, their, and them are loan words from Old Norse, the predecessor of modern Danish, Norwegian, and Swedish.

zh: 英语仅在这段时期从其他语言中借用了代词。

en: This period is the only time that English ever borrowed pronouns.

zh: 这里似乎很淸楚，皮尔士的论证完全没有说服力，而且对它本来想取而代之的先定和谐说，也没有什么改进。
en: Here,it seems clear that Peirce’s argument is entirely without force and that it offers little improvement over the pre-established harmony that it was presumably intended to replace.

zh: 心理是自然法则的产物这一事实，并不意味着心理具有理解这些法则或通过“外展”得出这些法则的能力。
en: The fact that the mind is a product of natural laws does not imply that it is equipped to understand these laws or to arrive at them by “abduction.”

zh: 要设计出一种装置(例如，编写一部计算机程序），一种自然法则的产物，并非难事，但输入数据后，它可能会得出任意荒谬的理论来“解释”这些数据。
en: There would be no difficulty in designing a device(say, programing a computer)that is a product of natural laws, but that, given data, will arrive at any arbitrary absurd theory to “explain” these data.

zh: 使用委婉语并不是新鲜事。
en: The use of euphemisms is not new.

zh: 据报道希腊历史学家普卢塔克在公元1世纪曾写道，“古代的雅典人……过去曾用吉利、礼貌的术语来掩盖事物的丑陋，给它们以礼貌、讨人喜欢的名字。因此，他们称harlots （妓女）为companions （伴侣），称taxes （纳税）为contributions （捐款），称prison （监狱）为chamber （房间）。”
en: It is reported that the Greek historian Plutarch in the first century c.e.wrote that “the ancient Athenians . . . used to cover up the ugliness of things with auspicious and kindly terms, giving them polite and endearing names. Thus they called harlots companions, taxes contributions, and prison a chamber.”

zh: 许多失语症患者并非丧失全部语言功能，而只是不同语言功能的选择性障碍。障碍的类型，一般都与脑损伤的位置有关。
en: Most aphasics do not show total language loss.Rather, different aspects of language are selectively impaired, and the kind of impairment is generally related to the location of the brain damage.

zh: 由于脑损伤与语言缺陷之间存在着这种关联，所以，对失语症病人的研究为弄清语言在人脑中的组织机制，提供了大量的信息。
en: Because of this damage-deficit correlation, research on patients with aphasia has provided a great deal of information about how language is organized in the brain.

zh: 琳达· 哈琴对詹姆逊和伊格尔顿的某些观点有不同看法。詹姆逊和伊格尔顿认为，后现代主义的文本间性只是以一种浅薄的、妥协的怀旧形式复制过去，而不是揭示其话语和意识形态中的结构。
en: Linda Hutcheon disputes the implication she finds in both Jameson and Eagleton that postmodernist intertextuality merely reproduces the past in the form of a shallow and compromised nostalgia rather than revealing its construction in discourse and ideology.

zh: 哈琴对此提出了批评，在《后现代主义政治》（1989） 中， 她通过分析伊格尔顿自己的历史小说《圣哲与学者》（1987），批评他“作为一个马克思主义批评家居然指责后现代小说是非历史的”。
en: In The Politics of Postmodernism (1989), she replies to Eagleton – ‘a Marxist critic who has accused postmodern fiction of being ahistorical’ – by way of an analysis of his own historical novel, Saints and Scholars (1987).

zh: 文化研究就是探讨我们在多大程度上受文化形式的操纵，以及我们能在多大程度上，或者用哪些方式使文化为其他目的服务，就像人们说的，发挥“能动作用”。
en: Cultural studies ask how far we are manipulated by cultural forms and how far or in what ways we are able to use them for other purposes, exercising‘agency’, as it is called.

zh: （“能动作用”是当前理论的简略提法。该问题是关乎我们在多大程度上可以成为对自己行为负责的主体，以及我们貌似自主的选择在多大程度上受制于我们所不能控制的力量的问题。）
en: (The question of ‘agency’, to use the shorthand of current theory, is the question of how far we can be subjects responsible for our actions and how far our apparent choices are constrained by forces we do not control.)

zh: 在文艺复兴时期，新兴的中产阶级想要自己的子女说“上层”阶级的方言。
en: In the Renaissance a new middle class emerged who wanted their children to speak the dialect of the “upper” classes.

zh: 这一愿望使得许多规定语法得以出版。
en: This desire led to the publication of many prescriptive grammars.

zh: 1762年，罗伯特•洛思主教写了一部《英语语法简论及评注》。
en: In 1762 Bishop Robert Lowth wrote A Short Introduction to English Grammar with Critical Notes.

zh: 洛思为英语制定了许多新规则，很多规定受到了他个人偏好的影响。
en: Lowth prescribed a number of new rules for English, many of them influenced by his personal taste.

zh: 在1911年的时候，波亚斯偶然提起爱斯基摩人用4个不相干的字根来说雪。
en: In 1911 Boas casually mentioned that Eskimos used four unrelated word roots for snow.

zh: 沃尔夫数到7个，而且暗示还有更多。
en: Whorf embellished the count to seven and implied that there were more.

zh: 他的文章流传很广，许多教科书都引用到；因此，这个数字就越来越膨胀，最后变成报纸“惊人的事实”的新闻。
en: His article was widely reprinted, then cited in textbooks and popular books on language, which led to successively in ated estimates in other textbooks, articles, and newspaper columns of Amazing Facts.

zh: 这些序列约束决定了一个语言中不出现但潜在的词是什么样的,还决定什么样的语音链“不可能”或“不合法”。
en: These determine what words are possible in a language, and what phonetic strings are impermissible.Possible but nonoccurring words constitute accidental gaps and are nonsense words, e.g.

zh: 例如，blick[blik]不是现有的英语单词，但它有可能成为英语单词；而kbli[kbli]或ngos[gos]不可能成为英语单词。
en: , blick [blɪk].

zh: 潜在而未出现的词构成了偶然缺位,也是无意义词。
这则漫画的幽默在于吐司（toast）一词的歧义。作为食物，法国吐司（French toast)是一个物质名词；作为祝辞，它又是个可数名词。
en: The humor of the cartoon is based both on the ambiguity of toast and the fact that as a food French toast is a mass noun, but as an oration it is a count noun.

zh: 这种可数或物质名词的区别表明说话者知道何种类型的限定词与不同种类的名词搭配的特性。
en: The count/mass distinction captures the fact that speakers know the prop- erties that govern which determiner types go with different nouns.

zh: 不过，我们现在可以认为，马克思只是求助于公认的（黑格尔式的）关于文学艺术的思维方式。
en: However, it is now possible to see that Marx was simply falling back on received (Hegelian) ways of thinking about literature and art.

zh: 我们在第二章中关于穆卡若夫斯基的讨论现在看来是马克思主义的观点：伟大的文学经典是社会产生的。
en: Our discussion of Mukarˇovsky ́ in Chapter 2 established what can now be regarded as a Marxist view: that canons of great literature are socially generated.

zh: 希腊悲剧的“伟大”不在于它具有普遍的、不变的存在，而在于它具有必须由一代又一代人作出重新阐释的价值。
en: The ‘greatness’ of Greek tragedy is not a universal and unchanging fact of existence, but a value which must be reproduced from generation to generation.

zh: 于是,在这种情况下，普通语法原理与独立建立起来的特殊语法规则相结合，就产生出一种特定的、相当惊人的经验结果，即35和36对代词“him”的指称所作的解释，必定是不同的。
en: In this case, then, a principle of universal grammar combines with an independently established rule of particular English grammar to yield a certain rather surprising empirical consequence, namely that 35 and 36 must differ in the referential interpretation of the pronoun “him.”

zh: 我们再次看到，与例27a和27b所讨论的元音弱化的情形大致相似，要用“习惯”、“倾向”和“类推”对上述情形进行解释，是根本不可能的。
en: Once again, as in the formally somewhat analogous case of vowel reduction discussed earlier in connection with examples 27a and 27b, it is quite impossible to provide an explanation in terms of“habits”and“dispositions” and “analogy.”

zh: 毋宁说，我们必须提出某种支配人类心理能力的、在某种程度上是抽象的普遍原理，来解释那些正在讨论的现象。
en: Rather, it seems that certain abstract and in part universal principlesgoverning human mental faculties must be postulated to explain the phenomena in question.

zh: 第一种符号是“图像”的，描写了词与物之间“自然的”对应，它总结了索绪尔之前的老语言观，即词与物表现出一种具有普遍意义的自然的统一性。
en: The first sign is ‘iconic’, describing the ‘natural’ correspondence between word and thing, and it sums up the old pre-Saussurean notion of language, according to which words and things appear naturally unified in a universal meaning.

zh: 第二种图摧毁了词与物之间古老的和谐：“女”与“男”作为能指标在了可辨识的门上。
en: The second diagram destroys the old harmony: the signifiers ‘ladies’ and ‘gentlemen’ are attached to identical doors.

zh: “同样的”门被置于不同的语言系统中，这样就让我们把它们看作“不同的”了。
en: The ‘same’ doors are made to enter the differential system of language, so that we are made to see them as ‘different’.

zh: 在停止讨论俄狄浦斯情结的问题之前，应该强调指出：这一问题是弗洛伊德工作中最核心的部分。
en: Before leaving the question of the Oedipus complex, its utter centrality to Freud's work should be emphasized.

zh: 它并非只是另一情结：它是一个使我们成为现在这样的男人和女人的关系结构。
en: It is not just another complex: it is the structure of relations by which we come to be the men and women that we are.

zh: 它是我们作为主体得以产生和构成的关键所在。对于我们来说，问题在于，它在某种意义上总是偏颇的和有缺陷的机制。
en: It is the point at which we are produced and constituted as subjects; and one problem for us is that it is always in some sense a partial, defective mechanism.

zh: 它标志着从快乐原则转向现实原则；从封闭的家庭转向广阔的社会，因为我们从乱伦转向超家庭关系；从自然转向文化，因为我们可以把幼儿与母亲的关系在某种意义上视为“自然关系”，而把在俄狄浦斯阶段之后的儿童视为正处于在整个文化秩序中采取某种立场这一过程之中的人。
en: It signals the transition from the pleasure principle to the reality principle; from the enclosure of the family to society at large, since we turn from incest to extra-familialrelations; and from Nature to Culture, since we can see the infant's relation to the mother as somehow 'natural', and the post-Oedipal child as one who is in the process of assuming a position within the cultural order as a whole.

zh: 这并不否认艺术的主要形式对“外在的”不变的世界负有直接的固定的义务。
en: This is not to deny that major modes of art will appear to involve an apparently straightforward and stable commitment to an unchanging world ‘beyond’ themselves.

zh: 一本书总是象一个窗口，从那里可以清楚地看到这个世界。
en: A book of a certain kind will always appear as a window through which such a world is clearly visible.

zh: 书中，能指似乎总是直接地、明确无误地指向所指。但是正如我们看到的，结构主义和符号学的主旨是，即使在那些作品的目的完全是现实主义的事例中（如巴尔扎克的侦探小说《萨拉西纳》)，写作的这种“透明性”，文学的这种“单纯性”仍不过是幻想。
en: In it, the signiﬁers appear to point directly and conﬁdently to the signiﬁeds.But a central tenet of structuralism and semiotics is, as we have seen, that even in cases where the aim of the work is utter realism (the detective novel, Balzac’s Sarrasine), this ‘transparency’ of writing, this ‘innocence’ of literature, remains an illusion.

zh: 然而另一方面，正像托马舍夫斯基支出的那样，我们一旦接受了某种新的程式，就会变得习惯起来，对它的所有荒诞性和不可能性视而不见，听而不闻。
en: On the other hand, as Tomashevsky pointed out, we become accustomed to all kinds of absurdities and improbabilities once we learn to accept a new set of conventions.

zh: 在冒险故事中，英雄被恶棍杀害之前总会通过某种方式获得解救，而我们总是分辨不出那些完全不可能的方式来。
en: We fail to notice the improbable way in which heroes are always rescued just before they are about to be killed by the villains in adventure stories.

zh: 的确，现实主义的核心策略就是掩饰其人为的虚构性，假装在作品与作品展示给我们的现实之间没有艺术可言，就此而论，它与“直白其形式技巧”的做法恰恰相反。
en: Indeed, realism’s central strategy is to disguise its artiﬁciality, to pretend there is no art between it and the reality it shows us; in this respect, it does the exact opposite of ‘baring its device’.

zh: 在英文里，名词短语（NP）是由名词（N）前面加一个冠词或限定词（略写为det），与任何数目的形容词（A）所组成的。
en: In English a noun phrase (NP) is composed of a noun (N), sometimes preceded by an article or "determiner" (abbreviated "det") and any number of adjectives (A).

zh: 在语言学上箭头表示由什么组成, 括弧表示可用可不用，星号表示随便你要用几次。我讲这些符号的意思是说，上面这些讯息只要用几个符号就可很正确地表达出来了。
en: In the standard notation of linguistics, an arrow means "consists of," parentheses mean "optional," and an asterisk means "as many of them as you want," but I provide the rule just to show that all of its information can be captured precisely in a few symbols.

zh: 对于维多利亚时代的统治阶级来说，这是非常令人担忧的，因为从任何理由来说，宗教都是一种极其有效的意识形态控制方式。
en: This was particularly worrying for the Victorian ruling class, because religion is for all kinds of reasons an extremely effective form of ideological control.

zh: 像一切成功的意识形态一样，宗教活动依靠的主要不是明确的概念或系统的学说，而是意象、象征、习惯、仪式和神话。
en: Like all successful ideologies, it works much less by explicit concepts or formulated doctrines than by image, symbol, habit, ritual and mythology.

zh: 它是情绪的和经验的，因而能使自己与人类主体的最深的潜意识之根缠结在一起；任何一种社会意识形态，如果它不能与这种深刻的、非理性的恐惧和需要相契合——就艾略特(T.S.Eliot) 所了解的那样——它就不可能长存久在。
en: It is affective and experiential, entwining itself with the deepest unconscious roots of the human subject; and any social ideology which is unable to engage with such deepseated a-rational fears and needs, as T. S. Eliot knew, is unlikely to survive very long.

zh: 早期形式主义学派以象征主义为基础，他们和象征主义者一样把形式视为有效的交流工具，形式是自主的；自我表达的，能够借助词外的韵律、联想和含蓄等手段“伸展”语言，使其超出规范的“日常的”意义范围。
en: Early Formalism built on the groundwork of symbolism, and of the symbolist concern with form as a viable communicative instrument; autonomous, self-expressive, able by extra-verbal rhythmic, associative and connotative means to ‘stretch’ language beyond its normal ‘everyday’ range of meaning.

zh: 这些问题导致了文学批评首先关心的是文学语言得以发生作用的技巧，并且还要注意把这些技巧同“普通”语言的模式加以分离和区别。
en: These concerns engendered in criticism a preoccupation with the techniques by which literary language works, and a concern to specify and diﬀerentiate these from the modes of ‘ordinary’ language.

zh: 但是正如埃辛鲍姆写的那样，形式主义学派“向象征主义者开战，从他们手中夺回了诗学，使诗学从他们主观的哲学和美学理论中解放出来，并使诗学朝着科学地研究事实的方向发展”。
en: But, as Eichenbaum wrote, the formalists ‘entered the ﬁght against the symbolists in order to wrest poetics from their hands to free it from its ties with their subjective philosophical and aesthetic theories, and to direct it towards the scientiﬁc investigation of facts’.

zh: 楔形文字的传播遍及中东和小亚细亚。
en: The cuneiform writing system spread throughout the Middle East and Asia Minor.

zh: 巴比伦人、亚述人和波斯人都借用了楔形文字。
en: The Babylonians, Assyrians, and Persians borrowed it.

zh: 在采纳楔形文字语符的过程中，借用者常用它们来表达本族语中语词音节的读音。
en: In adopting cuneiform characters, the borrowers often used them to represent the sounds of the syllables in their own languages.

zh: 楔形文字就以这种方式演化成为一种音节文字系统。
en: In this way cuneiform evolved into a syllabic writing system.

zh: 也有人提出过有关语法上的性是否影响说话者对事物的思考这一问题。
en: The question has also been raised regarding the possible influence of grammatical gender on how people think about objects.

zh: 许多语言都把名词分为阳性和阴性（如西班牙语、德语）；在西班牙语中，la Have (钥匙）是阴性名词，而el puente(桥）是阳性名词。
en: Many languages, such as Spanish and German, classify nouns as masculine or feminine; Spanish “key” is la llave (feminine) and “bridge”is el puente (masculine).

zh: 有些心理学家指出，对性加以区别的语言的使用者把事物看成像人或动物那样具有性别。
en: Some psychologists have suggested that speakers of gender-marking languages think about objects as having gender, much like people or animals have.

zh: 有一项研究要求说德语和西班牙语的人用英语形容词来描写各种物体（这些人熟练掌握英语）。
en: In one study, speakers of German and Spanish were asked to describe various objects using English adjectives(the speakers were proficient in English).

zh: 因此，结构主义者的最终目标是永恒的结构：个人的行为、感觉和姿态都纳入其中，并由此得到它们最终的本质。
en: It follows that the ultimate quarry of structuralist thinking will be the permanent structures into which individual human acts, perceptions, stances ﬁt, and from which they derive their ﬁnal nature.

zh: 最后就象F •詹姆森所描绘的那样，是“明确地寻找心灵本身的永恒的结构，寻找心灵赖以体验世界的，或把本身没有意义的东西组成具有意义的东西所需要的那种组织类别和形式”。
en: This will ﬁnally involve what Fredric Jameson has described as ‘an explicit search for the permanent structures of the mind itself, the organizational categories and forms through which the mind is able to experience the world, or to organize a meaning in what is essentially in itself meaningless’.

zh: 显然，维柯的幽灵还没有得到安慰。
en: The ghost of Vico clearly remains unplacated.

zh: 翻译不仅仅是语词之间一对一的替换。
en: Translation is more than word-for-word replacement.

zh: 常常出现的情况是，在目的语中没有对应的词，词序也可能不同，比如把英语这样的主一动一宾（SVO)语言翻译成日语那样的主一宾一动(SOV)语言就是这样。
en: Often there is no equivalent word in the target language, and the order of words may differ, as in translating from an SVO language like English to an SOV language like Japanese.

zh: 另外，翻译习语、隐喻、行话等等时也会有困难。
en: There is also difficulty in translating idioms, metaphors, jargon, and so on.

zh: 人工翻译，这些问题都能处理好，因为翻译人员知道两种语言的语法，并且能够利用对所谈内容和世界的综合了解来表达原文所想要表达的意义。
en: Human translators cope with these problems because they know the grammars of the two languages and draw on general knowledge of the subject matter and the world to arrive at the intended meaning.

zh: 雅各布森在交流行为本质和语言功能方面的相关工作已在前文有所提及。
en: Jakobson’s work on the nature of the communicative act, and on the functions of  the  language  involved  has  already  been  mentioned.

zh: 他关于“诗歌的功能”的阐述具有特别的意义。
en: His account of the ‘poetic function’ has been of particular significance.

zh: 它证实了上面已经提到的那些见解，并在文学的领域里，为形式主义和结构主义的最终结合提供了理论基础。
en: It confirms the insights already mentioned, and supplies the theoretical basis for the final stage of the bridge which links Formalism and Structuralism in respect of literature.

zh: 对于这个给定的结构，还能进一步应用形态规则。
en: Further morphological rules can be applied to the given structure.

zh: 举例来说，英语有一个派生后缀-al，出现在egotistical, fantastical和astronomical这样的词中。
en: For example, English has a derivational suffix -al, as in egotistical, fantastical, and astronomical.

zh: 在以上这些例子中，-al附加到形容词egotistic (自我中心的），fantastic (绝妙的），astronomic (天文学的）上，形成一个新的形容词。
en: In these cases, -al is added to an adjective—egotistic, fantastic, astronomic—to form a new adjective.

zh: 儿童不必学每个词的复数形式，每个词的过去时态，每种所有格形式和每个动词的词尾变化。
en: The young child doesn’t need to learn each plural, each past tense, each possessive form, and each verb ending, on a noun-by-noun or verb-by-verb basis.

zh: 只要学会一条规则，就能知道成千上万的词形变化。
en: Once the rule is learned,thousands of word forms are automatically known.

zh: 在第八章讨论语言的发展的时候，我们还会看见，有很清楚的证据说明，儿童在学习形态音位规则（例如复数规则）的时候，会把这些规则用过了头，结果产生类似mouses, mans等在成人语言中被认为是不正常的形式。
en: And as we will see when we discuss language development in chapter 8, children give clear evidence of learning morphophonemic rules such as the plural rules by applying the rule too broadly and producing forms such as mouses, mans, and so on, which are ungrammatical in the adult language.

zh: 我们的语言“代表”客体：所有语言在某种意义上都是“隐喻”，它以它自身替代对于客体本身的某种无言的直接占有。
en: Our language 'stands in' for objects: all language is in a way 'metaphorical', in that it substitutes itself for some direct, wordless possession of the object itself.

zh: 在斯威夫特的笔下，拉普顿岛的居民随身背着一个大口袋，装满他们交谈时可能需要的所有物体，并把这些物体直接拿给别人看，作为他们的谈话方式。
en: It saves us from the inconvenience of Swift's Laputans, who carry on their back a sack full of all the objects they might need in conversation, and simply hold these objects up to each other as a way of talking.

zh: 语言能使我们免除这种不便，在儿童无意识地在语言领域中学习这些课程的同时，他也无意识地从性的世界里学习他们的课程。
en: But just as the child is unconsciously learning these lessons in the sphere of language, it is also unconsciously learning them in the world of sexuality.

zh: 各种人的谈论——医生的、神职人员的、小说家的、心理学家的、伦理学家的、社会福利工作人员的、政治家的，等等——我们把这些谈论与压制性行为的理念联系在一起。事实上，正是在这些谈论中才出现了我们称为“性”的东西。
en: All the sorts of talk – by doctors, clergy, novelists, psychologists, moralists, social workers, politicians – that we link with the idea of the repression of sexuality were in fact ways of bringing into being the thing we call ‘sex’.

zh: 福柯写道：关于“性”的概念，以一种人为的统一把解剖学中的不同组成部分、生理功能、行为、情感、欲望的满足等聚合在一起，而且使你能把这种虚构的统一看作一种根本的原因，一种无处不在的意义，一种处处皆有的、有待破译的秘密。
en: Foucault writes, ‘The notion of “sex” made it possible to group together, in an artificial unity, anatomical elements, biological functions, conducts, sensations, pleasures; and it enabled one to make use of this fictitious unity as a causal principle, an omnipresent meaning, a secret to be discovered everywhere.’

zh: 多利莫尔特别讨论了这一点，他以洞见发掘了权力与快乐的复杂纠合关系：“快乐与权力不互相取消，也不互相抵梧。”他在《性的异议》（1991）中写道，“它们相互追求，相互搭接，相互加强。它们被复杂的机制、激动与刺激的手段链接起来”。这样，多利莫尔就有效地将男同性恋理论回归到弗洛伊德的“多形态的性反常”概念上——即儿童在成长为减缩的生殖器官的性之前享受多样的性的理论。
en: In developing this insight, Jonathan Dollimore, in particular, has explored the complex involvement of power with pleasure: ‘pleasure and power do not cancel or turn back against one another’, he writes in Sexual Dissidence (1991), ‘they seek out, overlap, and reinforce one another. They are linked together by complex mechanisms and devices of excitation and incitement.’ In this way, Dollimore has effectively returned gay theory to Freud’s concept of ‘polymorphous perversity’ – the theory that the child enjoys multiple sexualities before it moves to the reductive primacy of genital sex.

zh: 不论何时，一个新学科诞生后，它必须建立自己足够的语言，来研究自己领域的对象。
en: Whenever a new discipline arises it must establish the adequacy of its own language to the objects in its field of study.

zh: 但是，这不是由逻辑的争论来完成的，而是由一个“比逻辑的更修辞的前修辞运动”来完成的。
en: However, this is done not by logical argument but by a ‘pre-figurative move that is more tropical than logical’.

zh: 当历史学家爬梳整理他们的研究资料时，他们会不声不响地运用肯尼思·博克（Kenneth Burke）所谓的“四大主要修辞格”（即隐喻、换喻、提喻和反讽）来处理它。
en: When historians order the material of their study, they render it manageable by the silent application of what Kenneth Burke called the ‘Four Master Tropes’: metaphor, metonymy, synecdoche, and irony.

zh: 确定动机是故事要求的，不可缺少的；而“自由”动机从故事的角度看则无关大局，可有可无。
en: A bound motif is one which is required by the story, while a ‘free’ motif is inessential from the point of view of the story.

zh: 然而从文学的角度看，“自由”动机却很可能是艺术的焦点。
en: However, from the literary point of view, the ‘free’ motifs are potentially the focus of art.

zh: 譬如，让拉斐尔叙述天国战争的技巧就是一个“自由”动机，因为它并不是故事本身的部分。
en: For example, the device of having Raphael relate the War in Heaven is a ‘free’ motif, because it is not part of the story in question.

zh: 可是从形式上说，它比战争本身的叙述更为重要，因为，它可以让弥尔顿把这段叙述艺术地插入他整个的情节中。
en: However, it is formally more important than the narration of the War itself, because it enables Milton to insert the narration artistically into his overll plot.

zh: 这个问题的全部意义也许在V·I·普洛普的著作中得到最精辟的阐述。普洛普的《民间故事的形态研究》至今仍是形式主义学派的重大贡献之一，它向适合于小说艺术的“诗学”迈出了一大步。
en: The full implications of this problem were perhaps best handled in the work of V. I. Propp, whose Morphology of the Folktale remains one of the major formalist contributions, and represents a further signiﬁcant step towards a ‘poetics’ appropriate to the art of ﬁction.

zh: 事实上，普洛普所关注的恰好是叙述结构得以发挥作用的“标准”，它所要处理的那些内容的单位。他试图对这些加以分类的做法至今仍然有很高的结构价值，因为，就如神话一样，童话是任何叙述的重要原型。
en: Propp’s concern, in fact, is exactly with the ‘norms’ by which narrative structures work, the units of ‘content’ in which they seem to deal, and his attempt at a taxonomy of these retains considerable structural value to the present day, for, like the myth, the fairy tale ranks as an important prototype of all narrative.

zh: 有时候，叙述接受者就是作品中的一个人物。
en: Sometimes the narratee is an important character.

zh: 譬如，《天方夜谭》中叙述者山鲁佐德（或译谢赫拉查德）之所以能够存在，完全取决于叙述接受者国王哈里发对她持续的注意；假如他对她讲的故事失去了兴趣，她就得死。
en: For example, in A Thousand and One Nights the very survival of the narrator, Scheherazade, depends on the continued attention of the narratee, the caliph; if he loses interest in her stories, she must die.

zh: 普林斯详尽的理论旨在彰显叙述的各个层面，读者可以直觉地理解叙述中的这些层面，但她们仍旧显得朦胧，因而需要界定。
en: The effect of Prince’s elaborated theory is to highlight a dimension of narration which had been understood intuitively by readers but which had remained shadowy and undefined.

zh: 结构主义者没有把主题作为一个单独的考察对象进行研究。
en: Structuralists have not made theme a separate object of investigation.

zh: 其原因也许很简单，因为主题并不是一组具体的语言成分的必然结果，相反，它只是对我们从文本中发现的连贯一致的形式的命名，或对我们成功地将各种代码联系在一起、并呈现出条理的方法的命名。
en: The reason may be quite simply that theme is not the result of a specific set of elements but rather the name we give to the forms of unity which we can discern in the text or to the ways we succeed in making various codes come together and cohere.

zh: 正如格莱麦和列维-斯特劳斯的模式所清楚表明的，选择行为代码的最终结构是主题，因此不妨说，情节无非是主题结构的顺时性投射。

en: The ultimate structures of the proairetic code, as Greimas and Lévi-Strauss’s model makes clear, are thematic, and we could say that plot is but the temporal projection of thematic structures.

zh: 我们再次看到，与在例27a和27b中所讨论的元音弱化的情形形式上大致相似，要用“习惯”、“倾向”和“类推”对上述情形进行解释，是根本不可能的。
en: Once again, as in the formally somewhat analogous case of vowel reduction discussed earlier in connection with examples 27a and 27b, it is quite impossible to provide an explanation in terms of “habits” and “dispositions” and “analogy.”

zh: 毋宁说，我们必须提出某种支配人类心理能力的、在某种程度上是抽象的普遍原理，来解释那些正在讨论的现象。
en: Rather, it seems that certain abstract and in part universal principles governing human mental faculties must be postulated to explain the phenomena in question.

zh: 如果循环应用原理的确是一种决定人类语言知识形式的规则原理，那么，一个已经掌握了支配英语中代词化的特殊规则的人，无需训练或额外证据，就能直觉地认识到例35和例36在刚才所提到的那方面的不同之处。
en: If the principle of cyclic application is indeed a regulative principle determining the form of knowledge of language for humans, a person who has learned the particular rules governing pronominalization in English would know, intuitively and without instruction or additional evidence, that 35 and 36 differ in the respect just noted.

zh: 他认为，按照历史只能出现在意识中这一假设，马克思主义就挖空了历史的物质性，而将总体化的叙述填充在由此形成的空白中。
en: In its assumption that history is available to consciousness, Marxism is seen as emptying history of its materiality, ﬁlling the void thus created with a totalizing narrative.

zh: 在他看来，话语意识淹没了以欲望为核心的图像世界（这个观点与上面第7章中德路兹和瓜塔里的理论十分接近，可参阅）。
en: Discursive consciousness is seen as submerging the ﬁgural world and its associated nexus of desire (in a theory close to that of Deleuze and Guattari: see Chapter 7).

zh: 这种压抑正是“现代”的标志，也是理性推演过程和那些说明现代性特征的正义、文明模式产生的结果。
en: This repression represents the mark of the ‘modern’, consequent upon the procedures of rationality and associated with the models of justice and civilization which characterize modernity.

zh: 卢梭一再把写作界定为只是一种补充，是一种可有可无的附加，甚至是一种“言语不健全”的现象：写作是由可能导至误解的符号组成的。因为它是人们在说话人不在场的情况下解读的，而说话人又不能对那些符号做出解释和纠正。
en: Rousseau repeatedly characterizes writing as a mere addition, an inessential extra, even ‘a disease of speech’: writing consists of signs that introduce the possibility of misunderstanding since they are read in the absence of thespeaker, who is not there to explain or correct.

zh: 不过，虽然卢梭称写作是可有可无的附加.但实际上他在自己的著作中还是把写作作为使言语完整，或者弥补言语中的不足的手段的，他总是不断地用写作弥补言语中出现的疏忽，比如能会造成误解的疏漏等。
en: But though Rousseau calls writing an inessential extra, his works in fact treat it as what completes or makes up for something lacking in speech: writing is repeatedly brought in to compensate for the flaws in speech, such as the possibility of misunderstanding.

zh: 我们可以把述行语言和述愿语言之间所谓的“创造的矛盾”（aporia)做如下解释：创造性的矛盾就是一种无法判定的、摇摆不定的“僵局”，就像到底是鸡生蛋，还是蛋生鸡一样。
en: An ‘aporia’ is the ‘impasse’ of an undecidable oscillation, as when the chicken depends upon the egg but the egg depends on the chicken.

zh: 要声明语言以其述行功能僵造世界的唯一方法是通过述愿言语，就像“语言塑造世界”这句话一样；但是从另一方面 讲，除了言语行为也没有别的方法声明述愿语的可推断性。执行声明行为的那些陈述必然要声称绝对如实展现事情真 相。
en: The only way to claim that language functions performatively to shape the world is through a constative utterance, such as ‘Language shapes the world’; but contrariwise, there is no way to claim the constative transparency of language except by a speech act.

zh: 然而，如果你要证实另一面——声明如实再现的事实其实是把它们的范畴强加给了世界——那么你除了声明何为真实，何为不真实的情况之外也别无他法。
en: The propositions which perform the act of stating necessarily claim to do nothing but merely display things as they are; yet if you want to show the contrary– that claims to represent things as they are in fact impose their categories on the world – you have no way to do this except through claims about what is or is not the case.

zh: 支持人类天生就有文法设计蓝图的这个说法的证据，来自对婴儿的研究。
en: Evidence corroborating the claim that the mind contains blueprints for grammatical rules comes, once again, out of the mouths of babies and suckings.

zh: 以英文句子He walks为保持一致性而添加的字尾变化-s为例。
en: Take the English agreement suffix -s as in "He walks".

zh: 这个一致性在许多语言中都是一个重要的处理过程，但是在现代的英语中，它是多余的，是过去古英语丰富系统所留下的残余物。
en: Agreement is an important process in many languages, but in modern English it is superfluous, a remnant of a richer system that flourished in Old English.

zh: 假如它完全消失我们也不会怀念它，就像我们不会怀念Thou sayest中的字尾变化-est一样。
en: If it were to disappear entirely, we would not miss it, any more than we miss the similar -est suffix in "Thou sayest".

zh: 失聪婴儿发出的咿呀语听上去不同于有听觉的婴儿。
en: Deaf infants produce babbling sounds that are different from those of hearing children.

zh: 可见咿呀语跟听觉输入有关，而且具有语言的性质。
en: Babbling is related to auditory input and is linguistic in nature.

zh: 对正常儿童的口头咿呀语和失聪儿童的咿呀手势的比较研究，支持"咿呀语是一种跟儿童获得的那种语言输入相关的语言能力”这一观点。
en: Studies of vocal babbling of hearing children and manual babbling of deaf children support the view that babbling is a linguistic ability related to the kind of language input the child receives.

zh: 动词不仅能决定一个句子中论元的数量, 还可以限制其主语和补足语的语义特征。
en: The verb not only determines the number of arguments in a sentence, but it also limits the semantic properties of both its subject and its complements.

zh: 例如，find和sleep要求(s-选择)有生主语。
en: For example, find and sleep require (s-select) animate subjects.

zh: 那个著名的例句colorless green ideas sleep foriously之所以在语义上是异常的，是因为“思想” (不论是否有颜色）不是有生的。
en: The well-known colorless green ideas sleep furiously is semantically anomalous because ideas (colorless or not) are not animate.

zh: 一个动词的语义成分也关系到它能选择怎样的补足语。
en: Components of a verb’s meaning can also be relevant to the choice of complements it can take.

zh: 在卷帙浩繁的黑格尔传统的阐释游戏中，每一位读者都竭力达到理解领悟其他一切的最外圈，然而这种阐释活动本身却未包括在内。于是，我们这里所谈的这一层次上的逼真性，至少在现时条件下，便处于一个十分优越的地位，因为它有执掌并转化其他层次的能力。
en: In the great Hegelian game of interpretation, where each reader strives to attain the outermost circle that comprehends all else but is not itself comprehended, this level of vraisemblance enjoys, at least at our moment in history, a privileged status because of its ability to assume and transform other levels.

zh: 但是，它充其量又只不过是一种形式的程式性归化，它试图组织起这个规划过程，使之超越意识形态和惯例习俗，而且，如第十章将要论证的，超越整个观念的范畴。
en: But it is none the less a mode of conventional naturalization, and attempts to organize it so that it would lie beyond ideology and convention take us, as chapter 10 will argue, beyond the bounds of sense altogether.

zh: 长短、音高、响度、重音是韵律或超音段特征，附加于音节中语音的音段值之上。
en: Length, pitch, loudness, and stress are prosodic, or suprasegmental, features.They are imposed over and above the segmental values of the sounds in a syllable.

zh: 在很多语言的音节中，元音的音高具有语言学意义。
en: In many languages, the pitch of the vowel in the syllable is linguistically significant.

zh: 例如，两个词的音段都一样，但如果一个高调，一个低调，意义就可能不一样。
en: For example, two words with identical segments may contrast in meaning if one has a high pitch and another a low pitch.

zh: 这样的语言叫声调语言。
en: Such languages aretone languages.

zh: 不管说什么话，每个人说话时音高总在变动。
en: Speakers of all languages vary the pitch of their voices when they talk.

zh: 音高对于音节的影响在不同语言中有所不同。
en: The effect of pitch on a syllable differs from language to language.

zh: 英语中说cat这个词，不管用高调还是低调都没关系，意思总是指“猫”。
en: In English, it doesn’t matter whether you say cat with a high pitch or a low pitch.It will still mean “cat.”

zh: 但在尼日利亚的努佩语中，你如果用高调说ba，意思是“酸”，如果低调，就成了“算”。
en: But if you say [ba] with a high pitch in Nupe (a language spoken in Nigeria), it will mean “to be sour,” whereas if you say [ba] with a low pitch, it will mean “to count.”

zh: 那些在元音或音节上用音高区别词义的语言叫声调语言。
en: Languages that use the pitch of individual vowels or syllables to contrast meanings of words are called tone languages.

zh: 一些词是因为故意错用逆构词法才新造出来的。
en: Some word creation comes from deliberately miscast back-formations.

zh: bikini (比基尼泳装，三点式）一词是一个单语素的名祖，因马绍尔群岛的比基尼环礁而得名。
en: The word bikini comes from the Bikini atoll of the Marshall Islands.

zh: 由于第一个音节bi-(比）在bicycle (自行车）这样的词中意为“两或双”，于是一些聪明人就将无上装的“一点式” 泳装称为monokini。
en: Because the first syllable bi- is a morpheme meaning “two” in words like bicycle, some clever person called a topless bathing suit a monokini.

zh: 与此相对应，在英国，哈兹里特在谈论诗歌时说:“它是语言的音乐，与心灵的音乐相合……音乐与深藏的激情之间有着密切的联系。人疯了就会唱歌。”
en: Correspondingly, in England, Hazlitt said of poetry: ‘It is the music of language, answering to the music of the mind…There is a near connection between music and deep-rooted passion. Mad people sing.’

zh: 有了这些关于语言中音型的事实，就可以把音位定义成处于互补分布的，语音上相似的音的集合。
en: Given these facts about the patterning of sounds in a language, a phoneme can be defined as a set of phonetically similar sounds that are in complementary distribution.

zh: 一个这样的集合可能只有一个元素。
所以有些音位仅用一个音表达，它们只有一种音位变体。
en: Some phonemes are represented by only one sound; they have one allophone.

zh: 当集合中存在不止一个音位变体的时候，这些音素听上去应该相似，也就是说，共享绝大部分的语音特征。
en: When there is more than one allophone in the set, the phones must be phonetically similar; that is, share most phonetic features.

zh: 正如我们所见，音位配列限制说明了哪些语音序列可以在某种语言中出现，因此在英语中blick是一个潜在词，但lbick不是。
en: As we saw, phonotactic constraints specify which sound sequences are permissible in a particular language, so that in English blick is a possible word but *lbick isn’t.

zh: 很多音系学家相信音系规则的存在保证了表层，或词汇的语音形式不会违反音位配列限制。
en: Many linguists believe that phonological rules exist to ensure that the surface or phonetic forms of words do not violate phonotactic constraints.

zh: 如果底层形式维持不变，常会违反该语言的音位配列学。
en: If underlying forms remained unmodified, they would often violate the phonotactics of the language.

zh: 现在我们知道，在汉语、泰语以及阿肯语这样的声调语言中，音高是一个音位特征。
en: We can now see that pitch is a phonemic feature in tone languages such as Chinese, Thai, and Akan.

zh: 我们将这些相对音高称为区别性声调。
en: We refer to these relative pitches as contrasting tones.

zh: 在英语那种语调语言中，表现为短语或句子的音高曲拱或语调的音高依然起着重要作用。
en: In intonation languages such as English, pitch still plays an important role, but in the form of the pitch contour or intonation of the phrase or sentence.

zh: 在 12世纪，一位冰岛学者为当时的冰岛语文字设计了一套源自拉丁字母的正字法。
en: In the twelfth century, an Icelandic scholar developed an orthography derived from the Latin alphabet for the writing of the Icelandic language of his day.

zh: 同时代的其他学者对正字法改革也颇感兴趣，但当时唯有这位冰岛人为他的正字法原则留下了记录，他被称为“第一位语法学家”（因为他的那篇未署名论文是当时一部语法论文集的首篇)。
en: Other scholars in this period were also interested in orthographic reform, but the Ice-lander, who came to be known as “the First Grammarian” (because his anonymous paper was the first entry in a collection of grammatical essays), was the only one of the time who left a record of his principles.

zh: 他所发明的正字法显然是根据音位原则来设计的。
en: The orthography he developed was clearly based on the phonemic principle.

zh: 音系规则的变化能够造成、并且常常确实造成了方言的差异。
en: Changes in phonological rules can, and often do, result in dialect differences.

zh: 在前一章中我们讨论了英语中增加了“r-删略”规则（除非/r/后面紧接着一个元音，否则/r/不发音)，这条规则并未在英语中普遍开来。
en: In the previous chapter we discussed the addition of an r-dropping rule in English (/r/ is not pronounced unless followed by a vowel) that did not spread throughout the language.

zh: 目前只在英国英语和美国英语的东北以及南方方言中存在r不发音的现象，由此我们可以看到这一规则的影响。
en: Today, we see the effect of that rule in the r-less pronunciation of British English and of American English dialects spoken in the northeastern and the southern United States.

zh: 在某些语言中，从音位上区别单词也可以用韵律即超音段特征，如音高、重音以及音段的长度或音长。
en: Words in some languages may also be phonemically distinguished by prosodic or suprasegmental features, such as pitch, stress, and segment length.

zh: 有的语言用音高造成音节或词的对立，这种语言叫声调语言。
en: Languages in which syllables or words are contrasted by pitch are called tone languages.

zh: 其余的叫语调语言，它是用短语或句子上的音高变化来分辨意义差别。
en: Intonation languages may use pitch variations to distinguish meanings of phrases and sentences.

zh: 在柯尔律治的有机论中，感觉的意象成了仅仅供大脑加工的素材——这些素材在与新的整体同化的过程中完全失去了原有的面貌。
en: In Coleridge's organic theory, images of sense become merely materials on which the mind feeds—materials which quite lose their identity in being assimilated to a new whole.

zh: “从第一个或初始的观念中，就像从种子中一样，萌发出连续的观念。”
en: ‘From the first, or initiative Idea, as from a seed, successive Ideas germinate.’

zh: 在有机论美学逐步形成的过程中，夏夫茨伯里公爵第三也起了重要作用，但这不是说他提出了什么合适的原则，而是因为他对德国作家产生了巨大影响（的性质）。
en: In the development toward an organic aesthetics the third Earl of Shaftesbury was also important, but more by the nature of his great influence on German writers than by his proper doctrine.

zh: 他说，真正的诗人是“第二个造物主”。“他就像至高无上的艺术家或是普遍的有形成力的自然，造就了一个整体，这个整体本身是联贯的、比例得当的，它的组成部分也有着一定的从属性和受支配性。
en: The true poet, he said, is ‘a second Maker.’ Like that sovereign artist or universal plastic nature, he forms a whole, coherent and proportioned in itself, with due subjection and subordinacy of constituent parts.

zh: 这问题有一部分是来自从录音带到文件，中间我们说话的抑扬顿挫、语调，及短语交错的时间性都失去了。除非是高真实度的录音带，不然是很不可靠的。
en: Part of the problem comes from the circumstances of transcription: the intonation and timing that delineate phrases is lost, and a tran­scription from anything but the highest-fidelity tape is unreliable.

zh: 白宫自己的转录文件可读性就比较高了，他把I want the uh, uh to go 写成 I want them, uh, uh，to go。
en: Indeed, in the White House's independent transcription of this low­-quality recording, many puzzling passages are rendered more sensibly.For example, I want the, uh, uh, to go is transcribed as I want them, uh, uh, to go.

zh: 当一个词同时属于几个不同的句法范畴时，语法分析程序可能会遇到麻烦。
en: Parsers may run into difficulties with words that belong to several syntactic categories.

zh: 比如，在The little orange rabbit hopped (这个橙色小兔跳过去了)这样一个句子中，语法分析程序就可能误把orange(橙色的)当作名词。
en: In a sentence like The little orange rabbit hopped, the parser might mistakenly assume orange is a noun.

zh: 随后，当错误凸现出来时，分析程序会返回来尝试将orange判定为形容词。
en: Later, when the error is apparent, the parser backtracks to the decision point, and retries with orange as an adjective.

zh: 在我看来，所谓人类语言学已经推翻了普遍语法假设的信念，在两个重要方面是很虚妄的。
en: The belief that anthropological linguistics has demolished the assumptions of universal grammar seems to me to be quite false in two important respects.

zh: 首先，这个信念误解了古典唯理主义的语法观点。古典唯理主义语法认为，不同的语言只是在较深的层次上——在语法关系得到表达、语言运用的创造性得以实现的层次上——才是相同的；其次，这种信念严重误解了人类语言学的发现。事实上，人类语言学几乎完全把自己局限在语言结构的表层。
en: First,it misinterprets the views of classical rationalist grammar, which held that languages are similar only at the deeper level, the level at which grammatical relations are expressed and at which the processes that provide for the creative aspect of language use are to be found.Second, this belief seriously misinterprets the findings of anthropological linguistics, which has, in fact, restricted itself almost completely to fairly superficial aspects of language structure.

zh: 英语中还有两组语素变体，它们是所有格语素和第三人称单数语素，拼写为s或es。
en: Two further allomorphs in English are the possessive morpheme and the thirdperson singular morpheme, spelled s or es.

zh: 这两组语素按照和复数语素规则相同的规则变化。
en: These morphemes take on the same phonetic form as the plural morpheme according to the same rules!

zh: 在ship的后面加上s就可以得到ship's; 在woman的后面加上z就可以得到woman's; 在judge的后面加上əz则得到judge's。
en: Add [s] to ship to get ship’s; add [z] to woman to get woman’s; and add [əz] to judge to get judge’s.

zh: 儿童能够如此快速、省力地习得语言，就是因为他们无须弄懂自己语言中的全部规则，只需要弄懂那些他们那种具体的语言所特有的规则就可以了。
en: Children acquire language as quickly and effortlessly as they do because they do not have to figure out all the grammatical rules, only those that are specific to their particular language.

zh: 语言的普遍属性一一语言的法则——是他们生理禀赋的一部分。
en: The universal properties—the laws of language—are part of their biological endowment.

zh: 语言理论旨在揭示那些刻画所有人类语言共性的原理，并且展示使得语言习得成为可能的天赋语言机制。
en: Linguistic theory aims to uncover those principles that characterize all human languages and to reveal the innate component of language that makes language acquisition possible.

zh: 在第八章我们将详细讨论语言习得的问题。
en: In chapter 8 we will discuss language acquisition in more detail.

zh: 另外，有些儿童拥有良好的语言技能，但却几乎没有或只有极其有限的交际技能，比如，患有严重功能性孤独症的儿童。对这些儿童的研究表明，认为语言能力只是交际能力发展的结果的任何观念，或者认为语言能力发展的目的只是服务于交际功能的任何观念，都是错误的。
en: In addition, any notion that linguistic competence results simply from communicative abilities, or develops to serve communicative functions, is belied by studies of children with good linguistic skills, but nearly no or severely limited communicative skills.

zh: 语言的习得和运用所依赖的认知能力，与在社会语境中进行交际的能力似乎是不同的。
en: The acquisition and use of language seem to depend on cognitive skills different from the ability to communicate in a social setting.

zh: 然而叙述不单单是一个学术科目。
en: But narrative is not just an academic subject.

zh: 听故事和讲故事是一种人类的基本欲望。
en: There is a basic human drive to hear and tell stories.

zh: 儿童从很小就练就了可以称之为基本叙述能力的本领：他们要听故事，如果故事还没有结束，你就企图骗他们停下来.他们是不会上当的。
en: Children very early develop what one might call a basic narrative competence: demanding stories, they know when you are trying to cheat by stopping before reaching the end.

zh: 因此，叙述理论的第一个问题或许应该是，我们对故事的基本形态究竟掌握哪些隐性知识？这些知识使我们能够区分出哪些故事结束得“恰当”，哪些结束得不恰当,事情还悬而未决。
en: So the first question for the theory of narrative might be, what do we implicitly know about the basic shape of stories that enables us to distinguish between a story that ends‘properly’ and one that doesn’t, where things are left hanging?

zh: 那么也许就可以这样理解叙述理论：它尝试把叙述能力讲清楚、说明白，就像语言学努力要把语言能力解释清楚一样：讲一种语言的人在认识这种语言时，其潜意识已经知道了些什么。
en: The theory of narrative might, then, be conceived as an attempt to spell out, to make explicit, this narrative competence, just as linguistics is an attempt to make explicit linguistic competence: what speakers of a language unconsciously know in knowing a language.

zh: 这样，叙述理论也可以被视为对一种直觉文化知识或理解的阐释。
en: Theory here can be conceived as a setting forth of an intuitive cultural knowledge or understanding.

zh: 据说南美洲土著语皮拉罕语里没有2以上的数字，也没有不同的词来表示颜色。
en: The South American indigenous language Pirahã is said to lack numbers beyond two and distinct words for colors.

zh: 请对该语言作一研究。可以从Google搜索入手，看看皮拉罕语是否支持语言决定论或语言相对论。
en: Research this language—Google would be a good start—with regard to whether Pirahã supports or fails to support linguistic determinism and/or linguistic relativism.

zh: 这种柏拉图主义的因素贯透了洪堡特的整个思想。对他来说，提出一种柏拉图式的“学习”理论，就象卢梭依据人类自由的概念对压迫人的社会制度进行批判一样的自然，——这种人类自由的概念严格说来之 于笛卡尔哲学关于机械论解释之限度的假设。
en: This Platonistic element in Humboldt’s thought is a pervasive one; for Humboldt, it was as natural to propose an essentially Platonistic theory of “learning” as it was for Rousseau to found his critique of repressive social institutions on a conception of human freedom that derives from strictly Cartesian assumptions regarding the limitations of mechanical explanation.

zh: 概言之，把浪漫主义时期的心理学和语言学理解为主要是唯理主义概念的结果，似乎是合适的。
en: And in general it seems appropriate to construe both the psychology and the linguistics of the romantic period as in large part a natural outgrowth of rationalist conceptions.

zh: 语言透过孩子而不朽。
en: Languages are perpetuated by the children who learn them.

zh: 当语言学家看到一个语言只有大人在用时，他知道这个语言己经去日无多了。
en: When linguists see a language spoken only by adults, they know it is doomed.

zh: 因为这个原因，他们对人类历史即将来临的悲剧提出了警告。
en: By this reasoning, they warn of an impending tragedy in the history of humankind.

zh: 理解一个句子涉及许多层次上的分析。
en: Understanding a sentence involves analysis at many levels.

zh: 首先我们必须理解听到的单个语音。
en: To begin with, we must comprehend the individual speech sounds we hear.

zh: 我们意识不到自己用来理解言语的复杂处理过程，正如我们意识不到消化食物和利用食物中的营养成分的复杂过程。
en: We are not conscious of the complicated processes we use to understand speech any more than we are conscious of the complicated processes of digesting food and utilizing nutrients.

zh: 我们必须慎重、科学地研究这些过程。
en: We must study these processes deliberately and scientifically.

zh: 语言运用的首要问题之一涉及声学信号的切分。
en: One of the first questions of linguistic performance concerns segmentation of the acoustic signal.

zh: 了解一些信号的知识会有助于理解这个过程。
en: To understand this process, some knowledge of the signal can be helpful.

zh: 自20世纪70年代以来，有两个著名的自然语言处理系统是利用谓词一主目方法来进行语义表征的。
en: Two well-known natural language processing systems have used the predicate-argument approach to semantic representation.

zh: 一个被其开发者特瑞•维诺格拉德称为“喜儿德路”（SHRDLU)，它展示出了多种能力，比如能够理解问题，进行推理，学习新词，甚至解释其行为。
en: One, named SHRDLU by its developer Terry Winograd, demonstrated several abilities, such as being able to interpret questions, draw inferences, learn new words, and even explain its actions.

zh: 它在由一个“积木世界”构成的语境中运行，在这个“积木世界”中有一张桌子，形状、尺寸和颜色多种多样的积木，一个用来移动积木的自动机械臂。
en: It operated in the context of a “blocks world,” consisting of a table, blocks of various shapes, sizes, and colors, and a robot arm for moving theblocks.

zh: 语义特征无法直接观察到，其存在必须从语言证据中推知。
en: Semantic properties are not directly observable.Their existence must be inferred from linguistic evidence.

zh: 其中一个证据的来源就是我们每个人都会犯的言语错误，亦即“言语错误”或“口误”。
en: One source of such evidence is the speech errors, or “slips of the tongue,” that we all produce.

zh: 考虑下面说话者实际说出来的一些口误，他们无意中用一些词代替了原本想说的词。
en: Consider the following unintentional word substitutions that some speakers have actually spoken.

zh: 许多实验研究表明, 儿童对各种语言属性 (如重音和音位配例限制) 以及对输入的统计规律都很敏感, 这使他们能够将听到的流利的言语分割成单词。
en: Many experimental studies show that children are sensitive to various linguistic properties such as stress and phonotactic constraints, and to statistical regularities of the input that enable them to segment the fluent speech that they hear into words.

zh: 语音分割的一种方法是韵律引导。
en: One method of segmenting speech is prosodic bootstrapping.

zh: 其他的引导方法可以帮助孩子学习基于句法语境 (句法引导) 的动词意义, 或基于词义 (语义引导) 和分布证据的句法类别。
en: Other bootstrapping methods can help the child to learn verb meaning based on syntactic context (syntactic bootstrapping), or syntactic categories based on word meaning (semantic bootstrapping) and distributional evidence.

zh: 词句的音位表征和语音表征(这些词句的发音)之间的关系是由音系规则决定的。
en: The relationship between phonemic representation and phonetic representation (pronunciation) is determined by phonological rules.

zh: 音系规则作用于音位链，使之发生各种变化，派生出语音表征。在手势语中，就会派生出手形。
en: Phonological rules apply to phonemic strings and alter them in various ways to derive their phonetic representation, or in the case of signed languages, their hand configuration.

zh: 从第六章语音学讨论中我们知道，[ s ]和 [ z ]的唯一差别是带声性；[ s ]不带声，[ z ]带声。就是这个语音特征区别了 seal和 zeal。
en: From the discussion of phonetics in chapter 6, we know that [s] and [z] differ in voicing: [s] is voiceless and [z] is voiced.The phonetic feature of voicing therefore distinguishes the two words.

zh: 这个特征还能区别feel (感觉) 和 veal (小牛肉) [t]/[v]，以及cap (帽子) 和 cab (车厢) [p]/[b]。
en: Voicing also distinguishes feel and veal [f]/[v] and cap and cab [p]/[b].

zh: 如果一个特征能区别开两个音位，从而区分开两个词,它就是区别特征(即音位特征)。
en: When a feature distinguishes one phoneme from another, hence one word from another, it is a distinctive feature or, equivalently, a phonemic feature.

zh: 有了IPA音标，我们可以无歧义地表示发音了。
en: Using the IPA symbols, we can now unambiguously represent the pronunciation of words.

zh: 例如，在下面六个词里，字母ou表示六个不同的元音，gh除了在rough里读[f],其他都不发音；th表示两个音，而would中的l是哑字母。
en: For example, in the six words below, ou represents six distinct vowel sounds; the gh is silent in all but rough, where it is pronounced [f]; the th represents a single sound, either [Ð] or [ð], and the l in would is also silent.

zh: 用音标来进行语音转写则告诉了我们实际的发音。
en: However, the phonetic transcription gives us the actual pronunciation.

zh: 让我们回到英语、德语和瑞典语，我们发现，“人”这个词在三种语言里分别是 man [msn],Mann [m an]和man [man]。
en: Restricting ourselves to English, German, and Swedish, we find the word for “man” is man [mæn], Mann [man], and man [man], respectively.

zh: 在很多对应的词表中，我们都 能看到三种语言之间分别有[m]-[m]-[m]和 [n]-[n]-[n] 的规则语音对应，而这只是其中一个例子。
en: This is one of many word sets in which we can observe the regular sound correspondence [m]-[m]-[m] and [n]-[n]-[n] in the three languages.

zh: 在这些证据的基础之上，比较法使得我们可以在原始日耳曼语中为“人”这个词构拟 *mVn 的形式。
en: Based on this evidence, the comparative method has us reconstruct *mVn as the word for “man” in Proto-Germanic.

zh: V表示元音，其特征我们还不确定，因为尽管拼写相似，但是在不同的日耳曼语中，元音的发音却不同，如果没有更多的证据，我们也不清楚如何对它进行构拟。
en: The V indicates a vowel whose quality we are unsure of because, despite the similar spelling, the vowel is phonetically different in the various Germanic languages, and it is unclear how to reconstruct it without further evidence.

zh: 历史比较语言学家利用文字记录研究语言，这是一项富于挑战性的工作。但是这远不如试图在没有文字历史的语言中寻找谱系关系那么困难。
en: The historical comparativists working on languages with written records have a challenging job, but not nearly as challenging as that of scholars who are attempting to discover genetic relationships among languages with no written history.

zh: 语言学家首先必须转写各类语言的大量数据，从音系、形态和句法上对这些数据进行分析，并为谱系关系建立基础，如并非由偶然或借用因素导致的基本词汇的相似性以及语音对应关系。然后 ，才能运用比较法构拟已经灭绝的原始语。
en: Linguists must first transcribe large amounts of language data from all the languages; analyze them phonologically, morphologically, and syntactically;  and establish a basis for relatedness such as similarities in basic vocabulary and regular sound correspondences not resulting from chance or borrowing.Only then can the comparative method be applied to reconstruct the extinctprotolanguage.

zh: 图6.5中的元音没包括所有讲英语的人所拥有的元音。
en: The vowels in Figure 6.5 do not represent all the vowels of all English speakers.

zh: 你可能有些特定的元音没表达在图中。
en: They may not represent your particular vowel set.

zh: 很多讲英国英语的人有一个图中没有的后低圆唇元音，例 如 hot—词中的元音。
en: If you speak British English, there’s a good chance that you have a low, back, rounded vowel in the word hot that the vowel chart lacks.

zh: 还有很多英国人发的紧元音有很重的复元音倾向，比美国人厉害得多，如gate发成[gejt]，go发成[gow]。
en: Canadian English speakers pronounce the vowel in words like bite as [ʌɪ] rather than [aɪ].

zh: 与此相对的是讲英语的爱尔兰人，他们都发成单元音。
“读者”这个术语可以进一步分为“隐含读者”与“实际读者”。
en: The term ‘reader’ can be subdivided into ‘implied reader’ and ‘actual reader’.

zh: “隐含读者”是文本为自己创造的读者，它是一个激励回应的结构网，引导我们以某种方式阅读。
en: The first is the reader whom the text creates for itself and amounts to ‘a network of response-inviting structures’ which predispose us to read in certain ways.

zh: “实际读者”在阅读过程中接受某些心理意象；但是，这些意象不可避免地会被读者“现存的经验储备”赋予某些色彩。
en: The ‘actual reader’ receives certain mental images in the process of reading; however, the images will inevitably be coloured by the reader’s ‘existing stock of experience’.

zh: 例如上面提到的华兹华斯那首诗，倘若我们是无神论者，而不是基督徒，那我们会受到的影响就会完全不同。
en: If we are atheists we will be affected differently by the Wordsworth poem above (p. 47) than if we are Christians.

zh: 阅读的经验会根据我们过去的经验而有所不同。
en: The experience of reading will differ according to our past experiences.

zh: 当我们把作诗的技法、韵律和节奏的格式也归入考察之列时，就会发现，它们对确定的“意义”的范围同样做出了贡献。其方式既受外部的常规支配，也受内部的由诗歌本身激起的愿望所支配。
en: When the devices of versiﬁcation, patterns of rhyme and rhythm are also considered, it becomes clear that they too contribute inextricably to the range of ‘meanings’ available, in ways that are determined both externally, by convention, and internally, by the expectations aroused by the poem itself.

zh: 因此诗歌中所运用的全部“技法”生成并因此也构成了诗歌的“意义”范围。
en: Thus the sum total of ‘devices’ employed in the poem generate and so constitute its range of ‘meaning’.

zh: 最后，诗歌就成为自己的技法，诗歌就是自已的形式。
en: In the end, the poem is its devices, and it is its form.

zh: 现在这个问題在于把evolved from转换成very evolved不是从一个动词的主动转成被动,这个跟Andre beat Boris转成被动的Boris was beaten by Andre是不一样的。
en: The problem is that the conversion of “evolved from” to “very  evolved” is not a switch from the active voice of a verb to the passive voice, as  Andre beat Boris → Boris was beaten by Andre.

zh: 塞费尔所提的来源evolved from在现代英语中是不及物的动词，没有直接的受词。
en: The source Safire mentions, “evolved from”, is intransitive in modern English, with no direct object.

zh: 在英文中要把一个动词变为被动，你要把受词先转为主语，所以is evolved只有在Something evolved Andre的情况下才可能转为被动式，但是这个句子不存在。
en: To passivize a verb in English you convert the direct object into a subject, so “is evolved” could only have been passivized from “Something evolved Andre”, which does not exist.

zh: 在现代英语里，只有很基本的格系统。通常主动词后紧接的名词短语为直接宾语，因此如果形成疑问句时，需要将主动词提前，那么前后两个规则就会相互矛盾。
en: Modern English, with its rudimentary case system, defines grammatical relations structurally: the direct object is the NP that is sister to the verb.

zh: 引入do之后可以让主动词保持在原来的位置上，因此保证了句子的SVO词序，因而清楚地显示出句子的主语和宾语。
en: If the main verb were to move, this sisterhood configuration would be violated.The introduction of do allows the verb to remain in its base position, and the sentence thus retains the SVO word order that most plainly indicates the subject and object of the sentence.

zh: 除此之外，结构主义是这样一系列文学理论之一，他们想以某种有效的东西取代宗教：在结构主义这里，是以科学这一现代宗教。这是注定失败的尝试。
en: Structuralism is among other things one more of literary theory's series of doomed attempts to replace religion with something as effective: in this case, with the modern religion of science.

zh: 但是，追求文学的纯客观阅读显然造成了严重的问题。
en: But the search for a purely objective reading of literary works clearly poses grievous problems.

zh: 因为，即使在最严格的客观分析中，似乎也不可能根除某些解释因素以及主观性因素。
en: It seems impossible to eradicate some element of interpretation, and so of subjectivity, from even the most rigorously objective analysis.

zh: 吉尼的话语中缺乏助动词、冠词、第三人称单数的一致性标记、过去时标记和大部分代词。
en: Genie’s utterances lacked articles, auxiliary verbs like will or can, the thirdperson singular agreement marker -s, the past-tense marker -ed, question words like who, what, and where, and pronouns.

zh: 她不能构造类型更为复杂的句子，比如主语和动词位置互换的疑问句（例如：Are you hungry?
en: She had no ability to form more complex types of sentences such as questions (e.g., Are you feeling hungry?

zh: “你饿了吗”)。吉尼是在关键期过后才开始学习语言的，因此不能完全习得英语的语法规则。
en: ).Genie started learning language after the critical period and was therefore never able to fully acquire the grammatical rules of English.

zh: 我认为，这意味着列维-斯特劳斯认为他已取得一种具有“一套转换规则”的分析方法，使我们能够从神话的一种变体转到另一种变体。
en: This means, I take it, that Lévi-Strauss believes he has arrived at a method of analysis which furnishes ‘rules of transformation’ enabling us to shift from one variant of the myth to another.

zh: 在这种过程中，我们可以看到一种中介的、有效的、“创造出真实”的力量在活动，这股力量可以制服“残酷的”现实并使之转化为自己的意象。
en: In the process, a mediating, validating, ‘true-making’ agency can be seen to operate which overcomes ‘brute’ reality and transforms it into its own image.

zh: 神话就作为这种活动的必不可少的“逻辑工具”。通过这种活动，在社会里，我们在前进中不断“弥补”现实，解决事实上不可能解决的“对立”，从而使我们的经验足以证明我们的理论前提，这个前提就是神话思维总是从对立的意识出发，朝着对立的解决而前进。
en: Myth emerges as the ‘logical tool’ essential to this operation: one whereby we, in society, ‘make up’ reality as we go along, resolve what are in fact unresolvable ‘oppositions’, and so make our experiences adequate to our theoretical presuppositions: ‘mythical thought always progresses from the awareness of oppositions toward their resolution’.

zh: 当某个工程师要去建立一个组合字的系统时，他第一个想到的就是字串机器。
en: When an engineer has to build a system to combine words in particular orders, a word-chain device is the first thing that comes to mind.

zh: 打电话到査号台所听到的语音录音就是一个很好的例子。
en: The recorded voice that gives you a phone number when you dial directory assistance is a good example.

zh: 它是用人的声音去录下十个数字的念音，在7个不同的位置(如电话号码第一个位置时的声调，同样数字在电话号码第二个位置的声调等等)的各种抑扬顿挫声调。
en: A human speaker is recorded uttering the ten digits, each in seven different sing-song patterns (one for the first position in a phone number, one for the second position, and so on).

zh: 而更为重要的是，只有当读者凭借现行的阐释手段，以处理这种阅读方法所发现的任何结论时，字谜才能被用于产生意义。
en: Moreover, and this is the important point, anagrams can be used to produce meaning only if one relies on current interpretive techniques for dealing with whatever this mode of reading discovers.

zh: 当读者发现马拉美的诗题Brise marine（海风）中有一个rire（笑）的字谜时，他可以说道一番，因为他知道这个词语如果真地在诗中出现，应该如何处理。
en: On finding an anagram of rire in Mallarmé’s title Brise marine one can make something of it because one knows what one might do if the word itself appeared in the poem.

zh: 如果在阅读阐释过程中会出现某种意义，那一定存在某种具体的办法，使字谜与文本发生关系。
en: There must be particular ways of relating anagram to text if any meaning is to result from the operation.

zh: 那么，我们究竟如何区分“人咬狗”跟“狗咬人”呢?
en: So how do we actually distinguish “Man bites dog” from “Dog bites man”?

zh: 在字典上，咬的定义写的是 “咬的人是主语，被咬的东西是受词”，但是我们如何在树状图上找到主语和受词呢?
en: The dictionary entry for “bite” says ''The biter is the subject; the bitten thing is the object.'' But how do we find subjects and objects in the tree?

zh: 文法规则在名词短语上挂了个小标签，使它可以跟动词意义所规范的角色相配合。
en: Grammar puts little tags on the noun phrases that can be matched up with the roles laid out in a verb's dictionary entry.

zh: 这个小标签就叫做“格”。
en: These tags are called cases.

zh: 在许多语言里，这个格是以名词的字首或字尾变化的形式出现。
en: In many languages, cases appear as prefixes or suffixes on the nouns.

zh: 然而，继续追究这个问题是没有意义的。原因是，关键的问题并不在于短语结构语法的“简单性”，而是在于具有短语结构成分并在生成深层结构过程中起作用的转换语法的“简单性”。
en: However, it is pointless to pursue this topic, because what is at stake is not the“simplicity” of phrase structure grammars but rather of transformational grammars with a phrase structure component that plays a role in generating deep structures.

zh: 并且，也绝对不存在“容易计算”或“算法的简单性”这样的数学概念，能够哪怕是含糊地暗示，符合这种系统可能优于从这一视角仔细考察过的各种自动机系统，例如有限状态自动机、线性有界自动机等等。
en: And there is absolutely no mathematical concept of “ease of computation”or“simplicity of algorithm”that even vaguely suggests that such systems may have some advantage over the kinds of automata that have been seriously investigated from this point of view-for example, finite state automata, linear bounded automata, and so on.

zh: 以下是英语元音辅音的特征矩阵。
en: Here are feature matrices for vowels and consonants in English.

zh: 通过挑出所有在一个或多个特征上相同的音段，你可以辨别出自然类。
en: By selecting all segments marked the same for one or more features, you can identify natural classes.

zh: 例如，高元音的自然类/i，i,u ，u / 可以在表7 .4 的元音特征图中标为[+高] ;带声塞音的自然类/b，m, d, n, g, ŋ，dʒ/可以在表7 .5 的辅音特征图中标记为[+带声] [-通]。
en: For example, the natural class of high vowels /i, ɪ, u, ʊ/ is marked [+high] in the vowel feature chart of Table 7.4; the natural class of voiced stops /b, m, d, n, g, ŋ, dʒ/ are the ones marked [+voice] [–continuant] in the Table 7.5.

zh: 对文学专业的学生来说，列维-斯特劳斯的“结构”人类学和由此产生的结构语言学的含义必然是深刻的。
en: For the student of literature, the implications of Lévi-Strauss’s sort of ‘structural’ anthropology and the structural linguistics from which it derives, must be considerable.

zh: 首先，这两门学科的基本概念都为现代人攻击“现实主义”或“自然主义”提供了基础，并因而给予了动力。“现实主义”或“自然主义”的前提是，一件语言艺术作品和它必定要“涉及”的“现实”或“自然”之间存在着明显的一对一的对应。
en: Primarily, the notions fundamental to both disciplines provide a basis for, and so lend power to, the modern attack on ‘realism’ or ‘naturalism’: the presupposition that a transparent ‘one-to-one’ correspondence exists between a work of art in language, and the ‘reality’ or ‘nature’ to which that work of art is presupposed to ‘refer’.

zh: 要完全理解一句话的意义，我们必须把词汇串分析为句法结构，因为言语的意义除了依赖词汇的意义之外，还依赖于词序和成分结构。
en: To get the full meaning of an utterance, we must parse the string into syntactic structures, because meaning depends on word order and constituent structure in addition to the meaning of words.

zh: 有些心理语言学家相信我们在理解言语的过程中，既运用了自上而下处理方式也运用了自下而上处理方式。
en: Some psycholinguists believe we use both top-down processing and bottom-up processing during comprehension.

zh: 自上而下处理方式除了利用来自感官输入的词汇信息之外，还利用了语义和句法信息，但自下而上处理方式只利用感官输入中所含有的信息。
en: Top-down processing uses semantic and syntactic information in addition to the lexical information drawn from the sensory input; bottom-up processing uses only information contained in the sensory input.

zh: 你可以听到第五个语言发音器官的效应，假如你把Sam和sat的母音拉长，再无限延长最后的子音，你会感到这个效应。
en: You can hear the effects of the fifth speech organ by drawing out the vowel in Sam and sat, and postponing the final consonant indefinitely.

zh: 在英语的各个方言中，母音是不一样的。
en: In most dialects of English, the vowels will be different: the vowel in Sam will have a twangy, nasal sound.

zh: Sam 的母音有鼻音，这是因为软腭是张开的，可以让空气从鼻中出来，鼻腔是另一个共鸣箱，当振动的空气流过它时，另一组频率的声波被放大和被抵消。
en: That is because the soft palate or velum (the fleshy flap at the back of the hard palate) is opened, allowing air to flow out through the nose as well as through the mouth.The nose is another resonant chamber, and when vibrating air flows through it, yet another set of frequencies gets amplied and filtered.

zh: 如果诗歌是一种行为，一个关键的问题是诗歌作者的行为与发言者，或者是朗诵诗歌的“声音”的行为之间的关系。
en: For the poem as act, a key question has been the relation between the act of the author who writes the poem and that of the speaker or ‘voice’ that speaks there.

zh: 这是一个错综复杂的问题。
en: This is a complicated matter.

zh: 作者不用去读诗，而是要去写诗，就是说作者要想像他或她自己，或者另外一个声音去朗诵这首诗。
en: The author does not speak the poem; to write it, the author imagines himself or herself or another voice speaking it.

zh: 他还认为，群氓文化既不是美国土生土长的文化，也不是民主制度的必然结果。
en: He claims that mass culture is not American by nature, or by example, nor is it the inevitable culture of democracy.

zh: 在罗森伯格看来，群氓文化在苏联最普遍。
en: Mass culture, according to Rosenberg, is nowhere more widespread than in the Soviet Union.

zh: 其始作俑者不是资本主义，而是科技。
en: Its author is not capitalism, but technology.

zh: 小说《黑暗之心》和电影《现代启示录》中的人物库尔茨就属于这种类型。
en: Kurtz of both Heart of Darkness and Apocalypse Now is such a figure.

zh: 第二类故事则强调拥有“种族优越性”的白人对丛林及丛林栖息者的利用与征服。
en: Then there are stories of whites, who because of the supposed power of their racial heredity impose themselves on the jungle and its inhabitants.

zh: 小说、电影和神话故事中常常出现的角色“人猿泰山”则是此类帝国主义小说最典型的代表。
en: ‘Tarzan’ (novels, films and myth) is the classic representation of this imperial fiction.

zh: 在东方主义的视角下，上述两种叙事结构均包蕴着帝国主义文化的欲望和焦虑，而不仅仅是对其他种族和异域土地的征服。
en: From the perspective of Orientalism both narratives tell us a great deal more about the desires and anxieties of the culture of imperialism than they can ever tell us about the people and places of colonial conquest.

zh: 1998年，在肥皂剧《加冕街》中，虚构人物迪尔德丽•拉希德被捕人狱。
en: The 1998 case of the imprisonment of Coronation Street character Deirdre Rachid is perhaps a classic example of hyperrealism.

zh: 全英国的小报不但报道了这一消息，更积极呼吁将其释放，仿佛这不是一部虚构电视剧的虚构情节，而是一起“真实生活”中的事件。
en: The tabloid press not only covered the story, it campaigned for her release, in much the same way as if this was an incident from ‘real life’.

zh: 这或可算是超级真实主义的经典案例。
《每日星报》发起了一场名为“释放威瑟菲尔德人”的抗议运动，鼓动读者通过电话或传真的方式联名抗议。
en: The Daily Star launched a campaign to ‘Free the Weatherfield One’, and invited readers to phone or fax them to register their protest.

zh: 两份英国报纸在报道1992年洛杉矶暴动时（此前4名洛杉矶警察殴打一名骑摩托车的黑人Rodney King。路人录下殴打画面后，公众气愤要求严惩涉事警察，但4人却被法院无罪释放。这一事件引发了洛杉矶大规模的黑人暴动）使用的标题是“洛杉矶无法无天”和“洛杉矶之战”。很显然，编辑在制作标题的时候既未联系与该新闻事件性质相似的1965年沃茨暴动，亦未考虑游行示威者在暴乱中喊出的口号“无正义毋宁战”，而是借鉴了美国电视剧《洛城法网》的名字，完全在虚构世界里寻找对新闻故事的诠释方法。
en: The riots, following the acquittal of the four Los Angeles police officers captured on video physically assaulting the black motorist Rodney King, were headlined in two British newspapers as ‘LA Lawless’, and in another as ‘LA War’ -- the story anchored not by a historical reference to similar disturbances in Watts, Los Angeles in 1965, or to the implications of the words --‘No justice no peace’--chanted by demonstrators during the riots; the editors chose instead to locate the story within the fictional world of the American television series LA Law.

zh: 约于纪元前1380年席卷埃及的伟大宗教革命与政治革命，一直被描述为一个人，即诶赫那顿的业绩。
en: The great religious and political revolution which gripped Egypt about 1380b.c. has been pictured as the work of one man: Ikhnaton.

zh: 布里斯特德说：“在埃赫那顿以前，世界史不过是传统之不可遏止的拓展。”
en: "Until Ikhnaton," says Breasted, "the history of the world had been but the irresistible drift of tradition.

zh: 奥格拉拉人相信圆圈是神圣的，因为神灵使自然界所有的东西都成为圆的，除了石头。
en: The Oglala believe the circle to be sacred because the great spirit caused everything in nature to be round except stone.

zh: 石头是用于破坏的工具。
en: Stone is the implement of destruction.

zh: 太阳与天空，地球与月亮，就像盾牌一样都是圆形的，尽管天空深得像一只碗。
en: The sun and the sky, the earth and the moon are round like a shield, though the sky is deep like a bowl.

zh: 此外，因为一切人类语言可以互相翻译，就可以通过问答而得知人们如何看待他们自己的思想和行为。
en: Moreover, because of the mutual translatability of all human languages, what people think about their thoughts and behavior can be learned through questions and answers.

zh: 一个巴聪加人如何称呼他的母亲？
en: What does a Bathonga call his mother?

zh: “妈妈妮。”
en: "Mamani."

zh: 葛兰西对文化研究作出的最大贡献就是提出了“霸权”这个概念，他用这个概念来解释（在资本主义制度的剥削和压迫之下）为何西方资本主义民主国家之内无法产生社会主义革命。
en: Central to the cultural studies appropriation of Gramsci is the concept of hegemony.Hegemony is for Gramsci a cultural concept developed to explain (given the exploitative and oppressive nature of capitalism) the absence of socialist revolutions in the Western capitalist democracies.

zh: 在葛兰西看来，所谓“霸权” 指的是某种进行中的状况，它描述了统治阶级（连同其他相关阶级或阶级成分）通过操纵“精神及道德领导权”的方式对社会加以引导而非统治的 过程（Gramsci, 2009: 75)。
en: The concept of hegemony is used by Gramsci (2009) to refer to a condition in process in which a dominant class (in alliance with other classes or class fractions) does not merely rule a society but leads it through the exercise of‘intellectual and moral leadership (75)’.

zh: 在霸权之中包含了一种特殊的共识，即某个社会群体想方设法将自己的特定利益展示为整个社会的整体利益。
en: Hegemony involves a specific kind of consensus: a social group seeks to present its own  interests as the general interests of the society as a whole.

zh: 于是，尽管社会之中始终存在着剥削和压迫，但各个阶级之间却达成了高度的共识，彼此和谐相处；被统治阶级似乎服膺于“共同的”价值、观念、目标，以及文化和政治内涵，并以此种方式被既有的权力结构“收编” (incorporate)。
en: In this sense, the concept is used to suggest a society in which, despite oppression and exploitation, there is a high degree of consensus, a large measure of social stability; a society in which subordinate groups and classes appear to actively support and subscribe to values, ideals, objectives, cultural and political meanings, which bind them to, and ‘incorporate’ them into, the prevailing structures of power.

zh: 大众文化的第五个定义来自意大利马克思主义者安东尼奥•葛兰西的政治分析，尤其与其对“霸权”这一概念的发展密切相关。
en: A fifth definition of popular culture, then, is one that draws on the political analysis of the Italian Marxist Antonio Gramsci, particularly on his development of the concept of hegemony.

zh: 葛兰西用“霸权”这个词来指涉社会统治集团如何通过控制“智力与道德的领导权”来贏取被统治集团的赞同。
en: Gramsci uses the term ‘hegemony’ to refer to the way in which dominant groups in society, through a process of ‘intellectual and moral leadership’, seek to win the consent of subordinate groups in society.

zh: 对此，我们将在第四章进行详细讨论。
en: This will be discussed in some detail in Chapter 4.

zh: 这个问题仍在等待答案。任何谙熟历史学、社会学或人类学论争的人都不难同意关于文化的科学仍缺乏真正的识别标准，即观察什么和怎样观察，比较什么和怎样比较关于在进化和传播中探索什么的标准，在这门迟到的科学中有一个学派的成员将他们的研究建基于拜日文化（heliolithic culture)的概念之上或其周围。
en: That this problem still awaits its solution, and that the science of culture still lacks real criteria of identification—that is, criteria of what to observe and how to observe, what to compare and how to carry it out, of what to trace in evolution and diffusion —will hardly be disputed by anyone acquainted with the controversies of history, sociology, or anthropology.In this latter science, there is one school whose members base most of their researches on and around the concept of heliolithic culture.

zh: 反对这种理论的学者直接否认拜日文化是可以在世界各地予以识别的现实。
en: Those who reject such theories would flatly deny that heliolithic culture is a reality which can be identified all over the globe.

zh: 他们对从巨石纪念碑、二元组织（dual organization)、象牙符号、将子安贝 (cowrie shell)贝壳解释成性象征为参照物进行的识别，大有争议。事实上，他们对每一项假定的现实都不以为然。
en: They would dispute the identification carried out with reference to megalithic monuments, dual organization, the elephant's trunk symbol, the interpretation of the sexual symbolism in the cowrie shell, in fact, every one of the realities postulated.

zh: 消费是对资本主义体制的战术袭击。

正如德塞都（1984: 31）所言：实际上，一个理性化的、扩张主义的、中心化的、奇观式的以及声势浩大的生产，正遭遇着一种判然有别的生产，它 的名字叫“消费”。其特征是：诡计、分裂（这是环境使然）、偷袭、秘密性、不知疲傣却静悄悄地行为……简言之，“消费”有一种半隐蔽性（quasi-invisibility），因为它展现自己的方式，不是凭借它自己的产品（它会把这些产品放在哪里呢？），而是凭借一种艺术，一种利用那些强加到“消费”之上的产品的艺术。
en: As de Certeau (1984: 31) puts it: In reality, a rationalized, expansionist, centralized, spectacular and clamorous production is confronted by an entirely different kind of production, called "consumption" and characterized by its ruses, its fragmentation (the results of the circumstances), its poaching, its clandestine nature, its tireless but quiet activity, in short by its quasi-invisibility, since it shows itself not in its own products (where would it place them?) but in an art of using those imposed on it.

zh: 在艾柯看来，这种斗争尽管是机会主义的结果，却确定了弗莱明的摩尼教意识形态，形成了一种基本的二元对立面。
en: This struggle, which  for Eco defines Fleming's Manichaean ideology even if it is the result of opportunism, forms a fundamental binary opposition.

zh: 邦德系列小说类似于童话，在其中，一个骑士（邦德）按照国王（M）的命令去执行一项消灭妖怪——如一条恐龙（那个反面人物）——的任务，并营救夫人（那个女人）。
en: The Bond novels are comparable to fairy tales in which a knight (Bond), under the orders of a king (M), goes on a mission to destroy the monster, such as a dragon (the villain), and rescue the lady (the woman).

zh: 这两类故事都涉及到体现了善与恶之间二元对立的各种基本因素的转换。
en: Both types of story involve transformations of the basic elements embodied in the binary opposition between good and evil.

zh: 同时他又在精确科学(exact sciences)研究常有的教条主义面前保持了自由。
en: At the same time he remained free from the dogmatism usually associated with the study of the exact sciences.

zh: 维尔海姆·冯特把他的兴趣导向了文化人类学。
en: His interests were diverted to cultural anthropology by Wilhelm Wundt.

zh: 他主要田野工作地点是新几内亚和西北美拉尼西亚，特别是特罗布里恩群岛。但他也曾简单调查过澳大利亚的一些部落、亚利桑那州的荷比人(the Hopi) 、东非的本巴人(the Bemba)和查卡人(the Chagga),以及墨西哥的查布特克人(the Zapotec)。
en: Although his basic fieldwork was done in New Guinea and Northwestern Melanesia, parThe Interpretation of Culturesularly in the Trobriand Islands, he also spent briefer intervals with some Australian tribes, the Hopi of Arizona, the Bemba and Chagga of East Africa and the Zapotec of Mexico.

zh: 但是，在现实中，在近距离审视的放大镜之下，我们就能看出更加多样化的倾向、理论和方法。每一派都以关于什么是真正解释原则的某种根本概念为特征；每一派都有它希望用以理解文化过程和产物的具体方法；每一派在进入田野时都有一套略显不同的知识分类架构(pigeonholes)来收集和分装证据。
en: In reality, however, and under the magnifying glass of closer scrutiny, we could find a much greater diversity of tendencies, theories, and methods, each characterized by some ultimate conception as to what is the real principle of interpretation; each having some specific approach through which it hopes to reach the comprehension of a cultural process or product; each going into the field with a somewhat differential set of intellectual pigeonholes into which to gather and distribute evidence.

zh: 于是，就有了比较方法，学者们使用它时，兴趣主要在于收集广泛的跨文化材料，就像我们在弗雷泽的《金枝》(The Golden Bough) 和泰勒的《原始文化》( Primitive Culture),以及韦斯特马克关于婚姻和道德的著作中看到的那样。
en: Thus there is the comparative method, in which the student is primarily interested in gathering extensive cross-cultural documentations, such as we see in Frazer's The Golden Bough, or in Tylor's Primitive Culture, or in the volumes of Westermarck on marriage and morals.

zh: 在这些著作中，作者主要感兴趣的是指示出泛灵信仰(animisThe Interpretation of Cultures belief) 或巫术仪式(magical rite),或人类文化的某一阶段，或基本组织某一类型的根本性质。
en: In such works the authors are primarily interested in laying bare the essential nature of animisThe Interpretation of Cultures belief or magical rite, of a phase in human culture or a type of essential organization.

zh: 很显然，这整个方法预设了一个关于所比较的现实的真正科学定义。
en: Obviously, this whole approach presupposes a really scientific definition of the realities compared.

zh: 很显然，这整个方法预设了一个关于所比较的现实的真正科学定义。
en: Obviously, this whole approach presupposes a really scientific definition of the realities compared.

zh: 除非我们列出真正可比的现象的详尽无遗的“清单”，而且不为表面的相似之处或虚构的类推所欺骗，否则，大量工作却会导致错误结论 。
en: Unless we list, in our exhaustive inventories, really comparable phenomena, and are never duped by surface similarities or fictitious analogies, a great deal of labor may lead to incorrect conclusions.

zh: 我们还应记住，比较的方法必须始终是任何归纳，任何理论原则，或任何适用于我们的研究课题的普遍法则的基础。
en: Let us also remember that the comparative method must remain the basis of any generalization, any theoreThe Interpretation of Culturesal principle, or any universal law applicable to our subject matter.

zh: 为了掩饰这种“标准化”，音乐工业采取了阿多诺所称的“伪个人化”策略：“音乐的标准化使消费者按照生产者规定的方式“规规矩矩地”听歌。而伪个人化所发挥的作用就是让他们在乖乖听歌的同时完全意识不到自己的听歌方式是被控制的，或者说，这些歌都是被“预先消化”过的。”
en: In order to conceal standardization, the music industry engages in what Adorno calls "pseudo-individualization": "Standardisation of song hits keeps the customers in line by doing their  listening for them, as it were. Pseudo- individualization, for its part, keeps them in line by making them forget that what they listen to is already listened to for them, or "pre-digested".

zh: 旧人类学的另一主导倾向是强调播化。即强调一个文化向其他文化的采纳（adopting)或借用（borrowing)各种用具、工具、制度及信仰的过程。
en: The other dominant tendency of older anthropology laid primary stress on diffusion, that is, the process of adopting or borrowing by one culture from another various devices, implements, institutions, and beliefs.

zh: 播化作为一种文化过程，和进化一样，是真实存在和无可攻击的。
en: Diffusion as a cultural process is as real and unassailable as evolution.

zh: 这两种过程之间看来也实在难觅其异。
en: It seems certain that no distinction can be made between the two processes.

zh: 况且，尽管两个学派的支持者有些不肯妥协和敌视态度，但他们都从不同角度研究了文化成长问題，并为说明这个问题做出了各自的贡献。
en: The votaries of either school, however, in spite of their somewhat intransigent and hostile attitude to each other, have approached the problem of culture growth from different angles and have contributed to its illumination independently.

zh: 进化论与播化论的歧异——每种学说内部自然也为部分学派和分歧的观点——看来是人类学方法和概念“装备”的主要分水岭。
en: The rift between evolutionism and diffusionism—and each of them, of course, contains a number of partial schools and divergent opinions—still appears as the main dividing line in method and conceptual outfit.

zh: 如今，这两派之外有时又加上功能学派。本文作者常被认为是它的主要责任人。
en: To these two, there is sometimes added at present the functional school, for which the present writer is often held to be largely responsible.

zh: 但是，在现实中，在近距离审视的放大镜之下，我们就能看出更加多样化的倾向、理论和方法。每一派都以关于什么是真正解释原则的某种根本概念为特征；每一派都有它希望用以理解文化过程和产物的具体方法；每一派在进人田野时都带有一套略显不同的知识分类架构来收集和分装证据。
en: In reality, however, and under the magnifying glass of closer scrutiny, we could find a much greater diversity of tendencies, theories, and methods, each characterized by some ultimate conception as to what is the real principle of interpretation; each having some specific approach through which it hopes to reach the comprehension of a cultural process or product; each going into the field with a somewhat differential set of intellectual pigeonholes into which to gather and distribute evidence.

zh: 我们将看到，物质事物在文化中扮演着十分具体的角色。
en: Material objects, as we shall see, play a very specific part in culture.

zh: 将一件人工制品作为某一文化因素的模型,有着极大危险。
en: To take an artifact as the model of a cultural element is exceedingly dangerous.

zh: 人们针对文化圈理论（Kulturkreislehre)而提出的主要批评是它将一件艺术品的物理形式看作文化识别的主要或全部指标（index)的谬论。
en: The main criThe Interpretation of Culturesisms which will be made against the Kulturkreislehre are directed at the fallacy of taking the physical form of an artifact as the main or exclusive index of cultural identification.

zh: 主要受安克尔曼（Ankermann)和格雷布纳（Graebner)一类“博物馆鼹鼠”的影响，播化论总是与在古旧建筑的展柜和地窖中堆放，分类不清、定义不准的器物中得到的启示有关。
en: Diffusionism, mainly through the influence of certain museum moles like Graebner and Ankermann, has been linked up with the inspiration of ill-assorted and ill-defined objects lumped together in the vitrines and cellars of an old building.

zh: 但是，既然播化论的基础必须是对那些显示在地图上的文化现实的正确识别，所以，派生于著名的形态标准和数量标准的错误识别，就对它那本来尚可接受的倾向的健康发展造成了浩劫。
en: Since, however, the basis of diffusionism must be a correct identification of cultural realities plotted on the map, the false identifications derived from the famous criteria of form and quantity have played great havoc with the sound development of that otherwise essentially acceptable tendency.

zh: 相似的批评也适用于大多数播化学派所使用的基本概念，即 “特质”和“特质丛”。
en: A similar adverse criticism must be applied to the fundamental concept of most diffusionist schools, that of the trait and trait complex.

zh: 同其他任何比较研究一样，播化论首先必须面对和解决识別的难题。
en: In diffusion, as in any other comparative research, the problem of identity first has to be faced and solved.

zh: 最先直面这一难题之功应首推德国博物馆民族学家弗•格雷布纳，他早年受到历史学方面的训练，但在开创性著作《民族学方法》中，确立了著名的，经常为人引用的形态和数量的标准。
en: The credit of having faced this first belongs to F. Graebner, the German museum ethnologist, in his earlier career trained in history, who established the famous and oft-repeated criteria of form and quantity in his pioneering work, Methode der Ethnologie (1911).

zh: 折衷主义是本世纪前半期美国的主导研究策略。
en: Eclecticism  was the dominant research strategy in the United States during the first half of this century.

zh: 在弗朗兹·博厄斯的深入的影响下。美国人类学家致力于在同韦斯勒的普遍类型纲领大体一致的广阔题材范围里收集实地资料。
en: Under the pervasive influence of Franz Boas, American anthropologists devoted themselves to the collection of field data over a broad range of topics roughly corresponding to Wissler’s scheme of universal categories.

zh: 在纯粹的宗教和宗教应用之间，在遭遇到设想的“真正的真实”和以这种遭遇观察普通经验之间，存在着质的差别——这种差别是经验的而不是超验的。对差别的认识和探索将使我们比原始神秘主义者和原始实用主义者更深刻地理解当博罗罗人说“我是一只鹦鹉”和一个基督徒说“我是一个罪人”时他们是什么意思。在原始神秘主义理论中，普通世界消失在一片奇怪思想的云雾中；在原始实用主义理论中，宗教分解成一些有用的虚构。
en: The recognition and exploration of the qualitative difference-an empirical, not a transcendental difference-between religion pure and religion applied, between an encounter with the supposedly "really real" and a viewing of ordinary experience in light of what that encounter seems to reveal, will, therefore, take us further toward an understanding of what a Bororo means when he says "I am a parakeet," or a Christian when he says "I am a sinner," than either a theory of primitive mysticism in which the commonplace world disappears into a cloud of curious ideas or of a primitive pragmatism in which religion disintegrates into a collection of useful fictions.

zh: 同时他又在精确科学(exact sciences)研究常有的教条主义面前保持了自由。
en: At the same time he remained free from the dogmatism usually associated with the study of the exact sciences.

zh: 维尔海姆·冯特把他的兴趣导向了文化人类学。
en: His interests were diverted to cultural anthropology by Wilhelm Wundt.
