zh: 他主要田野工作地点是新几内亚和西北美拉尼西亚，特别是特罗布里恩群岛。但他也曾简单调查过澳大利亚的一些部落、亚利桑那州的荷比人(the Hopi) 、东非的本巴人(the Bemba)和查卡人(the Chagga),以及墨西哥的查布特克人(the Zapotec)。
en: Although his basic fieldwork was done in New Guinea and Northwestern Melanesia, particularly in the Trobriand Islands, he also spent briefer intervals with some Australian tribes, the Hopi of Arizona, the Bemba and Chagga of East Africa and the Zapotec of Mexico.

zh: 如果列出世界上各种文化的所有表现，我们就会明显地发现一系列详尽的边缘古怪习俗：如食人之风（cannibalism)、猎头、 产翁制（couvade)、夸富宴（potlatch)、库拉圈（kula)、火葬(cremation)、木乃伊（mummification)等。
en: Were we to plot out all the manifestations of every culture in the world, we obviously would find such elements as cannibalism, head-hunting, couvade, potlatch, kula, cremation, mummification, and a vast array of detailed peripheral eccentricities.

zh: 就此而论，显然没有单一的文化能够包罗许多其他文化中的所有形式的畸形和怪癖。
en: From this point of view obviously no single culture covers all the itemized freaks and eccentricities of many others.

zh: 然而我要说，这种研究方法在本质上是不科学的。
en: Yet this approach, I submit, is essentially unscientific.

zh: 1998年，在肥皂剧《加冕街》中，虚构人物迪尔德丽•拉希德被捕人狱。
en: The 1998 case of the imprisonment of Coronation Street character Deirdre Rachid is perhaps a classic example of hyperrealism.

zh: 全英国的小报不但报道了这一消息，更积极呼吁将其释放，仿佛这不是一部虚构电视剧的虚构情节，而是一起“真实生活”中的事件。
en: The tabloid press not only covered the story, it campaigned for her release, in much the same way as if this was an incident from ‘real life’.

zh: 这或可算是超级真实主义的经典案例。
《每日星报》发起了一场名为“释放威瑟菲尔德人”的抗议运动，鼓动读者通过电话或传真的方式联名抗议。
en: The Daily Star launched a campaign to ‘Free the Weatherfield One’, and invited readers to phone or fax them to register their protest.

zh: 如班泽尔博士所说，超自然物“没有与人类为敌的意向，因为人类可扣压他们的供品，它们的支撑必须由祭品、祈祷、巫术习俗给予保证。
en: The supernaturals, as Dr. Buozel says, 'have no animus against man. In as much as they may withhold their gifts, their assistance must be secured by offerings, prayers and magical practices.'

zh: ”但它不是对邪恶势力的抚慰。
en: But it is no placation of evil forces.

zh: 因为可能有所保留，它们对人类的帮助必须由祭品、祈祷、巫术习俗给予保证。
”但这样说并不是对邪恶势力的抚慰。
这种世界性的文化传播却妨碍了我们。让我们没有认真对待其他民族的文明，此前从未有过这样的妨碍。它已赋予了我们的文化以一种我们已很久未从历史上予以说明的巨大的普遍性，而且这个普遍性我们也能解释成是必要的和不可避免的。
en: This world-wide cultural diffusion has protected us as man had never been protected before from having to take seriously the civilizations of other peoples; it has given to our culture a massive universality that we have long ceased to account for historically, and which we read off rather as necessary and evitable.

zh: 列维—施特劳斯指出，神话的运行方式和语言是一样的。神话是由“神话素”构成的，就像语言是由“词素”和“音素”等单元构成的一样。
en: Myths, Lévi-Strauss argues, work like language: they comprise individual "mythemes", analogous to individual units of language, "morphemes" and "phonemes".

zh: 如词素和音素一般，神话素无法独立生成意义，而必须以某种方式被组合起来方可。
en: Like morphemes and phonemes, mythemes only take on meaning when combined in particular patterns.

zh: 人类是一个动物物种，他们受基本自然条件的制约。
en: Human beings are an animal species.

zh: 只有满足这些条件，个人才能生存，种族才能延续，整个物种的正常形态才能维持。
en: They are subject to elemental conditions which have to be fulfilled so that individuals may survive, the race continue and organisms one and all he maintained in working order.

zh: 此外，人在其整套物质装备和制造及鉴赏这套装备的能力之外，又创造出另一个次生环境（secondary environment)。
en: Again, in his whole outfit of artifacts and his ability to produce them and to appreciate them, man creates a secondary environment.

zh: 这些都已是老生常谈，况且类似的文化定义经常得到陈述和详尽说明。
en: There is nothing new said so far, and similar definitions of culture have often been stated and elaborated.

zh: 但是，我们还要引出一两条额外的结论。
en: We shall, however, draw one or two additional conclusions.

zh: 有几位美国权威人士指出，在日本整个封建时代的七百余年中，天皇一直是有名无实的傀儡元首。
en: Some American authorities pointed out that through all Japan's seven feudal centuries the Emperor was a shadowy figurehead.

zh: 每个人所尽忠的对象是各自直接的主君——“大名”，以及大名之上的军事大元帅——将军。
en: Every man's immediate loyalty was due to his lord, the daimyo, and, beyond that, to the military Generalissimo, the Shogun.

zh: 对天皇忠诚与否，几乎根本投人关心。
en: Fealty to the Emperor was hardly an issue.

zh: 天皇被幽禁在被隔绝的宫廷之中，其活动和仪式均受将军所制定的规章制度的严格限制。
en: He was kept secluded in an isolated court whose ceremonies and activities were rigorously circumscribed by the Shogun's regulations.

zh: 或者换个稍微不同的说法，可以比较那些案例：一类是比现有的公民国家要小而在种族、部落、语言等方面充满“一体团体情感”的群体，另一些是比较大，或者至少在某种形式上超出了边界之外的群体。
en: Or, put somewhat differently, one can contrast those cases in which the racial, tribal, linguistic, and so on, reference group that is charged with a "corporate sentiment of oneness" is smaller than the existing civil state, and those where it is larger, or at least transcends its borders in some fashion.

zh: 在第一个例子中，产生于政治压制；在第二个例子中，产生于政治解体感。
en: In the first instance primordial discontent arises from a sense of political suffocation; in the second, from a sense of political dismemberment.

zh: 缅甸的克伦人、加纳的阿散蒂人或乌干达的巴干达人的分裂主义是前者的例子；泛阿拉伯主义、大索马里主义、泛非洲主义，是后者的例子。
en: Karen separatism in Burma, Ashanti in Ghana, or Baganda in Uganda are examples of the former; pan-Arabism, greater Somaliism, pan-Africanism, of the latter.

zh: 从很多方面看，这都不是件易事。
en: This is, in many ways, a daunting task.

zh: 正如托尼•本内特（Tony Bennett)所指出的那样：“从当下情况看，‘大众文化’这一概念实在无用， 它似乎把若干混沌不清乃至彼此抵触的含义塞进一个大熔炉，只会将种种对真相的探索引入理论的死胡同。
en: As Tony Bennett (1980) points out, ‘as it stands, the concept of popular culture is virtually useless, a melting pot of confused and contradictory meanings capable of misdirecting inquiry up any number of theoretical’ (18).

zh: ”（Bennett，1980: 18)此种“界定困难”一部分源自“他者”（otherness)这一概念的特殊性--当我们使用 “大众文化”这一表述时，暗示着与大众文化相对的“他者”总是缺席/在场的。
en: Part of the difficulty stems from the implied otherness that is always absent/ present when we use the term ‘popular culture’.

zh: 在阅读后面的章节时，你也会发现我们往往有意无意地将大众文化与其他文化——民间文化、群氓文化、宰制性文化、工人阶级文化等等——进行对比，并在对比中为“大众文化”下定义。
en: As we shall see in the chapters which follow, popular culture is always defined, implicitly or explicitly, in contrast to other conceptual categories: folk culture, mass culture, dominant culture, working-class culture, etc.

zh: 大众文明及伴随而来的群氓文化架设了一个极具破坏力的战场，时刻威胁着我们，要使我们“不可避免地陷人混乱之中”。
en: Mass civilization and its mass culture pose a subversive front, threatening‘to land us in irreparable chaos’.

zh: 正是为了与大众文明展开斗争，利维斯主义才登上了历史舞台，竭力鼓吹“要在学校教育中加人抵制（群氓文化）的训练”。在学校之外，利维斯主义主张“‘少数人’应当武装起来，主动出击，自觉地采用各种抵抗的形式”。
en: It is against this threat that Leavisism writes its manifestos, and proposes ‘to introduce into schools a training in resistance to mass culture’; and outside schools, to promote a‘conscious and directed effort...to take the form of resistance by an armed and active minority.

zh: 在所有这些表述里，我们看到迄今为止，人们对我们在前一章里描述过的科学活动尚未给予充分注意。它应该包括活跃于巫术、图腾崇拜、氏族体系、家庭制度等文化事实相关要素做出明确的界定和联系。
en: In all this we can see that not sufficient attention has been given so far to that scientific activity which we described in a previous section, and which consists in clearly defining and relating the relevant factors which operate in such cultural facts as magic, totemism, the clan system, and the domestic institution.

zh: 首当其冲的是，有必要表明我们需要在不同文化中对其进行比较，要追索其进化过程或追踪其播化途径的各种现象，是我们进行观察和理论讨论的合理单元（isolate)。
en: It is necessary to show, first and foremost, that a phenomenon which we want to compare in various cultures, which we want to trace in its evolution or follow in its diffusion, is a legitimate isolate of both observation and theoretical discourse.

zh: 因此，我们就有必要清楚明确地说明那众多的物质决定要素，人类行动、信仰和观念，亦即象征表达，是从哪里进入这一单元或文化现实，它们如何互动，又是如何获得彼此间稳定和必然的关系特性。
en: It is necessary to state clearly and precisely where the material determinants, human actions, beliefs and ideas, that is, symbolic performances, enter into such an isolate or reality of culture, how they interact and how they obtain that character of permanent, necessary relationship to each other.

zh: 非洲的泛民族主义运动主要是基于种族，库尔德斯坦是基于部落主义；在老挝是几个掸邦；泰国是基于语言。
en: Pan-national movements in Africa are largely based on race, in Kurdistan, on tribalism; in Laos, the Shan States, and Thailand, on language.

zh: 但是所有这些现象在某种意义上都属于一类。
en: Yet all these phenomena, too, are in some sense of a piece.

zh: 它们形成了一个确定的研究领域。
en: They form a definable field of investigation.

zh: 根据我对阿多诺的论点的概述，他显然很少作出努力从经验上来论证他所提出的主张。
en: It should be evident from the outline above that Adorno makes few attempts to substantiate empirically the claims he makes.

zh: 例如，他对倒退倾听的讨论，一点都没有提到真正的听众们。确切地说，它依赖于一个受其理论限定的推论出来的主题。
en: For example, his discussion of regressive listening makes no reference to audience studies but instead relies on inferences from his theory.

zh: 在德川幕府于十九世纪后半叶崩溃时，日本没有任何集团主张废除这些规范。
en: When the Tokugawa regime crumbled in the first half of the nineteenth century, no group in the nation was in favor of tearing up the map.

zh: 那里没有发生“法国大革命”，甚至连“1848年式的革命”（指“二月革命”）也没有发生。
en: There was no French Revolution.There was not even an 1848.

zh: 然而，形势已无可挽回。
en: Yet the times were desperate.

zh: 在家庭内部，我们看到信仰与祖先崇拜相关。
en: Within the family we find beliefs related to ancestor worship.

zh: 氏族信仰与崇拜或人或兽的祖先图腾相关，起着宗教集会的功能。
en: The clan with its worship of totemic forebears, animal or human, functions as a religious congregation.

zh: 在村庄、城镇和领地群内，我们看到地缘性的崇拜（local cults)。
en: We find local cults of villages, cities, and municipalities.

zh: 宗教也经常成为各类政治国家和帝国的关注焦点。
en: Religion often becomes also the center of political states and empires.

zh: 日本人生活中的等级制习惯，在阶级关系上象在家庭中一样地强烈。
en: The hierarchal arrangements of Japanese life have been as drastic in relations between the classes as they have been in the family.

zh: 在整个历史上，日本一直是个等级森严的阶级社会。一个有几个世纪等级制习惯的民族，既有其重大的长处，也有其重大的短处。
en: In all her national history Japan has been a strong class and caste society, and a nation which has a centuries-long habit of caste arrangements has certain strengths and certain weaknesses which are of the utmost importance.

zh: 克莉丝汀•格莱德希尔发表过类似的观点。她认为女性主义文化研究“应当将广受鄙夷的大众文化形式与具体的文化消费环境相结合，并将其受众视为由社会历史建构的产物”。
en: Christine Gledhill makes a similar point: she advocates a feminist cultural studies ‘which relates commonly derided popular forms to the condition of their consumption in the lives of sociohistorical constituted audiences’.

zh: 她声称：“只有如此，对女性电影和肥皂剧的女性主义分析才能跳出对女性观看行为的负面电影精神分析的窠臼，超越女性被征服、被孤立、被凌虐的身份立场。”
en: ‘In this respect’, she observes, ‘feminist analysis of the woman’s film and soap opera is beginning to counter more negative cine-psychoanalytic . . . accounts of female spectatorship, suggesting colonized, alienated or masochistic positions of identification’.

zh: 对名分的“情义”，就是使名声不受玷污的义务。
en: Giri to one's name is the duty to keep one's reputation unspotted.

zh: 这种“情义’由一系列德行构成，在西欧人看来，有的互相矛盾，但对日本人来说则是完全统一的。因为这类义务不是报恩，不属于“恩的范围”，不涉及往日受恩于别人的问题，而是保持自身名誉的行为。
en: It is a series of virtues—some of which seem to an Occidental to be opposites, but which to the Japanese have a sufficient unity because they are those duties which are not repayments on benefits received; they are 'outside the circle of on.

zh: 大众在观看电视剧《全家福》（All in the Family）中那位刚愎自用的阿尔竒·邦克（Archie Bunker)时，会因为把自己放在他们所塑造的不同的社会层理与文化效忠从属关系中，而对这一人物形象有迥然不同的理解。
en: People watching Archie Bunker, the bigoted male in All in the Family, made sense of him quite differently according to how they positioned themselves within the social formation and thus the cultural allegiances they forged.

zh: 当观众把邦克用作一种文化资源，来思考他们自己的社会体验和意义时，邦克的意义，便能够并的确在阶级轴、年龄轴、性别轴、种族轴之间（此处仅枚举若干最明显的轴线）移动不止。

en: "His" meanings could and did move fluidly along the axes of class, age, gender, and race, to name only the most obvious, as viewers used him as a cultural resource to think through their social experience and the meanings they made out of it.

zh: 大众文本的这种多义的开放性 (polysemic openness)，正是社会差异所需要的，并被用来维持、置疑、思索这些差异。
en: The polysemic openness of popular texts is required by social differences and is used to maintain, question, and think through those differences.

zh: 根据其他文化形式，所有上述婚姻方式，都包含了为年轻人做群体财产的投资。
en: All those which according to other cultural forms involve investment of group property for the young man.

zh: 祖尼人干脆就根除了这些情形。
en: Zufii simply eliminates the occasions.

zh: 每种安排都防止孩子受俄底浦斯情结困扰的可能性。
en: Every arrangement militates against the possibility of the child's suffering from an Oedipus complex.

zh: 比起阶级之间的对抗，大众与权力集团之间的对立，才是整个矛盾的主线，而文化区域正是围绕着这一矛盾分化的。
en: The people versus the power-bloc: this, rather than "class-against-class," is the central line of contradiction around which the terrain of culture is polarized.

zh: 大众文化更是围绕着这一矛盾，即大众力量与权力集团的对抗加以组织的。霍尔由此作结，大众文化研究的开始处，每每是“遏制与对抗的双向运动，这在大众文化内部常常是难以避免的。”
en: Popular culture, especially, is organized around the contradiction: the popular forces verses the power-bloc.This leads him to conclude that the study of popular culture should always start wth "the double movement of containment and resistance, which is always inevitably inside it"

zh: 但是，正如费斯克指出的那样：“在资本主义社会里，不存在所谓的‘本真’民间文化，自然也就无法用‘本真与否’去衡量群氓文化的价值。故而，对‘本真’的哀悼注定只是沉浸在浪漫怀旧中的一种徒然无功的行为。
en: But as Fiske points out, ‘In capitalist societies there is no so-called authentic folk culture against which to measure the “inauthenticity” of mass culture, so bemoaning the loss of the authentic is a fruitless exercise in romantic nostalgia’.

zh: ”这一观点同样适用于对“逝去的有机社区”的分析。
en: This also holds true for the ‘lost’ organic community.

zh: 在第四章中，我们会发现法兰克福学派将消逝的“黄金时代”置于未来而非过去。
en: The Frankfurt School, as we shall see in Chapter 4, locate the lost golden age, not in the past, but in the future.

zh: 另一个更引人注目的例子是美国反正统文化的音乐。这种音乐鼓励人们反抗既定的人生规划，抵制纳粹美利坚对越南发动的战争；而与此同时，这种音乐也为文化工业带来了巨额利润（音乐自身对此无法控制），这些利润很可能被用来支持美国军队在越南战场上的军事行动。杰斐逊飞机乐队越是高唱“你的所有私人财产/都是敌人攻击的靶/而你的敌人/就是我们自己，RCA唱片公司赚的钱就越多。
en: "Another example, in some ways more compelling than that of reggae, is the music of the American counterculture. It inspired people to resist the draft and to organize against Amerika’s war in Vietnam; yet, at the same time, its music made profits (over which it had no control) that could then be used to support the war effort in Vietnam. The more Jefferson Airplane sang‘All your private property/Is target for your enemy/ And your enemy/Is We’, the more money RCA Records made. "

zh: 或者换个稍微不同的说法，可以比较那些案例：一类是比现有的公民国家要小而在种族、部落、语言等方面充满“一体团体情感”的群体，另一些是比较大，或者至少在某种形式上超出了边界之外的群体。
en: Or, put somewhat differently, one can contrast those cases in which the racial, tribal, linguistic, and so on, reference group that is charged with a "corporate sentiment of oneness" is smaller than the existing civil state, and those where it is larger, or at least transcends its borders in some fashion.

zh: 在第一个例子中，原生性不满，产生于政治压制；在第二个例子中，产生于政治解体感。
en: In the first instance primordial discontent arises from a sense of political suffocation; in the second, from a sense of political dismemberment.

zh: 缅甸的克伦人、加纳的阿散蒂人或乌干达的巴干达人的分裂主义是前者的例子；泛阿拉伯主义、大索马里主义、泛非洲主义，是后者的例子。
en: Karen  separatism in Burma, Ashanti in Ghana, or Baganda in Uganda are examples of the former; pan-Arabism, greater Somaliism, pan-Africanism, of the latter.

zh: 或者换个稍微不同的说法，可以比较那些案例：一类是比现有的公民国家要小而在种族、部落、语言等方面充满“一体团体情感”的群体，另一些是比较大，或者至少在某种形式上超出了边界之外的群体。
en: Or, put somewhat differently, one can contrast those cases in which the racial, tribal, linguistic, and so on, reference group that is charged with a "corporate sentiment of oneness" is smaller than the existing civil state, and those where it is larger, or at least transcends its borders in some fashion.

zh: 在第一个例子中，原生性不满，产生于政治压制；在第二个例子中，产生于政治解体感。
en: In the first instance primordial discontent arises from a sense of political suffocation; in the second, from a sense of political dismemberment.

zh: 缅甸的克伦人、加纳的阿散蒂人或乌干达的巴干达人的分裂主义是前者的例子；泛阿拉伯主义、大索马里主义、泛非洲主义，是后者的例子。
en: Karen  separatism in Burma, Ashanti in Ghana, or Baganda in Uganda are examples of the former; pan-Arabism, greater Somaliism, pan-Africanism, of the latter.

zh: 我们多少有些信口开河地谈论观念和价值，利益和信仰；我们在巫术和宗教的分析中讨论民间故事的动机和教条性的概念。
en: We speak more or less glibly about ideas and values, about interests and beliefs; we discuss motive in folk tales, and dogmatic conceptions in the analysis of magic or religion.

zh: 当研究一种一神教信仰，或神力 (mana)的观念，或泛灵论（animism )、前泛灵论（preanimism) 以及图腾崇拜的倾向时，我们能在什么意义上谈论形态？
en: In what sense can we speak of form when we approach the belief in one God, or the concept of mana, or the tendency toward animism, preanimism, or totemism?

zh: 有些社会学家求诸于集体制裁（collective censorium)的假设，假定社会是“一个客观的道德存在，将其意志强加于其成员。
en: Some sociologists resort to the hypothesis of a collective censorium, hypostatize society as "the objective moral being, which imposes its will upon its members."

zh: 但很明显，不能诉诸观察的任何东西都不是客视的。
en: It is clear, however, that nothing can be objective which is not accessible to observation.

zh: 贝洛克认为这种社会从两个方面崩溃:一方面是国家采取福利行动(纯粹的资本主义无法体现的行动）；另一方面是垄断并限制交易。
en: Belloc sees it breaking down in two ways: on the one hand into State action for welfare (which pure capitalism cannot embody); on the other hand into monopoly and the restraint of trade.

zh: 资本主义制度既然崩溃，只有两条路可供选择:社会主义——贝洛克称之为集体主义；以及大规模重新分配财产——贝洛克称之为分产主义。
en: There are only two alternatives to this system: socialism, which Belloc calls collectivism; and the redistribution of property on a significant scale, which Belloc calls distributivism.

zh: 如果把我们的社会困境视为工业革命的产物，那就不能了解这种困境，因为现代社会并不是由于工业的发展而形成的事实上英囯在工业制度以前就有资本主义。
en: Our social difficulties will not be understood if they are regarded as the product of the Industrial Revolution: modern society was not formed by the growth of industry, but by the fact that capitalism was here in England before the Industrial System.

zh: ……在一连串重大发现之前，工业制度的策源地英国，就已经被一种有钱人的寡头政治所控制。
en: . . . England, the seed-plot of the Industrial System, was already captured by a wealthy oligarchy before the series of great discoveries began.

zh: 然而，这个最佳食谱又必须参考一个给定文化来确定。
en: This optimum, however, must be defined with reference to a given culture.

zh: 因为只有在参考肌肉和神经的活动量、任务的复杂程度，以及特定文化形貌对其成员的潜在紧张和努力的要求时，这个最佳食谱才可被界定。
en: For the optimum is only definable with relation to the amount of labor, muscular and nervous, to the complexity of tasks, to potential strains and efforts demanded by a given cultural configuration from its members.

zh: 同时，如果我们不参考环境供应力，生产体系和分配上的可行性，营养学家提供的这个理想方式，就不会有任何理论和实践意义。
en: At the same time, the ideal formula provided by a dietitian is of no practical or theoretical importance unless we can relate it to environmental supplies, to the systems of production and possibilities of distribution.

zh: (扎根美学）是从符号与实践中获取意义的创造性元素，通过对符号与实践进行选择、再选择、强化以及重组来反映更合时宜、更独特的意义。
en: [Grounded aesthetics] is the creative element in a process whereby meanings are attributed to symbols and practices and where symbols and practices are selected, reselected, highlighted and recomposed to resonate further appropriate and particularised meanings.

zh: 这一过程既基于情感，又基于认知。
en: Such dynamics are emotional as well as cognitive.

zh: 有多少种美学，就有多少片适宜其生长的土壤。
en: There are as many aesthetics as there are grounds for them to operate in.

zh: 因此，扎根美学乃是共同文化的催化剂。
en: Grounded aesthetics are the yeast of common culture.

zh: 从这个角度看待人类学，其宗旨便是扩大人类话语的范围。
en: Looked at in this way, the aim of anthropology is the enlargement of the universe of human discourse.

zh: 当然，这不是它的惟一宗旨——教学、娱乐、实际建议、道德进步、发现人类行为的自然秩序等等则是它的其他宗旨；而且人类学也不是追求这一宗旨的惟一学科。
en: That is not, of course, its only aiminstruction, amusement, practical counsel, moral advance, and the discovery of natural order in human behavior are others; nor is anthropology the only discipline which pursues it.

zh: 但是，这却是一个符号学的文化概念特别适合的宗旨。
en: But it is an aim to which a semiotic concept of culture is peculiarly well adapted.

zh: 有关巴干维尔岛的记述以及法国耶稣会成员的某些著述影响了“高尚的野蛮人”理论，同时激发了卢梭和孟德斯鸠。在他们的著作中，我们已能看到人类学灵感的两个来源：把原始人的生活作为文明人的模型，以及用野蛮人的相似之处来批判现代文明。
en: The accounts of Bougainville and of some of the French Jesuits influenced the theory of the Noble Savage, and inspired Rousseau and Montesquieu, in whose writings we find already two sources of anthropological inspiration: the use of primitive life as a model for civilized man, as well as a criticism of civilization by parallels from savagery.

zh: 我们还看到一神更科学的意图，即通过各种变异形式的比较来理解整体的文化。
en: We find there also the more scientific desire to understand culture as a whole by the comparison of its varieties.

zh: 这是由“大众文化”中的“大众”一词所决定的。
en: The popular of popular culture would seem to demand it.

zh: 但也必须清楚地认识到，仅仅依靠一个量化指标是不足以对概念本身进行完全充分的界定的。
en: What is also clear, however, is that on its own, a quantitative index is not enough to provide an adequate definition of popular culture.

zh: 否则，很多受到权威认可的、属于“髙雅文化”的书籍、唱片和电视剧本，由于拥有很大的销量和收视率，便只能被“理所当然”地归入“大众”范畴之内了。（Bennett，1980: 20—1)。
en: Such counting would almost certainly include ‘the officially sanctioned “high culture” which in terms of book and record sales and audience ratings for television dramatisations of the classics, can justifiably claim to be “popular” in this sense’ (Bennett, 1980: 20–1).

zh: 这样就保证日本政府中的高级职位都掌握在“阁下”们手中。但是，这决不意味着日本在“各安其分”的体制下没有自治。
en: Japan therefore ensured that those who held high government posts remain 'Their Excellencies,' but this does not mean that there was not self-government in its 'proper place.'

zh: 在所有亚洲国家中，不管在何种政治体制下，上面的权力总在向下伸展，而在中间与下面的地方自治权碰上。
en: In all Asian nations, under whatever regime, authority from above always reaches down and meets in some middle ground local self-government rising from below.

zh: 很多人认为，这些变革除了破坏社会稳定和扰乱社会秩序之外别无他用。
en: Such developments, it was argued, could only mean a weakening of social stability, a destabilizing of the social order.

zh: 于是，本杰明•迪斯雷利所言之“两国”时代拉开了帷幕。文化格局的巨变甚至催生了新兴工人阶级的第一次大规模政治文化运动，即宪章运动。
en: It marked the beginning of what Benjamin Disraeli would call the "two nations", and it eventually gave birth to the first political and cultural movement of the new urban working class – Chartism.

zh: 正是这种情况及其带来的持续性后果，促使大众文化的政治研究开始肇兴。
en: It is out of this context, and its continuing aftermath, which the political study of popular culture first emerges.

zh: 从很多方面看，这都不是件易事。
en: This is, in many ways, a daunting task.

zh: 正如托尼•本内特（Tony Bennett)所指出的那样：“从当下情况看，‘大众文化’这一概念实在无用， 它似乎把若干混沌不清乃至彼此抵触的含义塞进一个大熔炉，只会将种种对真相的探索引入理论的死胡同。
en: As Tony Bennett (1980) points out, ‘as it stands, the concept of popular culture is virtually useless, a melting pot of confused and contradictory meanings capable of misdirecting inquiry up any number of theoretical blind alleys’ (18).

zh: ”（Bennett，1980: 18)此种“界定困难”一部分源自“他者”（otherness)这一概念的特殊性--当我们使用 “大众文化”这一表述时，暗示着与大众文化相对的“他者”总是缺席/在场的。
en: Part of the difficulty stems from the implied otherness that is always absent/ present when we use the term ‘popular culture’.

zh: 在阅读后面的章节时，你也会发现我们往往有意无意地将大众文化与其他文化——民间文化、群氓文化、宰制性文化、工人阶级文化等等——进行对比，并在对比中为“大众文化”下定义。
en: As we shall see in the chapters which follow, popular culture is always defined, implicitly or explicitly, in contrast to other conceptual categories: folk culture, mass culture, dominant culture, working-class culture, etc.

zh: 我们可以说通过引入这个概念，我们在提倡一种新的启发式原理。这强调另外一种新研究类型的绝对必要性。
en: We might say that in introducing this concept, we are supplying a new heuristic  principle in laying stress on the absolute necessity for an additional type of research.

zh: 这主要体现于考察某些机制、组织形式、习俗或观念如何在一方面扩大人类潜力的范围，而在另一方面又如何把某些限制加之于人类行为，简言之，功能论就是对于文化作为一个决定原理究竟为何物的考察。特别是把它作为向个人和集体生活标准提供的附加物的考察。
en: This consists primarily in a consideration of how certain devices, forms of organization, customs, or ideas enlarge the range of human potentialities on the one hand, and impose certain restrictions on human behavior on the other.In short, functionalism is the consideration of what culture is as a determining principle, in terms of the addition which it provides to the individual and collective standard of living.

zh: 让我们暂不考虑牛仔裤的功能性。
功能与文化几乎毫无 干系，因为文化关注的是意义、快感、身份认同，而不是功效。
en: Let's dismiss their functionality first, for this has little to do with culture, which is concerned with meanings, pleasures, and identities rather than efficiency.

zh: 当 然，牛仔裤是一种极为实用的服饰，它舒适、耐用，有时也很便 宜，并只需要“低度保养”（low maintenence)可是劳动服也有 这些特点。
en: Of course jeans are a supremely functional garment, comfortable, tough, sometimes cheap, and requiring “low maintenance"—but so, too, are army fatigues.

zh: 进化论与播化论的歧异——每种学说内部自然也有大量小学派和分歧的观点——看来是人类学方法和概念“装备”的主要分水岭。
en: The rift between evolutionism and diffusionism—and each of them, of course, contains a number of partial schools and divergent opinions—still appears as the main dividing line in method and conceptual outfit.

zh: 如今，这两派之外有时又加上功能学派（functional school)。本文作者常被认为是它的主要责任人。
en: To these two, there is sometimes added at present the functional school, for which the present writer is often held to be largely responsible.

zh: 但是，在现实中，在近距离审视的放大镜之下，我们就能看出更加多样化的倾向、理论和方法。每一派都以关于什么是真正解释原则的某种根本概念为特征；每一派都有它希望用以理解文化过程和产物的具体方法；每一派在进入田野时都带有一套略显不同的知识分类架构（pigeonholes)来收集和分装证据。
en: In reality, however, and under the magnifying glass of closer scrutiny, we could find a much greater diversity of tendencies, theories, and methods, each characterized by some ultimate conception as to what is the real principle of interpretation; each having some specific approach through which it hopes to reach the comprehension of a cultural process or product; each going into the field with a somewhat differential set of intellectual pigeonholes into which to gather and distribute evidence.

zh: 我们力图表明，有可能发展一套理论。该理论可将基本需求及其文化满足与新的文化需求的衍生挂钩。而且，这些新的文化需求又将一套次生型的决定机制强加于人与社会。
en: We shall attempt to show that a theory can be developed in which the basic needs and their cultural satisfaction can be linked up with the derivation of new cultural needs; that these new needs impose upon man and society a secondary type of determinism.

zh: 我们将能把产生于诸如经济、道德、教育和政治等活动类型的功用性驱力 (instruimental imperatives)整合驱力（integrative imperatives) 区分开。
en: We shall be able to distinguish between instrumental imperatives—arising out of such types of activity as economic, normative, educational and political—and integrative imperatives.

zh: 后者可以知识、宗教和巫术为例。
en: Here we shall list knowledge, religion, and magic.

zh: 我们将能把艺术和娱乐活动与人类机体的特定生理特征直接联系，并表明它们对协作行为方式，对巫术、工业和宗教信仰等等的影响和依赖。
en: Artistic and recreational activities we shall be able to relate directly to certain physiological characteristics of the human organism, and also to show their influence and dependence upon modes of concerted action, magical, industrial, and religious belief.

zh: 让我用图表的形式来阐明这一点。
en: Let me present this in a diagrammatic form.

zh: 下表列出了一连串的关键序列。
en: In the adjoining table a series of vital sequences are listed.

zh: 每个序列都被分解为三个连贯的阶段。
en: Each of them has been analyzed into a tripartite concatenation of phases.

zh: 此外，与此有关的是这一概念：在后现代状况下，越发难以把经济和通俗文化分开。
en: An aspect of this is the idea that in the postmodern condition it becomes more difficult to distinguish the economy from popular culture.

zh: 消费领域——我们购买什么和决定我们购买什么——正日益受到通俗文化的影响。消费与通俗文化的联系日益密切，因为通俗文化日益决定着消费，例如，我们能看到更多影片,是由于影碟机拥有量的扩大，而广告则日益利用通俗文化的各种参照物，在决定我们购买什么方面起着一种更加重要的作用。
en: Consumption—what we buy and what determines what we buy—is increasingly influenced by popular culture because popular culture increasingly determines consumption.For example, we watch more films because of the extended ownership of VCRs, while advertising, which makes increasing use of popular cultural references, plays a more important role in deciding what we will buy.

zh: 显然，这两种分析方案中的任何一种都并不意味着所有文化是相同的也不意味着文化研究者必须对身份、文化的一致性或相似性投入比其对于文化的差异性更多的兴趣。
en: Obviously, neither of these two schemes of analysis implies that all cultures are identical, nor yet that the student of culture must be more interested in identities or similarities than he is in differences.

zh: 然而我主张，要理解各种歧异，一种清晰，共同的比较尺度必不可少。
en: I submit, however, that in order to understand divergencies, a clear, common measure of comparison is indispensable.

zh: 此外，这也可能证明，通常被归因于不同民族或部落特殊天才的多数歧异，持有此说者并不只限于国家社会主义理论——乃是种种制度围绕某些高度专门化的需求和价值而形成的理由。
en: It will, moreover, be possible to demonstrate that most of the divergencies which are often attributed to specific national or tribal genius—and that not only in the theory of National Socialism—are the reason for institutions organized around some highly specialized need or value.

zh: 在一次学术会议上，我听到一位与会者声称李维斯牛仔裤绝不可能采用果酱乐队的歌来为自己的产品促销。
en: At a conference I once attended, a contribution from the floor suggested that Levi jeans would never be able to use a song from The Jam to sell its products.

zh: 尽管事实上李维斯早已采用了撞击乐队的音乐做过广告歌，但这些人仍然固执己见。
en: The fact that they had already used a song by The Clash would not shake this conviction.

zh: 在这种偏见背后，是对文化差异的捍卫——李维斯牛仔裤的电视广告是群氓文化，而果酱乐队的音乐是由“人民”创造出来的一种对抗性的大众文化，后者绝不应该为前者服务，除非果酱乐队背弃自己的信仰。
en: What underpinned this conviction was a clear sense of cultural difference--television commercials for Levi jeans are mass culture, the music of The Jam is popular culture defined as an oppositional culture of ‘the people’.The only way the two could meet would be through The Jam‘selling out’.

zh: 在本章中，我将对“种族”这个概念，以及种族主义在英国的历史变迁进行一番考察。
en: In this chapter I will examine the concept of ‘race’ and the historical development of racism in England.

zh: 此外，我还会就一种特殊的种族表征政体，即爱德华•萨义德的东方主义展开讨论。
en: I will then explore a particular regime of racial representation, Edward Said’s analysis of Orientalism.

zh: 作为大众文化中的东方主义案例，我将分析好莱坞关于越南战争的种种表述及其对第一次海湾战争的征兵活动产生的潜在影响。
en: I will use Hollywood’s account of America’s war in Vietnam, and its potential impact on recruitment for the first Gulf War as an example of Orientalism in popular culture.

zh: 本章的末尾将以对文化研究与反种族主义的扼要讨论作结。
en: The chapter will conclude with a brief discussion of cultural studies and anti-racism.

zh: “后马克思主义”这个概念至少有两种含义。
en: Post-Marxism can mean at least two things.

zh: 欧内斯托·拉克劳和尚塔尔·墨菲合著之《霸权与社会主义战略：通向激进民主政治之路》对后马克思主义产生了深远的影响。在书中，作者指出：“如果说本书的主题是"后马克思主义"的，那它同时也必然是"后马克思主义"的。”
en: As Ernesto Laclau and Chantal Mouffe point out in their deeply influential contribution to post-Marxism, Hegemony and Socialist Strategy: Towards a Radical Democratic Politics, "if our intellectual project in this book is post-Marxist, it is evidently also post-Marxist" (4).

zh: 这些元素究竟是如何被接合的？这在一定程度上取决于进行文化生产及消费的社会语境和历史条件。
en: How these elements are articulated will depend in part on the social circumstances and historical conditions of production and consumption.

zh: 霍尔以威廉斯的观点为基础，建构了一套“受众立场”的理论。他认为，受众在解读文本时，有“主导式”、“协商式”和“屈从式”三种立场（Hall，1980a)。
en: Hall (1980a) uses Williams’s insight to construct a theory of reading positions: ‘subordinate’, ‘dominant’, and ‘negotiated’.

zh: 大卫•莫利（David Morley)对这一理论作出了修正，充分重视了话语 (discourse)和主观性因素：受众对文本的解读始终是文本话语与受众话语之间进行的互动行为（Moriey，1980)。
en: David Morley (1980) has modified the model to take into account discourse and subjectivity: seeing reading as always an interaction between the discourses of the text and the discourses of the reader.

zh: 这在一定程度上取决于进行文化生产及消费的社会语境和历史条件。
en: How these elements are articulated will depend in part on the social circumstances and historical conditions of production and consumption.

zh: 霍尔以威廉斯的观点为基础，建构了一套“受众立场”的理论。他认为，受众在解读文本时，有“主导式”、“协商式”和“屈从式”三种立场。
en: Hall uses Williams’s insight to construct a theory of reading positions: ‘subordinate’,‘dominant’, and ‘negotiated’.

zh: 大卫•莫利对这一理论作出了修正，充分重视了话语和主观性因素：受众对文本的解读始终是文本话语与受众话语之间进行的互动行为。
en: David Morley has modified the model to take into account discourse and subjectivity: seeing reading as always an interaction between the discourses of the text and the discourses of the reader.

zh: 如果列出世界上各种文化的所有表现，我们就会明显地发现一系列详尽的边缘古怪习俗：如食人之风（cannibalism)、猎头、 产翁制（couvade)、夸富宴（potlatch)、库拉圈（kula)、火葬(cremation)、木乃伊（mummification)等。
en: Were we to plot out all the manifestations of every culture in the world, we obviously would find such elements as cannibalism, head-hunting, couvade, potlatch, kula, cremation, mummification, and a vast array of detailed peripheral eccentricities.

zh: 就此而论，显然没有单一的文化能够包罗许多其他文化中的所有形式的畸形和怪癖。
en: From this point of view obviously no single culture covers all the itemized freaks and eccentricities of many others.

zh: 然而我要说，这种研究方法在本质上是不科学的。
en: Yet this approach, I submit, is essentially unscientific.

zh: 卡莱尔在这个领域中博览群书，论述广泛，谈诺瓦里斯的论文与《时代的征兆》同年写成， 是其中的一个例子，他们的关系由此可昭然若揭。
en: Carlyle had already read and written widely in this field, and the essay on Novalis, for example, written in the same year as Signs of the Times, shows evident relations to it.

zh: 关干机械思考与动力思考(mechanic and dynamic thinking)之对比的一段引文正是出自他正在评论《诺瓦里斯作品》第二卷中的《杂论》之中，这又是一例。
en: The contrast of mechanical and dynamic thinking is there, for instance, in a quotation from the Fragments in the second volume of the Novalis Schriften which he was reviewing.

zh: 还有其他许多观念、片言只语，也同样可以在这些德国影响中追根溯源。
en: Many of the other ideas, and phrases, may be similarly traced.

zh: 不过，完全撇开商品拜物教理论，马克思对于意识形态在资本主义社会的整个结构中的地位，似乎也具有一种独特的和决定论的看法。
en: However, apart from the theory of commodity fetishism, Marx appears to have had a further and more deterministic theory about the place of ideology in the structure of capitalist societies.

zh: 这就是众所周知的基础—上层建筑模式。
en: This is commonly known as the base— superstructure model.

zh: 一个社会的基础是其物质生产的方式，通常是各种经济的方式，社会借此从物质上再生产自己，它也是剥削阶级关系的来源。
en: The base of a society is its mode of material production, the economic system by which it reproduces itself, and the source of exploitative class relations.

zh: 基础决定一个社会的上层建筑，决定它的政治和意识形态制度、社会关系和一系列在基础之外的观念，如家庭、国家、宗教、教育和文化。
en: It determines the superstructure of a society, its political and ideological institutions, the social relations and sets of ideas that lie outside the base such as the family, the state, religion, education and culture.

zh: 在基督教社会主义运动中，骚赛与欧文的影响清晰可见。
en: In a movement like Christian Socialism, the influence of both Southey and Owen can be clearly discerned.

zh: 然而，欧文的主要方向导致社会主义与合作社，骚塞则与伯克和科尔律治走向新的保守主义。
en: Yet Owen, in his main bearings, led to socialism and the cooperatives; Southey, with Burke and Coleridge, to the new conservatism.

zh: 而且，骚塞在新保守主义中亦并非次要角色；举个例子，斯迈思举例说明了《对话论》是年轻的英国观念的主要来源，又称骚塞是“这个运动的真正创造者”。
en: Southey's part in the latter movement, moreover, was no minor one; Smythe, for example, instanced the Colloquies as a main source of the ideas of Young England, and called Southey 'the real founder of the movement'.

zh: 极权主义社会，以及自由民主政治，已被看成是大众社会的典型。
en: Totalitarian societies, along with liberal democracies, have been viewed as types of mass society.

zh: 大众社会的概念已构成了关于大众媒介和大众文化在现代资本主义社会中的作用的一种重要看法。在英国和美国那样的社会中，正是知识分子对他们所认为的大众社会和大众文化崛起的担忧与焦虑，才形成和激发了对这些发展的争论。
en: The concept of mass society has formed one important perspective on the role of mass media and mass culture in modern capitalist societies.It has been the fears and anxieties of intellectuals, in societies such as Britain and America, about the rise of what they have seen as a mass society and a mass culture which have served to organise and inform the debates about these developments.

zh: 费边社的集体主义的道路被坚决地抛弃：它从未自认为是一种艺术的理想。
en: The Fabian road of collectivism is firmly rejected: It never presumed to be an artistic ideal.

zh: 它最后甚至不敢自认为是人类的理想。
en: It has ended in not even daring to be a human one.

zh: 反社会主义者说，社会主义不注意人性，是言之有理的。
en: The Anti-Socialist who told us that Socialism left human nature out of account stands justified.

zh: 人类学家一方面信奉所有种族，白种、棕种和黑种人的权利，以及所有少数民族享受同等待遇的权利；同时他也有保守的偏见，这使他承认传统的价值、文化多样性的价值，无论是一种文化自身还是多种文化交汇（cross-fertilization)。
en: The anthropologist believes, on the one hand, in the right of all races, white, brown and black, and in the right of all minorities to equal treatment.He also has the conservative bias which makes him recognize the value of tradition, the value of the diversity of cultures, in their independence as well as in their cross-fertilization.

zh: 他的忠告是：不能用武力、财力和法律强制力把我们的文化强加于其他文化。
en: His advice would be that our culture must not be imposed on others by the force of arms, the power of wealth, and the stringency of law.

zh: 一厢情愿式的传教士精神至少应该节制。
en: The missionary spirit in the crudest form will have to be modified, at least.

zh: 结构主义的两个基本观点都来自索绪尔的语言学。
en: Structuralism takes two basic ideas from Saussure's work.

zh: 第一，关注文本与实践之中包含的基本关系，以及使意义得以生成的语法”；第二，始终认为意义是在词句组合与选择的相互关系和影响中形成的，决定性因素则是潜藏的结构。
en: First, a concern with the underlying relations of texts and practices, the "grammar" that makes meaning possible.Second, the view that meaning is always the result of the interplay of relationships of selection and combination made possible by the underlying structure.

zh: 换言之，结构主义者将文本与实践当作语言来研究。
en: In other words, texts and practices are studied as analogous to language.

zh: 休闲娱乐带给工人们的并不是“再创造”(再创造劳动中失去的东西），而是“创造无力”(劳动过程中失去的东西的混合体）。
en: Therefore, instead of recreation (re-creating what is lost in work), leisure provides workers with only 'decreation' (a compounding of the loss experienced through work).

zh: 情况如此，难怪人们会向群氓文化寻求情感补偿和被动娱乐。毒品开始大行其道，每个人都成了沉溺于“生活替代品”中的瘾君子。
en: Given such a situation, it is little wonder that people turn to mass culture for compensation and passive distraction; the drug habit develops and they become junkies addicted to ‘substitute living’.

zh: 田园牧歌的世界不复存在，取而代之的是乏味平庸的“近郊主义”（suburbanism) (99)。
en: A world of rural rhythms has been lost to the monotony and mediocrity of ‘suburbanism’ (99).

zh: 在有机社区里，日常文化源源不断地为个体提供健康的养料；而在大众文明之中，每个人都必须时刻保持清醒，抵御日常文化产生的恶劣影响。
en: Whereas in the organic community everyday culture was a constant support to the health of the individual, in mass civilization one must make a conscious and directed effort to avoid the unhealthy influence of everyday culture.

zh: 至于威廉斯所言之“在日常文化之中，同样存在着贫穷、卑鄙的专制、疾病与死亡、无知与气馁"（Williams，1963: 253)，利维斯们则完全无视。
en: The Leavisites fail to mention, as Williams (1963) remarks, ‘the penury, the petty tyranny, the disease and mortality, the ignorance and frustrated intelligence which were also among its ingredients’ (253).

zh: 后现代文化之所以尽失历史性，与詹明信所归纳的第二种风格特征密切相关，即“精神分裂症”。
en: The failure to be historical relates to a second stylistic feature identified by Jameson, cultural "schizophrenia".

zh: 这一表述来自拉康，意指语言的失序与能指之间时态关系的错乱。
en: He uses the term in the sense developed by Lacan  to signify a language disorder, a failure of the temporal relationship between signifiers.

zh: 在“精神分裂症”的作用下，时间并非不间断的连续体（过去-现在-未来），而是一个周而复始的在场，只有在过去或某种未来的可能性的侵人之下，方可显现自身。
en: The schizophrenic experiences time not as a continuum (past–present– future), but as a perpetual present that is only occasionally marked by the intrusion of the past or the possibility of a future.

zh: 而我们第一次有意识地察觉到自己乃是一个独立的个体，发生于拉康所言之“镜像阶段”。
en: Our sense of being a unique individual only begins to emerge in what Lacan calls ‘the mirror stage’.As Lacan points out, we are all born prematurely.

zh: 他指出，所有人都是早产的婴儿，需要花时间学会控制与协调自己的行动；而只有当婴儿第一次在镜子中看到自己的影像（大约在出生后6到18个月期间）时，这一过程才算正式完成。
en: It takes time to be able to control and coordinate our movements.This has not been fully accomplished when the infant first sees itself in a mirror (between the ages of 6 and 18 months).

zh: 尽管婴儿“仍然处于行动不便且必须依靠哺乳存活的状态中”，但却在瞥见镜中影像的那一刻形成了某种认同感。
en: The infant, ‘still sunk in his motor incapacity and nursling dependence’, forms an identification with the image in the mirror.

zh: 因此，它并不像我们刚开始讨论人的研究的科学方法时显现的那样无用、无聊和自命不凡，而是现代和未来人类学对整个人文学科做出的真正贡献。
en: Thus, it is not as futile, jejune, and presumptuous as it might first appear to discuss the scientific approach to the Study of Man as the real contribution of modern and future anthropology to humanism as a whole.

zh: 我们需要一种文化理论，一种关于文化的过程和产物，一神关于它的特殊决定论、一种关于它与人类心理的基本事实和发生在人体内部的有机现象之间的关系，以及社会对于环境的依赖的理论。这种理论当然不是人类学家的专利。
en: We need a theory of culture, of its processes and products, of its specific determinism, of its relation to basic facts of human psychology and the organic happenings within the human body, and of the dependence of society upon the environment.Such a theory is by no means the monopoly of the anthropologist.

zh: “葛兰西派”的学者认为，大众文化是一个富含冲突的场所。在这里，被统治集团之“抵抗”力量与统治集团利益对被统治集团的“收编”力量进行着斗争。
en: Those using this approach see popular culture as a site of struggle between the ‘resistance’ of subordinate groups and the forces of ‘incorporation’ operating in the interests of dominant groups.

zh: 大众文化既不是理论家自上而下灌输给“群氓”的文化，也不是自下而上的、由“人民”创造的对抗性文化，而是两者进行交流和协商的场域，同时包括了“抵抗”与“收编”。
en: Popular culture in this usage is not the imposed culture of the mass culture theorists, nor is it an emerging from below, spontaneously oppositional culture of ‘the people’ – it is a terrain of exchange and negotiation between the two: a terrain, as already stated, marked by resistance and incorporation.

zh: 大众文化的文本与实践就在葛兰西所谓的“均势妥协”（compromise equilibrium)中流动（1971 : 161 )。
en: The texts and practices of popular culture move within what Gramsci (1971) calls a ‘compromise equilibrium’ (161).

zh: 这一过程既是历时性的（在某一时期被贴上“大众文化”标签的文化，在另一时期也许就成了其他文化），又是共时性的（无论在哪个特定的历史时期，大众文化都在“抵抗”与“收编”之间游弋）。
en: The process is historical (labelled popular culture one moment, and another kind of culture the next), but it is also synchronic (moving between resistance and incorporation at any given historical moment).

zh: 例如，海滨休假一度是贵族的特权，如今却成了大众文化的范例。
en: For instance, the seaside holiday began as an aristocratic event and within a hundred years it had become an example of popular culture.

zh: 这些研究可以追溯到仍处于石器时代的文化。在中国和印度、西亚和埃及的古老文明中，它们当然早已兴盛。
en: Such contributions can be traced back to cultures still perpetuating the Stone Age; they certainly have flourished in the old civilizations of China and India, of Western Asia and Egypt.

zh: 经济学和法学、政治科学和美学、语言学、考古学和比较宗教研究，则是后来加人到人文学科中的新内容。
en: Economics and jurisprudence, political science and aesthetics, linguistics, archaeology, and the comparative study of religions, constitute a more recent addition to humanism.

zh: 约两个世纪前，研究人类心智的心理学，随后又有探究人类关系的社会学，被列人正式的学术研究名录。
en: Some two centuries ago psychology, the study of the mind, and later on, sociology, an inquiry into human relations, were added to the list of official academic studies.

zh: 如果列出世界上各种文化的所有表现，我们就会明显地发现一系列详尽的边缘古怪习俗：如食人之风（cannibalism)、猎头、 产翁制（couvade)、夸富宴（potlatch)、库拉圈（kula)、火葬(cremation)、木乃伊（mummification)等。
en: Were we to plot out all the manifestations of every culture in the world, we obviously would find such elements as cannibalism, head-hunting, couvade, potlatch, kula, cremation, mummification, and a vast array of detailed peripheral eccentricities.

zh: 就此而论，显然没有单一的文化能够包罗许多其他文化中的所有形式的畸形和怪癖。
en: From this point of view obviously no single culture covers all the itemized freaks and eccentricities of many others.

zh: 然而我要说，这种研究方法在本质上是不科学的。
en: Yet this approach, I submit, is essentially unscientific.

zh: 如果列出世界上各种文化的所有表现，我们就会明显地发现一系列详尽的边缘古怪习俗：如食人之风（cannibalism)、猎头、 产翁制（couvade)、夸富宴（potlatch)、库拉圈（kula)、火葬(cremation)、木乃伊（mummification)等。
en: Were we to plot out all the manifestations of every culture in the world, we obviously would find such elements as cannibalism, head-hunting, couvade, potlatch, kula, cremation, mummification, and a vast array of detailed peripheral eccentricities.

zh: 就此而论，显然没有单一的文化能够包罗许多其他文化中的所有形式的畸形和怪癖。
en: From this point of view obviously no single culture covers all the itemized freaks and eccentricities of many others.

zh: 然而我要说，这种研究方法在本质上是不科学的。
en: Yet this approach, I submit, is essentially unscientific.

zh: 有关男性气质的意识形态让男人别无选择。
en: The ideology of masculinity left men no choice.

zh: 他们的选择是被迫的，或者失败的。
en: Their options were oppression or failure.

zh: 他们觉得，那两个因妻子没有回答“好，老公”而被当众“拆穿”的丈夫，要比另外两个顺从丈夫的妻子，受到更大的困窘。
en: They felt that the embarrassment of the two husbands whose wives "showed them up" in public by not answering "Yes, master" was greater than that of the compliant wives who did.

zh: 它普遍存在于最原始的文化直至我们现代的西方文明。在此前提下，人生的某些阶段被划定出来。而对应于这些阶段，人们对社会环境的依赖又有不同：婴儿期和一定程度的儿童期；从训练和学习期；介于性成熟和婚姻之间的青春期；部落的正式成员期（full tribal membership);以及最后的老年阶段。
en: It is universal from the most primitive culture up to our modern Western civilization, in that certain stages of human life are marked out, and to these stages there correspond periods of complete dependence upon the social milieu, as in infancy and, to a certain extent, in childhood; the period of training and learning; the period of adolescence as between sexual maturity and marriage; the period of full tribal membership; and finally, the stage of senility.

zh: 最后这个阶段可能会对部落或民族事务产生重要影响，因此民族志还专门有个杜撰词汇，叫老人政治（gerontocracy);但这一阶段也可能仅仅意味着老年男、女实际上处于部落生活主流之外，单调地打发时日而已。
en: This latter may either be associated with great influence in tribal or national affairs, for which an ethnographic word, gerontocracy, has been coined; or else it simply means that old men and old women are allowed to vegetate virtually outside the full current of tribal life.

zh: 在一些文化中，体质或精神变态者如性倒错（sexual inversion)、癲痫或歇斯底理倾向，成为构成群体组织的基础，有时与萨满教相关,有时则部分地形成法外族(outlawed caste) 。
en: In some cultures physical and mental abnormalities, such as sexual inversion or epileptic or hysterical tendencies, form the basis of group organization, at times connected with shamanism, at times constituting a partially outlawed caste.

zh: 利维斯主义的影响力大约持续了40年。
en: The work of Leavisism spans a period of some forty years.

zh: 不过，“利维斯派”关于大众文化的观点却是在20世纪30年代早期形成的，总计有三部代表性著作：利维斯的《大众文明与少数人文化》、利维斯的《小说与阅读公众》（利维斯的妻子,与其夫同为著名文学批评家,后人习惯称之为“利维斯夫人”）以及利维斯与丹尼斯•汤普森合著的《文化与环境》。
en: However, the Leavisite attitude to popular culture was formed in the early 1930s with the publication of three texts: Mass Civilisation and Minority Culture, by F.R. Leavis, Fiction and the Reading Public, by Q.D. Leavis and Culture and Environment, by F.R. Leavis and Denys Thompson.

zh: 正是这三部著作为利维斯主义的大众文化研究奠定了基调。
en: Together these form the basis of the Leavisite response to popular culture.

zh: 对意识形态的社会决定因素的研究，目前主要有两种方法：利益论与张力论。
en: There are currently two main approaches to the study of the social determinants of ideology: the interest theory and the strain theory.

zh: 对前者而言，意识形态是面具和武器；对后者而言，意识形态是症状及处方。
en: For the first, ideology is a mask and a weapon; for the second, a symptom and a remedy.

zh: 在利益论中，意识形态见解被置于为好处进行的普遍斗争的背景之中；在张力论中，则被看成是为纠正社会心理的不平衡而进行的长期努力。
en: In the interest theory, ideological pronouncements are seen against the background of a universal struggle for advantage; in the strain theory, against the background of a chronic effort to correct sociopsychological disequilibrium.

zh: 库宁海姆（Cunningham,1982)告诉我们，在整个19世纪，中产阶级是怎样一以贯之地将他们的精神风尚与组织形式，强加在体育运动上。
en: Cunningham (1982) shows how consistently throughout the nineteenth century the middle classes attempted to impose their ethos and forms of organization upon sport.

zh: 譬如足球与板球，是从它们大众的、无秩序的起源那里“偷”来的，并被重新组织而变得体面，再被转化为塑造年青绅士的品质乃至民族国家的性格的手段。
en: Football and cricket, for instance, were "stolen" from their popular, disorderly origins, and were organized, made respectable, and turned into the means of building the character of young gentlemen, and thus of the nation.

zh: 这种策略，同其他所有的控制策略-样，只在某方面成功，其相对的失败之处在于，体育运动乃沿着阶级的界线分裂开来。
en: This strategy, like all strategies of control, was successful only up to a point, and its comparative failure is evidenced by the way sport split along class lines.

zh: 替如业余英式橄榄球（rugby union)的参与者是一群绅士，而联盟制橄榄球（rugby league)的球员则是出身工人阶级的职业选手。
en: Rugby union, for instance, became the form played by gentlemen amateurs, rugby league by working-class professionals.

zh: 如果列出世界上各种文化的所有表现，我们就会明显地发现一系列详尽的边缘古怪习俗：如食人之风（cannibalism)、猎头、 产翁制（couvade)、夸富宴（potlatch)、库拉圈（kula)、火葬(cremation)、木乃伊（mummification)等。
en: Were we to plot out all the manifestations of every culture in the world, we obviously would find such elements as cannibalism, head-hunting, couvade, potlatch, kula, cremation, mummification, and a vast array of detailed peripheral eccentricities.

zh: 就此而论，显然没有单一的文化能够包罗许多其他文化中的所有形式的畸形和怪癖。
en: From this point of view obviously no single culture covers all the itemized freaks and eccentricities of many others.

zh: 然而我要说，这种研究方法在本质上是不科学的。
en: Yet this approach, I submit, is essentially unscientific.

zh: 弗雷泽自己提出的解决方案是：诸如婚姻、法律、财产和政府这些制度确实“满足了现实的人类需要”。
en: The solution is indicated by Frazer himself.Such institutions as marriage, or law, or property, or government do "answer real human needs."

zh: 如果弗雷泽更充分地探询这些需求的本质，他就可能最早地向我们提出了人类制度和人类文化的法律、政府、经济和社会组织等方面的真文“起源”的正确理论。
en: Had Frazer inquired more fully into the nature of those needs, he might have, first and foremost, given us a correct theory of the real "origins" of human institutions and of such aspects of human culture as law, government, economics, and social organization.

zh: 他早就会发现从最早的开端延续至今的人类组织的某些形态如家庭、亲属关系、地缘群体或领地群体(municipality)以及国家等，乃是与组织化人类生活的明确需求相对应的。
en: He would have discovered that forms of human organization which have endured from the very beginnings till our times, such as the family, kinship, the local group or municipality, and the state, correspond to definite needs of organized human life.

zh: 然后他就可以证明，并且是确凿和充分地证明：巫术和宗教的某些形式何以有助于协调人类活动和人类集群在某些方面的持续和发展。
en: He could then show, and show convincingly and adequately, why certain forms of magic and religion have contributed towards the permanence and the development of certain aspects of concerted human activities and of human groupings.

zh: 这种轮换历法是到目前为止最为重要的。
en: The permutational calendar is by far the most important.

zh: 它由十个不同的日期名称的周期组成。
en: It consists of ten different cycles of daynames.

zh: 这些周期的长度不同。
en: These cycles are of varying lengths.

zh: 最长的一个周期有十个日期名称，根据固定的顺序依次相随，顺序轮完之后第一个日期名称再次出现，这个周期又开始。
en: The longest contains ten day-names, following one another in a fixed order, after which the first day-name reappears and the cycle starts over.

zh: 这种哲学在日本是看不到的。
en: Such philosophy is alien in Japan.

zh: 尽管日本是一个佛教大国，但轮回和涅槃的思想从未成为日本人民佛教信仰的一部分。
en: Even though Japan is a great Buddhist nation, ideas of transmigration and of nirvana have never been a part of the Buddhist faith of the people.

zh: 虽有少数僧侣接受这种教义，但从未影响过民间的思想和习俗。
en: These doctrines are personally accepted by some Buddhist priests, but they have never affected folkways or popular thought.

zh: 马克思主义（Marxism)是一个艰深复杂且颇具争议的体系，绝不仅仅是一套旨在改天换地的革命理论。
en: Marxism is a difficult and contentious body of work.But it is also more than this: it is a body of revolutionary theory with the purpose of changing the world.

zh: 马克思本人有句名言：“哲学家们只是 用不同方式解释世界，问题在于改变世界。”（Marx，1976b: 65)
en: As Marx (1976b) famously said: ‘The philosophers have only interpreted the world, in various ways; the point is to change it’ (65).

zh: 大众的快感以两种主要的方式运作：躲避（或冒犯）与生产力。
en: The work of popular pleasure takes two main forms: evasion (or offensiveness) and productivity.

zh: 大众快感的抵抗活动在不同的形式中.
en: Its resistances are practiced differently in each form.

zh: ，有不同的实践方式。将大众的快感进行这样的分类时，我们必须牢记，这仅仅是一种分析策略；而大众的快感只存在于它具体的实践、语境与生产的时刻，因此，大多数大众的快感都规避了槪括与理论所呼吁的那种结构化倾向
en: In categorizing its work in such a way, we must remember that this is an analytical strategy only; popular pleasure exists only in its practices, contexts, and moments of production, and thus much of it escapes the sort of structuring that generalization and theory call for.

zh: 除了少数“摩登”人物之外，一般良家子弟的婚姻对象都要由父母通过媒人来选择。
en: Except in 'modan' (modern) circles it is taken for granted in respectable families that the parents select their son's wife, usually through the good offices of go-betweens.

zh: 关心挑选一个好媳妇的，不是儿子本人，而是他的家庭。其原因不仅是涉及金钱，主要是因为那媳妇将载入家谱，生出男孩，传宗接代。
en: The family, not the son, is chiefly concerned about the matter of a good selection, not only because of the money transactions involved but because the wife will be entered in the family genealogy and will perpetuate the family line through her sons.

zh: 从很多方面看，这都不是件易事。
en: This is, in many ways, a daunting task.

zh: 正如托尼•本内特（Tony Bennett)所指出的那样：“从当下情况看，‘大众文化’这一概念实在无用， 它似乎把若干混沌不清乃至彼此抵触的含义塞进一个大熔炉，只会将种种对真相的探索引入理论的死胡同。
en: As Tony Bennett (1980) points out, ‘as it stands, the concept of popular culture is virtually useless, a melting pot of confused and contradictory meanings capable of misdirecting inquiry up any number of theoretical blind alleys’ (18).

zh: ”（Bennett，1980: 18)此种“界定困难”一部分源自“他者”（otherness)这一概念的特殊性--当我们使用 “大众文化”这一表述时，暗示着与大众文化相对的“他者”总是缺席/在场的。
en: Part of the difficulty stems from the implied otherness that is always absent/ present when we use the term ‘popular culture’.

zh: 在阅读后面的章节时，你也会发现我们往往有意无意地将大众文化与其他文化——民间文化、群氓文化、宰制性文化、工人阶级文化等等——进行对比，并在对比中为“大众文化”下定义。
en: As we shall see in the chapters which follow, popular culture is always defined, implicitly or explicitly, in contrast to other conceptual categories: folk culture, mass culture, dominant culture, working-class culture, etc.

zh: 他的忠告是：不能用武力、财力和法律强制力把我们的文化强加于其他文化。
en: His advice would be that our culture must not be imposed on others by the force of arms, the power of wealth, and the stringency of law.

zh: 一厢情愿式的传教士精神至少应该节制。
en: The missionary spirit in the crudest form will have to be modified, at least.

zh: 在保守反应和每个民族认识到自身文化的整合价值的意义上，民族主义正如火如荼地传遍整个世界。
en: Nationalism, in the sense of a conservative reaction and the recognition of the integral value of its own culture by each nation, is spreading like wildfire all over the world.

zh: 作为白人种族的成员，我们对此负有主要责任。我们一直在向其他种族和民族施舍我们的宗教、我们的教育和许多其他精神恩惠，并带着一个含蓄的承诺：一但他们接受了我们的文明，就能与我们平起平坐。
en: We, the members of the white race, are primarily responsible for that, and we have been giving our religion, our education, and many other spiritual boons to other races and other peoples, with an implied promise that once they accept our civilization they will become our equals.

zh: 这个许诺没有兑现。
en: This promise has not been redeemed.

zh: 如果列出世界上各种文化的所有表现，我们就会明显地发现一系列详尽的边缘古怪习俗：如食人之风（cannibalism)、猎头、 产翁制（couvade)、夸富宴（potlatch)、库拉圈（kula)、火葬(cremation)、木乃伊（mummification)等。
en: Were we to plot out all the manifestations of every culture in the world, we obviously would find such elements as cannibalism, head-hunting, couvade, potlatch, kula, cremation, mummification, and a vast array of detailed peripheral eccentricities.

zh: 就此而论，显然没有单一的文化能够包罗许多其他文化中的所有形式的畸形和怪癖。
en: From this point of view obviously no single culture covers all the itemized freaks and eccentricities of many others.

zh: 然而我要说，这种研究方法在本质上是不科学的。
en: Yet this approach, I submit, is essentially unscientific.

zh: 如尼古拉斯·马克斯韦尔所建议的：如果我们对科学的目的作出一种决定性的假设的话，那么某些范式和理论甚至在它们的实质结果被检验之前就能得到评价的这种决定性假设是，科学的总目标就是要发现宇宙中或任何一种探讨领域中固有的最大数目的秩序。
en: As Nicholas Maxwell (1974a, 1974b) has suggested, if we make one crucial assumption about the purpose of science, then the possibility arises that some paradigms and theories can be evaluated even prior to the examination of their substantiveproducts.This one crucial assumption is that the overall aim of science is to discover the maximum amount of order inherent in the universe or in any field of inquiry.

zh: 马克斯韦尔称此为“目标定向经验论”。
en: Maxwell calls this “aim-oriented empiricism.

zh: 范式把它的目标简单定在发现上，而不承担任何义务去找出有秩序的关系，这比起其竞争者来就会被断定为非科学的或至少是不太科学的。
en: " Paradigms that aim simply at discovering what’s there without any commitment to discovering orderly relationships would then be judged unscientific or at least less scientific than their competitors.

zh: 相同的标准可以广泛应用于理论和假设。
en: This same criterion would be applicable to theories and hypotheses.

zh: 比如说，“男性气质”是一种物质存在，我们也习惯于认为“男性气质”是一种“生物学”的特征；但实际上，在文化中有许多不同的方式来展示男性气质，来表达“什么才是有男性气质的”。
en: For example, masculinity has real material conditions of existence, which we think of as ‘biological’, but there are different ways of representing masculinity in culture, different ways of ‘being masculine’.

zh: 而且，这些展示与表达的方式大多不尽相同，很难确定哪一种是“真实的”或“正常的”。
en: Moreover, these different ways do not all carry the same claims to ‘authenticity’ and ‘normality’.

zh: 故而，尽管“男性气质”在物质上是一种生物学的存在，但“男性气质”的意义，以及人们抢夺意义的解释权的争斗，却永远存在于文化领域中。
en: Masculinity, therefore, may depend on biological conditions of existence, but what it means, and the struggle over what it means, always takes place in culture.

zh: 这并不是语义差异的问题，并不是对关于世界的不同阐释的简单比较，而是关涉文化与权力的关系，是一场决定究竞谁有权对社会现实加以定义的斗争。文化所关注的，就是如何以特定的方式使世界（以及世界上的存在之物）有意义。
en: This is not a question of semantic difference--a simple question of interpreting the world differently--it is about relations of culture and power; about who can claim the power and authority to define social reality; to make the world (and the things in it) mean in particular ways.

zh: 意识形态的第四个定义与法国文化理论家罗兰•巴尔特（Roland Barthes)的早期作品有密切关联（在第六章会详细讨论）。
en: A fourth definition of ideology is one associated with the early work of the French cultural theorist Roland Barthes (discussed in more detail in Chapter 6).

zh: 巴尔特指出，意识形态（巴尔特本人称之为“神话”）主要在内涵（connotation)层面上发挥作用，是文本或实践所承载或可能承载的、间接的、常常是无意识的含义。
en: Barthes argues that ideology (or ‘myth’ as Barthes himself calls it) operates mainly at the level of connotations, the secondary, often unconscious meanings that texts and practices carry, or can be made to carry.

zh: 例如，英国保守党在1990年制作播出了一期政治宣传节目，节目结束时的最后一个词是“社会主义”，而此时电视上出现了红色监狱栅栏的影像，这就暗示其竞争对手工党所鼓吹的社会主义无异于建造了社会、经济与政治的囹圄。
en: For example, a Conservative Party political broadcast transmitted in 1990 ended with the word ‘socialism’ being transposed into red prison bars.What was being suggested is that the socialism of the Labour Party is synonymous with social, economic and political imprisonment.

zh: 在后来的一部著作《符号学的诸要素》中，巴特通过划分外延和内涵之间的差别，重新推敲了他对能指、所指和神话之间关系的理解。
en: In a later work, Elements of Semiology, Barthes refined his understanding of the relationship between the signifier, the signified and myth by drawing a distinction between denotation and connotation.

zh: 在一个层面上，各神通俗文化符号的意义是自明的。
en: On one level, the meaning of popular cultural signs is self-evident.

zh: 它们是它们本身的样子或者它们显现的样子，一则广告，一幅黑人士兵的照片，一束玫瑰花等等。
en: They are what they are or what they appear to be, an advert, a photo of a black soldier, a bunch of roses and so on.

zh: 在与异文化的人打交道时，使用短路的“移情”（empathy)，即猜想其他人会有什么思想和感受，总是比较危险的。
en: In dealing with people of a different culture, it is always dangerous to use the short-circuiting of "empathy," which usually amounts to guessing as to what the other person might have thought or felt.

zh: 实地工作者和行为论者的基本原理都认为观念、感情、意欲无论有意识或无意识，都不会在深不可测的心灵之内形成神秘和隐藏的存在。
en: The fundamental principle of the field-worker, as well as of the behaviorist, is that ideas, emotions and conations never continue to lead a cryptical, hidden existence within the unexplorable depths of the mind, conscious or unconscious.

zh: 所有可靠的，亦即实验的心理学都只能对外显的行为进行观察，虽然将这种观察与简单的内省解释（introspective interpretation)联系起来或许也不无用处。
en: All sound, that is, experimental psychology can deal only with observations of overt behavior, although it may be useful to relate such observations to the shorthand of introspective interpretation.

zh: 文化唯物主义理论把这些过程想象为狩猎—采集的成本一效益相对于农业和饲养家裔的成本—效益的根本转变。
en: Cultural materialist theories envision these processes as fundamental shifts in the cost-benefits of hunting-gathering as opposed to the cost-benefits of farming and stock raising.

zh: 这些转变可能与标志着大约13，000年以前存在的间冰期开始的全球性气候变化有关。
en: These shifts were probably related to the global imatological changes marking the onset of the present interglacial period about 13,000 yearsago.

zh: 这一全球规模的事件为农业体系的同时出现提供了解释。
en: The global scale of this event provides an explanation for the simultaneous emergence of agricultural systems.

zh: 其作用在不同的生态带的差异说明了导致新石器时代世界不同地区转交类型的差异。
en: And the diversity of its effects in different ecozones accounts for the diversity of scenarios leading to neolithic types of transitions in different parts of the world.

zh: 在书中，作者指出：“如果说本书的主题是‘后马克思主义’的，那它同时也必然是‘后马克思主义’的。
”前者意味着超越马克思主义，去寻找一套更好的理论体系；而后者则主张对马克思主义进行修正，用女性主义、后现代主义、后结构主义和拉康精神分析学说等前沿理论成果来丰富马克思主义的内涵。
en: To be post-Marxist is to leave behind Marxism for something better, whereas to be post-Marxist is to seek to transform Marxism, by adding to it recent theoretical developments from, especially, feminism, postmodernism, post-structuralism and Lacanian psychoanalysis.

zh: 拉克劳和墨菲更多地属于“后马克思主义”而非“后马克思主义”，他们促进了马克思主义与“新女性主义、种族抗议运动、少数民族与反性别歧视运动、由社会边缘群体发动的反体制的生态斗争、反对核扩散运动以及外围资本主义国家发生的非典型社会斗争”之间的结合。
en: Laclau and Mouffe are more post-Marxist than they are post-Marxist.They envisage a partnership between Marxism and the ‘new feminism, the protest movements of ethnic, national and sexual minorities, the anti-institutional ecology struggles waged by marginalized layers of the population, the anti-nuclear movement, the atypical forms of social struggle in countries on the capitalist periphery’

zh: 所谓法兰克福学派，指的是一个以法兰克福大学社会研究所为大本营的德国知识分子群体。
en: The Frankfurt School is the name given to a group of German intellectuals associated with the Institute for Social Research at the University of Frankfurt.

zh: 该研究所成立于1923年，并于希特勒上台后的1933年迁至美国纽约，隶属于哥伦比亚大学。
en: The Institute was established in 1923.Following the coming to power of Hitler in 1933, it moved to New York, attaching itself to the University of Columbia.

zh: 1949年，研究所再度迁回德国。
en: In 1949 it moved back to Germany.

zh: 法兰克福学派的主要研究风格混合了马克思主义和精神分析学说，常常被人们称为“批判理论”。
en: ‘Critical Theory’ is the name given to the Institute’s critical mix of Marxism and psychoanalysis.

zh: 用这一理论也可解释广泛存在的夫兄弟婚和妻姐妹婚制度。
en: The widespread institutions of levirate and sororate are explainable by this theory also.

zh: 在夫兄弟婚中，一个人与其已故兄弟的妻子或妻子们结婚。
en: In the levirate a man marries the wife or wives of his deceased brother.

zh: 当一个人按照习俗与其亡妻的未婚姐妹联姻时，这种做法被称之为妻姐妹婚。
en: When a man customarily marries the unwed sister of his deceased wife the practice is called sororate.

zh: “契约”涉及到一种协议，即一个文本将以我们所确认的各种方式对我们说话。
en: A "contract" involves an agreement that a text will talk to us in ways we recognise.

zh: 它将进入到与我们的一种对话之中。
en: It will enter into  a dialogue with us.

zh: 而那种对话，加上它的可靠因素和形式，将同我们社会生活的某些方面联系起来……我一直在说明特殊的喜剧为其读者的社会生活的某个方面提供了一种契约……
en: And that dialogue, with its dependable elements and form, will relate to some aspect of our lives in our society.… I have been illustrating the way specific comics offer a contract to some aspect of the social lives of their readers…

zh: 它是他们生存本身的前提条件。
en: It is a prerequisite of their very existence.

zh: 但是价值的这层含义也扩散开去，并恒久地与手工能力和理论知识相联系。
en: This sense of value, however, also pervades and becomes permanently attached to both manual ability and theoretical knowledge.

zh: 体现在所有原始技术、原始经济组织和社会组织中的科学态度，即考虑未来活动时依靠过去的经验，是一个整体的要素。我们必须假定它从人类产生之初，从这个物种刚刚开始其作为器物制作人（homo faber)、智人（homo sapiens)、政治人（homo politcus)的生涯时，就在起作用。
en: The scientific attitude, embodied in all primitive technology and also in the organization of primitive economic enterprises and social organization, that reliance on past experience with the view to future performance, is an integral factor which must be assumed as having been at work from the very beginning of mankind, ever since the species started on its career as homo faber, as homo sapiens, and as homo policus.

zh: 原始共同体中，只要有一代人丧失对这种科学态度及对其价值的珍视，该群体就会沦落到动物的境地，或者更可能就此灭绝。
en: Were the scientific attitude and the valuation of it to become extinct even for one generation in a primitive community, such a community would either lapse into an animal status or, more likely, become extinct.

zh: 过度性与浅白性是“生产者式文本”的主要特征。
en: Excessiveness and obviousness are central features of the producerly text.

zh: 这两种特征提供了创造大众文化的丰富和肥沃的资源。
en: They provide fertile raw resources out of which popular culture can be made.

zh: 过度性指的是意义挣脱控制，挣脱意识形态规范的控制或是任何特定文本的要 求。
en: Excessiveness is meaning out of control, meaning that exceeds the norms of ideological control or the requirements of any specific text.

zh: 流行音乐展现的是“情感现实主义”（emotional realism);青年男女“认同这些集体表征，并以之指引自己的想象。对青少年来说，这些象征性的想象就如同甜美的民谣一样，部分地塑造并建构着他们心中的世界图景”（281)。
en: Pop music exhibits ‘emotional realism’; young men and women ‘identify with these collective representations and . . . use them as guiding fictions. Such symbolic fictions are the folklore by means of which the teenager, in part, shapes and composes his mental picture of the world’ (281).

zh: 此外，霍尔和维诺还考察了青少年言谈的方式、常去的场所以及特殊的着装方式——正是这些让他们与成年人的世界保持着距离。
en: Hall and Whannel also identify the way in which teenagers use parThe Interpretation of Culturesular ways of talking, parThe Interpretation of Culturesular places to go, particular ways of dancing, and particular ways of dressing, to establish distance from the world of adults.

zh: 这个恰恰相当于文化的环境必须持续地得到再生、维持和管理。
en: This environment, which is neither more nor less than culture itself, has to be permanently reproduced, maintained, and managed.

zh: 这就创造出该字眼最一般意义上所谓的生活的新水准。它取决于社区文化水准，取决于环境，也取决于群体的劳动效率。
en: This creates what might be described in the most general sense of the term as a new standard of living, which depends on the cultural level of the community, on the environment, and on the efficiency of the group.

zh: 然而，生活的文化水准意味着新需求的出现，以及有新的驱力（imperatives)或决定因素被加之于人类行为。
en: A cultural standard of living, however, means that new needs appear and new imperatives or determinants are imposed on human behavior.

zh: 很明显，文化传统必须从一代传递给下一代。
en: Clearly, cultural tradition has to be transmitted from each generation to the next.

zh: 某种教育方法和机制必然存在于每种文化之中。
en: Methods and mechanisms of an educational character must exist in every culture.

zh: 不过，权力并非单纯通过凝视来控制我们，而是想方设法让我们自己意识到凝视的存在，进而也就迫使我们进行自我约束。
en: But it is not simply that power catches us in its gaze, rather power works when we recognize its gaze.

zh: 福柯曾以剧院作比来阐述这一论点：“我们既非身处古罗马圆形剧场，亦非置身于舞台之上，但我们仍感觉自己正在被人监视……这就是全景敞视机制所产生的权力效应。从我们进人此体系那一刻起，就已被它牢牢控制住了。
en: As Foucault makes clear, using a theatre metaphor, "We are neither in the amphitheatre, nor on the stage, but in the panoptic machine, invested by its effects of power, which we bring to ourselves since we are part of the mechanism" .

zh: ”由是，福柯指出，监视成了权力机制发挥作用的首要方式。
en: In this way, then, he argues, surveillance has become the dominant mode of the operation of power.

zh: 普鲁士的权威主义不仅在家庭生活中，而且在市民日常生活中根深蒂固，这就需要对德国制定某种谈和条件。
en: Prussian authoritarianism, embedded as it is in the family and in the daily civic life, makes necessary certain kinds of peace terms for Germany.

zh: 明智的谈和条款对日本应该不同于对德国。
en: Wise peace directives would differ from those for Japan.

zh: 德国人不象日本人，他们不认为自己对社会和历史欠恩情，他们努力奋斗，不是为了偿还无穷的债务或恩情，而是避免沦为牺牲者。
en: Germans do not regard themselves, like the Japanese, as debtors to the world and to the ages.They strive, not to repay an incalculable debt, but to avoid being victims.

zh: 从很多方面看，这都不是件易事。
en: This is, in many ways, a daunting task.

zh: 正如托尼•本内特（Tony Bennett)所指出的那样：“从当下情况看，‘大众文化’这一概念实在无用， 它似乎把若干混沌不清乃至彼此抵触的含义塞进一个大熔炉，只会将种种对真相的探索引入理论的死胡同。
en: As Tony Bennett (1980) points out, ‘as it stands, the concept of popular culture is virtually useless, a melting pot of confused and contradictory meanings capable of misdirecting inquiry up any number of theoretical blind alleys’ (18).

zh: ”（Bennett，1980: 18)此种“界定困难”一部分源自“他者”（otherness)这一概念的特殊性--当我们使用 “大众文化”这一表述时，暗示着与大众文化相对的“他者”总是缺席/在场的。
en: Part of the difficulty stems from the implied otherness that is always absent/ present when we use the term ‘popular culture’.

zh: 在阅读后面的章节时，你也会发现我们往往有意无意地将大众文化与其他文化——民间文化、群氓文化、宰制性文化、工人阶级文化等等——进行对比，并在对比中为“大众文化”下定义。
en: As we shall see in the chapters which follow, popular culture is always defined, implicitly or explicitly, in contrast to other conceptual categories: folk culture, mass culture, dominant culture, working-class culture, etc.

zh: 文化是一个活生牛的、积极的过程：它只能从内郜发展出来，而不能无中生有，或从上面强加而成。
en: Culture is a living, active process: it can be developed only from within, it cannot be imposed from without or above.

zh: 群众文化（mass culture)理论家的担忧，并未在实践中得到证实，因为群众文化一词如此自相矛盾，以致无法存在。
en: The fears of the mass culture theorists have not been borne out in practice because mass culture is such a contradiction in terms that it cannot exist.

zh: 一种同质性的、外部生成的文化并不能现成地卖给群众：文化完全不是那样运作的。
en: A homogeneous, externally produced culture cannot be sold ready-made to the masses: culture simply does not work like that.

zh: “心理学解释并未曾使任何人在历史现象的分类方面获得很大进展，我也不能转而依赖于它。
en: “Psychological explanations have not got anyone very far in reducing the phenomena of history to order, and I shall not fall back on them.

zh: ”但在当前的人格研究和墨迹实验中，克鲁伯几乎成了孤家寡人。
en: " But in these days of personality studies and ink-blot tests, Kroeber stands almost alone.

zh: 如何解释人类学从文化学倒退到心理学和精神病学的现象呢？
en: How is anthropology's regression from culturology to psychology and psychiatry to be explained?

zh: 因此，我们所讲的人性，就是指内在于每个文明及其中所有个体的生物决定因素，即执行诸如呼吸、睡觉、休息、营养、排泄和生殖等躯体功能。
en: By human nature, therefore, we mean the biological determinism which imposes on every civilization and on all individuals in it the carrying out of such bodily functions as breathing, sleep, rest, nutrition, excretion, and reproduction.

zh: 我们可以将基本需求定义为群体和个体为了生存而必须满足的环境和生物条件。
en: We can define the concept of basic needs as the environmental and biological conditions which must be fulfilled for the survival of the individual and the group.

zh: 事实上，两者的生存都要求维持以保持为文化表演所必须的起码健康和活力，并保持为防止逐渐的人口减少所必需的最低数量。
en: lndeed, the survival of both requires the maintenance of a minimum of health and vital energy necessary for the performance of cultural tasks, and for the minimum numbers necessary for the prevention of gradual depopulation.

zh: 里特尔（Ritter)和拉策尔两人可能是这一思潮的先锋人物。无论举他们中哪一位的工作为例，我们都可以看到他们对旧进化论的修正在于：他们在全球场景之内考察历史过程。
en: Whether we take the work of Ritter or Ratzel, who probably might be regarded as pioneers of this movement, we find that the correction of the older evolutionism consists in regarding historical processes wTithin the context of the globe.

zh: 人类地理学 (anthropo-geographic)观点暗示，对每一文化的思考都必须考虑其所处的自然环境。
en: The anthropo-geographic point of view implies, on the one hand, the consideration of each culture within its natural surroundings.

zh: 作为一种方法，它也要求在讨论文化问题时应借助地图，并且要按文化的各组成部分来参考文化分布图。
en: As a method it also demands the posing of cultural problems with reference to a map, and to a map of the distribution of cultures in terms of their component parts.

zh: 正如科学总是通过采用另一套决定因素体系（system of determinants）而获益一样，这一思潮给人类学以极大助益。
en: In so far as science always gains by moving into another system of determinants, this movement has rendered great services to anthropology.

zh: 这个简要的概括实际上是我们以下更全面分析的蓝图。它表明科学的人类学是基于制度的理论，即对组织单位类型的具体分析。
en: This brief outline, which is really a blueprint for our following fuller analysis, indicates that scientific anthropology consists in a theory of institutions, that is, a concrete analysis of the type units of an organization.

zh: 作为一种关于基本需求，关于功用和整合驱力之衍生的理论，科学的人类学提供给我们功能的分析，使我们能界定习俗性观念和发明能力的形式和意义。
en: As a theory of basic needs, and a derivation of instrumental and integrative imperatives, scientific anthropology gives us the functional analysis, which allows us to define the form, as well as the meaning, of a customary idea or contrivance.

zh: 经济学和法学、政治科学和美学、语言学、考古学和比较宗教研究，则是后来加人到人文学科中的新内容。
en: Economics and jurisprudence, political science and aesthetics, linguistics, archaeology, and the comparative study of religions, constitute a more recent addition to humanism.

zh: 约两个世纪前，研究人类心智的心理学，随后又有探究人类关系的社会学，被列人正式的学术研究名录。
en: Some two centuries ago psychology, the study of the mind, and later on, sociology, an inquiry into human relations, were added to the list of official academic studies.

zh: 人类学，作为广义的人的科学，作为人文研究中最宽泛的学科，是一位姗姗来迟者。
en: Anthropology, as the science of man at large, as the most comprehensive discipline in humanism without portfolio, was the last to come.

zh: 人类学，作为广义的人的科学，作为人文研究中最宽泛的 “无论所"学科，是一位姗姗来迟者。
en: Anthropology, as the science of man at large, as the most comprehensive discipline in humanism without portfolio, was the last to come.

zh: 因此，它必须得在范围、 对象、方法等方面见缝插针，挤出空间。
en: It had to peg out its claims as to scope, subject matter, and method as best it could.

zh: 它搜罗别人的剩余，甚至要悄然挤占老学科的一些领地。
en: It absorbed what was left over, and even had to encroach on some older preserves.

zh: 只有群体持续而正常地更新，文化才能继续存在。
en: No culture can continue if the group is not replenished continually and normally.

zh: 相反，文化会明显地随着群体的不断萎缩而逐渐消亡。
en: Otherwise, obviously, the culture will perish through the progressive dying out of the group.

zh: 因此每个人类群体以及群体内的每个个体都受某些起码最低条件的制约。
en: Certain minimum conditions are thus imposed on all groups of human beings, and on all individual organisms within the group.

zh: 我们可以根据一个事实来定义人性（human nature)：即无论居于何处及实践何种文明，人们都必须吃喝、呼吸、睡觉、生育，并且从机体排泄废物。
en: We can define the term "human nature" by the fact that all men have to eat, they have to breathe, to sleep, to procreate, and to eliminate waste matter from their organisms wherever they live and whatever type of civilization they practise.

zh: 后现代的另一个重要方面是文化的融合，即“新媒体与旧媒体互相碰撞，草根媒体与商业媒体互相交叠，媒体生产者与媒体消费者亦以前所未有的方式互相影响”。
en: Another aspect of the postmodern is convergence culture,‘where old and new media collide, where grassroots and corporate media intersect, where the power of the media producer and the power of the media consumer interact in unpredictable ways’.

zh: 所谓“融合”，指的是媒介内容在一系列不同平台间的流动。
en: Convergence involves the flow of media content across a range of different platforms.

zh: 这并非简单的新技术问题，而是一个要求消费者更加主动地参与到传媒生产之中的过程。
en: This is not simply a matter of new technologies but a process that requires the active participation of consumers.

zh: 如此看来，这一封面所展示的，并不是逃避现实者的幻想， 即为单调的日常生活带来不同寻常的剌激。
en: This page, then, is not an escapist fantasy bringing some unusual stimulation into the drabness of the everyday.

zh: 对煽情主义 (Sensationalism)进行轻蔑的“解释'会使人最终相信，那些能在当中找到乐趣的人根本上都是没有辨识能力的人；他们的感 觉是那么迟钝，只有最粗陋、最夸张的煽情主义才能在他们身上 奏效。虽然这样的观点或许有利于巩固那些赞同此观点的人的自我，但是却很难解释当下这类杂志在美国大受欢迎的原因。
en: Such a dismissive "explanation" of sensationalism leads one finally to the belief that those who find pleasure in it are essentially undiscriminating and have such blunted sensibilities that only the crassest, most exaggerated sensationalism can get through to them at all—a view that may do much for the egos of those that hold it, but that does little to explain the popularity of such magazines in contemporary America.

zh: 就阿多诺本人对现代通俗文化的理解来说，很少有什么论述能够较生动地概括马克思的商品拜物教理论的含义。处于阿多诺文化工业理论背后的，是马克思的理论。
en: Few statements could more graphically summarise the relevance of Marx's theory of commodity fetishism for Adorno's attempt to use the idea of the culture industry to understand modern popular culture.

zh: 在阿多诺和法兰克福学派看来，马克思对商品拜物教的讨论是一种理论的基础，即像通俗音乐这样的文化形式可以起到保证资本在经济上、政治上和意识形态上持久统治的作用。
en: For Adorno and the Frankfurt School, commodity fetishism is the basis of a theory of how cultural forms such as popular music can secure the continuing economic, political and ideological domination of capitalism.

zh: 战争是社会有机体之间的斗争，而不是个人之间的斗争。
en: Warfare is a struggle between social organisms, not individuals.

zh: 因此，对战争只能从社会或文化上进行解释，而不能从心理学上加以说明。

en: Its explanation is therefore social or cultural, not psychological.

zh: 靠着调查男人和女人的心理动机，我们将永远也不能理解美国为什么要参加第二次世界大战或其他任何一场战争。
en: We could never understand why the United States entered World War II—or any other war—by an inquiry into the psychological motives of men and women.

zh: 例如，英国保守党在1990年制作播出了一期政治宣传节目，节目结束时的最后一个词是“社会主义”，而此时电视上出现了红色监狱栅栏的影像，这就暗示其竞争对手工党所鼓吹的社会主义无异于建造了社会、经济与政治的囹崮。
en: For example, a Conservative Party political broadcast transmitted in 1990 ended with the word "socialism" being transposed into red prison bars.What was being suggested is that the socialism of the Labour Party is synonymous with social, economic and political imprisonment.

zh: 这期节目就是要达到为“社会主义”一词赋予内涵的目的。
en: The broadcast was attempting to fix the connotations of the word "socialism".

zh: 此外，此举还旨在将对手置于某种二元对立关系——社会主义意味着囚禁，而保守主义倡导自由——之中。
en: Moreover, it hoped to locate socialism in a binary relationship in which it connoted unfreedom, whilst conservatism connoted freedom.

zh: 在每种场合下他的活动都由一系列关系决定，包括与某些商业或工业企业，与学校或宗教机构，与政治社团或娱乐组织机构的关系等。他在这些机构中或是官员或是普通职员。
en: In every case his activities are determined by his relation to some commercial or industrial business, to a school or a religious institution, to a political association or a recreational organization of which he is the official or the servant.

zh: 如果我们调査个人的日常行为，或男或女、或老或少、或健康或体弱，都能发现其生存的所有阶段必须都与这种或那种由我们的文化进一步细分的组织化活动系统相联系。
en: If we were to survey the daily behavior of any individual, male or female, young or old, healthy or sick, we would find that all phases of his existence must be related to one or other of the systems of organized activities into which our culture can be subdivided; which, in their agglomerate, really constitute our culture.

zh: 这时，他们的父亲就会教训说：“你希望的是什么？要体会人生，就必须接受一些训练；如果放弃修养，今后肯定会不愉快。如果陷入这种处境而遭受社会上议论，我是不会袒护你的。
en: Their fathers may talk to them and say, 'What do you wish? Some training is necessary to savor life. If you give this up and do not train yourself at all, you will be unhappy as a natural consequence. And if these natural consequences should occur, I should not be inclined to protect you against public opinion.'

zh: ”用他们常用的说法，修养就是磨掉“身上的锈’。
en: Shuyo, in the phrase they use so often, polishes away 'the rust of the body.'

zh: 它会使人变成一把锋利的刀。这当然是他们所希望的。
en: It makes a man a bright sharp sword, which is, of course, what he desires to be.

zh: 在整个这段时期，可以追溯出某种前后一致的文化模式。
en: Throughout this period a consistent cultural pattern can be traced.

zh: 大众的快感被视为在社会秩序之外并因而威胁到它。
en: Popular pleasures were recognized to lie outside social control and thus to threaten it.

zh: 这些快感粗鲁不雅、无视规矩的特征，被中产阶级描绘成不道德的、无序的以及在经济上不节俭的。
en: Their unruliness was characterized by the middle classes as immoral, disorderly, and economically improvident.

zh: 这些社会层面的威胁，被局部化到个人内部，无产阶级的身体成为个人的身体。
en: These social threats were localized within the individual; the proletarian body became the individual body.

zh: 于是身体的快感与无度——酗酒、做爱、懒散、粗暴——被视为对社会秩序的威胁。
en: So the pleasures and excesses of the body—drunkenness, sexuality, idleness, rowdiness—were seen as threats to the social order.

zh: 个人身体的快感构成了对身体政治（body poliThe Interpretation of Cultures)的威胁。
en: The pleasures of the individual body constituted a threat to the body politics.

zh: 列维—施特劳斯指出，神话的运行方式和语言是一样的。神话是由“神话素”构成的，就像语言是由“词素”和“音素”等单元构成的一样。
en: Myths, Lévi-Strauss argues, work like language: they comprise individual "mythemes", analogous to individual units of language, "morphemes" and "phonemes".

zh: 如词素和音素一般，神话素无法独立生成意义，而必须以某种方式被组合起来方可。
en: Like morphemes and phonemes, mythemes only take on meaning when combined in particular patterns.

zh: P•P•克鲁泡特金（Prince Peter Kropotkin)正确地指出，在合作共同体中，个体之间的互助是个支配性概念，而个体间的生存竞争则不适用于整体的人类社会。
en: Prince Peter Kropotkin was quite right in pointing out that mutual aid between individuals of a cooperative community is the dominant concept, while the struggle between the individuals for survival can not be applied to human societies as a whole.

zh: 我们不能仅依据极少的文献证据就想当然地将物竞天择的概念应用于原始共同体，当然更不能把战争、弱者群体灭绝和强者以弱者、胜者以败者为代价的扩张假定为一种常态。
en: We could not intelligently and with any chance of documentary evidence apply the concept of struggle for existence to primitive communities, certainly not in the sense of assuming a perpetual state of warfare, of extermination of weaker groups and the expansion of 'stronger ones at the expense of those defeated or destroyed.

zh: 不过，我们可以将生存价值的概念应用于文化。
en: We can, however, apply the concept of survival value to cultures.

zh: 在此它或许不应与文化内或文化间斗争（struggle)的任何概念，而应与竞争（competition)的概念相搭配。
en: This probably would not be coupled here with any concept of struggle, but rather with that of competition, within cultures and between cultures.

zh: 我们能肯定，任 何文化在功用效能、人工制品、合作或符号精确性等方面的失败，都会不可避免地导致整个文化器物层的逐渐消失。
en: We could affirm that the failure within any culture as regards instrumental efficiency, artifacts, cooperation, or symbolic accuracy, would inevitably lead to the gradual extinction of the whole cultural apparatus.

zh: 为了构拟这份清单，我们最好先考虑将人们聚集整合为永久性群体的普同性原理。
en: In order to construct such a list it might be best to consider the general principles which bind human beings together and integrate them into permanent groups.

zh: 我们首先看到的事实当然就是生育。
en: We have, of course, first and foremost, the fact of reproduction.

zh: 在所有人类社会中，生育，即夫妻关系和亲子关系，导致规模虽小却极其重要的群体的产生。
en: In all human societies, reproduction, that is, the relationship between husband and wife, and parents and children, leads to the formation of small yet exceedingly important groups.

zh: 因此，我们可以讨论生育的整合原理即亲属关系原理，亦即血亲关系和姻亲关系。
en: We can, therefore, speak about the reproductive principle of integration or the principle of kinship, that is, relationship by blood and relationship by marriage.

zh: 《摇滚与摔跤》节目拒绝“公正”。
en: Rock 'n' Wrestling refuses "fairness."

zh: 它就是不公正。
en: It is unfair.

zh: 没有人被给予“胜负均等的机会”（sporting chance)，而且任何人如果想要“公平比赛”，就会被占便宜，且最终会受到惩处。
en: Nobody is given a "sporting chance" and anyone who attempts to "play fair" is taken advantage of and suffers as a result.

zh: 不过评论员倒是一次又一次把我们带回到这个被拒绝的标准，作为理解这场动作的出发点。
en: Yet the commentators return us again and again to this rejected standard as a point from which to make sense of the action.

zh: 文化也是一种实践（praxis)，或是在某一社会中分配日用品、导引生产流向的一种方式；就生产方式最宽泛的意义而言，文化是……有关生产的观念（notion)，而生产则因人的存在而获得充足的涵义。
