en: A culture is also a praxis or a means of distributing supplies in a society and thus directing the flow of production; it is, in the widest sense a means of production, . . . the notion of production then acquires its full significance as production by a human being of his own existence.

zh: ……这首先暗示了文化不是 无用的，也不仅仅是一种过剩的玩意儿，而是内在于某一存 在模式中的特定行为。其次，它暗示了阶级利益（在结构的意义上，联系着生产和财产关系）并不能确保整个社会的生产劳动仅靠自己的力量便可以存在。
en: . . .This implies first that culture is not useless, a mere exuberance, but a specific activity inherent in a mode of existence, and second that class interests (structurally connected to production and property relations) cannot ensure the totality of society's operative existence unaided.

zh: 文化工业经营各种谎言，而不是真理，经营各种虚假需求和虚假解决办法，而不是现实的需求和现实的解决办法。
en: The culture industry deals in falsehoods not truths, in false needs and false solutions, rather than real needs and real solutions.

zh: 它“仅仅在表面上”解决各种问题，不是按照在现实世界中应当解决它们的那样去做。
en: It solves problems ‘only in appearance’, not as they should be resolved in the real world.

zh: 它提供解决各种问题的伪装,而不是实质，把对各种虚假需求的虚假满足当作对各种现实问题的现实解决办法的替代物。
en: It offers the semblance not the substance of resolving problems, the false satisfaction of false needs as a substitute for the real solution of real problems.

zh: 它在这么做时将大众的意识接管了。
en: In doing this, it takes over the consciousness of the masses.

zh: 奥萨治人由亲属团体组成,在这种氏族中，世系血统通过父系相传，对母系则置之不理。
en: The Osage are organized in kinship groups in which descent is traced through the father and disregards the mother's line.

zh: 这些氏族团体继承一个共同的超自然的福赐。
en: These clan groups have a common inheritance of supernatural blessing.

zh: 每个氏族的传说都讲着其祖先如何寻求一种幻象，并且怎样得到某一动物的祝福,该氏族的姓氏正是这种动物的名称。
en: The legend of each clan tells how its ancestor sought a vision, and was blessed by the animal whose name the clan has inherited.

zh: 当然，这种创造力的另一面是“事后的再书写”（retrospective rewriting)，即假设剧本书与本来应该发生什么，能像前文本那么富有创造性。
en: The flip-side of this creativity of course is retrospective "rewriting"—the what-would-have-happened if script can be just as productive as the predictive one.

zh: 以这种方式，书迷闲聊填补了文本的裂隙。
en: In this way, fan gossip fills in the gaps in the text.

zh: 它说明了文本中省略或掩埋了的动机和结果，它扩展了解释的空间，提供了另一种或者额外的洞见；它再诠释，再表现，再创造。
en: It explains motivations and consequences omitted from or buried in the text itself; it expands explanations, offers alternative or extended insights; it reinterprets, re-presents, reproduces.

zh: 原初的文本是一种文化资源，从中可以生产出无数的新文本。
en: The original text is a cultural resource out of which numerous new texts are made.

zh: 前者的结构可能会限制或决定新文本的范围，但是永远不可能限制使用它的“书迷”的创造力和“生产者的特性”。
en: Its structure may limit or determine the range of new texts that can be produced from it, but it can never limit the creativity, the "producerliness" of the fans that use it.

zh: “这一至关重要且格外敏感的互文性折射出受众的能力与叙事技巧的变迁，而构成娱乐与文化素养的种种因素亦在后现代文化的图景中变得面目全非。
en: He argues that “This foregrounded, hyperconscious intertextuality reflects changes in terms of audience competence and narrative technique, as well as a fundamental shift in what constitutes both entertainment and cultural literacy in post- modern culture”.

zh: ”其结果就是“叙事行为如今在两个层面上同时运作：一是人物的历险，二是文本的历险。两者共同构成了当代文化产品的循环系统”。
en: As a consequence of this, Collins argues, ‘Narrative action now operates at two levels simultaneously--in reference to character adventure and in reference to a text’s adventures in the array of contemporary cultural production.’

zh: 但是，说巴厘人的宗教在方法上没有条理，并不是说它完全没有秩序。
en: Yet, again, to say that Balinese religion is not methodically ordered is not to say that it is not ordered at all.

zh: 它不仅有着连续一致的、极有特点的格调(一种只有大量的描述才能引发的刻意的戏剧性）,而且组成它的因素形成一系列明确的仪式复合体(complex),它反过来又对含蓄但不乏合理性的适当的宗教问题显示出明确的态度。
en: Not only is it pervaded with a consistent, highly distinctive tone (a kind of sedulous theatricalism which only extended description could evoke), but the elements which comprise it cluster into a number of relatively well-defined ritual complexes which exhibit, in turn, a definite approach to properly religious issues no less reasonable for being implicit.

zh: 其中有三方面最重要：（1)寺庙体系；（2）社会不平等的神圣化;（3）死亡和巫术崇拜。
en: Of these, three are of perhaps greatest importance: (I) the temple system; (2) the sanctification of social inequality; and (3) the cult of death and witches.

zh: 从很多方面看，这都不是件易事。
en: This is, in many ways, a daunting task.

zh: 正如托尼•本内特（Tony Bennett)所指出的那样：“从当下情况看，‘大众文化’这一概念实在无用， 它似乎把若干混沌不清乃至彼此抵触的含义塞进一个大熔炉，只会将种种对真相的探索引入理论的死胡同。
en: As Tony Bennett (1980) points out, ‘as it stands, the concept of popular culture is virtually useless, a melting pot of confused and contradictory meanings capable of misdirecting inquiry up any number of theoretical blind alleys’ (18).

zh: ”（Bennett，1980: 18)此种“界定困难”一部分源自“他者”（otherness)这一概念的特殊性--当我们使用 “大众文化”这一表述时，暗示着与大众文化相对的“他者”总是缺席/在场的。
en: Part of the difficulty stems from the implied otherness that is always absent/ present when we use the term ‘popular culture’.

zh: 在阅读后面的章节时，你也会发现我们往往有意无意地将大众文化与其他文化——民间文化、群氓文化、宰制性文化、工人阶级文化等等——进行对比，并在对比中为“大众文化”下定义。
en: As we shall see in the chapters which follow, popular culture is always defined, implicitly or explicitly, in contrast to other conceptual categories: folk culture, mass culture, dominant culture, working-class culture, etc.

zh: 但是，很多古典学派在一个要点上是犯了有意为之而不是疏忽遗漏之过。
en: There is, however, one point on which the various older schools have committed a sin of commission, rather than omission.

zh: 人类文化“死物”或文化化石这一概念缺乏批判力，有时甚至是反科学的。
en: This is the uncritical and, at times, even anti-scientific concept of "dead-weights" or cultural fossils in human culture.

zh: 我这里指的是那种认为文化范围广泛，即使脱离了其所处背景的观念、信仰、组织、风俗、器物也具有十分重要地位的信条。
en: By this I mean the principle that cultures harbor to a considerable extent, and in positions of strategic importance, ideas, beliefs, institutions, customs, and objects which do not really belong in their context.

zh: 在进化理论中，这种死物在“遗存”的伪装下出现。
en: In evolutionary theories, such dead-weights appear under the guise of "survivals".

zh: 播化论把它们叫做“借来特质”或特质丛。
en: The diffusionist speaks of them as "borrowed traits" or "trait complexes."

zh: 最近，特质分析法（trait analysis）在加利福尼亚大学得到了一种新的和当之无愧的复兴。
en: Quite recently a new and very competent revival of trait analysis has been undertaken at the University of California.

zh: 这一研究的牵头人是A•L•克罗伯教授。他正确地认识到，特质分析以及用特质或特质丛进行文化特征概括，都取决于他们能否作为现实而加以离析，并因而能在实际观察和理论上变得可以比较。
en: Professor A. L. Kroeber, the leader of this inquiry, quite rightly recognizes that trait analysis and the characterization of culture by traits or trait complexes depends on the question whether they can be isolated as realities, and thus made comparable in observation and theory.

zh: 实际上，日本人关于天皇的概念是太平洋诸岛上一再被发现的那种概念。
en: The truth is that Japan's conception of her Emperor is one that is found over and over among the islands of the Pacific.

zh: 他是神圣首领，可以参与政治，也可以不参与。
en: He is the Sacred Chief who may or may not take part in administration.

zh: 在一些太平洋岛屿上，他自己行使权力；在另一些岛屿上，则将权力委托给别人。
en: In some Pacific islands he did and in some he delegated his authority.

zh: 但他的人身则是神圣的。
en: But always his person was sacred.

zh: 弗雷泽认为，巫术来源于原始人的一种基本观念。
en: Magic to Frazer is due to an essential conception of primitive man.

zh: 它是观念联动原理（the principles of association of ideas)的应用--或误用--以及这些原理向一种自然过程理论的转移（transposition)。
en: It is the application, or rather misapplication, of the principles of association of ideas, and their transposition into a theory of natural processes.

zh: 巫术的两大原理是：同类相生（like produces like)和相互接解过的事物在远距离内继续相互作用。
en: The two principles of magic are that like produces like, and that things which have been once in contact with each other continue to act on each other at a distance.

zh: 弗雷泽称这两条原理为原始巫术自然观法则（the laws of primitive magical outlook)。
en: Frazer designates these two principles as the laws of primitive magical outlook.

zh: “虽然这些法则未经言语阐明，甚至蛮人也不这样抽象地考虑它们。但蛮人潜在地相信它们很能独立人类意志而调节自然过程。”
en: "Though these laws are certainly not formulated in so many words, nor even conceived in the abstract by the savage, they are nevertheless implicitly believed by him to regulate the course of nature quite independently of human will."

zh: 上学之前以及上学后的头二、三年内，男孩与女孩一起结伴玩。但多数是同性之间最亲近，特别是同年龄的孩子最易结为密友。
en: Girls and boys play together until they go to school, and for two or three years after, but closest ties are likely to be between children of the same sex and especially between children of the same chronological age.

zh: 这样的同年集团，特别是在农村可以持续终生，其持续性超过其它集团。
en: These age-groups (donen), especially in the villages, are lifelong and survive all others.

zh: 在须惠村，上了年纪的人，“随着性关系的逐渐减退，同年人的集会便成为人生的真正乐趣。须惠村俗话说：‘同年比老婆还要近’。”
en: In the village of Suye Mura, “as sexual interests decrease parties of donen are the true pleasures left in life. Suye (the village) says, ‘Donen are closer than a wife.’”

zh: 1944年，西奥多•阿多诺和马克斯•霍克海默用“文化工业”这个概念来描述流氓文化的产品及其生产过程。
en: In 1944 Theodor Adorno and Max Horkheimer coined the term ‘culture industry’ to designate the products and processes of mass culture.

zh: 他们声称，文化工业生产出来的产品具有两个特征：第一，同质性电影、广播和杂志构成了一个体系，生产出来的东西从整体到局部都是千篇一律的……所有的流氓文化都差不多”。第二，可预见性。
en: The products of the culture industry, they claim, are marked by two features: homogeneity, ‘film, radio and magazines make up a system which is uniform as a whole and in every part...all mass culture is identical’; and predictability:

zh: 很明显，后现代主义已经成了近年来引起日益增长的兴趣和注意的一个问题。
en: Postmodernism has attracted increasing interest and attention in recent years.

zh: 单是根据已出版的书名所使用的术语或它们的对应词语来判断，或者根据它们阐明自己对后现代主义的关注来判断，就很容易看出这一点。
en: This can readily be seen by the book titles published using the term or its equivalents, or making clear their concern with postmodernism.

zh: 《已出版图书》的索引显示，1978年到1981年期间，没有出版书名与后现代主义有关的任何图书，但在1988年出版了14种，1989年出版了22种，1990年出版了29种。
en: The Books in Print index shows no book titles published on postmodernism between 1978 and 1981, but 14 published in 1988, 22 in 1989 and 29 in 1990.

zh: 考虑一下图腾制度。
en: Consider totemism.

zh: 图腾制度长期被认为是一个自发的、一元化的社会习俗，一种原始的自然崇拜，被以这一种或是那一种机械论——进化论、功能主义、精神分析法、功利主义——来加以解释。对莱维‑斯特劳斯来说，这仅仅是从特殊的形象中建立起概念结构的倾向的一个特例。
en: Long regarded as an autonomous, unitary institution, a kind of primitive nature worship to be explained in terms of mechanical theories of one sort or another-evolutionist, functionalist, psychoanalytic, utilitarian-it is for Levi-Strauss only a special case of this overall tendency to build conceptual schemes out of particular images/

zh: 有一些有关的问题与对通俗文化的符号学分析有联系。
大多与巴特对外延和内涵的区分有关。
en: Barthes's distinction between denotation and connotation.

zh: 有人论证说，神话之所以起作用，是因为我们看见了一个特定符号或神话的外延，但它的内涵仍然隐藏着，直到符号学家把它们向我们揭示出来。
en: It is argued that myth works because we see the denotations of a particular sign or myth but its connotations remain hidden until they are revealed to us by a semiologist.

zh: 然而，有纯粹的外延这种东西吗？
en: Yet is there such a thing as pure denotation?

zh: 一个符号的各种内涵即使有时不那么清晰，也没有它的外延清晰吗？
en: Are not the connotations of a sign as clear as, if not sometimes more clear than, its denotations?

zh: 强大的外样大名成了倒幕派的先锋，他们想通过“王政复古”取代德川氏而统治日本，只要求换一下当权者。
en: The great Outside Lords, the daimyo of Japan's strongest fiefs who spearheaded the overthrow of the Shogunate, thought of the Restoration as a way in which they, instead of the Tokugawa, could rule Japan.They wanted a mere change of personnel.

zh: 农民们盼望多保留一些自己收获的稻米，却讨厌“改革”。
en: The farmers wanted to keep more of the rice they raised but they hated 'reforms.'

zh: 武土阶层则希望保持俸禄，并能挥刀上阵建立功勋。
en: The samurai wanted to keep their pensions and be allowed to use their swords for greater glory.

zh: 在财政上支持王政复古派军队的商人们，希望推行重商主义，却从未指责过封建制度。
en: The merchants, who financed the Restoration forces, wanted to expand mercantilism but they never arraigned the feudal system.

zh: 人类长期以来抱有万能的幻觉。
en: Man has long cherished the illusion of omnipotence.

zh: 这种幻觉是人的自我感到满足和舒适。

en: It is flattering and comforting to his ego.

zh: 在过去人相信能够控制天气，无数的原始民族为祈求雨水、平息大风和预防暴风雪而举行各种仪式。
en: In days gone by, man has believed that he could control the weather; countless primitive peoples have had rituals for making rain, stilling high winds, or averting storms.

zh: “王政复古”使天皇位居顶峰，废除了将军，简化了等级制。
en: The Restoration had simplified the hierarchal order by placing the Emperor at its apex and eliminating the Shogun.

zh: 王政复古后的政治家又废除了藩，稍除了忠于藩主和忠于国家之间的矛盾。
en: The post-Restoration statesmen, by abolishing the fiefs, eliminated the conflict between loyalty to one's own seigneur and to the State.

zh: 这些变化并没有从根本上否定等级制的习惯，只是赋予了一个新的位置。
en: These changes did not unseat hierarchal habits.They gave them a new locus.

zh: 从他出生之时起，他生于其中的风俗就在塑造着他的经验与行为。
en: From the moment of his birth the customs into which he is born shape his experience and behaviour.

zh: 到他能说话时。他就成了自己文化的小小的创造物，而当他长大成人并能参与这种文化的活动时，其文化的习惯就是他的习惯，其文化的信仰就是他的信仰，其文化的不可能性亦就是他的不可能性。
en: By the time he can talk, he is the little creature of his culture, and by the time he is grown and able to take part in its activities, its habits are his habits, its beliefs his beliefs, its impossibilities his impossibilities.

zh: 我首先要说，我自己对此也不敢太武断。
en: I would like first to say that here I am not too dogmatic myself.

zh: 我宁愿说，功能的 概念在这层意义上——即作为理解更紧密联系的社会结构，理解更广泛更深的服务和用品的分配，以及理解观念和信仰的一个新角度，作为循着某些社会现象的生命力和文化功效（cultural utility) 这一线路研究的一种重新定向，它可能会有用。
en: I would rather suggest that a concept of function in this sense, that is, as a contribution towards a more closely knit social texture, towards the wider and more penetrating distribution of services and goods, as well as of ideas and beliefs, might be useful as a reorientation of research along the lines of the vitality and cultural utility of certain social phenomena.

zh: 我还认为，在文化进化中，我们可以引进保全斗争（struggle for maintenance ) 的概念，不是保全个体机体，也不是保全人类群体，而是保全文化形态作为一条原理，这也许有助于估量传播的概率（chances)。
en: I would also suggest that in cultural evolution we might introduce the concept of the struggle for maintenance, not of individual organisms nor yet of human groups, but rather of cultural forms.This also might be useful as a principle in assessing the chances of diffusion.

zh: 在消费社会中，所有的商品既有实用价值，也有文化价值。
en: In a consumer society, all commodities have cultural as well as functional values.

zh: 倘若将这一要点模式化，我们必须扩展原有的经济概念，把文化经济容纳进去。在文化经济中，流通过程并非货币的周转，而是意义和快感的传播。
en: To model this we need to extend the idea of an economy to include a cultural economy where the circulation is not one of money, but of meanings and pleasures.

zh: 于是此处的观众，乃从一种商品转变成现 在的生产者，即意义和快感的生产者。
en: Here the audience, from being a commodity, now becomes a producer, a producer of meanings and pleasures.

zh: 第二章里提到过，利维斯主义者在英国为大众文化打开了教育的空间，而霍加特和威廉斯便占领了这一空间；他们一方面继承了利维斯主义的某些观点，另一方面也对其理论体系的某些基本假设提出了挑战一这多少有些自相矛盾。
en: As we noted in Chapter 2, the Leavisites opened up in Britain an educational space for the study of popular culture.Hoggart and Williams occupy this space in ways that challenge many of the basic assumptions of Leavisism, whilst also sharing some of these assumptions.

zh: 在重温“文化与文明”传统之余，霍加特和威廉斯向前迈了一大步，不仅开创了文化主义的传统，更为大众文化研究的文化研究路径奠定了基调。而《识字的用途》（The Uses of Literacy)、《文化与社会》与《漫长的革命》(The Long Revolution)三部著作则标志着文化主义和利维斯主义的决裂，被视为“左派利维斯主义”（left-Leavisism)的代表作（Hall，1996a)。
en: It is this contradictory mixture – looking back to the ‘culture and civilization’ tradition, whilst at the same time moving forward to culturalism and the foundations of the cultural studies approach to popular culture – which has led The Uses of Literacy, Culture and Society and The Long Revolution to be called both texts of the ‘break’ and examples of ‘left-Leavisism’ (Hall, 1996a).

zh: 尽管上述几位作者的观点不尽相同，但他们的著作共同构成了文化主义的经典文本。
en: This body of work, despite certain differences between its authors, constitutes the founding texts of culturalism.

zh: 诚如霍尔所言：文化主义始终是英国文化研究领域内最具活力、最有特色的一支。
en: As Hall was later to observe, ‘Within cultural studies in Britain, “culturalism” has been the most vigorous, indigenous strand’.

zh: 在本章末尾，我们还将对文化主义在伯明翰大学当代文化研究中心的建制过程展开讨论。
en: The chapter will end with a brief discussion of the institutionalization of culturalism at the Centre for Contemporary Cultural Studies.

zh: 由于在阿尔都塞看来意识形态是一个封闭的系统，所以意识形态并不是无所不能的。也就是说，为了让自己老老实实地待在专属的领地（那是一片无比和谐的神奇疆域）内，意识形态必须小心翼翼地回避那些自己无法解答的问题。
en: Because ideology is for Althusser a closed system, it can only ever set itself such problems as it can answer; that is, to remain within its boundaries (a mythic realm without contradictions), it must stay silent on questions which threaten to take it beyond these boundaries.

zh: 于是，阿尔都塞又提出了“问题域”①（problematic)这个概念。
en: This formulation leads Althusser to the concept of the ‘problematic’.

zh: 他先用这一概念去解释“认识论上的断裂。”他宣称马克思1845年的著作中就存在断裂。
en: He first uses the concept to explain the ‘epistemological break’, which he claims occurs in Marx’s work in 1845.

zh: 所谓问题域，指的是“客观的内部指向系统……也就是确定了哪些问题需要被回答的系统”（67)。马克思的问题域不仅仅决定了他可以提出哪些问题并对其作出解答，还指明了其著作中缺失了什么问题或概念。
en: Marx’s problema, ‘the objective internal reference system . . . the system of questions commanding the answers given’ (67), determines not only the questions and answers he is able to bring into play, but also the absence of problems and concepts in his work.

zh: 乌托邦作为一种至善至美的结构——在这结构中，人类生活将达到无暇的繁荣昌盛,是无法实现的。
en: Utopia cannot be achieved as a final and perfect structure within which human life will reach a faultless flowering.

zh: 这种乌托邦只能被视为是纯然的白日梦。
en: Utopias of this sort should be recognized as pure day-dreaming.

zh: 社会秩序的真正改善取决于更谨慎而又是更艰难的辨别力。
en: Real improvements in the socialorder depend upon more modest and more difficult discriminations.

zh: 如其他大量情境一样，普韦布洛人的巫技是一种焦虑情结（anxiety complex）。
en: Witchcraft among the Pueblos, like so many of their situations, is an anxiety complex.

zh: 他们不明确地互相猜疑;假如某人极其令人讨厌，巫技就必定会施用在他身上。
en: They vaguely suspect one another; and if a man is sufficiently disliked, witchcraft is sure to be attributed to him.

zh: 一般的死亡与巫技断言毫无关系。
en: There is no concern with witchcraft allegations at an ordinary death.

zh: 类似的例子不胜枚举。正是为人们所共享的、有意识或无意识的“感知结构”通过虚构文本化解了19世纪社会中的冲突与矛盾。
en: All these (and more) are presented as examples of a shared structure of feeling, the unconscious and conscious working out in fictional texts of the contradictions of nineteenth-century society.

zh: 文化分析就是要通过这些记录性的档案——“从诗歌到建筑，再到服饰风尚”——来对感知结构进行解读。
en: The purpose of cultural analysis is to read the structure of feeling through the documentary record, "from poems to buildings and dress-fashions".

zh: 我们的整个分析一直在强调一个重要的事实：所有组织都始终基于物质环境场景并与之紧密相联。
en: An important fact has been registered throughout our analysis: all organization is invariably based upon and intimately associated with the material environmental setting.

zh: 没有任何制度悬于空中或以模糊不定的方式在空间中漂荡。
en: No institution is suspended in the air or floating in a vague, indefinite manner through space.

zh: 它们都拥有一个物质底层 (material substratum)，即以财富、器具形式而存在的环境装置特定部分，还有一个产生于活动的增益部分。
en: One and all have a material substratum, that is, a reserved portion of the environmental outfit in wealth, in instruments, and also a portion of the profits accruing from concerted activities.

zh: 依据宪纲而组织起来，通过社会化和组织化协作而行动，遵循他们特定行业的规则，使用他们手中的物质装备，群体从事其为之而组织的活动。
en: Organized on the charter, acting through their social and organized cooperation, following the rules of their specific occupation, using the material apparatus at their disposal, the group engages in the activities for which they have organized.

zh: 对戴尔来说，娱乐的乌托邦色彩是文本的特有属性。
en: For Dyer, entertainment’s utopian sensibility is a property of the text.

zh: 斯戴西拓展了此一论断,将人们体验娱乐的社会情境也囊括至讨论的范畴。
en: Stacey extends his argument to include the social context in which entertainment is experienced.

zh: 相关的通信内容和问卷调査显示，工人阶级女性从电影中获取的绝不仅仅是视觉愉悦和听觉快感，她们同时还体验到一种“共映”的仪式，分享着一个专属于电影观众的“想象共同体”，并享受到影院建筑的美妙与奢华。
en: The letters and completed questionnaires by the women made it clear to her that the pleasures of cinema expressed by them were always more than the visual and aural pleasures of the cinema text--they included the ritual of attending a screening, the shared experience and imagined community of the audience, the comfort and comparative luxury of the cinema building.

zh: 这可不单单是“沉醉于好莱坞的魔力”这样简单。
en: It was never a simple matter of enjoying the glamour of Hollywood.

zh: 不过，济慈是在他那句名言里说明艺术家的人格的：“消极能力……能暗处于不定、神秘、怀疑之中而不烦躁企求实事与理智”。
en: But the account of the artist's personality which Keats then gives is, in his famous phrase, that of "Negative Capability...when a man is capable of being in uncertainties, mysteries, doubts, without any irritable reaching after fact and reason.

zh: 或者：天才人物的伟大之处，非常像某些作用于中性智力的微妙化学物。不过，他们不具备个性、没有确定的性格——具有适当自我的人，其高明者，我称为有力的人。
en: ' Or again: Men of Genius are great as certain ethereal Chemicals operating on the Mass of neutral intellect-but theu have not any individuality, any determined Character-I would call the top and head of those who have a proper self, Men of power.

zh: 我们必须将文化的理论建立在所有人类属于同一动物物种这个事实之上。
en: We have to base our theory of culture on the fact that all human beings belong to an animal species.

zh: 人作为机体必须存在于不仅能保障其生存，亦能使其进行健康和正常的新陈代谢的状态之下。
en: Man as an organism must exist under conditions which not only secure survival, but also allow of healthy and normal metabolism.

zh: 只有群体持续而正常地更新，文化才能继续存在。
en: No culture can continue if the group is not replenished continually and normally.

zh: 相反，文化会明显地随着群体的不断萎缩而逐渐消亡。
en: Otherwise, obviously, the culture will perish through the progressive dying out of the group.

zh: 这一概念还极大地妨碍了我们对所谓的“新娘身价”的逐步理解。它从来不是一种商业交换，而是一种复杂，但却有着相当清楚、一目了然的经济、法律以及宗教功能的合法机制。
en: Here also this concept has retarded very much our gradual understanding that the so-called bride-price is never a commercial transaction, but a legal device with complex but perfectly clear and fully obvious economic, juridical, and religious functions.

zh: 考察每一个“遗存”的例子，我们都能首先看到，所谓的文化“残留”的遗存性质主要来自于对事实所作的不充分分析。
en: Take any example of "survival."You will find, first and foremost, that the survival nature of the alleged cultural "hangover" is due primarily to an incomplete analysis of the facts.

zh: 我们还会看到，大多数“遗存”，尤其是被预测为重要的制度、基本要素或用法的遗存，正在逐步和无可挽回地从人类学理论中消失。
en: You will also find that most survivals, especially those which have been predicated about important institutions, fundamental elements or usages, have gradually and progressively faded out of anthiopological theory.

zh: 这一概念的真正危害是妨碍有效的田野工作。
en: The real harm done by this concept.was to retard effective field-work.

zh: 它使研究者们不去寻求任何文化事实的当今功能，而仅仅满足于建成一个僵固的、自足的实体。
en: Instead of searching for the present-day function of any cultural fact, the observer was merely satisfied in reaching a rigid, self-contained entity.

zh: 赞许精神分析一点也不会减低行为理论(behaviorism)所宣称的要将社会与文化过程纳入基础心理学的重要性。
en: The approval of psychoanalysis does not in any way detract from the great importance which behaviorism promises to acquire as the basic psychology for the study of social and cultural processes.

zh: 我说的行为理论是指由耶鲁大学的 C·哈尔 (C·Hull),哥伦比亚大学的桑代克(Thorndike)，康奈尔大学的里德尔(H·S·Liddell)三位教授在“刺激--反应”(stimulus-- response)心理学方面做出的新发展。
en: By behaviorism I mean the newer developments of stimulus-and-response psychology as elaborated by Professor C. Hull at Yale, Thorndike at Columbia, or H. S. Liddell at Cornell.

zh: 行为理论的价值首先在于其研究方法的局限和长处都与人类学实地考察工作相似这一事实。
en: The value of behaviorism is due, first and foremost, to the fact that its methods are identified as regards limitations and advantages with those of anthropological field-work.

zh: 在与异文化的人打交道时，使用短路的“移情”(empathy)，即猜想其他人会有什么思想和感受，总是比较危险的。
en: In dealing with people of a different culture, it is always dangerous to use the short-circuiting of "empathy," which usually amounts to guessing as to what the other person might have thought or felt.

zh: 实地考察工作者和行为论者的基本原理都认为观念、感情、意欲无论有意识或无意识，都不会在深不可测的心灵之内形成神秘和隐藏的存在。
en: The fundamental principle of the field-worker, as well as of the behaviorist, is that ideas, emotions and conations never continue to lead a cryptic, hidden existence within the unexplorable depths of the mind, conscious or unconscious.

zh: 离开了为社会成员所共享的代码（无论是有意识的还是无意识的），内涵将会一无是处。
en: Without access to this shared code (conscious or unconscious) the operations of connotation would not be possible.

zh: 当然，这种知识既是历史的，又是文化的，这就意味着在不同的文化传统下、在不同的历史时期内，人们所共享的社会知识体系也是不尽相同的。
en: And of course such knowledge is always both historical and cultural.That is to say, it might differ from one culture to another, and from one historical moment to another.

zh: 此外，造成差异的其他因素还包括阶级、种族、性别、代际和性取向等等。
en: Cultural difference might also be marked by differences of class, race, gender, generation or sexuality.

zh: 上述论点比较接近于霍尔（1986）晚期的“言传理论”（theory of arThe Interpretation of Culturesulation)。在这—理论中，霍尔说明了文本在大众文化中运作的双重方式。其一为文本中心的方式，其二为读者中 心的方式。
en: This accords better with Hall's (1986) later theory of articulation, in which he accounts for the double way in which texts work in popular culture: a text-centered way, and a reader-centered way.

zh: 让我就此试举一例—这是一个假定的例子，但有经验研究为基础。这是拉德薇（1984)对言情小说读者的研究。
en: Let me take an example of this—a hypothetical one, but one based on an empirical study—Radway's (1984) study of romance readers.

zh: 后文我还会再次回到这一研究，因为它是研究大众文化运作过程的一部重要的民族志著作。
en: I shall return to this study again because it is a major ethnographic study of the processes of popular culture at work.

zh: 文本所“言说”（utter)的东西决定、限制并影响 着它和读者之间可能建立起来的关联，但是文本本身并不能建立或者控制这些联系。
en: What a text "utters" determines, limits, and influences the links that can be made between it and its readers, but it cannot make them or control them.

zh: 只有读者能够这样做。
en: Only readers can do that.

zh: 一个文本要成为大众的，就必须“言说”读者想要说的东西，并民必须允许读者在 建构和发现文本与他们的社会情境具有的相关点时，同时参与选择文本所言说的东西（因为文本所言说的东西必然是多元的）。
en: For a text to be popular, it must “utter" what its readers wish to say, and must allow those readers to participate in their choice of its utterances (for texts must offer multiple utterances) as they construct and discover its points of pertinence in their social situation.

zh: 相比之下，“言语”要受“语言体系”的限制和决定。
en: Parole is defined and determined by langue.

zh: 它是“语言体系”才能造成的语言的实际显现，并且源于“语言体系”。
en: It is the use of language made possible by, and deriving from, langue.

zh: “言语”是涉及说话和写作的各种语言单位的总和。
en: Parole is the sum of the linguistic units involved in speaking and writing.

zh: 让我们先讲衍生文化驱力的严格性和制约性。
en: Let us start with the stringency and determinism of the derived imperatives of culture.

zh: 整个人类，以及每个社会中的个体，在初生之际都是赤裸的机体。他们没有武器，没有防护，亦没有装备。
en: Humanity as a whole, and each individual in every society, start as naked organisms, unarmed, unprotected, and unequipped.

zh: 与其他动物相比，人的构造禀赋颇为有限。
en: Man's anatomical endowment, compared with other animals', is somewhat limited.

zh: 他缺少天然武器如利爪、尖牙、毒囊之类。
en: It lacks any natural weapons, such as claws, fangs, poison receptacles.

zh: 人的牙齿不足以锯木凿石,双手不利于掘地或杀牲。
en: Man's teeth are not good enough for sawing wood, breaking stone, nor are his hands useful to dig the soil or to kill his prey.

zh: 但作为替代，人制造出锋利而沉重的武器，能够击中远处的目标；他发明和改进工具用以掘土，用以杀死或诱捕地面、空中和水里的猎物；他借用动物的毛皮或以植物的纤维制作纺织品。
en: Instead of that, man produces sharp and heavy weapons, capable of attaining even a distant aim.He invents and develops instruments to dig, to kill or trap the prey on the ground, in the air, and in the water.He borrows animal furs and prepares textiles from vegetable fiber.

zh: 库宁海姆（Cunningham,1982)告诉我们，在整个19世纪，中产阶级是怎样一以贯之地将他们的精神风尚与组织形式，强加在体育运动上。
en: Cunningham (1982) shows how consistently throughout the nineteenth century the middle classes attempted to impose their ethos and forms of organization upon sport.

zh: 譬如足球与板球，是从它们大众的、无秩序的起源那里“偷”来的，并被重新组织而变得体面，再被转化为塑造年青绅士的品质乃至民族国家的性格的手段。
en: Football and cricket, for instance, were "stolen" from their popular, disorderly origins, and were organized, made respectable, and turned into the means of building the character of young gentlemen, and thus of the nation.

zh: 这种策略，同其他所有的控制策略-样，只在某方面成功，其相对的失败之处在于，体育运动乃沿着阶级的界线分裂开来。
en: This strategy, like all strategies of control, was successful only up to a point, and its comparative failure is evidenced by the way sport split along class lines.

zh: 替如业余英式橄榄球（rugby union)的参与者是一群绅士，而联盟制撤揽球（rugby league)的球员则是出身工人阶级的职业选手。
en: Rugby union, for instance, became the form played by gentlemen amateurs, rugby league by working-class professionals.

zh: 孩子们称正式夫人为“母亲”，不承认生母与孩子的关系。
en: The child calls the legal wife 'mother,' and ties between the real mother and her child are not acknowledged.

zh: 中国那种显然已成为传统习惯的东方式一夫多妻制与日本迥然不同。
en: The whole Oriental arrangement of polygamy, which is so pronounced a traditional pattern in China, is thus quite un-Japanese.

zh: 日本人对家庭义务与“人情”，甚至在空间上也是径渭分明的。
en: The Japanese keep family obligations and 'human feelings' even spatially apart.

zh: 行为论的价值首先在于其研究方法的局限和长处都与人类学实地工作相似这一事实。
en: The value of behaviorism is due, first and foremost, to the fact that its methods are identical as regards limitations and advantages with those of anthropological field-work.

zh: 在与异文化的人打交道时，使用短路的“移情”（empathy)，即猜想其他人会有什么思想和感受，总是比较危险的。
en: In dealing with people of a different culture, it is always dangerous to use the short-circuiting of "empathy," which usually amounts to guessing as to what the other person might have thought or felt.

zh: 实地工作者和行为论者的基本原理都认为观念、感情、意欲无论有意识或无意识，都不会在深不可测的心灵之内形成神秘和隐藏的存在。
en: The fundamental principle of the field-worker, as well as of the behaviorist, is that ideas, emotions and conations never continue to lead a cryptic, hidden existence within the unexplorable depths of the mind, conscious or unconscious.

zh: 伊索普关注的焦点是他所谓之“宰制性男性气质”（将异性恋的男性气质视为不言自明的核心之物，认为其坚强、专断、泰然自若、无所不知，且始终具有自我控制的能力，等等）。
en: Easthope’s focus is on what he calls dominant masculinity (the myth of heterosexual masculinity as something essential and self-evident which is tough, masterful, self-possessed, knowing, always in control, etc.).

zh: 从一开始，他就指出男性气质乃是文化建构的结果，绝非“自然”、“正常”或“普适”之物。
en: He begins from the proposition that masculinity is a cultural construct; that is, it is not ‘natural’, ‘normal’ or ‘universal’.

zh: 宰制性的异性恋男性气质如同一套性别规范，任何与之相抵的“活的男性气质”（包括同性恋男性气质）都不得不依照其标准来自我约束。
en: He argues that dominant masculinity operates as a gender norm, and that it is against this norm that the many other different types of ‘lived masculinities’ (including gay masculinities) are invited to measure themselves.

zh: 列维一施特劳斯指出，神话的运行方式和语言是一样的。神话是由“神话素”构成的，就像语言是由“词素”和“音素”等单元构成的一样。
en: Myths, Lévi-Strauss argues, work like language: they comprise individual "mythemes", analogous to individual units of language, "morphemes" and "phonemes".

zh: 如词素和音素一般，神话素无法独立生成意义，而必须以某种方式被组合起来方可。
en: Like morphemes and phonemes, mythemes only take on meaning when combined in particular patterns.

zh: 似乎并不遵循经济决定论逻辑的媒介机构的一种典型，是公共扇形广播。
en: One type of media institution which does not appear to obey the logic of economic determinism is public sector broadcasting.

zh: 这在英囯以英国广播公司为代表，它被期望提供一种启蒙、教育以及娱乐的媒介文化。
en: This is represented in Britain by the BBC, which is supposed to provide a media culture which enlightens and educates as well as entertains.

zh: 由于这种服务要由许可证费提供资金，而不是靠其产品在市场上所能要求的价格提供资金，所以它显然不会受到资本主义经济的各种压力。
en: Because this service is funded primarily by a licence fee and not by the prices its products can command on the market, it is not obviously subject to capitalist pressures.

zh: 1.营养补给。从这里的营养需求的直接满足人手，我们将看到人类吃、喝并非直接诉诸自然，亦非孤立状态，甚至也不是单纯的解剖学或生理学表现。
en: 1. Commissariat.Starting here with the direct satisfaction of the nutritive need, we would find that human beings eat and drink not by direct resort to nature, nor yet in isolation, nor yet in terms of mere anatomical or physiological performance.

zh: 如果考察最初级的原始人，如澳洲土著部落、火地岛民的小群体，或者考察髙度发达的美国或欧洲杜区，我们会碰到共餐的事实。
en: Were we to turn to the lowest primitives, to an Australian aboriginal tribe, to a small group of Firelanders, or to a highly sophisticated American or European community, we would come upon facts of commensalism.

zh: 在那些将大众文化视为群氓文化的人们心中，曾经存在过一个“黄金 时代”；那时的文化与现在的文化有本质的不同。
en: Those working within the mass culture perspective usually have in mind a previous ‘golden age’ when cultural matters were very different.

zh: 这一论断通常包含下述两种表述方式：有机社区（organic community)的逝去或民间文化（folk culture)的消亡。
en: This usually takes one of two forms: a lost organic community or a lost folk culture.

zh: 但是，正如费斯克指出的那样：“在资本主义社会里，不存在所谓的‘本真’民间文化，自然也就无法用‘本真与否’去衡量群氓文化的价值。故而，对‘本真’的哀悼注定只是沉浸在浪漫怀旧中的一种徒然无功的行为。”（Fiske, 1989a: 27)这一观点同样适用于对“逝去的有机社区”的分析。
en: But as Fiske (1989a) points out, ‘In capitalist societies there is no so-called authentic folk culture against which to measure the “inauthenticity” of mass culture, so bemoaning the loss of the authentic is a fruitless exercise in romantic nostalgia’ (27).This also holds true for the ‘lost’ organic community.

zh: 在第四章中，我们会发现法兰克福学派（The Frankfurt School)将消逝的“黄金时代”置于未来而非过去。
en: The Frankfurt School, as we shall see in Chapter 4, locate the lost golden age, not in the past, but in the future.

zh: 在另一些时刻，他辩称文化产业将成年人变成孩子。他用幼稚病的比喻说法来刻画倒退听众和倒退倾听的现象。
en: At other times he argues that adults are turned into children by the culture industry, using the metaphor of infantilism to characterise the regressive listener and regressive listening.

zh: 他的论点是这些现象都是长时间消费文化产业产品的结果。
en: His case is that this results from consuming the products of the culture industry.

zh: 这种理论明确地对大众社会概念的含义作了界定，并论证说工业化和都市化帮助造成了所谓的“原子化”。
en: The theory argues that industrialisation and urbanisation serve to create what is called "atomisation".This defines precisely what is meant by a mass society.

zh: 这意味着大众社会是由这样的人们构成的：他们只能像物理或化学复合物中的原子一样相互联系。
en: A mass society consists of people who can only relate to each other like atoms in a physical or chemical compound.

zh: 大众社会由原子化的人们组成，他们相互之间缺乏任何有意义的或者在道德上的紧密联系。
en: Mass society consists of atomised people, people who lack any meaningful or morally coherent relationships with each other.

zh: 诚然，狗、猿、马、鸟等等，也许还应包括处于较低进化等级上的那些动物，可被教会以某种特殊方式对人的口头指令做出反应。这一情况完全属实。
en: It is perfectly true, of course, that dogs, apes, horses, birds, and perhaps creatures even lower in the evolutionary scale, can be taught to respond in a specific way to a vocal command.

zh: 凯洛格试验中一只名叫“小呱“的幼年黑猩猩，在一段时间内对人的语言反映大大超过了婴儿。
en: Little Gua, the infant chimpanzee in the Kelloggs' experiment, was, for a time, "considerably superior to the child in responding to human words."

zh: 第三种叙事范式是“战争的美国化”。
en: The third narrative paradigm is "the Americanization of the war".

zh: 这一表述的意味是：在好莱坞越战影片（当然还有其他美国文化产品）中，越南战争已经演变成一个纯粹的美国现象，与越南无关——我们可称之为“帝国式自恋”。
en: What I want to indicate by this term is the way in which the meaning of the Vietnam War has become in Hollywood's Vietnam (and elsewhere in US cultural production) an absolutely American phenomenon.

zh: 在此种情结作祟下，美国成了世界的中心，越南和越南人民只不过作为美国悲剧的语境而存在，而越南人的粗蛮则最终导致了美国式纯真的迷失。
en: This is an example of what we might call "imperial narcissism", in which the United States is centred and Vietnam and the Vietnamese exist only to provide a context for an American tragedy, whose ultimate brutality is the loss of American innocence.

zh: 从很多方面看，这都不是件易事。
en: This is, in many ways, a daunting task.

zh: 正如托尼•本内特（Tony Bennett)所指出的那样：“从当下情况看，‘大众文化’这一概念实在无用， 它似乎把若干混沌不清乃至彼此抵触的含义塞进一个大熔炉，只会将种种对真相的探索引入理论的死胡同。
en: As Tony Bennett (1980) points out, ‘as it stands, the concept of popular culture is virtually useless, a melting pot of confused and contradictory meanings capable of misdirecting inquiry up any number of theoretical blind alleys’ (18).

zh: ”（Bennett，1980: 18)此种“界定困难”一部分源自“他者”（otherness)这一概念的特殊性--当我们使用 “大众文化”这一表述时，暗示着与大众文化相对的“他者”总是缺席/在场的。
en: Part of the difficulty stems from the implied otherness that is always absent/ present when we use the term ‘popular culture’.

zh: 在阅读后面的章节时，你也会发现我们往往有意无意地将大众文化与其他文化——民间文化、群氓文化、宰制性文化、工人阶级文化等等——进行对比，并在对比中为“大众文化”下定义。
en: As we shall see in the chapters which follow, popular culture is always defined, implicitly or explicitly, in contrast to other conceptual categories: folk culture, mass culture, dominant culture, working-class culture, etc.

zh: 古典人类学家并未根据有关原始民族的第一手认识撰写著述。
en: The classical anthropologists did not write out of first-hand knowledge of primitive people.

zh: 他们是那些随心所欲利用旅行家、传教士说的逸闻趣事和早期民族学家外在的、图解式说明的书斋学者。
en: They were armchair students who had at their disposal the anecdotes of travellers and missionaries and the formal and schematic accounts of the early ethnologists.

zh: 从这些琐事细节，追溯敲牙或者内脏占卜风俗的分布是可能的，但要理解这些特质如何根植于那些给予这种过程以形式与意义的特殊结构里的不同部落之中，则是不可能的。
en: It was possible to trace from these details the distribution of the custom of knocking out teeth, or of divination by entrails, but it was not possible to see how these traits were embedded in different tribes in characteristic configurations that gave form and meaning to the procedures.

zh: 对意识形态的社会决定因素的研究，目前主要有两种方法：利益论与张力论。
en: There are currently two main approaches to the study of the social determinants of ideology: the interest theory and the strain theory.

zh: 对前者而言，意识形态是面具和武器；对后者而言，意识形态是症状及处方。
en: For the first, ideology is a mask and a weapon; for the second, a symptom and a remedy.

zh: 在利益论中，意识形态见解被置于为好处进行的普遍斗争的背景之中；在张力论中，则被看成是为纠正社会心理的不平衡而进行的长期努力。
en: In the interest theory, ideological pronouncements are seen against the background of a universal struggle for advantage; in the strain theory, against the background of a chronic effort to correct sociopsychological disequilibrium.

zh: 我们力图表明，有可能发展一套理论。该理论可将基本需求及其文化满足与新的文化需求的衍生挂钩。而且，这些新的文化需求又将一套次生型的决定机制强加于人与社会。
en: We shall attempt to show that a theory can be developed in which the basic needs and their cultural satisfaction can be linked up with the derivation of new cultural needs; that these new needs impose upon man and society a secondary type of determinism.

zh: 我们将能把产生于诸如经济、道德、教育和政治等活动类型的功用性驱力 (instrumental imperatives)整合驱力（integrative imperatives) 区分开。
en: We shall be able to distinguish between instrumental imperatives—arising out of such types of activity as economic, normative, educational and political—and integrative imperatives.

zh: 后者可以知识、宗教和巫术为例。
en: Here we shall list knowledge, religion, and magic.

zh: 我们将能把艺术和娱乐活动与人类机体的特定生理特征直接联系，并表明它们对协作行为方式，对巫术、工业和宗教信仰等等的影响和依赖。
en: Artistic and recreational activities we shall be able to relate directly to certain physiological characteristics of the human organism, and also to show their influence and dependence upon modes of concerted action, magical, industrial, and religious belief.

zh: 它是他们生存本身的前提条件。
en: It is a prerequisite of their very existence.

zh: 但是价值的这层含义也扩散开去，并恒久地与手工能力和理论知识相联系。
en: This sense of value, however, also pervades and becomes permanently attached to both manual ability and theoreThe Interpretation of Culturesal knowledge.

zh: 体现在所有原始技术、原始经济组织和社会组织中的科学态度，即考虑未来活动时依靠过去的经验，是一个整体的要素。我们必须假定它从人类产生之初，从这个物种刚刚开始其作为器物制作人（homo faber)、智人（homo sapiens)、政治人（homo politcus)的生涯时，就在起作用。
en: The scientific attitude, embodied in all primitive technology and also in the organization of primitive economic enterprises and social organization, that reliance on past experience with the view to future performance, is an integral factor which must be assumed as having been at work from the very beginning of mankind, ever since the species started on its career as homo faber, as homo sapiens, and as homo politicus.

zh: 原始共同体中，只要有一代人丧失对这种科学态度及对其价值的珍视，该群体就会沦落到动物的境地，或者更可能就此灭绝。
en: Were the scientific attitude and the valuation of it to become extinct even for one generation in a primitive community, such a community would either lapse into an animal status or, more likely, become extinct.

zh: 我们感兴趣的是大众化生产的都市文化，包括电影、广告、科幻小说和流行音乐。
en: The area of contact was mass produced urban culture: movies, advertising, science fiction, pop music.

zh: 我们感觉到大多数知识分子非但未曾对商业文化标准产生抵触情绪，反而能够坦然接受现实、讨论细节，并成为商业文化的狂热消费者。
en: We felt none of the dislike of commercial culture standard among most intellectuals, but accepted it as a fact, discussed it in detail, and consumed it enthusiastically.

zh: 这场运动的一个成果即是将波普文化与“逃避现实”、“纯粹娱乐”以及“消遣放松”剥离开来，进而赋予其艺术的严肃性。
en: One result of our discussions was to take Pop culture out of the realm of ‘escapism’, ‘sheer entertainment’, ‘relaxation’, and to treat it with the seriousness of art.

zh: 如果我们认为意识形态是一个非系统性的指意的集合，那么批评家的工作就是通过将这些指意整合为符号的方式来解读文本。
en: If ideology is thought of as a non-systematic ensemble of significations, the work proposes a reading of these significations, by combining them as signs.

zh: 文化批评教会了我们分析符号的方法。

en: Criticism teaches us to read these signs".

zh: 在这个意义上，马施立的批评实践试图说明：文学文本是如何通过赋予意识形态以具体形式的方式，在自相矛盾之中对意识形态加以呈现的。
en: In this way, Machereyan critical practice seeks to explain the way in which, by giving ideology form, the literary text displays ideology in contradiction with itself.

zh: 至于我们所要探讨的“大众文化”，则需灵活运用文化的第二个和第三个定义。
en: To speak of popular culture usually means to mobilize the second and third meanings of the word ‘culture’.

zh: 定义之二--文化作为一种特别的生活方式——要求我们去研究人类的某些具体活动，诸如海滨度假、圣诞庆典、青年亚文化等。
en: The second meaning – culture as a particular way of life – would allow us to speak of such practices as the seaside holiday, the celebration of Christmas, and youth subcultures, as examples of culture.

zh: 我们通常称此类活动为“活的” (lived)文化或实践。
en: These are usually referred to as lived cultures or practices.

zh: 而定义之三——文化作为指意实践——则将肥皂剧、流行音乐、连环漫画等纳入了文化研究的范畴，我们称其为“文本”(text)。
en: The third meaning – culture as signifying practices – would allow us to speak of soap opera, pop music, and comics, as examples of culture.These are usually referred to as texts.

zh: 甚少人会在思考大众文化相关问题时想到威廉斯为文化所下的第一个定义。
en: Few people would imagine Williams’s first definition when thinking about popular culture.

zh: 它是他们生存本身的前提条件。
en: It is a prerequisite of their very existence.

zh: 但是价值的这层含义也扩散开去，并恒久地与手工能力和理论知识相联系。
en: This sense of value, however, also pervades and becomes permanently attached to both manual ability and theoretical knowledge.

zh: 体现在所有原始技术、原始经济组织和社会组织中的科学态度，即考虑未来活动时依靠过去的经验，是一个整体的要素。我们必须假定它从人类产生之初，从这个物种刚刚开始其作为器物制作人（homo faber)、智人（homo sapiens)、政治人（homo politcus)的生涯时，就在起作用。
en: The scientific attitude, embodied in all primitive technology and also in the organization of primitive economic enterprises and social organization, that reliance on past experience with the view to future performance, is an integral factor which must be assumed as having been at work from the very beginning of mankind, ever since the species started on its career as homo faber, as homo sapiens, and as homo politicus.

zh: 原始共同体中，只要有一代人丧失对这种科学态度及对其价值的珍视，该群体就会沦落到动物的境地，或者更可能就此灭绝。
en: Were the scientific attitude and the valuation of it to become extinct even for one generation in a primitive community, such a community would either lapse into an animal status or, more likely, become extinct.

zh: 在科贝特论著中表现出的另一而是,19世纪社会批评的一大特色是把中世纪理想化，他在这件事上应负重要责任。
en: The other aspect of Cobbett's work is his surprising share of responsibility for that idealization of the Middle Ages which is so characteristic of nineteenth-century social criticism.

zh: 作为一个文学运动,中世纪主义自18世纪中叶以来即不断发展。
en: As a literary movement, mediaevalism had been growing since the middle of the eighteenth century.

zh: 对科贝特来说，中世纪主义最重要的一个方面是以修道院作为社会机构的标准:另行建立一个公社式的社会以取代个人主义。
en: Its most important aspect, for Cobbett, was its use of the monasteries as a standard for social institutions: the image of the working of a communal society as a welcome alternative to the claims of individualism.

zh: 在对那种与我们邻人不同的行为（不论这种不同是多么细微）予以担忧的方面，中型城镇则是我们都市的典型例子。
en: Middletown is a typical example of our usual urban fear of seeming in however slight an act different from our neighbours.

zh: 在反常与阿谀之间，人们更害怕前者。
en: Eccentricity is more feared than parasitism.

zh: 为了使家人一个都不背上任何分裂的污名，人们为此在时间和平静方面都做出了极大牺牲。
en: Every sacrifice of time and tranquillity is made in order that no one in the family may have any taint of nonconfomity attached to him.

zh: 什么是“种族遗传特性”？
en: For what is ‘racial inheritance'?

zh: 从父亲到儿子，我们大概就可知道什么是遗传了。
en: We know roughly what heredity is from father to son.

zh: 在家族血统中，遗传的重要性无比巨大，但它仅是家族血统的事。
en: Within a family line the importance of heredity is tremendous.But heredity is an affair of family lines.

zh: 超越此界，它便是神话。
en: Beyond that it is mythology.

zh: 首先，有人认为，葛兰西的理论只不过代表了主导意识形态命题的另一个变种。
en: There is, first, the claim that Gramsci's theory represents merely another variant of the dominant ideology thesis.

zh: 在霸权概念的出现及其历史变化方面，葛兰西所提的矛盾斗争极为重要。
en: Gramsci stresses the importance of conflict for the emergence of hegemony and historical changes.

zh: 还有，人们一般都会证明这一事实：统治集团实际能够获得确保其统治某种霸权形式。
en: None the  less, it is usual for dominant groups to assert hegemony to secure their rule.

zh: 霸权可能是阶级矛盾的结果，但它也是一种以牺牲各种从属集团一方为代价、一直有利于斗争的统治集团一方的结果。
en: Hegemony is a consequence of class conflict, but it continually favours one side of the struggle rather than the other: the dominant group at the expense of the subordinate groups.

zh: 在我们自己的主导特质尚是一个活着的问题的时候，对它进行评价就为时过早。
en: Appraisal of our own dominant traits has so far waited till the trait in question was no longer a living issue.

zh: 宗教也不会得到客观的讨论，除非它已不再是深深影响我们文明的文化特质。
en: Religion was not objectively discussed till it was no longer the cultural trait to which our civilization was most deeply committed.

zh: 今天，我们对宗教的比较研究，才能自由地探索该问题的各个方面。
en: Now for the first time the comparative study of religions is free to pursue any point at issue.It is not yet possible to discuss capitalism in the same way.

zh: 同理，讨论资本主义在今天仍不可能；在战时，战争和国际关系问题也同样成为禁忌。
en: And during wartime,welfare and the problems of international relations are similarly tabu.

zh: 该学派对资本主义的分析，似乎设想了一个找到了永恒稳定之秘诀的社会。
en: The School"s analysis of capitalism appears to be of a society which has discovered the secret of eternal stability.

zh: 资本主义在文化工业中找到了各种手段，它们可以有效地遏制各种激进的与替代的社会力量对它构成的威胁。
en: The culture industry provides capitalism with the means by which it can effectively contain any threats posed to it by radical and alternative social forces.

zh: 资本主义的确越来越有能力压制所有此类的社会力量。
en: Indeed, it is increasingly capable of suppressing such social forces altogether.

zh: 这种稳定和一致的程度，很难与社会学和资本主义社会的历史相吻合。
en: This degree of stability and consensus is hardly consistent with the sociology and history of capitalist societies.

zh: 他论证说，正是较广泛的社会力量和阶级利益，才支配着各种写作风格的形成和变化。
en: He argues that it is wider social forces and class interests which govern the formation and transformation of writing styles.

zh: 19世纪各种新的阶级利益和冲突的出现，结果便是古典风格的崩溃。
en: The emergence of new class interests and conflicts in the nineteenth century results in the breakdown of the classical style.

zh: 这种风格尽管很做作，巴特还是把它解释为资产阶级霸权崛起的一个方面，因而是一种“阶级特色”。
en: Barthes interprets this style, despite its pretensions, as an aspect of the rise of bourgeois hegemony, and thus as a "class idiom".

zh: 根据巴特的观点，资产阶级意识形态的特征是要否认资产阶级的存在。
en: According to Barthes, bourgeois ideology characteristically denies the existence of a bourgeois class.

zh: 他写道：“作为一种意识形态事实，它完全消失了：资产阶级已把它的名字顺便从现实到表现、从经济上的人到心理上的人抹掉了”。
en: He writes: "as an ideological fact, it completely disappears: the bourgeoisie has obliterated its name in passing from reality to representation, from economic man to mental man".

zh: 这是一个没有名字的阶级，因为神话起到了意识形态的作用以确保它不被命名。
en: This is a class with no name because myth functions as ideology to ensure that it is not named.

zh: 例如，下雨是由其它气象现象为先导的，并伴随着降水现象；化石不过是古生物学诸事件之链条中的一个环节。
en: Thus, rain falls because other meteorologic phenomena precede and accompany rainfall; a fossil is merely a link in a chain of paleontologic events.

zh: 在这种哲学类型中，解释是由对相关事件的详尽说明而构成的，科学解释因而成为简要的描述。
en: Explanation in this type of philosophy consists of a recitation of relevant events; scientific explanation is thus condensed description.

zh: 这是自然主义的哲学。
en: This is the philosophy of naturalism.

zh: 最终，弗洛伊德通过三个术语对人类的精神世界作出了划分：自我、超我和本我。三者间的相互关系。
en: Freud’s final model of the psyche introduces three new terms: the ego, the super-ego, and the id.

zh: 本我是人类存在中的最原始的部分，是“我们只遵循自然法则的非人格化的天性”，是“我们人性之中最黑暗、最艰于触摸的部分……无比混乱，仿佛是充满沸腾的刺激的巨大汽锅……尽管始终激发着蠢蠢欲动的本能之力，却不服从任何既定规则和集体意愿……它的一切目的就是遵循快乐原则，想尽办法满足本能的需求”。
en: The id is the most primitive part of our being.It is the part of ‘our nature [which] is impersonal, and, so to speak, subject to natural law’; it‘is the dark, inaccessible part of our personality...a chaos, a cauldron full of seething excitations....It is filled with energy reaching it from the instincts, but it has no organization, produces no collective will, but only a striving to bring about the satisfaction of the instinctual needs subject to the observance of the pleasure principle’.

zh: 自由泰国运动此时看似死寂，但是它可能因为泰国的外交政策发生变化，或者甚至是巴特寮在老挝取得胜利而死灰复燃。
en: The Free Thai movement seems dead at the moment, but it could revive with a change in Thailand's foreign policy or even with Pathet success in Laos.

zh: 伊拉克的库尔德人表面上已经几次平息下去，但是持续显示着不平静的迹象。诸如此类的现象不胜枚举。
en: Iraq's Kurds, several times ostensibly mollified, continue to show signs of restlessness.
And so on.

zh: 两个因素决定了国家的必要性。
en: Two factors make the State necessary.

zh: 首先，昔日稳居权力中心的贵族集团已经衰落；其次，民主制度正在冉冉升起。
en: First, the decline of the aristocracy as a centre of authority; second, the rise of democracy.

zh: 两者的结合为无政府状态提供了肥沃的土壤。
en: Together they create a terrain favourable to anarchy.

zh: 要想解决这个问题，必须以文化和强权为武器来“抢占地盘”。
en: The solution is to occupy this terrain with a mixture of culture and coercion.

zh: 流行音乐的第二个特征是：它使得听音乐变成了一个消极被动的过程。
en: Adorno’s second claim is that popular music promotes passive listening.

zh: 前文曾经提到过，资本主义制度下的劳动是极为枯燥的，因此每个人都在想方设法逃避现实。但是，由于这种劳动使人非常疲惫，所以没有人真正有本事“逃出去”。
en: As already noted, work under capitalism is dull and therefore promotes the search for escape, but, because it is also dulling, it leaves little energy for real escape--the demands of ‘authentic’ culture.

zh: 霸权的“均势妥协”还可被用来分析大众文化内部及大众文化所折射出的其他类型的冲突。
en: The compromise equilibrium of hegemony can also be employed to analyse different types of conflict within and across popular culture.

zh: 本内特强调的是阶级冲突，除此之外，族裔、“种族”、性别、代际、性征、身体缺陷等范畴内的冲突也同样适用，因为所有这些冲突都在不同的情况下参与到了旨在对抗主流或宰制性力量之收编的文化斗争之中。
en: Bennett highlights class conflict, but hegemony theory can also be used to explore and explain conflicts involving ethnicity, ‘race’, gender, generation, sexuality, disability, etc.– all are at different moments engaged in forms of cultural struggle against the homogenizing forces of incorporation of the official or dominant culture.

zh: 在对霸权理论的应用中，尤其是在后马克思主义的文化研究范式中（参见第四章），最关键的概念是“接合”①(arThe Interpretation of Culturesulation;此处本词同时表达了两层意思，一是“表达自己的观点”，二是“与对方建立临时的关联”）。
en: The key concept in this use of hegemony theory, especially in post-Marxist cultural studies (see Chapter 4), is the concept of ‘arThe Interpretation of Culturesulation’ (the word being employed in its double sense to mean both to express and to make a temporary connection).

zh: 大众文化的文本与实践就在葛兰西所谓的“均势妥协”中流动。
en: The texts and practices of popular culture move within what Gramsci calls a ‘compromise equilibrium’.

zh: 这一过程既是历时性的（在某一时期被贴上“大众文化”标签的文化，在另一时期也许就成了其他文化），又是共时性的（无论在哪个特定的历史时期，大众文化都在“抵抗”与“收编”之间游弋）。
en: The process is historical (labelled popular culture one moment, and another kind of culture the next), but it is also synchronic (moving between resistance and incorporation at any given historical moment).

zh: 例如，海滨休假一度是贵族的特权，不到一百年却成了大众文化的范例。
en: For instance, the seaside holiday began as an aristocratic event and within a hundred years it had become an example of popular culture.

zh: 黑色电影起初只是一种广遭贬斥的大众电影类型，但不到三十年就摇身一变，顶上了艺术电影的光环。
en: Film started as despised popular cinema and within thirty years had become art cinema.

zh: 大体上，霸权理论认为大众文化毋宁说是统治阶级与被统治阶级、统治者文化与被统治者文化进行意识形态斗争的力场。
en: In general terms, those looking at popular culture from the perspective of hegemony theory tend to see it as a terrain of ideological struggle between dominant and subordinate classes, dominant and subordinate cultures.

zh: 而且，流行音乐还反映了青少年在处理情感问题与性纠结时所遭遇的困境，让他们体会到了热情拥抱生活的需要。
en: Moreover, pop songs reflect adolescent difficulties in dealing with a tangle of emotional and sexual problems.They invoke the need to experience life directly and intensely.

zh: 在充满不确定性和可变性的情感世界里，流行歌曲仿若一种安全的驱动力。
en: They express the drive for security in an uncertain and changeable emotional world.

zh: 尽管商业市场的背景决定了流行音乐缺乏某种本真性，但它却以戏剧化的方式表达了真实可触的感受，几乎就是青少年情感世界的写照。
en: The fact that they are produced for a commercial market means that the songs and settings lack a certain authenticity.Yet they dramatize authentic feelings.They express vividly the adolescent emotional dilemma.

zh: 弗雷泽是人类学一个时代的代表。这个时代随着他的去世而结束。
en: Frazer is the representative of an epoch in anthropology which ends with his death.

zh: 纵观他所有直接的理论贡献，可以说他是一名对“原始人”（primitive）感兴趣的进化论者，不论这是指广义的人类，还是指当代“野蛮人”的特殊信仰、习俗和实践。
en: In all his directly theoreThe Interpretation of Culturesal contributions he is an evolutionist, interested in the "primitive," whether this refers to mankind at large, or to specific beliefs, customs and pracThe Interpretation of Cultureses of contemporary "savages."

zh: 他用比较方法进行研究，收集和检验从世界各地、处在所有发展水平上和所有文化中的证据。
en: He works by the comparative method, collecting and examining evidence from all parts of the world, at all levels of development, and in all cultures.

zh: 比较方法与进化方式的结合就意味着特定的普遍假设：人在本质上相似；他们从原始水平经过各个进化阶段而逐步发展。
en: The comparative method combined with the evolutionary approach implies certain general assumptions.Men are substantially similar.They develop gradually from a primitive level and pass through various stages of evolution.

zh: 在文章中，阿多诺指出流行音乐具有三个主要特征。
en: In the essay he makes three specific claims about popular music.

zh: 第一，流行音乐是“标准化”的音乐。
en: First, he claims that it is "standardised".

zh: “标准化”使得“那些即使是最独特的东西也变得乏善可陈”。
en: "Standardisation" as Adorno points out, "extends from the most general features to the most specific ones".

zh: 一旦某种音乐或歌词风格受到欢迎,那么这种风格就会遭到商业的滥用，造成的结果就是“标准的结晶化”。
en: Once a musical and/or lyrical pattern has proved successful it is exploited to commercial exhaustion, culminating in "the crystallisation of standards".

zh: 当然，在此还有必要引入时间要素，即变迁要素。
en: It will also be necessary, of course, to introduce the element of time, that is, of change.

zh: 我们在此试图证明，所有文化进化或传播过程都首先以制度变迁的形式发生。
en: Here we shall attempt to show that all evolutionary or diffusion processes happen, first and foremost, in the form of institutional change.

zh: 无论是以发明的形式还是以传播的行动，新的技术装置总要被结合到业已确立的组织化行为系统之中，并逐渐对原有制度产生全部的重塑。
en: Whether in the form of invention, or as an act of diffusion, a new technical device becomes incorporated into an already established system of organized behavior, and produces gradually a complete remolding of that institution.

zh: 另外，根据功能分析，我们可以证明，除非有新的需求被创造出来，任何发明、任何革命、任何社会或知识的变迁都不会发生。因而技术、知识或信仰方面的新装置都要适合于文化过程或某种制度。
en: Again, in terms of our functional analysis, we will show that no invention, no revolution, no social or intellectual change, ever occurs except when new needs are created; and thus new devices in technique, in knowledge, or in belief are fitted into the cultural process or an institution.

zh: 然而，即使在有记载的历史领域里，那些能让我们构拟一段真正科学的历史的资料都很薄弱。它们通常至多允许一种知识性、描述性的片面构拟，就像我们在泰恩、兰普雷克特和马克斯•韦伯的著作中所读到的那样。
en: Even within the realm of recorded history, however, data which would allow us to reconstruct a really scientific history are very scanty, and usually allow, at best, such intelligent and illuminating partial reconstructions as we find in the writings of Taine, Lamprecht, or Max Weber.

zh: 而且，就如我们批评比较或播化论方法时指出的：结果的价值取决于我们对所研究的制度的枓学定义。
en: Once more, as in our criticism of the comparative or diffusionist methods, the value of the results depends on the really scientific definition of the institution which we follow in our inquiry.

zh: 在人类学用语中，“历史”或“历史的”这两词，就我所能看到的而言，还从未能够被令人满意地定义过。
en: In anthropological parlance, the terms "history" and "historical" have, so far as I can see, never been satisfactorily defined.

zh: 播化作为一种文化过程，和进化一样，是真实存在和无可攻击的。
en: Diffusion as a cultural process is as real and unassailable as evolution.

zh: 这两种过程之间看来也实在难觅其异。
en: It seems certain that no distinction can be made between the two processes.

zh: 况且，尽管两个学派的支持者有些不肯妥协和敌视态度，但他们都从不同角度研究了文化成长问題，并为说明这个问题独立地做出了各自的贡献。
en: The votaries of either school, however, in spite of their somewhat intransigent and hostile attitude to each other, have approached the problem of culture growth from different angles and have contributed to its illumination independently.

zh: 播化学派的真正功绩在于，他们更加注重具体实在的事物，历史感更强，尤其是他们对环境和地理影响的认识。
en: The real merit of the diffusionist school consists in their greater concreteness, fuller historical sense, and, above all, in their realization of environmental and geographical influences.

zh: 运动战是指以迅速、决定性地取胜为目的，对敌人进行快速的、正面的和直接的攻击。
en: War of movement refers to a swift, frontal and direct attack on the enemy with the aim of winning quickly and decisively.

zh: 这类似于政治上的起义行动。
en: This is comparable to insurrectionary political action.

zh: 它可以描述1917年的布尔什维克革命，这场革命涉及到一场运动战，针对的是由不受市民社会保护的、集中化的国家统治政权所提供的目标。
en: It describes the bolshevik revolution of 1917 in Russia, which involved a war of movement against the political target provided by a centralised and dominant state power left unprotected by civil society.

zh: 市民社会中的霸权是软弱的，而国家则是强大的和极其明显的,所以反对这个国家的一场革命运动战便可以进行下去。
en: Hegemony in civil society was weak while the state was strong and highly visible, so a revolutionary war of movement against the state could be mounted and concluded successfully.

zh: 假若超级真实主义真有道理，那也绝不像许多鲍德里亚主义者妄图表明的那样，意味着人们已经失去分辨虚构世界与真实世界的能力——事实是，在很大程度上，虚构与真实之间的界限已经变得越来越无足轻重了。
en: If hyperrealism means anything, it cannot with any credibility signal a decline in people’s ability to distinguish between fiction and reality.It is not, as some Baudrillardians seem to want to suggest, that people can no longer tell the difference between fiction and reality: it is that in some significant ways the distinction between the two has become less and less important.

zh: 为何会出现此种状况？这本身就是个耐人寻味的问题。
en: Why this has happened is itself an important question.

zh: 不过我认为，单凭“超级真实主义”这个概念，我们很难找到答案。
en: But I do not think that hyperrealism really supplies us with the answer.

zh: 这种观点对他们是陌生的。
en: The idea is foreign to them.

zh: 更确切地说他们认为，超自然物喜人之所喜，人喜欢跳舞，它亦喜欢跳舞。
en: They reckon, rather, that the supernaturals like what men like, and if men like dancing so will the supernaturals.

zh: 因此，在祖尼，人们用戴面具的方式把超自然物引入舞蹈，然后取出药束，使它们 “起舞”。
en: Therefore they bring the supernaturals back to dance in Zuni by donning their masks, they take out the medicine bundles and 'dance' them.

zh: 这会给它们以愉悦。
en: It gives thempleasure.

zh: 甚至还必须使仓里的玉米跳舞。
en: Even the corn in the storeroom must be danced.

zh: 大名在每个藩中居于等级制的最高地位，对其属下可以行使特权。
en: The daimyo stood at the apex of the hierarchy in each fief and he was allowed to exercise his prerogatives over his dependents.

zh: 将军在行政上最主要的任务就是控制大名。
en: The Shogun's great administrative problem was to control the daimyo.

zh: 他采取一切手段防止大名之间结盟或推行侵犯计划。
en: In every way he prevented them from forming alliances or from carrying out schemes of aggression.

zh: 文化的第三个含义与结构主义者以及后结构主义者所声称的“指意实践”（signifying practices)大体相同（参见第六章）。
en: Culture in this third definition is synonymous with what structuralists and post-structuralists call ‘signifying practices’ (see Chapter 6).

zh: 如果用第三种定义来看待文化，那么诗歌、小说、芭蕾、歌剧和美术都将被纳人考察的范畴。
en: Using this definition, we would probably think of examples such as poetry, the novel, ballet, opera, and fine art.

zh: 至于我们所要探讨的“大众文化”，则需灵活运用文化的第二个和第三个定义。
en: To speak of popular culture usually means to mobilize the second and third meanings of the word ‘culture’.

zh: 定义之二——文化作为 一种特别的生活方式——要求我们去研究人类的某些具体活动，诸如海滨度假、圣诞庆典、青年亚文化等。
en: The second meaning – culture as a particular way of life – would allow us to speak of such practices as the seaside holiday, the celebration of Christmas, and youth subcultures, as examples of culture.

zh: 我们通常称此类活动为“活的” (lived)文化或实践。
en: These are usually referred to as lived cultures or practices.

zh: 过去，工人就生活在自己创造的文化中；而现在，工人已完全置身于文化之外。
en: Whereas in the past a worker lived in his or her work, he or she now works in order to live outside his or her work.

zh: 工业化造成的后果之一就是工人们已经“被自己的作品搞得疲弱无力”。
en: But as a result of industrialization, the experience of work has deteriorated to such an extent that workers are actually ‘incapacitated by their work’.

zh: 休闲娱乐带给工人们的并不是“再创造”（再创造劳动中失去的东西），而是“创造无力”（劳动过程中失去的东西的混合体）。
en: Therefore, instead of recreation (re-creating what is lost in work), leisure provides workers with only ‘decreation’ (a compounding of the loss experienced through work).

zh: 情况如此，难怪人们会向群氓文化寻求情感补偿和被动娱乐。毒品开始大行其道，每个人都成了沉溺于“生活替代品”中的瘾君子。
en: Given such a situation, it is little wonder that people turn to mass culture for compensation and passive distraction; the drug habit develops and they become junkies addicted to ‘substitute living’.

zh: 田园牧歌的世界不复存在，取而代之的是乏味平庸的“近郊主义”。
en: A world of rural rhythms has been lost to the monotony and mediocrity of ‘suburbanism.’

zh: 群体形成的分群（grouping)的另一条通则是接近（propinguity)和接触（contiguity)。
en: Another general principle of grouping is that of propinquity and contiguity.

zh: 社会生活的本质是合作。
en: The essence of social life is cooperation.

zh: 当人们相互近在咫尺时,只能交换服务、一同工作以及在任务和才干上彼此依赖互补。
en: People can only exchange services, work together, and rely on supplementing each other as regards task and ability, when they are within reach.

zh: 在日本，等级制一直是日本有文字历史以来生活中的准则，甚至可以追溯到公元七世纪。那时，日本已经从无等级的中国吸取生活方式，使之适应其自身的等级制文化。
en: In Japan caste has been the rule of life through all her recorded history and even back in the seventh century A.D. she was already adapting the ways of life she borrowed from casteless China to suit her own hierarchal culture.

zh: 在七到八世纪时，日本的天皇及其宫廷已经着手进行要用中国那种使日本使节赞叹不已的高度文明习俗来充实日本的事业。
en: In that era of the seventh and eighth centuries, the Japanese Emperor and his court set themselves the task of enriching Japan with the customs of the high civilization that had greeted the amazed eyes of their envoys in the great kingdom of China.

zh: 斯戴西的观点对大多数电影精神分析的普适主义论调提出了指责。
en: Stacey’s work represents something of a rebuke to the universalistic claims of much cine-psychoanalysis.

zh: 经由细致的受众研究，“女性的观影行为理应被视作与好莱坞电影宰制性意义进行的协商，而非仅仅被动受制于后者的过程”。
en: By studying the audience, ‘female spectatorship might be seen as a process of negotiating the dominant meanings of Hollywood cinema, rather than one of being passively positioned by it’.

zh: 由此视角出发，一度牢不可破、天衣无缝的好莱坞父权力量开始动摇，其意识形态上的成功亦绝非天经地义。
en: From this perspective, Hollywood’s patriarchal power begins to look less monolithic, less seamless, its ideological success never guaranteed.

zh: 要成为大众的，一个大众的文本必须能够在各式各样的社会语境中，对于各式各样的读者具有相关点。因此，它本身必须 具有多元的意义，任何一种解读方式必须是有条件的，因为它必须被它解读的社会条件所决定。
en: A popular text, to be popular, must have points of relevance to a variety of readers in a variety of social contexts, and so must be polysemic in itself, and any one reading of it must be conditional, for it must be determined by the social conditions of its reading.

zh: 相关性要求意义的多元性与相对性，拒绝封闭性、绝对性和普遍性。
en: Relevance requires polysemy and relativity—it denies closure, absolutes, and universals.

zh: 因此，列维-斯特劳斯根据这样的假设建立了一个二元对立的和可能的置换格栅：图腾崇拜现象是各种社会中较为基本的和普遍的倾向在经验上的一种显现，即根据事物的性质（如动物或植物）来划分社会文化事物（如群体或部落）。图腾崇拜提供了一种包含个体和集体的社会（文化）事物的非社会（自然）体现。自然事物包括物类和特殊者。文化事物包括群体和个体。
en: Lévi- Strauss constructs a grid of binary oppositions and possible permutations based on two assumptions: that totemism provides a nonsocial (natural) representation of the social (cultural) which is both individual and collective; and that the natural consists of categories and particulars, and the cultural of groups and persons.

zh: 所谓法兰克福学派，指的是一个以法兰克福大学社会研究所为大本营的德国知识分子群体。
en: The Frankfurt School is the name given to a group of German intellectuals associated with the Institute for Social Research at the University of Frankfurt.

zh: 该研究所成立于1923年，并于希特勒上台后的1933年迁至美国纽约，隶属于哥伦比亚大学。
en: The Institute was established in 1923.Following the coming to power of Hitler in 1933, it moved to New York, attaching itself to the University of Columbia.

zh: 1949年，研究所再度迁回德国。
en: In 1949 it moved back to Germany.

zh: 法兰克福学派的主要研究风格混合了马克思主义和精神分析学说，常常被人们称为“批判理论”。
en: ‘Critical Theory’ is the name given to the Institute’s critical mix of Marxism and psychoanalysis.

zh: 于是，杰斐逊飞机乐队反资本主义政治理念的传播反而为其所属的资本主义唱片公司带来了滚滚财源。这也是一个体现了接合过程的例子。社会中的统治阶级通过与反抗者的声音“协商”的方式将其引至某个安全地带，从而确保自身的领导权得以维系。反传统文化并非一无是处（毫无疑问，这种音乐产生了特定的文化效应和政治效应），但它终究还是成了支持战争且唯利是图的资本主义音乐工业的同谋。
en: "The proliferation of Jefferson Airplane’s anti-capitalist politics increased the profits of their capitalist record company. Again, this is an example of the process of articulation: the way in which dominant groups in society attempt to ‘negotiate’ oppositional voices on to a terrain which secures for the dominant groups a continued position of leadership. The music of the counterculture was not denied expression (and there can be little doubt that this music produced particular cultural and political effects), but what is also true is that this music was articulated in the economic interests of the war-supporting capitalist music industry."

zh: 在日本，分娩与性交一样隐秘。产妇在阵痛时不能大声呻吟以避免让人知道。
en: Childbirth is as private in Japan as sexual intercourse and women may not cry out in labor because this would publicize it.

zh: 母亲要提前给婴儿准备新被褥和小床，因为，新生婴儿不睡新床不吉利。
en: A little pallet bed has been prepared for the baby with its own new mattress and bedcover.

zh: 贫苦家庭买不起新床，也要把被料和棉花洗净，作成“新”被。
en: It would be a bad omen for the child not to have its own now bed, even if the family can do no more than have the quilt covers and the stuffing cleaned and renovated to make them 'new.'

zh: 小被褥也不象大人的那样板硬，而且很轻。
en: The little bed quilt is not as stiff as grown-ups' covers and it is lighter.

zh: 要表明食品生产及其分配是组织化的行为体系，并证明它们构成部落或国家营养补给的一部分就更容易。
en: It is less difficult to show that production of food and its distribution are organized behavior systems, and that they form part of the tribal or national commissariat.

zh: 说到对大型企业的控制、征税，有时甚至是组织，部落或国家也时常插手其事。
en: Very often the tribe or the state enters into this, insofar as large-scale enterprise is controlled, taxed, and occasionally even organized.

zh: 一方面，在某些文化状态下，食品生产、分配、制作和消费是在同一制度——即家户内实现。
en: There are, on the one hand, cultural conditions in which production, distribution, preparation, and consumption of food are carried out within the same institution, that is, the household.

zh: 在以后的五年中，又从法律上废除了等级间的不平等及作为等级、地位的服饰、徽章等外观标志，甚至下令“散发”（指“散发脱刀今”，1871年公布。准许自由剪发，废除佩刀，以破除旧习，提倡“文明开化”。）。贱民被解放了。
en: Within the next five years all legal inequality among the classes was summarily abolished, insignia and distinctive dress of caste and class were outlawed—even queues had to be cut,—the outcasts were emancipated, the laws against alienation of land withdrawn, the barriers that had separated fief from fief were removed and Buddhism was disestablished.

zh: 废除了禁止土地转让的法令。
撤除了各藩之间的关卡。
取消了佛教的国教地位。
弗洛伊德称：“我要郑重提醒大家，绝不可过分强调意象分析在释梦过程中的重要性，不能将对梦境的阐释简化为对象征符号的分析。要想充分解读梦的含义，就必须深人考察做梦者与梦境之间发生缔合的机制。
en: As he warns: "I should like to utter an express warning against overestimating the importance of symbols in dream-interpre-tation, against restricting the work of translating dreams merely to translating symbols and against abandoning the technique of making use of the dreamer's associations".

zh: ”尤其是，同一个象征符号“往往具有多重含义……要想作出正确的解读，就必须结合情境，做到具体问题具体分析”；而所谓“情境”，则是由做梦者自己构建的。
en: Moreover, symbols "frequently have more than one or even several meanings, and . . . the correct interpretation can only be arrived at on each occasion from the context".Again, context will be something established by the dreamer.

zh: 诸多困难源自他者的缺失。不管使用何种释义，他者这一概念一直困扰着我们。
en: A great deal of the difficulty arises from the absent other which always haunts any definition we might use.

zh: 大众文化是一个说不完、道不尽的话题，而我们总是在对比之中来理解大众文化。
en: It is never enough to speak of popular culture; we have always to acknowledge that with which it is being contrasted.

zh: 无论与大众文化相对的“他者”是什么——是群氓文化、高雅文化，还是工人阶级文化、民间文化，等等——概念本身都会因之而发生理论或政治意义上的变化。
en: And whichever of popular culture’s others we employ, mass culture, high culture, working-class culture, folk culture, etc., it will carry into the definition of popular culture a specific theoretical and political inflection.

zh: 正如本内特所指出的：“对此问题，绝无‘万无一失’的解决方法;却有一系列互不相同的解决途径，每一种途径都会带来不同的释义、产生不同的影响。"（Bennett, 1982a: 86)本书的主要意图在于：在文化理论与大众文化之错综复杂的关系中，为各种各样的问题及其纷繁的解决路径绘制一个学科地图。
en: ‘There is’, as Bennett (1982a) indicates, ‘no single or “correct” way of resolving these problems; only a series of different solutions which have different implications and effects’ (86).The main purpose of this book is to chart the many problems encountered, and the many solutions suggested, in cultural theory’s complex engagement with popular culture.

zh: 例如，人们可能坚信文化应当是“复杂的”；也就是说，“真正的”文化必须是很难被人理解的。
en: For example, we might want to insist on formal complexity.In other words, to be real culture, it has to be difficult.

zh: 只有这样，所谓的“髙雅文化”才具有排他性。
en: Being difficult thus ensures its exclusive status as high culture.

zh: 文化的这种排他性是真实存在的，它同时决定了髙雅文化的受众也具有相应的排他性。
en: Its very difficulty literally excludes, an exclusion that guarantees the exclusivity of its audience.

zh: 最后有人找到了摆脱这个绝境的捷径。
en: Finally some one broke a way out of the impasse.

zh: 他用简单明了的语言宣布：全部“戈尔索克”问题从始至终都不过是些“传闻、传闻、传闻”而已，几个世纪以来，智者们一直追踪着这些传闻的踪迹，而结果是“并不比过去更接近于找到答案。”
en: He declared in plain language that the whole Golshok business, from start to finish, was nothing but "words, words, words," that the wise men had been chasing their tails for centuries, with "the solution no nearer now than then."

zh: 那些被称为“阁下”的新领导人为了向国民推行他们的卓越政纲，甚至加强了中央集权的统治。
en: ‘Their Excellencies,' the new leaders of Japan, even strengthened centralized rule in order to 'impose their own workmanlike programs upon the people.

zh: 他们交替使用施加压力和给予恩惠的办法，思威并施，以求贯彻目的。
en: They alternated demands from above with gifts from above and in this way they managed to survive.

zh: 但是，在公共舆论不赞成改用太阳历、设立公共学校及废除对贱民的不平等待遇等等时，他们丝毫也没想要去迎合。
en: But they did not imagine that they had to cater to a public opinion which might not want to reform the calendar or to establish public schools or to outlaw discrimination against the outcasts.

zh: 阿诺德未曾给大众文化下一个明确的定义。
en: Popular culture is never actually defined.

zh: 然而，在通读阿诺德的著作之后我们不难发现：所谓的“无政府状态”在一定程度上成了大众文化的代名词，阿诺德正是用这个词来描述工人阶级的活文化先天具有的某种破坏性的特质的。他尤其坚信，从1867年城市中的男性工人阶级成员正式参与到政治生活之中开始，政治上的危险便已不可避免了。
en: However, it becomes clear when reading through Arnold"s work that the term "anarchy" operates in part as a synonym for popular culture. Specifically, anarchy/popular culture is used to refer to Arnold"s conception of the supposedly disruptive nature of working-class lived culture: the political dangers that he believes to be inevitably concomitant with the entry of the male urban working class into formal politics in 1867.

zh: 诸多困难源自他者的缺失。不管使用何种释义，他者这一概念一直困扰着我们。
en: A great deal of the difficulty arises from the absent other which always haunts any definition we might use.

zh: 大众文化是一个说不完、道不尽的话题，而我们总是在对比之中来理解大众文化。
en: It is never enough to speak of popular culture; we have always to acknowledge that with which it is being contrasted.

zh: 无论与大众文化相对的“他者”是什么——是群氓文化、高雅文化，还是工人阶级文化、民间文化，等等——概念本身都会因之而发生理论或政治意义上的变化。
en: And whichever of popular culture’s others we employ, mass culture, high culture, working-class culture, folk culture, etc., it will carry into the definition of popular culture a specific theoretical and political inflection.

zh: 正如本内特所指出的：“对此问题，绝无‘万无一失’ 的解决方法;却有一系列互不相同的解决途径，每一种途径都会带来不同的释义、产生不同的影响。"（Bennett, 1982a: 86)本书的主要意图在于：在文化理论与大众文化之错综复杂的关系中，为各种各样的问题及其纷繁的解决路径绘制一个学科地图。
en: ‘There is’, as Bennett (1982a) indicates, ‘no single or “correct” way of resolving these problems; only a series of different solutions which have different implications and effects’ (86).The main purpose of this book is to chart the many problems encountered, and the many solutions suggested, in cultural theory’s complex engagement with popular culture.

zh: 反功能论者会抗议说，毕 竟有些文化根本不用羹匙、餐叉或餐刀，因此，功能什么也没有解释。对此我们只需指出，对科学的思想家来说，解释只不过是对个复杂事实的最恰当描述。
en: When an anti-functionalist remonstrates that, after all, there are cultures where neither spoons nor forks nor knives are used, and that, therefore, function explains nothing, we simply have to point out that explanation to the scientific thinker is nothing else but the most adequate description of a complex fact.

zh: 针对功能论的这种批评派生于对于前科学第一因或“真正原因”的渴求，这使它根本不能证明为什么一种特殊形式的鼓或喇叭、餐具或神学概念在一个文化中的流行。
en: The type of criticism levelled against functionalism, to the effect that it never can prove why a specific form of drum or trumpet, of table implement or theological concept, is prevalent in a culture, derives from the prescientific craving for first causes or "true causes."

zh: 在对“起源”和“历史原因”的持续搜求中，即在无文献、无记载的朦胧王国中对既无历史又未留下任何先前进化痕迹的民族的历史过去和进化开端的搜索中，这些弊端更为显而易见。
en: These can be more readily seen in the persistent search for "origins" and "historic causes," in the nebulous realms of the undocumented, unrecorded historic past or evolutionary beginnings of a people who neither have a history nor have left any traces of their previous evolution.

zh: 举一个身边的例子，关于主要的功能解释是否必须考虑“社会密度”（social density)、群体团结及其整合、欣快与沮丧等现象，这在功能学派内部也存在争议。
en: Within the functional school, to take an example nearer home, there is dispute as to whether the principal functional explanation must revolve about the fact of "social density," the solidarity of the group, its integration, and such phenomena as euphoria and disphoria, which are held to be unidentifiable by one branch of functionalists and real by the other.

zh: 某些功能论者认为这都不可识別，其他人则认为这是真实存在。
尽管多数人类学家认为家庭至少是现实中的一个真实单元，它可以识别并遍布于整个人类，是所有文化中的一个普同现象。但仍有为数不少的人类学家否认这个文化形貌（configuration)或制度的确定性。
en: Whereas most anthropologists agree that the family, at least, is a real isolate of cultural reality that can be identified and traced throughout humanity, and is a universal of all culture, there are still not a few anthropologists who dispute the identity of this cultural configuration or institution.

zh: 因此，宪纲的形成和规范的程序化都意味着文化中的象征角色的全部理解。这一点我们很快还会转回来讲。
en: Hence, the formulation of the charter, as well as the codification of norms, implies a full understanding of the role of symbolism in culture, a point to which we will soon have to turn.

zh: 至于功能，我们已将其定义为需求的满足。
en: As regards function, we have defined it as the satisfaction of needs.

zh: 至此，我们只是全面分析了生物或基本的需求，也间接指出了衍生、次生、功用性驱力或文化需求的不可避免性。
en: So far we have only fully analyzed the biological or basic needs, and indicated the inevitability of the derived, secondary or instrumental imperatives or cultural needs.

zh: 然而很显然，这个概念指的不过是科学分析的类型，人类行为的另一种类型，尤其是当我们把它应用于一个完整的制度时。
en: It is clear, however, that this concept refers rather to the type of scientific analysis, the other type to human behavior, especially when we apply it to an institution as a whole.

zh: 这种进程的一个方面是，艺术日益与经济相结合，这既是因为通过扩大艺术在广告中所起的作用而被用来鼓励人们消费，也是因为艺术本身变成了一种商品。
en: Another aspect of this process is that art becomes increasingly integrated into the economy because it is used to encourage people to consume through the expanded role it plays in advertising, and because it becomes a commercial good in its own right.

zh: 另一个方面是，后现代通俗文化拒绝尊重艺术的权利和特色。
en: Also, postmodern popular culture refuses to respect the pretensions and distinctiveness of art.

zh: 因此，艺术与通俗文化之间差别的崩溃,以及二者之间的交叉，己变得越发普遍。
en: Therefore, the breakdown of the distinction between art and popular culture, as well as crossovers between the two, become more prevalent.

zh: 这种事情是“决然”不会发生的，因此李维斯牛仔裤也就“决然”不可能利用果酱乐队的歌来为自己促销。然而，没有“决然”。
en: As this was not going to happen, Levi jeans would never use a song by The Jam to sell its products.

zh: 事实是，与果酱乐队具有同样政治信念的撞击乐队早已开始用自己的歌来为牛仔裤的销售服务。
en: But this had already happened to The Clash, a band with equally sound political credentials.

zh: 原有的循环转变戛然而止了，而文化研究即将用“霸权”的概念来为进一步的讨论提供理论支撑（参见第四章）。
en: This circular exchange stalled to a stop.The cultural studies use of the concept of hegemony would have, at the very least, fuelled further discussion (see Chapter 4).

zh: 微观政治与宏观政治之间的关系是多样而散乱的。
en: The relationships between micropolitics and macropolitics are diverse and dispersed.

zh: 最微观的微观政治是幻想的内在世界（见《解读大众》，第5b章）。
en: The most micro of micropolitics is the interior world of fantasy (see Reading the Popular, Chapter 5b).

zh: 将幻 想保留在内在空间，处于意识形态的殖民势力范围之外，具有想 像自己在不同的环境中有不同行为的能力，等等，这些并不一定导致无论是在微观或宏观层面上的社会行动，但却构成诸如此类行动的基础。
en: The preservation of fantasy as an interior place beyond the reach of ideological colonization, and the ability to imagine oneself acting differently in different circumstances, may not in itself result in social action, whether at the micro or macro level, but it does constitute the ground upon which any such action must occur.

zh: “话语”这个概念在后马克思主义的发展过程中扮演了中心角色。
en: The concept of discourse is central to the development of post-Marxism.

zh: 诚如拉克劳所言：“这一论断的基本假设是，很有可能人们的一切感知、思维和行动都依赖于某一特定的意义领域的结构化形成, 而这一领域先于一切即刻事实存在。”
en: As Laclau explains, "The basic hypothesis of a discursive approach is that the very possibility of perception, thought and action depends on the structuration of a certain meaningful field which preexists any factual immediacy".

zh: 由于1866—1867年英国发生了关于投票权的政治动乱，于是才有了阿诺德的这番言论。
en: The context of all this is the suffrage agitation of 1866–7.

zh: 引文中的“令我们困惑”一句清晰地表明了其话语的阶级属性。
en: Arnold’s employment of the phrase ‘beginning to perplex us’ is a clear indication of the class nature of his discourse.

zh: 阿诺德曾将英国人划分为野蛮人（Barbarians，指代贵族）、非利士指代中产阶级和群氓（Populace，指代工人阶级），表面上看似乎不偏不倚；还似乎就像阿诺德本人声称的那样，“无论哪个阶级的人，都有一种共同的人性基础”（同上）。
en: His division of society into Barbarians (aristocracy), Philistines (middle class) and Populace (working class) would seem at first sight to defuse the class nature of this discourse.This seems to be supported by his claim that under all ‘our class divisions, there is a common basis of human nature’ (ibid.).

zh: 与“戏仿”一样，“混仿”也是对某种独特假面或某种僵化语言的模拟，不过这种模拟是一种中立的实践，并不似“戏仿”一般基于某种隐秘的动机。“混仿”既无讽刺挖苦之意，更无诱人发笑之功；它认为人们偶然说出的反常言语中并不隐含着任何既定的惯例，而某些正常的语言规范依旧存在。
en: Pastiche is, like parody, the imitation of a peculiar mask, speech in a dead language: but it is a neutral practice of such mimicry, without any of parody's ulterior motives, amputated of the satiric impulse, devoid of laughter and of any conviction that alongside the abnormal tongue you have momentarily borrowed, some healthy linguistic normality still exists.

zh: 故而，“混仿”乃是一种空白的戏仿。
en: Pastiche is thus blank parody

zh: 虽然对意识形态的这种看法与《德意志意识形态》所提出的看法之间存在着明显的差别，但默多克和戈尔丁仍然把它并入了他们有关大众媒介的政治经济学的概念之中。
en: Despite differences between this perspective on ideology and that offered in The German Ideology, Murdock and Golding incorporate it into their conception of a political economy of the mass media.

zh: 既然马克思作出的这种陈述是对市民社会的政治经济学的一种概括，那么就可以用它来概括现代媒介。
en: Since Marx offers this statement as an outline of a political economy of civil society, it can be taken to include the modern media.

zh: 因而，默多克和戈尔丁把马克思关于占统治地位的观念与意识形态的基础—上层建筑模式结合起来时，没有遇到任何困难。
en: Murdock and Golding combine Marx's ruling ideas and base—superstructure models of ideology.

zh: 贝洛克认为这种社会从两个方面崩溃:一方面是国家采取福利行动(纯粹的资本主义无法体现的行动）；另一方面是垄断并限制交易。
en: Belloc sees it breaking down in two ways: on the one hand into State action for welfare (which pure capitalism cannot embody); on the other hand into monopoly and the restraint of trade.

zh: 资本主义制度既然崩溃，只有两条路可供选择:社会主义——贝洛克称之为集体主义；以及大规模重新分配财产——贝洛克称之为分产主义。
en: There are only two alternatives to this system: socialism, which Belloc calls collectivism; and the redistribution of property on a significant scale, which Belloc calls distributivism.

zh: 如果把我们的社会困境视为工业革命的产物，那就不能了解这种困境，因为现代社会并不是由于工业的发展而形成的事实上英囯在工业制度以前就有资本主义。
en: Our social difficulties will not be understood if they are regarded as the product of the Industrial Revolution: modern society was not formed by the growth of industry, but by the fact that capitalism was here in England before the Industrial System...

zh: ……在一连串重大发现之前，工业制度的策源地英国，就已经被一种有钱人的寡头政治所控制。
en: England, the seed-plot of the Industrial System, was already captured by a wealthy oligarchy before the series of great discoveries began.

zh: 建筑中的后现代主义拒绝这种元叙事。
en: Postmodernism in architecture rejects this metanarrative.

zh: 它的标志是装饰极其华美的、精心设计的、语境化的和色彩明快的建筑，突出虚构性和嬉笑顽皮，用几乎任意的和折中的方式，混合了从不同历史时期吸取来的各种风格。
en: Its hallmarks are: highly ornate, elaborately designed, contextualised and brightly coloured buildings; a stress on fictionality and playfulness; and the mixing of styles drawn from different historical periods in almost random and eclectic designs.

zh: 后现代主义把建筑变成了对风格和外表的赞颂，用建筑来对已建成的空间幵玩笑。
en: Postmodernism turns buildings into celebrations of style and surface, using architecture to make jokes about built space.

zh: 根据阿尔都塞的看法，经济决定论并不是一个可以从经验上来解决的问题，尽管他提到了社会的物质史和阶级斗争。
