en: According to Althusser, economic determinism is not a problem which can be resolved empirically, despite his references to the material history of societies and to the class struggle.

zh: 真正科学的解决办法必定是理论上的。
en: Real scientific solutions must be theoretical.

zh: 阿尔都塞承认马克思主义理论可以相应地被解释为经济决定论的，但坚持认为经济决定论仅仅在“最终”起作用。
en: Althusser knows that Marxism was and is a theory of economic determinism.However, he insists that, scientifically speaking, economic determinism works only in "the last instance".

zh: 在1880年到1990年间，在人类学方面，社会科学已经开始开掘出通向决定论哲学的道路。泰勒说：“如果某个领域中有其规律，那么，全部领域就都有其规律。”
en: Social science had won its way to the philosophy of determinism in the anthropology of the 1880's and '90's: "If law is anywhere it is everywhere." said Tylor.

zh: 霸权的“均势妥协”还可被用来分析大众文化内部及大众文化所折射出的其他类型的冲突。
en: The compromise equilibrium of hegemony can also be employed to analyse different types of conflict within and across popular culture.

zh: 本内特强调的是阶级冲突，除此之外，族裔、“种族”、性别、代际、性征、身体缺陷等范畴内的冲突也同样适用，因为所有这些冲突都在不同的情况下参与到了旨在对抗主流或宰制性力量之收编的文化斗争之中。
en: Bennett highlights class conflict, but hegemony theory can also be used to explore and explain conflicts involving ethnicity, ‘race’, gender, generation, sexuality, disability, etc.– all are at different moments engaged in forms of cultural struggle against the homogenizing forces of incorporation of the official or dominant culture.

zh: 在对霸权理论的应用中，尤其是在后马克思主义的文化研究范式中（参见第四章），最关键的概念是“接合”①(articulation;此处本词同时表达了两层意思，一是“表达自己的观点”，二是“与对方建立临时的关联”）。
en: The key concept in this use of hegemony theory, especially in post-Marxist cultural studies (see Chapter 4), is the concept of ‘articulation’ (the word being employed in its double sense to mean both to express and to make a temporary connection).

zh: 最近，史密斯教授和佩利先生提出文化源于埃及并向世界传播的学说。这是本应该归入其他被拋弃的假说之列，或者是否属于对文化史的持久贡献，还有待观察。
en: Whether the doctrines recently propounded by Prof. Elliot Smith and Mr. Perry about the universal spread of culture from Egypt will have to be classed with other discarded hypotheses or whether they contain a permanent contribution to the history of culture remains to be seen.

zh: 他们对人类学资料的利用不能令人满意，而且他们的争论实属考古学范畴，而他们在那里已经遇到反对的批判。
en: Their use of anthropological data is unsatisfactory and their argument really belongs to archaeology, in which field their views have met with adverse criticism.

zh: 由是，二人宣称：“酷儿理论并非仅仅"关于"同性恋者，正如女性研究也并非仅仅"关于"女人一样。事实上，酷儿理论所要攻击的乃是……性别之分的"理所当然性"，及其所竭力维护的异性恋霸权。“
en: In this way, they contend, "Queer Theory is no more “about” lesbians and gay men than women's studies is “about” women. Indeed, part of the project of Queer is to attack . . . the very “naturalness” of gender and, by extension, the fictions supporting compulsory heterosexuality".

zh: 利维斯主义的基本立场是：“文化始终是少数人的专利。”纵观历史，我们不难发现，社会因少数人的杰出经验而获益；是他们让传统中的那些细微而易碎的部分保持生机。衡量一个时代的生活优质与否的潜在的标准，也要依托于少数人。
en: Leavisism is based on the assumption that‘culture has always been in minority keeping’:Upon the minority depends our power of profiting by the finest human experience of the past; they keep alive the subtlest and most perishable parts of tradition.

zh: 正因有了他们，我们才知道何物有价值、何路通彼岸、何处是中心。
en: Upon them depend the implicit standards that order the finer living of an age, the sense that this is worth more than that, this rather than that is the direction in which to go, that the centre is here rather than there.

zh: 利益论的基本观点众所周知，毋需多讲。这些基本观点已被马克思主义传统发展到完善的地步，是普通人标准的知识装备。他们对政治争论很明白：输贏已定。
en: The fundamentals of the interest theory are too well known to need review; developed to perfection of a sort by the Marxist tradition, they are now standard intellectual equipment of the man-in-the-street, who is only too aware that in political argumentation it all comes down to whose ox is gored.

zh: 其实，《心灵的任务》四章由的每一章，虽然确有启发性和激励性，都以一个问号结尾。
en: As it is, every one of the four chapters of Psyche's Task, suggestive and stimulating as it is, ends on a questionmark.

zh: 在讨论过巫术对政府的贡献之后，我们被告知“许多人怀着迷信的畏惧，将其统治者——酋长或国 王——视为超人并拥有天赋的、大于凡人的力量。
en: After discussing the contributions of magic to government, we are told "that many peoples have regarded their rulers, whether chiefs or kings, with superstitious awe as beings of a higher order and endowed with mightier powers than common folk."

zh: ”这里正如我们指出的，弗雷泽自己的证据表明，作为秩序和规则支柱的权威，在家户、领地群体和部落中都不可或缺。
en: Here Frazer's own evidence shows, as we have indicated, that authority, as the backbone of order and regulation, is indispensable in household, municipality, and tribe.

zh: 原始人对自己酋长的敬畏是一种信念的副产品：即领导者凭其能力、专门知识和灵力或德行来作首领
en: The superstitious awe and respect given by the primitives to their chiefs is the byproduct of the conviction that the leader leads in virtue of his power, his expert knowledge, and his mana or sanctity.

zh: 这使得马克思主义呈现出一种独特的政治性。
en: This makes Marxist analysis political in a quite specific way.

zh: 当然，这并不意味着其他理论体系和研究方法就与政治绝缘；只不过，马克思主义强调世间万物归根结蒂都是政治的。
en: But this is not to suggest that other methods and approaches are apolitical; on the contrary, Marxism insists that all are ultimately political.

zh: 正如美国马克思主义文化批评家弗雷德里克•詹明信 (Fredric Jameson)所言：“政治的视角乃是一切阅读和解释行为的地平线。”（ Jameson，1981: 17)
en: As the American Marxist cultural critic Fredric Jameson (1981) puts it, ‘the political perspective [is] the absolute horizon of all reading and all interpretation’ (17).

zh: 很多19世纪的文化批评家都关心美国化问题，因为他们把它等同于大众民主的平民主义，因而担心它会让大众管理政府，降低文化标准。
en: Many nineteenth-century cultural critics were concerned about Americanisation because they identified it with mass democratic populism, and thus feared it would allow the masses to run the government and lower cultural standards.

zh: 不过，另一些人则把美国与民主、现代性、合理性和科学联系起来。
en: Others, however, associated America with democracy, modernity, rationality and science.

zh: 例如，科学家T.H.赫胥黎认为，美国代表着科学的、合理的未来的前途。
en: The scientist T.H.Huxley, for example, saw America as representing the promise of a scientific and rational future.

zh: 诸多问题都是由于他者的缺席引起的。不管使用何种释义，这总让我们觉得棘手。
en: A great deal of the difficulty arises from the absent other which always haunts any definition we might use.

zh: 大众文化是一个说不完、道不尽的话题，而我们总是在对比之中来理解大众文化。
en: It is never enough to speak of popular culture; we have always to acknowledge that with which it is being contrasted.

zh: 无论与大众文化相对的“他者”是什么——是群氓文化、高雅文化，还是工人阶级文化、民间文化，等等——概念本身都会因之而发生理论或政治意义上的变化。
en: And whichever of popular culture’s others we employ, mass culture, high culture, working-class culture, folk culture, etc., it will carry into the definition of popular culture a specific theoretical and political inflection.

zh: 正如本内特所指出的：“对此问题，绝无‘万无一失’ 的解决方法;却有一系列互不相同的解决途径，每一种途径都会带来不同的释义、产生不同的影响。"（Bennett, 1982a: 87)本书的主要意图在于：在文化理论与大众文化之错综复杂的关系中，为各种各样的问题及其纷繁的解决路径绘制一个学科地图。
en: ‘There is’, as Bennett (1982a) indicates, ‘no single or “correct” way of resolving these problems; only a series of different solutions which have different implications and effects’ (86).The main purpose of this book is to chart the many problems encountered, and the many solutions suggested, in cultural theory’s complex engagement with popular culture.

zh: 再以政府问题和政治强力在一个相对于文化组织的社区（community）内部的运用问题为例。
en: Take the problems of government and the use of political force within a community as opposed to cultural organization.

zh: 这是一个国家相对于民族的问题。
en: This is the problem of the state versus the nation.

zh: 人类学分析能为我们更全面地理解相对于公民身份的所谓民族性——过去一个半世纪的人类历史证明，它是民族主义(nationalism)的本质要素——提供一个背景。
en: A full understanding of what we mean by nation-ality as opposed to citizenship, which is the essence of nationalism as it has appeared during the last century and a half in human history, can also be supplied by a background of anthropological analysis.

zh: 这种分析能揭示出：在进化中，民族感(nationhood)是一条比政治制度、部落国家和帝国之类政治组织更古老和更基本的原理。
en: This would reveal that nationhood is a much older and more fundamental principle in evolution than the political organization of a police system, a tribe-state, or an empire.

zh: 这也表明，我们现代民族的文化自治，可以通过限制政治主权——特别是国家在军事方面的自决权——面得到丰富和复兴。
en: This would also show that the cultural autonomy of our modern nations would be enriched and revitalized by the limitation of political sovereignty, especially as regards the military self-determination of the state.

zh: 文化与权力的关系是后马克思主义文化研究所关注的首要议题。
en: Culture and power is the primary object of study in post-Marxist cultural studies.

zh: 霍尔解释道意义（也就是文化）……控制和组织着我们的行为和实践；它设定了规则、标准与惯例，而社会生活也因意义的存在而井井有条。
en: As Hall explains, ‘Meanings [i.e.cultures] . . . regulate and organize our conduct and practices--they help to set the rules, norms and conventions by which social life is ordered and governed.

zh: 于是，意义就成了那些想要操纵他人行为和思想的人竭尽全力抢占的‘必争之地”。
en: They are . . . , therefore, what those who wish to govern and regulate the conduct and ideas of others seek to structure and shape’.

zh: 意义是一种“物质的”存在，正因如此它才能够指导实践；此外，从前文提到的“男性气质”和“在中国递名片”的例子中我们也可以看到，正是意义为人们的日常行为设立了规范。
en: Meanings have a ‘material’ existence, in that they help organize practice; they establish norms of behaviour, as we recognized in the examples of different masculinities and the passing of a business card in China.

zh: 例如，英国保守党在1990年制作播出了一期政治宣传节目，节目结束时的最后一个词是“社会主义”，而此时电视上出现了红色监狱栅栏的影像，这就暗示其竞争对手工党所鼓吹的社会主义无异于建造了社会、经济与政治的囹圄。
en: For example, a Conservative Party political broadcast transmitted in 1990 ended with the word ‘socialism’ being transposed into red prison bars.What was being suggested is that the socialism of the Labour Party is synonymous with social, economic and political imprisonment.

zh: 这期节目就是要达到为“社会主义”一词赋予内涵的目的。
en: The broadcast was attempting to fix the connotations of the word ‘socialism’.

zh: 此外，此举还旨在将对手置于某种二元对立关系——社会主义意味着囚禁，而保守主义倡导自由——之中。
en: Moreover, it hoped to locate socialism in a binary relationship in which it connoted unfreedom, whilst conservatism connoted freedom.

zh: 在巴尔特看来，这期节目是意识形态操控的经典案例，电视文本试图将原本具有特殊性的事物普世化、合法化,让观众误将文化之物（人类创造的）当作自然之物（先天存在的）。
en: For Barthes, this would be a classic example of the operations of ideology, the attempt to make universal and legitimate what is in fact partial and particular; an attempt to pass off that which is cultural (i.e.humanly made) as something which is natural (i.e.
just existing).

zh: 巴尔特指出，为人们所消费的神话是在次级指意系统或内涵的层面上被生产出来的。
en: He claims that it is at the level of secondary signification or connotation that myth is produced for consumption.

zh: 在他看来，神话就是包含了一整套观念与实践的意识形态，其功能在于积极推行统治阶级的利益与价值观，维护既存的社会权力结构。
en: By myth he means ideology understood as a body of ideas and practices, which by actively promoting the values and interests of dominant groups in society, defend the prevailing structures of power.

zh: 若想深入理解巴尔特的上述观点，需首先认清符号的多义性特征，意即，一个符号具有指向多重意义的潜能。
en: To understand this aspect of his argument, we need to understand the polysemic nature of signs, that is, that they have the potential to signify multiple meanings.

zh: 然而，符号学的任务是要超越这些外延，达到符号的内涵。
en: But the task of semiology is to go beyond these denotations to get to the connotations of the sign.

zh: 这么做揭示了神话如何通过特定的各种符号起作用。在这个方面，可以发现神话建构的、虚构的和历史的定位。
en: Doing this reveals how myth works through particular signs, and shows how the constructed, manufactured and historical location of the myth can be discovered.

zh: 因时，神话的种种内涵可以得到确认：这看起来是一束玫瑰花，但它表示激情；这看起来是一幅黑人士兵向法国国旗敬礼的照片，但它的确表示了法帝主义的伟大和公正。
en: The connotations of myths can thus be identified: this may appear to be a bunch of roses but it connotes passion; or this may appear to be a photo of a black soldier saluting the French flag, but it really connotes the grandeur and impartiality of French imperialism.

zh: 在英国，种族主义最早是为维护奴隶制与奴隶贸易的合法性而出现的。
en: Racism first develops in England as a defence of slavery and the slave trade.

zh: 彼得•弗莱尔指出：“当英国的奴隶贸易、英国的种植园奴隶制和英国的制造业三者开始联手追逐髙额利润，那些古老的神话碎片与人种偏见便有了强悍的经济基础，逐渐转化为一套牢固的种族主义意识形态，也就是一系列关于种族的神话。
en: As Peter Fryer points out, "Once the English slave trade, English sugar-producing plantation slavery, and English manufacturing industry had begun to operate as a trebly profitable interlocking system, the economic basis had been laid for all those ancient scraps of myth and prejudice to be woven into a more or less coherent racist ideology: a mythology of race".

zh: ”换言之，种族主义起初是一种防御性意识形态，其传播意图在于维护奴隶制与奴隶贸易所带来的经济利益。
en: In other words, racism first emerges as a defensive ideology, promulgated in order to defend the economic profits of slavery and the slave trade.

zh: 毫无疑问，若无肇始于20世纪70年代早期的第二波女性主义浪潮，肖沃特决计说不出此番话来。
en: There can be no doubt that without the emergence of feminism (the second wave) in the early 1970s this sentence could not have been written.

zh: 性别问题得以添列学术议程，皆系女性主义之功。
en: It is feminism that has placed gender on the academic agenda.

zh: 不过，种种议题的特质亦于女性主义内部引发了激烈争论。
en: However, the nature of the agenda has provoked a vigorous debate within feminism itself.

zh: 由是，女性主义作为一个研究、写作和行为的整体性思潮如今已不复存在，而是发生了分裂并产生了若干变种。今日我们所要讨论的，与其说是单数的女性主义，不如说是复数的女性诸主义。
en: So much so that it is really no longer possible, if it ever was, to talk of feminism as a monolithic body of research, writing and activity; one should really speak of feminisms.

zh: 在下一部分，我将讨论浅白是对“有深度的” 真理的拒绝。归根到底，真理是一种控制性的话语，而浅白并不 提供有洞见卓识的解释，而是让它本身悬而未决。
en: In the next section I argue that the obvious refuses the "in-depth" truth, which is finally a controlling discourse—the obvious offers no insightful explanation, and leaves itself open.

zh: 不过，浅白不仅是指文本处理的事物是浅露的，而且其处理方式本身也具有浅露的特征。浅白与陈词滥调是同一件事物的两面。
en: But obviousness is not just a characteristic of what is dealt with, it lies also in the way it is handled—the obvious and the cliched are two sides of the same coin.

zh: 人类婴儿需要父母保护的时间比最髙等的类人猿还要长。
en: The human infant needs parental protection for a much longer period than does the young of even the highest anthropoid apes.

zh: 因此，如任何文化中的生殖，即交媾、怀孕和生产的行为，如果不与基于法律的亲子关系的事实相联系就不能延续。这种亲子关系规定父母必然照顾孩子很长一段时间，并应该由于付出照顾和心血而获得某些益处。
en: Hence, no culture could endure in which the act of reproduction, that is, mating, pregnancy, and childbirth, was not linked up with the fact of legally-founded parenthood, that is, a relationship in which the father and the mother have to look after the children for a long period, and, in turn, derive certain benefits for the care and trouble taken.

zh: 我们已经讨论过长期的生殖循环相对应的种种制度。
en: We have already discussed the various institutions corresponding to the long-drawn-out reproductive cycle.

zh: 我就认识一个像JR那样的讨厌鬼，尽管他只是个普通的建筑工人而已。
en: In real life I know a horror like JR, but he’s just an ordinary builder’ (43).

zh: ”（43)正因电视观众有能力将自己的日常生活与屏幕上那个德州豪门联系起来，我们才可言称《豪》剧体现了“情感现实主义”。
en: It is this ability to make our own lives connect with the lives of a family of Texan millionaires that gives the programme its emotional realism.

zh: 也许我们并不是有钱人，但我们和剧中的富家子弟之间存在着共通之处:悲欢离合，生老病死，诸如此类。
en: We may not be rich, but we may have other fundamental things in common: relationships and broken relationships, happiness and sadness, illness and health.

zh: 那些认为该剧现实的观众，将注意力从叙事的独特性（“外延”）上移开，转而关心剧情主题的普遍性（“内涵”）。
en: Those who find it realisict shift the focus of attention from the particularity of the narrative (‘denotation’) to the generality of its themes (‘connotation’).

zh: 政治组织和它的防御、侵略或大型部落集会之类的活动，当然都要求有饮食、居住和气候等某种形式的保护。
en: Political organization and such of its activities as defence, aggression, or large tribal gatherings, demand of course some form of feeding, housing, and climate protection.

zh: 因此，无论考察的是氏族、年龄级，还是军事力童或一个部落的议事会，我们都必须确定需求和驱力的整个范围。在成功的操作过程中它们必须得到满足。
en: Hence, whether we consider the clan, the age-grade, or the military force or deliberative council of a tribe, we would have to determine the whole range of needs and imperatives which have to be satisfied in the course of a successful performance.

zh: 即使转而考虑最高级文化中的高度成形的制度，即以职业分工为基础的制度，我们也会发现它们很少能以一个简单和特定的功能来定义。
en: Even if we turned to very highly crystallized institutions on the highest level of culture, that is, institutions on the occupational basis, we would find that they seldom can be defined in terms of a simple and specific function.

zh: 银行系统显然是首先关心提供信贷和进行投资以及企业的资本化。
en: The banking system is obviously concerned primarily with the supply of credit and the handling of investments and the capitalization of enterprise.

zh: 围绕着各种差异轴（譬如阶级、性别、种族、年龄等等）所组成的一种复杂的基质，社会得以结构成形，其中每一个差异轴都有一个权力向度。
en: Society is structured around a complex matrix of axes of difference (class, gender, race, age, and so on), each of which has a dimension of power.

zh: 如果没有权力差异，就没有社会差异。所以，正如霍尔所言，界定“大众”的方式之一，便是通过它与“权力集团”的对抗性来识别它。
en: There is no social difference without power difference, so one way of defining the popular is, as Hall does, to identify it by its oppositionality to “the power-bloc.

zh: 诸多问题都是由于他者的缺席引起的。不管使用何种释义，这总让我们觉得棘手。
en: A great deal of the difficulty arises from the absent other which always haunts any definition we might use.

zh: 大众文化是一个说不完、道不尽的话题，而我们总是在对比之中来理解大众文化。
en: It is never enough to speak of popular culture; we have always to acknowledge that with which it is being contrasted.

zh: 无论与大众文化相对的“他者”是什么——是群氓文化、高雅文化，还是工人阶级文化、民间文化，等等——概念本身都会因之而发生理论或政治意义上的变化。
en: And whichever of popular culture’s others we employ, mass culture, high culture, working-class culture, folk culture, etc., it will carry into the definition of popular culture a specific theoretical and political inflection.

zh: 正如本内特所指出的：“对此问题，绝无‘万无一失’ 的解决方法;却有一系列互不相同的解决途径，每一种途径都会带来不同的释义、产生不同的影响。"（Bennett, 1982a: 86)本书的主要意图在于：在文化理论与大众文化之错综复杂的关系中，为各种各样的问题及其纷繁的解决路径绘制一个学科地图。
en: ‘There is’, as Bennett (1982a) indicates, ‘no single or “correct” way of resolving these problems; only a series of different solutions which have different implications and effects’ (86).The main purpose of this book is to chart the many problems encountered, and the many solutions suggested, in cultural theory’s complex engagement with popular culture.

zh: 驱力的概念最好从人类行为分析里略去，除非我们明白我们对它的用法必须与动物心理学或生理学不同。由于概念的差异最好能用术语的差异来区分，所以我就用动机来代表在特定文化里确实存在的欲求。
en: The concept of drive is better omitted from any analysis of human behavior,unless, that is, we understand that we have to use it differently from the animal psychologists or physiologists.Since a conceptual differentiation is always best terminologically differentiated, we shall speak henceforth of motive, meaning by this the urge as it actually is found in operation within a given culture.

zh: 此外，我们必须重新界定生理学最低限度的概念，即生理动机能够从中得到调整但又不至于迫使一个文化里的文化成员机体退化或人口枯竭。
en: We have, however, to reformulate our concept of that physiological minimum, the limits within which physiological motivations can be refashioned so that they still do not force organic degeneration or depopulation upon the members of a culture.

zh: 因此，相对于动机时，我们使用需求。
en: As opposed to motive, therefore, we speak of needs.

zh: 人类学，作为广义的人的科学，作为人文研究中最宽泛的“无论所"学科，是一位姗姗来迟者。
en: Anthropology, as the science of man at large, as the most comprehensive discipline in humanism without portfolio, was the last to come.

zh: 因此，它必须得在范围、对象、方法等方面见缝插针，挤出空间。
en: It had to peg out its claims as to scope, subject matter, and method as best it could.

zh: 它搜罗别人的剩余，甚至要悄然挤占老学科的一些领地。
en: It absorbed what was left over, and even had to encroach on some older preserves.

zh: 它现在的研究包括史前史、民俗学、体质人类学和文化人类学这使它危险地接近其他社会和自然科学，如心理学、历史学、考古学、社会学和解剖学的合法研究领域。
en: It consists now of such studies as prehistory, folklore, physical anthropology, and cultural anthropology.These come dangerously near other legitimate fields of social and natural sciences: psychology, history, archaeology, sociology and anatomy.

zh: 于是，在撰写人的研究的科学方法时，人类学家就有了一项虽不甚轻松，但颇为重要的任务。
en: Thus, in writing about the scientific approach to the Study of Man, an anthropologist has a task which, though perhaps not easy, is of some importance.

zh: 他有责任界定人类学现存各分支之间实际存在何种关系。
en: It is his duty to define in what relation to one another the various branches of anthropology really stand.

zh: 他必须确定人类学在人文研究众多学科中应占据的位置，他也不得不重新讨论一个老问题，即人文学科在何种意义上才算是科学？
en: He has to determine the place which anthropology ought to occupy in the wider fraternity of humanistic studies.He has also to reopen the old question, in what sense humanism can be scientific.

zh: 我首先要说明，科学方法明显不是人文学科领域中惟一的关注点和灵感源泉。
en: I would like to state first that the scientific approach is obviously not the only interest or inspiration in the domain of humanism.

zh: 道德或哲学的观点；美学的、人道的或神学的热忱或灵感；因过去以一种既无需证实又无法否认，而使人神往，产生要知其为何物的欲望——这些都是所有人文学科的合法动机，如此等等。
en: Moral or philosophical points of view; aesthetic, humanitarian, or theological zeal or inspiration; the desire to know what the past was because the past appeals to our sentiments in a manner which need not be vindicated but cannot be gainsaid— all these are legitimate motivations in all humanities.

zh: 但科学至少作为一种工具，一种达到目的的手段，还是必不可少的。
en: Science, however, as a tool at least, as a means to an end, is indispensable.

zh: 因此，我们所讲的人性，就是指内在于每个文明及其中所有个体的生物决定因素，即执行诸如呼吸、睡觉、休息、营养、排泄和生殖等躯体功能。
en: By human nature, therefore, we mean the biological determinism which imposes on every civilization and on all individuals in it: the carrying out of such bodily functions as breathing, sleep, rest, nutrition, excretion, and reproduction.

zh: 我们可以将基本需求定义为群体和个体为了生存而必须满足的环境和生物条件。
en: We can define the concept of basic needs as the environmental and biological conditions which must be fulfilled for the survival of the individual and the group.

zh: 事实上，两者的生存都要求维持以保持为文化表演所必须的起码健康和活力，并保持为防止人口逐渐减少所必需的最低数量。
en: Indeed, the survival of both requires the maintenance of a minimum of health and vital energy necessary for the performance of cultural tasks, and for the minimum numbers necessary for the prevention of gradual depopulation.

zh: 如本书中讨论过的大多数大众文化形式一样，融合文化也是一个斗争与协商的场所。
en: Convergence culture, like most popular culture discussed in this book, is a site of struggle and negotiation.

zh: 我们不可将其孤立地理解为自上而下的强加的文化或自下而上的自发的文化，而需始终视其为两股力量之间复杂的冲突性共融的产物。
en: It cannot be explained and understood as something imposed from ‘above’ or as something spontaneously emerging from ‘below’, but as a complex and contradictory combination of both forces.

zh: 诚如亨利詹金斯所言：融合……既是一个自上而下的商业驱动过程，又是一个自下而上的消费驱动过程，是商业融合与草根融合的共存体。
en: As Jenkins observes, Convergence...is both a top--down corporate-driven process and a bottom--up consumer-driven process.

zh: 此外别无犯罪。
en: There are no other crimes.

zh: 偷窃很少发生，而且属于私事。
en: Theft rarely occurs and is a private matter.

zh: 通奸不箅犯罪，由此引起的紧张可通过他们的婚姻安排得到顺利解决，杀人也可通过双方家庭之间的赔偿而迅速得到处理。
en: Adultery is no crime and the strain that arises from such an act is easily taken care of under their marriage arrangements.Homicide, in the one case that is remembered, was settled quickly by payments between the two families.

zh: 霍皮人随蛇而舞并非故弄危险和制造恐怖，在我们的文明中，对蛇有着一种普遍的恐惧，以致造成我们对蛇舞的误解。
en: Nor is the dancing with snakes a courting of the dangerous and the terrible in Hopi.There is current in our civilization so common a horror of snakes that we misread the Snake Dance.

zh: 我们会轻而易举地将在类似情形下感受到的情绪归罪于跳舞人。
en: We readily attribute to the dancers the emotions we should feel in like case.

zh: 但美洲印第安人并不常把蛇与恐惧相联系。
en: But snakes are not often regarded with horror by the American Indians.

zh: 但是，就这个事实而言，多布中的无政府状态可以说是无与伦比了。他们以同心圆形式构成社会组织，每一组织内部，允许存在特殊的传统敌意形式。
en: Nothing could be further from the truth, however, than to see in Dobu a state of anarchy.Dobuan social organization is arranged in concentric circles, within each of which specified traditional forms of hostility are allowed.

zh: 除开在相应的特殊团体之内贯彻这些文化上认可的敌意外，任何人都不操握法律。
en: No man takes the law into his own hands except to carry out these culturally allowed hostilities within the appropriate specified group.

zh: 男性会社，即各种秘密社团、俱乐部、未婚男子会所以及类似的团体，都能包括进制度的概念而毫无困难。
en: Male associations, that is, secret societies, clubs, bachelors' houses, and such like, can be included in the concept of institutions without difficulty.

zh: 我要提醒你们的是，每种这样的分群也有其法律的和神话的宪纲，而这又意味着其人事及其行为规范的定义，它们每个都有一种物质体现、一个聚会地点、一些财产以及一些特定仪式和功用性的器物。
en: Let me remind you that each such grouping has also its legal and mythological charter, and that this implies a definition of its personnel and its norms of behavior, and that each of them has a material embodiment, a place of reunion, some wealth, and some specific ritual and instrumental apparatus.

zh: 大多制度都能被包括在个更宽泛的类别里，我们可以称其为职业或专业类别。
en: A large group of institutions can be included in a wide class, which we might label occupational or professional.

zh: 文化的各个方面，即教育、经济、法律的管理、巫术表演和宗教崇拜等各类行为，可能会也可能不会在具体的制度中得到体现。
en: The various aspects of culture, that is, the various types of activity such as education, economics, the administration of law, magical performance and religious worship, may or may not be embodied in specific institutions.
They pay much closer attention to behaving competently and they allow themselves fewer alibis than Amer- icans.

zh: 他们远比美国人更加注意力能胜任的行为，而不为自己找借口，也不象我们那样经常把生活的不满归咎于别人。他们也不会由于没有得到美国人所谓的平均幸福（average happiness）而常常沉湎于自怜。
en: They do not so often project their dissatisfactions with life upon scapegoats, and they do not so often indulge in self-pity because they have somehow or other not got what Americans call average happiness.

zh: 他们已被训练得比美国人更加注意自己“身上的锈”。
en: They have been trained to pay much closer attention to the 'rust of the body' than is common among Americans.

zh: 全部数学概念都绝没有脱离了人类物种的存在和有效性。用爱因斯言表述物理学基本原则和概念的短语来说，它们乃是“人类理智的自由创造。”
en: Far from having an existence and a validity apart from the human species, all mathematical concepts are "free inventions of the human intellect," to use a phrase with which Einstein characterizes the concepts and fundamental principles of physics.

zh: 在近年的劳工意识形态中，塔夫脱‑哈特莱法案一直是“奴隶劳工法”。
en: In recent labor ideology the Taft-Hartley Act has been a "slave labor act ."

zh: 公正地说，这个法案不配这个标签。
en: By no dispassionate exami nation does the Act merit this label.

zh: 对该法案任何不带偏见的评价都应分别考虑这个法的许多条款。
en: Any detached assessment of the Act would have to consider its many provisions individually.

zh: 用任何价值准则，甚至是那些工会自己的准则，这类评价也是复杂的。
en: On any set of values, even those of trade unions themselves, such an assessment would yield a mixed verdict.

zh: 他们对于破解的过程本身并没有什么兴趣。
en: The process itself interested them less.

zh: 这与《査理的天使》一片的女观众的选择行为，或者 说是偷袭战术，正好相反。《査理的天使》的女观众所选中的是 叙述过程，而不是父权制符码的显现与疑窦的解答。
en: This was quite the reverse selective practice, or poaching raid, from that of the women viewers of Charlie's Angels, who watched the narrative process rather than the patriarchal posing or resolution of the enigma.

zh: 在一个层面上，各神通俗文化符号的意义是自明的。
en: On one level, the meaning of popular cultural signs is self-evident.

zh: 它们是它们本身的样子或者它们显现的样子，一则广告，一幅黑人士兵的照片，一束玫瑰花等等。
en: They are what they are or what they appear to be, an advert, a photo of a black soldier, a bunch of roses and so on.

zh: 换句话说，它们向我们表示了某种东西，它们将自身向我们呈现为一个事实：这是一幅士兵的照片，一则广告，一束玫瑰花。
en: They denote something to us, they present it to us as a matter of fact: this is a photo of a soldier, an advert, a bunch of roses.

zh: 外延是指那些对我们显现为自然的东西和我们认为理所当然的东西。
en: Denotation refers to those things which appear to us as natural and which we can take for granted.

zh: 强大的外样大名成了倒幕派的先锋，他们想通过“王政复古”取代德川氏而统治日本，只要求换一下当权者。
en: The great Outside Lords, the daimyo of Japan's strongest fiefs who spearheaded the overthrow of the Shogunate, thought of the Restoration as a way in which they, instead of the Tokugawa, could rule Japan.They wanted a mere change of personnel.

zh: 农民们盼望多保留一些自己收获的稻米，却讨厌“改革”。
en: The farmers wanted to keep more of the rice they raised but they hated 'reforms.'

zh: 武土阶层则希望保持俸禄，并能挥刀上阵建立功勋。
en: The samurai wanted to keep their pensions and be allowed to use their swords for greater glory.

zh: 在财政上支持王政复古派军队的商人们，希望推行重商主义，却从未指责过封建制度。
en: The merchants, who financed the Restoration forces, wanted to expand mercantilism but they never arraigned the feudal system.

zh: 对不同文化的研究对当今的思想、行为还具有另一种重要的影响。
en: The study of different cultures has another important bearing upon present-day thought and behaviour.

zh: 现代生活已将许多文明置于紧密的联系之中；目前，对这种情形的最强烈的反应是民族主义和种族主义的势利眼。
en: Modern existence has thrown many civilizations into close contact, and at the moment the overwhelming response to this s1tuation is nationalism and racial snobbery.

zh: 从未有这样一个时代：文明更需要真正具有文化意识的人，能够客观地、毫不畏惧地、公正地理解其他民族在一定社会条件下的行为方式的人。
en: There has never been a time when civilization stood more in need of individuals who are genuinely culture-conscious, who can see objectively the socially conditioned behaviour of other peoples without fear and recrimination.

zh: 至于汤普森，则始终声称自己的作品是马克思主义的。
en: Thompson, on the other hand, would describe his work, then and always, as Marxist.

zh: 当代文化研究中心前主任理查德•约翰逊（Richard Johnson)用“文化主义”这个表述来为汤普森、霍加特和威廉斯三人的著作定性（Johnson，1979)。
en: The term ‘culturalism’ was coined to describe his work, and the work of Hoggart and Williams, by one of the former directors of the Centre for Contemporary Cultural Studies, Richard Johnson (1979).

zh: 约翰逊认为，上述三位理论家的观点奉行一套共同的理论预设，每一个人都对前人的成果提出了一些质疑，取得了一定突破。
en: Johnson uses the term to indicate the presence of a body of theoretical concerns connecting the work of the three theorists.Each, in his different way, breaks with key aspects of the tradition he inherits.

zh: 阿尔都塞认为，问题域中包含了假设、动机、潜在的观念，等等；而文本（比如说一则广告）就是通过这些要素被制造出来的。
en: According to Althusser a problematic consists of the assumptions, motivations, underlying ideas, etc., from which a text (say, an advert) is made.

zh: 这就是说，文本是由被呈现出来的（表达出来的）东西和缺席的（未表达出来的）东西共 同结构的。
en: In this way, it is argued, a text is structured as much by what is absent (what is not said) as by what is present (what is said).

zh: 因此，若想对某个文本的意义进行充分的解读，不但要发现文本中有些什么，还需弄清楚文本背后潜藏的种种假设（这些假设可能在文本之中全无任何痕迹，而仅仅存在于文本的问题域之中）。
en: Althusser argues that if we are to fully understand the meaning of a text, we have to be aware of not only what is in a text but also the assumptions which inform it (and which may not appear in the text itself in any straightforward way but exist only in the text’s problematic).

zh: 只有当一个文本试图去回答自身力所不及的问题时，它的问题域才会显现出来。
en: One way in which a text’s problematic is supposedly revealed is in the way a text may appear to answer questions which it has not formally posed.

zh: 而这些问题，也被包含在了问题域之中。
en: Such questions, it is argued, have been posed in the text’s problematic.

zh: 阿尔都塞试图通过批评实践来解构文本，揭示问题域；而所采取的具体方法，就是他所谓的“症候式解读” (symptomaThe Interpretation of Cultures reading) 。
en: The task of an Althusserian critical practice is to deconstruct the text to reveal the problematic.To do this is to perform what Althusser calls a ‘symptomatic reading’.

zh: 只有当一个文本试图去回答自身力所不及的问题时，它的问题域才会显现出来。
en: One way in which a text's problematic is supposedly revealed is in the way a text may appear to answer questions which it has not formally posed.

zh: 而这些问题，也被包含在了问题域之中。
en: Such questions, it is argued, have been posed in the text's problematic.

zh: 阿尔都塞试图通过批评实践来解构文本，揭示问题域；而所采取的具体方法，就是他所谓的“症候式解读”。
en: The task of an Althusserian critical practice is to deconstruct the text to reveal the problematic.To do this is to perform what Althusser calls a "symptomatic reading".

zh: 在阿诺德看来，只要外部环境稍稍发挥一点作用，“乌合之众”的“幽灵”就会成功占领“野蛮人”和“非利士人”的心灵。
en: According to Arnold, it takes only a little help from ‘circumstances’ to make this ‘eternal spirit’ triumph in both Barbarian and Philistine.

zh: 在这一问题上，文化具有两方面的功能。
en: Culture has two functions in this scenario.

zh: 第一，文化必须小心翼翼地指引贵族和中产阶级，使其免受外部环境的影响。
en: First, it must carefully guide the aristocracy and the middle class from such circumstances.

zh: 第二，对于那些心中仍然存留着所谓“人性”的工人阶级，文化必须为他们提供“一种不可或缺的道德标准……使他们尊重权威，克服自身的无政府倾向，不再对我们构成威胁”。
en: Second, it must bring to the working class, the class in which this so-called human nature is said to reside, ‘a much wanted principle... of authority, to counteract the tendency to anarchy that seems to be threatening us’.

zh: 而要想建立这种权威的道德标准，就必须有一个强大的、中央集权的国家。
en: The principle of authority, as we shall see, is to be found in a strong centralized State.

zh: 武士道这个正式名称是近代才有的。它不象“迫于情义”、“完全出于情义”、“为情义而竭尽全力”等格言那样有深厚的民族感情背景。
en: Bushido is a modern official term which has not the deep folk-feeling behind it that 'cornered with giri,' 'merely for giri', 'working strongly for giri' have in Japan.

zh: 它也不能包罗“情义”的复杂性和多样性。
en: Nor does it cover the complexities and the ambivalences of girli.

zh: 它是评论家出于灵感的创作。
en: It is a publicist's inspiration.

zh: 与“戏仿”一样，“混仿”也是对某种独特假面或某种僵化语言的模拟，不过这种模拟是一种中立的实践，并不似“戏仿”一般基于某种隐秘的动机。“混仿”既无讽刺挖苦之意，更无诱人发笑之功；它认为人们偶然说出的反常言语中并不隐含着任何既定的惯例，而某些正常的语言规范依旧存在。
en: Pastiche is, like parody, the imitation of a peculiar mask, speech in a dead language: but it is a neutral practice of such mimicry, without any of parody's ulterior motives, amputated of the satiric impulse, devoid of laughter and of any conviction that alongside the abnormal tongue you have momentarily borrowed, some healthy linguistic normality still exists.

zh: 故而，“混仿”乃是一种空白的戏仿。
en: Pastiche is thus blank parody

zh: 但是，孝道的性质则不可避免地有所改动，以适应日本家庭的不同结构。
en: The character of filial piety, however, was inevitably modified to suit the different structure of the family in Japan.

zh: 在中国，甚至现在，一个人仍然必须对其大宗族尽忠。
en: In China, even today, one owes loyalty to one's vast extended clan.

zh: 这个大宗族可能有成千上万个成员，宗族对全体成员拥有裁决权，并受到这些成员的支持。
en: It may number tens of thousands of people over whom it has jurisdiction and from whom it receives support.

zh: “新陈代谢”一项指进食、消化、相关分泌、营养吸收和废物排泄的过程。它以几种方式与环境因素以及机体与外部世界的互动相关。这种互动由文化所限定。
en: Thus, the entry metabolism means that the processes of food intake, digestion, the collateral secretions, the absorption of nutritive substances, and rejection of waste matter are related in several ways to environmental factors and the interaction between the organism and the outside world, an interaction culturally framed.

zh: 也就是说，我们在此把前表中分别陈述的几种要素压缩成类。
en: We have, thus, condensed here the several drives which were separately stated in our previous table.

zh: 固体食物、饮料和氧气的供给均由新陈代谢过程决定，排泄过程也不例外，个体在此过程中再次依靠环境。
en: The supply of solid foods, of liquids, and of oxygen is all determined by the metabolic processes, and so are the processes of excretion, in which the individual once more resorts to the environment.

zh: 大众文化的政治是日常生活的政治。
en: The politics of popular culture is that of everyday life.

zh: 这意味着大众文化在 微观政治的层面，而非宏观政治的层面，进行运作，而且它是循序渐进式的，而非激进式的。
en: This means that it works on the micropolitical level, not the macro level, and that it is progressive, not radical.

zh: 它关注的是发生在家庭、切身的工作环境、教室等结构当中，日复一日与不平等权力关系所进行的防商。
en: It is concerned with the day-to-day negotiations of unequal power relations in such structures as the family, the immediate work environment, and the classroom.

zh: 顺便可以提到，葛兰西的理论有一些次要的但依然有意义的问题。
en: There are a number of secondary but still significant problems with Gramsci's theory.

zh: 例如，把霸权同压制清楚地分开，存在着困难，因为霸权本身就可能是压制。
en: For example, there is the difficulty with separating hegemony from coercion, since hegemony can itself be coercive.

zh: 霸权还是一种统治形式，而压制可以用一种霸权的方式来运用。
en: Hegemony is about domination, while coercion can be used in a hegemonic fashion.

zh: 上述论点比较接近于霍尔(1986)晚期的“言传理论"（theory of articulation )。在这 —理论中，霍尔说明了文本在大众文化中运作的双重方式。其一为文本中心的方式，其二为读者中心的方式。
en: This accords better with Hall's (1986) later theory of articulation, in which he accounts for the double way in which texts work in popular culture: a text-centered way, and a reader-centered way.

zh: 考沃德之所以对言情小说产生兴趣，在很大程度上缘于“过去十年间(20世纪70年代），女性主义和雨后春笋般风靡的言情小说几乎是同步发展的”。
en: Coward's interest in romantic fiction is in part inspired by the intriguing fact that "over the past decade [the 1970s], the rise of feminism has been paralleled almost exactly by a mushroom growth in the popularity of romantic fiction".

zh: 关于言情小说，她提出了两个观点。
en: She believes two things about romantic novels.

zh: 第一，所有小说必定满足着某些特定的需求”；第二，这些小说为“某个无比强大的共同幻景”提供佐证、作出贡献。
en: First, that "they must still satisfy some very definite needs"; and second, that they offer evidence of, and contribute to, "a very powerful and common fantasy".

zh: 尤其是，“该理论体系将注意力从‘在异性恋文化中做一个同性恋者意味着什么’转移到‘文化是如何创造出异性恋的种种表现形式的’，旨在于一向严苛的异性恋文化中为‘反常性’找到相应的位置”（同上）。
en: Moreover, ‘by shifting the focus away from the question of what it means to be lesbian or gay within the culture, and onto the various performances of heterosexuality created by the culture, Queer Theory seeks to locate Queerness in places that had previously been thought of as strictly for the straights’ (ibid.).

zh: 由是，二人宣称：“酷儿理论并非仅仅‘关于’同性恋者，正如女性研究也并非仅仅‘关于’女人一样。事实上，酷儿理论所要攻击的乃是……性别之分的‘理所当然性’，及其所竭力维护的异性恋霸权。”（同上）
en: In this way, they contend, ‘Queer Theory is no more “about” lesbians and gay men than women’s studies is “about” women. Indeed, part of the project of Queer is to attack...the very “naturalness” of gender and, by extension, the fictions supporting compulsory heterosexuality’.

zh: 据说，是公共服务，而不是私利，才决定了所生产的东西。
en: Public service, not private profit, is said to determine what gets produced.

zh: 然而，默多克和戈尔丁却论证说，像英国广播公司这样的国家媒介机构，实际上运作起来就像是商业企业，而不是公共服务机构。
en: However, Murdock and Golding argue that state media institutions such as the BBC have in practice to operate as if they were commercial enterprises and not public services.

zh: 他们不得不去议会，以便说服政府维持或者提高他们的许可证费。
en: The BBC has to persuade governments to maintain or raise its licence fee.

zh: 从文化上说，人类中的一小部分脱离原始状态不过是昨天的事情。
en: It is only yesterday, culturologically speaking, that a small portion of mankind began to emerge from a condition of savagery.

zh: 迄今为止，人的大部分生计是完全依赖于野生食物的。实际上，自农业产生开始，人类历史不过流逝了2%的时间。
en: For most of his career thus far man has subsisted wholly upon wild foods; less than two per cent of human history, as a matter of fact, has elapsed since the origin of agriculture.

zh: 解剖学家还未能发现，为什么人能使用符号，而类人猿却不能。
en: The anatomist has not been able to discover why men can use symbols and apes cannot.

zh: 已知的人脑和猿脑的唯一区别是量的区别。如卡尔逊所评论过的那样：“……人并没有某种新的脑细胞或脑细胞网络”。
en: So far as is known the only difference between the brain of man and the brain of an ape is a quantitative one: ". . . man has no new kinds of brain cells or brain cell connections," as A. J. Carlson has remarked.

zh: 对“外来”之含义的第二个误解在于人们常常将“本土的”等同于“国家的”，却不知即使在一个国家内部也会存在许多个本土文化。
en: Another problem with this very limited notion of the foreign is that it is always assumed that the ‘local’ is the same as the national.But within the national, there may well be many ‘locals’.

zh: 而且，本土文化之间及其与宰制性文化（“国家文化”）之间还存在着不容忽视的矛盾冲突。
en: Moreover, there may be considerable conflict between them, and between them and the dominant culture (i.e.‘the national’).

zh: 因此，全球化既能强化本土文化，又可破坏本土文化；既能让个体安于某地，又可使之产生远离某地的感觉。
en: Globalization can therefore both help confirm and help undo local cultures; it can keep one in place and it can make one suddenly feel out of place.

zh: 这个简要的概括实际上是我们以下更全面分析的蓝图。它表明科学的人类学是基于制度的理论，即对组织单位类型的具体分析。
en: This brief outline, which is really a blueprint for our following fuller analysis, indicates that scientific anthropology consists in a theory of institutions, that is, a concrete analysis of the type units of an organization.

zh: 作为一种关于基本需求，关于功用和整合驱力之衍生的理论，科学的人类学提供给我们功能的分析，使我们能界定习俗性观念和发明能力的形式和意义。
en: As a theory of basic needs, and a derivation of instrumental and integrative imperatives, scientific anthropology gives us the functional analysis, which allows us to define the form, as well as the meaning, of a customary idea or contrivance.

zh: 显而易见，这样一种科学的研究方法在任何意义上都不排斥或否认进化或历史研究的有效性，它只是给它们提供一个科学的基础。
en: It can easily be seen that such a scientific approach does not by any means override or deny the validity of evolutionary or historical pursuits.It simply supplies them with a scientific basis.

zh: 史蒂文•康纳认为，《后现代状况》可被视为“对学术知识与学术机构在当下世界中的状况的隐秘寓言”。
en: Steven Connor suggests that The Postmodern Condition may be read ‘as a disguised allegory of the condition of academic knowledge and institutions in the contemporary world’.

zh: 在某种意义上,利奥塔“‘诊断’的并非所谓后现代状况，而是徒劳无益的当代知识分子”（同上）。
en: Lyotard’s ‘diagnosis of the postmodern condition is, in one sense, the diagnosis of the final futility of the intellectual’ (ibid.).

zh: 在他看来，当代知识分子身上充满了“消极英雄主义”的色彩。
en: Lyotard is himself aware of what he calls the contemporary intellectual’s ‘negative heroism’.

zh: “整个20世纪60年代对学术界的粗暴攻击和猛烈批评”导致知识分子丧失了原本的权威性。
en: Intellectuals have, he argues, been losing their authority since ‘the violence and critique mounted against the academy during the sixties’.

zh: 罗兰•巴尔特写于早年的大众文化研究著作关注指意的过程，以及意义的生产和流通机制。
en: Roland Barthes's early work on popular culture is concerned with the processes of signification, the mechanisms by which meanings are produced and put into circulation.

zh: 《神话学》—书就以法国的大众文化为考察的对象。
en: Mythologies is a collection of essays on French popular culture.

zh: 在这部著作中，巴尔特对诸多文化形态进行了讨论，包括角斗、肥皂粉与清洁剂、玩具、牛排与薯片、旅游，以及公众对科学的态度，等等。
en: In it he discusses, among many things, wrestling, soap powders and detergents, toys, steak and chips, tourism and popular attitudes towards science.

zh: 比如说“黑”与“白”是一种二元对立结构，当我们对“黑”作出界定的时候，总是意味着“白”作为一种缺席而存在。
en: Black and white, it could be argued, exist in a binary opposition, one always existing as the absent other when one of the terms is defined.

zh: 然而不难发现，在很多权力话语中，“白”是正面的、积极的，相对于“黑”而言具有优越性。
en: But it is not difficult to see how in many powerful discourses, white is the positive term, holding priority and privilege over black.

zh: 拋开种族主义话语不说，在历史中始终存在着“白”优“黑”劣的思维模式。
en: Even leaving aside racism, there is a long history of black connoting negatively and white connoting positively.

zh: 一方面，有争议的是，资本主义不如法兰克福学派所认为的稳定。另一方面，它并没有不断面临革命工人阶级运动绝对的或明确的威胁。
en: Capitalism is arguably less stable than the Frankfurt School theory recognises, but neither has it been continually confronted by the implicit or explicit threat of a revolutionary working-class movement.

zh: 如果这种推论似乎有理的话，那么通俗文化就不可能按照它确保资本主义持续稳定的基本作用来理解。
en: If this is the case, popular culture cannot be seen as playing a functional role in ensuring the continued stability of capitalism.

zh: 在巴特看来，撇开法国古典主义的做作不论，它既不是中立的和普遍的，也不是自然的和必然的。
en: For Barthes, French classicism, irrespective of its pretensions, is neither neutral and universal nor natural and inevitable.

zh: 相反，必须把它置于它的历史语境和社会语境之中。
en: Instead, it has to be located in its historical and social contexts.

zh: 照此，极为重要的是17世纪和19世纪之间资产阶级霸权的崛起，以及从1850年代以来出现的对这一霸权的挑战。
en: As such, it is central to the rise of bourgeois hegemony between the seventeenth and nineteenth centuries, and to the emergence of challenges to this hegemony from the 1850s onwards.

zh: 普韦布洛人不知道什么是自设苦刑。
en: The Pueblos do not understand self-torture.

zh: 每个人的手都有五个指头，不会短缺。除非它们为得到巫法忏悔而受到折磨，它们是不能给予伤害的。
en: Every man's hand has its five fingers, and unless they have been tortured to secure a sorcery confession they are unscarred.

zh: 与之相关，文化与政治的民主化进程在利维斯主义者看来简直是天方夜谭。
en: The threat of democracy in matters both cultural and political is a terrifying thought for Leavisism.

zh: 此外，利维斯夫人还声称：“权力的拥有者不再是知识权威和文化的代表。
en: Moreover, according to Q.D. Leavis, ‘The people with power no longer represent intellectual authority and culture’.

zh: ”和阿诺德一样，她也认为传统权威的坍塌是伴随着大众民主的兴起而到来的。
en: Like Arnold, she sees the collapse of traditional authority coming at the same time as the rise of mass democracy.

zh: 欲望通常来自日常生活之外，可对于大多数女性而言却只能通过一种日常生活行为获得满足，那就是购物。
en: Desire is generated for something more than the everyday, yet it can only be accomplished by what is for most women an everyday activity--shopping.

zh: 女性杂志、文章广告、时尚信息、家居装饰、烹饪化妆……上述种种所竭力兜售的，乃是一种既成功且怡人的女性气质。
en: What is ultimately being sold in the fictions of women’s magazines, in editorial or advertisements, fashion and home furnishing items, cookery and cosmetics, is successful and therefore pleasurable femininity.

zh: 只有采纳了某些建议，或购买了某些东西，才能成为一个更好的恋人、更好的母亲、更好的妻子以及更好的女人。
en: Follow this practical advice or buy this product and be a better lover, a better mother, a better wife, and a better woman.

zh: 对瓦利斯•巴奇来说，埃赫那顿是“宗教狂，他不容异说，骄傲自大而又固执己见，但又是个诚挚与直率的人。
en: To E. A. Wallis Budge, Ikhnaton was "a religious fanatic, intolerant, arrogant and obstinate, but earnest and sincere."

zh: ”他说，“除了半疯狂的人而外”，没有人“敢于如此无视现实，以至于试图废除阿门及对他的崇拜。”
en: No one, he says, "but a half-insane man would have been so blind to facts as to attempt to overthrow Amen and his worship."

zh: 霸权的“均势妥协”还可被用来分析大众文化内部及大众文化所折射出的其他类型的冲突。
en: The compromise equilibrium of hegemony can also be employed to analyse different types of conflict within and across popular culture.

zh: 本内特强调的是阶级冲突，除此之外，族裔、“种族”、性别、代际、性征、身体缺陷等范畴内的冲突也同样适用，因为所有这些冲突都在不同的情况下参与到了旨在对抗主流或宰制性力量之收编的文化斗争之中。
en: Bennett highlights class conflict, but hegemony theory can also be used to explore and explain conflicts involving ethnicity, ‘race’, gender, generation, sexuality, disability, etc.--all are at different moments engaged in forms of cultural struggle against the homogenizing forces of incorporation of the official or dominant culture.

zh: 在对霸权理论的应用中，尤其是在后马克思主义的文化研究范式中，最关键的概念是“接合”(此处本词同时表达了两层意思，一是“表达自己的观点”，二是“与对方建立临时的关联”）。
en: The key concept in this use of hegemony theory, especially in post-Marxist cultural studies, is the concept of ‘articulation’ (the word being employed in its double sense to mean both to express and to make a temporary connection).

zh: 可见弗雷泽不仅是他那代人类学的代言人，而且是现代科学人类学的先驱。
en: Thus Frazer is as much the pioneer in modern scientific anthropology as the spokesman of his generation.

zh: 他的研究方法的根基不能动摇。
en: The ground-work of his approach cannot be rejected.

zh: 比较方法仍是形成人类学科学普遍原理的主要理论工具。
en: The comparative method is still the main theoreThe Interpretation of Culturesal tool for the formulation of general principles of anthropological science.

zh: 关于人类基本需求的假定必须继续是我们深入考察文化现象的出发点。
en: The assumption of man's primary needs must remain the starting point in our inquiry into cultural phenomena.

zh: 人类学和人文学将永远不会完全摒弃进化原理及其基本理论概念（capital outfit)。
en: The evolutionary principle and its capital outfit will never become completely rejected by anthropology or humanism.

zh: 按照现代人类学的原理，这个理论不值一驳。

en: It is hardly necessary to refute this theory in the light of our modern anthropological principles.

zh: 我们知道，暴力和革命的立法行动是我们现代文明的特征，在原始人中不可能发生。
en: We know that violent and revolutionary acts of legislation are characteristics of our present civilization, but do not occur in primitive humanity.

zh: 我们同时不得不问，这样的革命立法活动是发生了一次然后通过播化而扩布，还是在很多地点都于适当时刻发生。
en: We still would have to ask whether such a revolutionary legislative act occurred once and then spread by diffusion, or whether it occurred in many cases and always at the right moment.

zh: 工业化和城市化带来了三个巨变，重新勾画了文化的地图。
en: As a result of industrialization and urbanization, three things happened, which together had the effect of redrawing the cultural map.

zh: 首先，工业化改变了雇佣者和被雇佣者之间的关系。
en: First of all, industrialization changed the relations between employees and employers.

zh: 原本是基于相互债务责任的雇佣关系变成了如托马斯•卡莱尔所言的对“金钱关系”的渴求。
en: This involved a shift from a relationship based on mutual obligation to one based solely on the demands of what Thomas Carlyle calls the "cash nexus".

zh: 其次，城市化造成了阶级与阶级居住地的彼此分离。
en: Second, urbanization produced a residential separation of classes.

zh: 在对文化整合进行理解时，有一个社会事实必须予以考虑。
en: There is a sociological fact that must be taken into account in any understanding of cultural integration.

zh: 这就是传播的意义，人类学巨大的主体研究已致力于了解人类模仿的事实。
en: This is the significance of diffusion.A vast body of anthropological work has been devoted to plumbing the facts of human imitativeness.

zh: 原始地区特质传播的范围就是极其惊人的人类学事实之一。
en: The extent of the primitive areas over which traits have diffused is one of the most startling facts of anthropology.

zh: 各藩藩界设有哨所关卡，查验过往行人，严禁“出女入炮”，以防止大名私运妇女出境或偷运武器入境。
en: Passport and customs officials were maintained at the frontiers of the fiefs to keep strict watch for 'outgoing women and incoming guns' lest any daimyo try to send his women away and smuggle arms in.

zh: 非经将军许可，大名不能联姻，以防止导致任何政治联盟的危险。
en: No daimyo could contract a marriage without the Shogun's permission lest it might lead to a dangerous political alliance.

zh: 藩与藩之间的通商也受到阻碍，甚至彼此之间不能架桥。
en: Trade between the fiefs was hindered even to the extent of allowing bridges to become impassable.

zh: 伯纳德•罗森伯格（他与大卫•曼宁•怀特同为该书的主编）声称，富庶、安定的美国社会正在遭遇来自群氓文化的非人性的破坏。
en: Bernard Rosenberg (co-editor with David Manning White) argues that the material wealth and well-being of American society are being undermined by the dehumanizing effects of mass culture.

zh: 他最大的担忧在于：“最糟糕的是，群氓文化不仅威胁到了我们的审美趣味，更会铺设一条通向冷酷无情的独裁主义的道路。
en: His greatest anxiety is that, ‘At worst, mass culture threatens not merely to cretinize our taste, but to brutalize our senses while paving the way to totalitarianism’.

zh: ”他还认为，流氓文化既不是美国土生土长的文化，也不是民主制度的必然结果。
en: He claims that mass culture is not American by nature, or by example, nor is it the inevitable culture of democracy.

zh: 在罗森伯格看来，群氓文化在苏联最普遍。
en: Mass culture, according to Rosenberg, is nowhere more widespread than in the Soviet Union.

zh: 其始作俑者不是资本主义，而是科技。
en: Its author is not capitalism, but technology.

zh: 不过，日本从一开始起就未能复制中国那种无等级的社会组织。
en: Japan, however, from the very first, failed to reproduce China's casteless social organization.

zh: 日本所采纳的官位制，在中国是授给那些经过科举考试合格的行政官员的；在日本却授给世袭贵族和封建领主。
en: The official titles Japan adopted were in China given to administrators who had passed the State examinations, but in Japan they were given to hereditary nobles and feudal lords.

zh: 这些就成了日本等级制的组成部分。
en: They became part of the caste arrangements of Japan.

zh: 首先，艾柯建构了该小说以之为基础的一系列对立面。
en: Eco constructs the series of oppositions upon which the novels are based.

zh: 这些对立面与列维斯特劳斯的二元对立面非常相似，可以彼此进行组合与再组合，并且是“直接的和普遍的”。
en: These oppositions, which are very similar to Lévi-Strauss's binary oppositions, can be combined and recombined with each other, and are "immediate and universal".

zh: 它们的“置换和相互作用”意味着，每个对立面的结合、联系和表现在某神程度上可以随着每一部小说而变化。
en: Their "permutation and interaction" means that the combination, association and representation of each opposition can be varied, to some extent, from novel to novel.

zh: 当阿诺德和利维斯惊恐于“无政府状态”，法兰克福学派眼中却只有人们对权力阶级的“遵从”：在这种情况下，“被蒙蔽的大多数”被困在一个“循环往复的操纵性的怪圈里，而整个系统的一致性也就日益增强”。
en: Where Arnold and Leavis saw ‘anarchy’, the Frankfurt School see only ‘conformity’: a situation in which ‘the deceived masses’ are caught in a ‘circle of manipulation and retroactive need in which the unity of the system grows ever stronger’.

zh: 阿多诺曾经对一部美国情景喜剧作出解读。在该剧中，有一位年轻的女教师，每个月只领微薄的薪水（一成不变），而且还经常被校长罚款。
en: Here is Adorno reading an American situation comedy about a young schoolteacher who is both underpaid [some things do not change], and continually fined by her school principal.

zh: 最后，她变得一贫如洗，连饭都吃不饱。
en: As a result, she is without money and therefore without food.

zh: 剧情的笑点在于这名女教师经常想方设法在朋友或熟人处“蹭饭”的情节。
en: The humour of the storyline consists in her various attempts to secure a meal at the expense of friends and acquaintances.

zh: 其结果便是，真实与仿真带给人们的体验别无二致，就像过山车一样绵延不绝，毫无差异。
en: The result is that reality and simulation are experienced as without difference - operating along a roller-coaster continuum.

zh: 而且，仿真有时甚至比真实本身显得更加真实——“比实实在在的东西还棒”。
en: Simulations can often be experienced as more real than the real itself – "even better than the real thing" .

zh: 我们不妨回头想想那部名为《现代启示录》的越战影片——它已经变成衡量表征的现实主义的标杆了。
en: Think of the way in which Apocalypse Now has become the mark against which to judge the realism of representations of America's war in Vietnam.

zh: 在观众眼中，越南战争只有“像”《现代启示录》中展现的那样，才可被称为一场真实的战争。
en: Asking if it has the "look" of Apocalypse Now is virtually the same as asking if it is realistic.

zh: “情义”则既与中国儒教无关，也非来自东方的佛教。
en: But giri owes to no Chinese Confucianism and to no Oriental Buddhism.

zh: 它是日本独有的范畴，不了解情义就不可能了解日本人的行为方式。
en: It is a Japanese category and it is not possible to understand their courses of action without taking it into account.

zh: 日本人在谈及行为的动机、名誉以及他在本国所遇到的各种麻烦时，都经常要说到“情义”。
en: No Japanese can talk about motivations or good repute or the dilemmas which confront men and women in his home country without constantly speaking of giri.

zh: 巴尔特指出：“是符号学使我们了解到神话的历史意向，及其妄图将政治观念自然化的野心。在当下，这一过程指的就是中产阶级的意识形态。
en: According to Barthes, "Semiology has taught us that myth has the task of giving an historical intention a natural justification, and making contingency appear eternal. Now this process is exactly that of bourgeois ideology".

zh: ”在巴尔特眼中，“神话是在历史质地丧失的过程中被建构出来的；在神话中，事物全然失去了自己曾经是"人造之物"的记忆”。
en: His argument is that "myth is constituted by the loss of the historical quality of things: in it, things lose the memory that they once were made".

zh: 工人阶级……粗野而未开化……长久以来半隐于贫困与肮脏之中……如今竟然从藏身之所跳了出来，宣称自己和所有英国人一样拥有上天赐予的自由。他们想在哪游行就在哪游行，想在哪聚会就在哪聚会，想说什么脏话就说什么脏话，想打砸什么地方就打砸什么地方。这真是一件令我们困惑的事。
en: The working class . . . raw and half developed . . . long lain half hidden amidst its poverty and squalor . . . now issuing from its hiding place to assert an Englishman's heaven born privilege of doing as he likes, and beginning to perplex us by marching where it likes, meeting where it likes, bawling what it likes, breaking what it likes.

zh: 麦当娜作为一个文本，甚至作为一系列文本，是不完整的，除非 她被放进社会流通之中。
en: Madonna as a text, or even as a series of texts, is incomplete until she is put into social circulation.

zh: 她的性别政治不在于她的文本性，而 是在于她的功能性。
en: Hergender politics lie not in her textuality, but in her functionality.

zh: 她是一个典型的大众文本，因为她充满了 矛盾——她包含了父权制式的女性性征的意义，同时也包含与 前者相对抗的意义，因为她的性征是她自备的，她可以用她所希望的方式来使用，而不需要男性的同意
en: She is an exemplary popular text because she is so full of feminine sexuality and the resisting ones that her sexuality is hers to use as she wishes in ways that do not require masculine approval.

zh: 不过，没有任何理由猜测这种边缘具有普遍的关联。
en: However, there is no reason to suppose that this hierarchy has universal relevance.

zh: 它也没有必要排斥变化。
en: Nor need it be closed to changes.

zh: “西方古典音乐重在旋律与和谐，而当代波普音乐则重在音色与内涵”，“嘟-呜普”的内涵是“1950年代青少年的波普文化”和“都市街头的各个角落”。
en: "Western classical music focused on melody and harmony, whereas contemporary pop music focuses on timbre and connotation", the connotation of doo-wop being "fifties teen pop culture" and "urban street corners".

zh: 每个驱力都控制着一种特定的表现类型，而每个关键序列在很大程度上都独立于其他序列。
en: Each drive commands a specific type of performance, and each vital sequence is to a large extent independent of others.

zh: 至此，形态和功能的问题，我们只能够证明两者都可以在分析的层次上确定。
en: As regards the problem of form and function, it will be possible to show that we can already define both at this level of analysis.

zh: 我们的关键序列中的每一项，都有其确定的形态。
en: Each of our vital sequences has its definite form.

zh: 每一种都可以从解剖学、生理学和物理学上加以描述。
en: Each can be described in terms of anatomy, physiology and physics.

zh: 在第一次海湾战争开始前几周，《新闻周刊》（1990年12月10日出版）在封面刊出了一张老布什总统表情严肃的特写照片。
en: In the weeks leading up to the first Gulf War, Newsweek (10 December 1990) featured a cover showing a photograph of a serious-looking George Bush.

zh: 照片上方印着一行大标题：“这绝不会成为另一场越战。
en: Above the photograph was the banner headline, ‘This will not be another Vietnam’.

zh: ”该标题源自布什此前所做的一次演讲，原话是：“我知道，国民担心越南战争的悲剧重演。我向大家保证……这绝不会成为另一场越战。”
en: The headline was taken from a speech made by Bush in which he said, ‘In our country, I know that there are fears of another Vietnam. Let me assure you ....this will not be another Vietnam’.

zh: 互文性也许并不是大众文化所独有的。它在“高雅”文化对 《闪灵》进行的阅读中，也起到了重要作用。但是，它的运作方式是不同的。
en: Intertextuality may not be unique to popular culture—it was central to the "high" cultural readings of The Shining as well, but it works differently.

zh: 高雅文化围绕“作者艺术家”建立互文关系，这比围绕类型或性别政治建立的互文性要有限许多，而且髙雅文化将文本视为技巧高超的对象。
en: The high cultural intertextual relations organized around the author-artist are more limiting than ones organized around genre or gender politics, and they accord well with the status of the text as a crafted object.

zh: 如阿诺德、利维斯和某些美国群氓文化理论家一样，法兰克福学派对大众文化问题的论述根本就是一种居髙临下、对他人的文化指手画脚的话语（一种严格区分了“我们”和“他们”的话语）。
en: Like the perspective developed by Arnold, Leavisism and some of the American mass culture theorists, the Frankfurt School perspective on popular culture is essentially a discourse from above on the culture of other people (a discourse of ‘us’ and ‘them’).

zh: 不过，法兰克福学派还是对那些出于自身利益而深切缅怀昔日“纯洁”、自治的文化传统的保守主义理论家进行了严厉的批判。
en: It is true that the Frankfurt School are very critical of conservative cultural critics who bemoaned the passing of, or threat to, a ‘pure’ autonomous culture for its own sake.

zh: J.M.伯恩斯坦就曾指出，阿多诺“认为保守主义者对髙雅文化的捍卫其实是在通过对一种虚无缥缈的文化实体的缅怀来维护社会的经济现状"。
en: Adorno, as J.M. Bernstein points out, ‘regards the conservative defence of high culture as reflecting an unreflective hypostatization of culture that protects the economic status quo’.

zh: 她是过度和浅白的，她超越了所有性感化的女性身体的规范，而且 用她裸露上腹的服饰来揭露这些规范的浅白性。
en: She is excessive and obvious; she exceeds all the norms of the sexualized female body and exposes their obviousness along with her midriff.

zh: 她对她的肚脐 所作的性感化，戏仿了父权制将女性身体的某些部位性感化的做法。她是一个父权制的文本，但充斥着怀疑态度。
en: Her sexualization of her navel is a parody of patriarchy's eroticization of female body fragments—she is a patriarchal text shot through with skepticism.

zh: 对此，他解释道：“若仅将文本收编视作"空白的戏仿"是决然无法触及本质的。我们需要在混仿机制中添加各种分类，以厘清当下的流行音乐如何对其所窃文本进行反对、拥护与促进。”
en: As he explains, "textual incorporation cannot be adequately understood as “blank parody”. We need categories to add to pastiche, which demonstrate how contemporary pop opposes, celebrates and promotes the texts it steals from".

zh: 大众文化的政治是日常生活的政治。
en: The politics of popular culture is that of everyday life.

zh: 这意味着大众文化在微观政治的层面，而非宏观政治的层面，进行运作，而且它是循序渐进式的，而非激进式的。
en: This means that it works on the micropolitical level, not the macro level, and that it is progressive, not radical.

zh: 它关注的是发生在家庭、切身的工作环境、教室等结构当中，日复一日与不平等权力关系所进行的防商。
en: It is concerned with the day-to-day negotiations of unequal power relations in such structures as the family, the immediate work environment, and the classroom.

zh: 结构主义被 认为与有关心理结构和文化结构普遍特征的各种主张相一致, 也与有关它们在引起可见的社会现象方面的因果作用的主张相 一致。
en: Structuralism claims that mental and cultural structures are universal, and that their causal effects give rise to observable social phenomena.

zh: 在采取符号学的态度时，则不需要具备这样的主张。
en: However, semiology need not be associated with either of these claims.

zh: 这是我在本章里将保持的一种粗略的用法。
en: This is roughly the usage that will be followed in this chapter.

zh: 我意识到，这并不能完 全令人满意，因为人们可以论证说，实际上，结构主义和符号学 以相同的方法研究相同的事物
en: It is not totally satisfactory because structuralism and semiology have studied the same things in similar ways.

zh: 索绪尔对结构主义的发展作出的另一重要贡献是他对语言和言语的区分。
en: Saussure makes another distinction that has proved essential to the development of structuralism.This is the division of language into langue and parole.

zh: 语言指的是人们借以表达的系统、规范与惯例，是一种社会机制。
en: Langue refers to the system of language, the rules and conventions that organize it.

zh: 正如罗兰•巴尔特指出的那样：“索绪尔所谓之语言，就是一个人为融人社区而必须接受的集体契约。
en: This is language as a social institution, and as Roland Barthes  points out, "it is essentially a collective contract which one must accept in its entirety if one wishes to communicate" .

zh: ”而言语指的则是个体言说的方式以及对语言的具体运用。
en: Parole refers to the individual utterance, the individual use of language.

zh: 在进化过程中，无论其为社会进化还是生物进化，我们几乎总是发现新的发展是从旧事物中生长出来，或是以之作为基础的。这里的情况便是如此。
en: In the evolutionary process, whether it be social or biological, we almost always find the new growing out of, or based upon, the old.

zh: 为攫取食物和防御外敌而建立的新的协作组织，是根据已经存在的结构即家庭而建立起来的。
en: And such was the case here; the new co-operative organization for food and defense was built upon a structure already present: the family.

zh: 除窥视欲外，大众电影还催生并满足了另一种快感：“所谓的窥视欲是在自恋的氛围中滋生出来的。
en: Popular cinema promotes and satisfies a second pleasure: ‘developing scopophilia in its narcissistic aspect’ (ibid.).

zh: ”（同上）此处，墨维援引拉康的“镜像阶段”理论（前文中有介绍），指出由电影制造出来的身份认同的快感与儿童的“自我”的构成具有高度的相似性。
en: Here Mulvey draws on Lacan’s account of the ‘mirror stage’ (see earlier section) to suggest that there is an analogy to be made between the constitution of a child’s ego and the pleasures of cinematic identification.

zh: 就像婴儿会对镜中自己的影像产生认同和误认一样，观众也会对银幕上的“自我”产生认同和误认。
en: Just as a child recognizes and misrecognizes itself in the mirror, the spectator recognizes and misrecognizes itself on the screen.

zh: 若想对“自然而然的”性别和异性恋霸权的虚构意识形态展开讨论，最佳方式莫过于从酷儿理论的奠基之著——茱迪丝•巴特勒那部影响深远的《性别麻烦》——入手。
en: To discuss the supposed naturalness of gender and the ideological fictions supporting compulsory heterosexuality, there is no better place to begin than with one of the founding texts of queer theory, Judith Butler's very influential book Gender Trouble.

zh: 巴特勒首先援引西蒙娜•德•波伏娃的名言：“女人并非生为女人，而是后天变成女人的”。
en: Butler begins from Simone de Beauvoir's  observation that "one is not born a woman, but, rather, becomes one".

zh: 波伏娃将人的性别划分为生物性别(“自然的”）和社会性别(“文化的”）两种，进而指出：尽管生物性别是天生稳定的，但后天之中却始终存在各种各样相互竞争的（因历史和社会的不同而异）女性气质和男性气质的“版本”。
en: De Beauvoir's distinction establishes an analytical difference between biological sex ("nature") and gender ("culture"), suggesting that while biological sex is stable, there will always be different and competing (historically and socially variable) "versions" of femininity and masculinity.

zh: 身体及其快感一直是并且仍将是权力与规避、规训与解放 相互斗争的场所。在这一章，我希望探索此中的一些方式。虽 然身体看起来是我们最个人化的部分，但它也是身体政治（阶级性的身体、种族性的身体以及性别化的身体）的物质形式。
en: In this chapter, I wish to trace some of the ways in which the body and its pleasures have been, and continue to be, the site of a struggle between power and evasion, discipline and liberation; though the body may appear to be where we are most individual, it is also the material form of the body politic: the class body, the racial body, and the body of gender.

zh: 对于那些不怎么爱看通俗小说的人而言，最大的危险则来自电影。
en: For those not addicted to popular fiction, there is always the danger of cinema.

zh: 电影大行其道，已成为一个极度危险的快感之源：“电影有一种催眠术般的魔力，使人们沦陷于廉价的情感诉求中不能自拔。这种诉求用心险恶，因为它伴随着关于真实生活的某种不由自主且栩栩如生的幻觉。”
en: Its popularity makes it a very dangerous source of pleasure indeed: "they [films] involve surrender, under conditions of hypnotic receptivity, to the cheapest emotional appeals, appeals the more insidious because they are associated with a compellingly vivid illusion of actual life" .

zh: 或者以礼仪规则为例。在某些社会中不准许男人戴耳环或使用口红。
en: Or, take the rules of etiquette: A man in a certain society is not permitted to wear earrings or to use lipstick.

zh: 这些限定的目的是为了在社会中确立个人的等级：男人、女人和僧侣等等，是以一定方式积极活动的个人，他（她）必须限制某些类别的行为。
en: The purpose of these restrictions is to define classes of individuals within society: a man, woman, priest, etc., is an individual who behaves positively in a certain manner and who must refrain from certain kinds of acts.

zh: 大众文明及伴随而来的群氓文化架设了一个极具破坏力的战场，时刻威胁着我们，要使我们“不可避免地陷人混乱之中”。
en: Mass civilization and its mass culture pose a subversive front, threatening‘to land us in irreparable chaos’.

zh: 正是为了与大众文明展开斗争，利维斯主义才登上了历史舞台，竭力鼓吹“要在学校教育中加人抵制（群氓文化）的训练”。在学校之外，利维斯主义主张“‘少数人’应当武装起来，主动出击，自觉地采用各种抵抗的形式”。
en: It is against this threat that Leavisism writes its manifestos, and proposes ‘to introduce into schools a training in resistance [to mass culture]’; and outside schools, to promote a ‘conscious and directed effort . . . [to] take the form of resistance by an armed and active minority’ (Q.D. Leavis, 1978: 270).

zh: 与之相关，文化与政治的民主化进程在利维斯主义者看来简直是天方夜谭。
en: The threat of democracy in matters both cultural and political is a terrifying thought for Leavisism.

zh: 马克思主义一度是英国文化研究最主要的理论体系，如今却面临着来自后现代主义批评家的质疑。他们认为马克思主义带有目的论色彩，质疑其宏大叙事、实在论、经济主义、欧洲中心主义，及其在整个启蒙运动中的地位。不仅如此，东欧巨变后，社会主义运动名誉扫地，也令马克思主义饱受苛责。（McRobbie，1992: 719)
en: Marxism, a major point of reference for the whole cultural studies project in the UK, has been undermined not just from the viewpoint of the postmodern critics who attack its teleological propositions, its meta-narrative status, its essentialism, economism, Eurocentrism, and its place within the whole Enlightenment project, but also, of course, as a result of the events in Eastern Europe, with the discrediting of much of the socialist project (719).

zh: 许多新国家马上受到这两类问题的困扰。
en: Many of the new states are plagued by both these sorts of problems at once.

zh: 首先，大多数国家之间的原生运动并没有涉及所有的分离国家，就像“泛”字开头的运动至少倾向于所做的那样，而是涉及到散居在几个国家中的少数民族。例如，统一和主权孟加尔运动，也许至此只是一种不成形的情感，目的是建立一个统一的主权的孟加拉国——即独立于印度与巴基斯坦的大孟加拉国。
en: In the first place, most interstate primordial movements do not involve entire separate countries, as the pan-movements at least tend to do, but rather minorities scattered through several, for example:  the movement, or perhaps it is so far only a formless sentiment, for a unified and sovereign Bengal—greater Bangladesh—independent of both India and Pakistan.

zh: 不过，另一些人则把美国与民主、现代性、合理性和科学联系起来。
en: Others, however, associated America with democracy, modernity, rationality and science.

zh: 例如，科学家T.H.赫胥黎认为，美国代表着科学的、合理的未来的前途。
en: The scientist T.H.Huxley, for example, saw America as representing the promise of a scientific and rational future.

zh: 赫胥黎是个乐观主义者，对他来说，试图维护衰落中的社会形式与文化形式毫无真正的益处。
en: Huxley was an optimist who saw little benefit in trying to preserve social and cultural forms which were in decline.

zh: 在第一章中我们曾经讨论过英国保守党在政治节目中将红色监狱栅栏用作“社会主义”的意象的例子。
en: I discussed in Chapter 1 how the Conservative Party presented a party political broadcast that concluded with the word ‘socialism’ being transposed into red prison bars.

zh: 此举显然表明保守党试图在次级指意系统（内涵系统）内将“社会主义”这个词固定到“限制、囚禁、反自由”等意义上。
en: This was undoubtedly an attempt to fix the secondary signification or connotations of the word ‘socialism’ to mean restrictive, imprisoning, against freedom.

zh: 在巴尔特眼中，这一“固定新内涵”的行为是在对神话的生产—对意识形态的生产—过程中完成的。
en: Barthes would see this as an example of the fixing of new connotations in the production of myth--the production of ideology.

zh: 约翰•斯盖特古德将对血统的关注与奴隶制的存废问题结合起来。他在1792写道:一旦允许废除奴隶制，“世界各地的黑人都会跑到我们的国家来，聚众扎堆，与本地人杂居，进而玷染我们普通人的血统，导致犯罪率和罪犯人数的飙升。如此一来，英国将变成整个地球的污水槽，充斥着杂种、暴徒和游手好闲的流浪汉”。
en: Linking this concern directly to the abolition of slavery, John Scattergood, writing in 1792, argued that if slavery is allowed to end, "the Negroes from all parts of the world will flock hither, mix with the natives, spoil the breed of our common people, increase the number of crimes and criminals, and make Britain the sink of all the earth, for mongrels, vagrants, and vagabonds".

zh: 今日，女性主义至少涵括了四个截然不同的流派，分别是激进女性主义、马克思主义女性主义、自由主义女性主义，以及西尔维娅•沃尔比所言之“双重系统理论”。
en: There are at least four different feminisms: radical, Marxist, liberal and what Sylvia Walby calls dual-systems theory.

zh: 每一流派都从特定的角度揭示女性所受之社会压迫，并根据不同的原因提出相应的解决方案。
en: Each responds to women’s oppression in a different way, positing different causes and different solutions.

zh: 激进女性主义认为造成女性受压迫地位的首恶是父权制，在这一社会系统内，男性群体得以将自己的权力凌驾于女性群体之上。
en: Radical feminists argue that women’s oppression is the result of the system of patriarchy, a system of domination in which men as a group have power over women as a group.

zh: 她是过度和浅白的，她超越了所有性感化的女性身体的规范，而且用她裸露上腹的服饰来揭露这些规范的浅白性。
en: She is excessive and obvious; she exceeds all the norms of the sexualized female body and exposes their obviousness along with her midriff.

zh: 她对她的肚脐所作的性感化，戏仿了父权制将女性身体的某些部位性感化的做法。她是一个父权制的文本，但充斥着怀疑态度。
en: Her sexualization of her navel is a parody of patriarchy's eroticization of female body fragments—she is a patriarchal text shot through with skepticism.

zh: 大众文明及伴随而来的群氓文化架设了一个极具破坏力的战场时刻威胁着我们，要使我们“不可避免地陷入混乱之中”。
en: Mass civilization and its mass culture pose a subversive front, threatening ‘to land us in irreparable chaos’.

zh: 正是为了与大众文明展开斗争，利维斯主义才登上了历史舞台，竭力鼓吹“要在学校教育中加人抵制（群氓文化）的训练"（Leavis，1933: 188—9)。在学校之外，利维斯主义主张“‘少数人’应当武装起来，主动出击，自觉地采用各种抵抗的形式”（Q.D. Leavis，1978: 270)。
en: It is against this threat that Leavisism writes its manifestos, and proposes ‘to introduce into schools a training in resistance [to mass culture]’ (Leavis, 1933: 188–9); and outside schools, to promote a ‘conscious and directed effort . . . [to] take the form of resistance by an armed and active minority’ (Q.D. Leavis, 1978: 270).

zh: 与之相关，文化与政治的民主化进程在利维斯主义者看来简直是天方夜谭。
en: The threat of democracy in matters both cultural and political is a terrifying thought for Leavisism.

zh: 为生产所有这些器物，他们必须遵循技术规范，调节集体行为，并通过一系列活动来使知识、法律和伦理传统保持活力。如作分析，这些活动可表现为经济的、法律的、教育的、政治的、科学的、巫术的、宗教的以及伦理的。
en: To produce all objects, they must follow the techniques, regulate collective behavior, and keep alive the tradition of knowledge, law, and ethics by a system of activities which, on analysis, can be shown to be economic, legal, educational, political, scientific, magical, religious, and ethical.

zh: 物质设备、社会团结、个人培训以及能力发展等方面若出现长期退化，则最终不仅导致文化解体，而且会引发饥荒、大规模疫病、个人效能衰退，当然，还会有明显的人口下降。
en: A permanent deterioration in material equipment, in social solidarity, in the training of the individual and the development of his abilities, would lead in the long run, not merely to the disorganization of culture, but also to starvation, large-scale disease, the deterioration of personal efficiency, hence also, obviously, to depopulation.

zh: 现在还应更为确切地界定，身为社会研究一员的人类学，为什么和凭什么宣称自己是一门能使人的研究变得更加科学的直接贡献者。
en: It remains now to define more specifically why and in what manner anthropology, of all social studies,can claim to be a direct contributor towards making the Study of Man more scientific.

zh: 我首先要说明，科学方法明显不是人文学科领域中惟一的关注点和灵感源泉。
en: I would like to state first that the scientific approach is obviously not the only interest or inspiration in the domain of humanism.

zh: 道德或哲学的观点；美学的、人道的或神学的热忱或灵感；因过去以一种既无需证实又无法否认，而使人神往，产生要知其为何物的欲望——这些都是所有人文学科的合法动机，如此等等。
en: Moral or philosophical points of view;aesthetic, humanitarian, or theological zeal or inspiration;the desire to know what the past was because the past appeals to our sentiments in a manner which need not be vindicated but cannot be gainsaid all these are legitimate motivations in all humanities.

zh: 历史学和社会学、经济学和法学，必须仔细地、认真地、谨慎地将它们的基础置于科学方法的基石之上。
en: History and sociology, as well as economics and jurisprudence, must lay their foundations carefully, consciously and deliberately, on the bedrock of scientific method.

zh: 社会科学还必须发展出心智力以控制机械力。
en: Social science also must develop into the power of mind used for the control of mechanical power.

zh: 人文学科永远不会没有艺术的、情感的、道德的因素。
en: Humanism will never cease to have its artistic, sentimental and moral elements.

zh: 但伦理原则的内在精髄正是中肯确切，这一特质只有在伦理像依赖情感一样地忠实于事实的时候才能获得。
en: But the very essence of ethical principles demands its cogency, and this can only be attained if the principle is as true to fact as it is indispensable to sentiment.

zh: 融合文化的出现是三个因素共同作用的结果。
en: Convergence culture is the result of three factors.

zh: 第一个因素是传媒所有权的集中。
en: The first is concentration of media ownership.

zh: 对多种平台的占有促使传媒巨头们在不同平台之间传播媒体内容。
en: Owning a range of different platforms encourages producers to distribute content across these different platforms.

zh: 例如，某传媒公司拍摄了一部电影，又出版了一本关于此部电影的书，同时还推出了相关的电子游戏，并通过自己旗下的杂志、报纸、网站以及手机公司对上述产品进行推广促销。
en: So, for example, a company may publish the book of the film, together with the game based on both and promote these in its magazines and newspapers and through its internet sites and mobile phone companies.

zh: 普韦布洛人对死亡的日神式态度，既不能免除亲人死亡，也不能避免对敌人的杀戮；最多能使它们成为祝福之源，并提供以最小的暴烈情绪超度它们的手段。
en: The Apollonian attitude of the Pueblos toward death cannot outlaw the death of relatives nor the killing of enemies; it can at its best only make them sources of blessing and provide means of getting past them with the least violence.

zh: 团体内的杀人极少发生，所以那里几乎没有有关两部杀人记载的传说。如果发生了这种杀人事件，就通过家族集团之间作出的补偿安排，毫不费事地加以解决。
en: Homicide, the taking of life within the group, occurs so seldom that there are hardly even tales remembered of it, but it occurs, it is settled without ado by payment arranged between the kin groups.

zh: 在消费社会中，所有的商品既有实用价值，也有文化价值。
en: In a consumer society, all commodities have cultural as well as functional values.

zh: 倘若将这一要点模式化，我们必须扩展原有的经济概念，把文化经济容纳进去。在文化经济中,流通过程并非货币的周转,而是意义和快感的传播。
en: To model this we need to extend the idea of an economy to include a cultural economy where the circulation is not one of money, but of meanings and pleasures.

zh: 会社的功能是，用一个特设的组织来实施特定的目标、兴趣或理想。组织中的特定功用和活动都指向这个共同目的。
en: The function of associations is the implementing of a specific purpose, interest, or ideal by an ad hoc organization in which specific instrumentalities and activities are directed to the common end.

zh: 在职业群体中，我们看到技能、技术的贯彻，而教育、法律、权力之类的活动则构成该群体的整合功能。
en: In occupational groups we see that the carrying out of skills, techniques, and such activities as education, law, and power, constitute the integral function of the group.

zh: 在摔跤比赛中，比在任何其他的“体育运动”中，都更可能让无秩序的大众的快感，获得自由而公开的表达。
en: In wrestling, probably more than in any other "sport," the disorderly popular pleasures are given free and public expression.

zh: 库宁海姆 (1982)也提到一种不冋却相对应的控制策略：除了试图挪用现有的体育运动之外，中产阶级也发明新的体育项目，譬如网球、 登山运动或者滑雪等。在这些项目中，中产阶级的精神风尚可 以播种在处女地上，而其成长也可以避开工人阶级“野草”的竞争。
en: Cunningham (1982) also mentions a different, though parallel, strategy of control: as well as attempting to appropriate existing sports, the middle classes also invented new sports, such as tennis, mountaineering, or skiing, where their ethos could be planted on virgin soil and could flourish free from the competition of working-class weeds.

zh: 除非将要素、“特质”、习俗或观念置于其相关的和真正的制度环境中，否则，它们就难以被界定，也不能被界定。
en: No element, "trait," custom, or idea is defined or can be defined except by placing it within its relevant and real institutional setting.

zh: 因此我们坚持认为这样的制度分析不仅可能而且必不可少。
en: We are thus insisting that such institutional analysis is not only possible but indispensable.

zh: 这里的主张是：制度乃是文化分析的真正单元。
en: It is maintained here that the institution is the real isolate of cultural analysis.

zh: 我们同时主张，任何基于孤立特质或特质丛的讨论或例证只要违背了制度整合的原理，就必定有误。
en: It is also maintained that any other type of discussion or demonstration in terms of isolated traits or trait complexes, other than those which would follow the institutional integration, must be incorrect.

zh: 弗雷泽曾经影响过弗朗斯、伯格森、汤恩比和斯宾格勒等人物。
en: Frazer has influenced men like Anatole France, Bergson, Arnold Toynbee and O.Spengler.

zh: 与其他任何作者相比，弗雷泽不仅使民族志证据更为现成，而且更多地激励了历史学和心理学、哲学和伦理学领域的先锋思想家。
en: Frazer, more than any other writer, has made ethnographic evidence available as well as inspiring to a host of pioneer thinkers in history and psychology, in philosophy and ethics.

zh: 只消把受到人类学激励和影响的课题列出清单，这一点就一目了然：禁忌和图腾、巫术和族外婚、原始宗教形态和政治制度发展。
en: This can be seen when the subjects with which anthropology has affected or inspired other studies are listed: taboo and totemism, magic and exogamy, forms of primitive religion and the development of political institutions.

zh: 所有这些课题都经过弗雷泽的首先处理或充分研究。
en: All these subjects have been first handled or most adequately treated by Frazer.

zh: 在这里，文字是通过两种方式发挥作用的。
en: The linguistic message works in two ways.

zh: 一方面，它使读者获知图片的外延意义，即“这是一位表情凝重的摇滚乐明星”；而另一方面，它限制了图像的潜在内涵的“增生”过程，让我们明确这位摇滚乐明星之所以表情凝重，是因为他的一位挚友死于过量吸毒，因此，图中人是在深思“究竟毒品在摇滚乐文化中扮演了何种角色”的问题。
en: It helps the reader to identify the denotative meaning of the image: this is a rock star looking reflective.Second, it limits the potential proliferation of the connotations of the image: the rock star is reflective because of the drug overdose by one of his closest friends.Therefore, the rock star is contemplating the role of drugs in rock music culture.

zh: 此外，说明文字还有一个功能，那就是想方设法使读者相信内涵的意义是在外延的层面上展示出来的。
en: Moreover, it tries to make the reader believe that the connotative meaning is actually present at the level of denotation.

zh: 然而，符号学的任务是要超越这些外延，达到符号的内涵。
en: But the task of semiology is to go beyond these denotations to get to the connotations of the sign.

zh: 这么做揭示了神话如何通过特定的各种符号起作用。在这个方面，可以发现神话建构的、虚构的和历史的定位。
en: Doing this reveals how myth works through particular signs, and shows how the constructed, manufactured and historical location of the myth can be discovered.

zh: 因时，神话的种种内涵可以得到确认：这看起来是一束玫瑰花，但它表示激情；这看起来是一幅黑人士兵向法国国旗敬礼的照片，但它的确表示了法帝主义的伟大和公正。
en: The connotations of myths can thus be identified: this may appear to be a bunch of roses but it connotes passion; or this may appear to be a photo of a black soldier saluting the French flag, but it really connotes the grandeur and impartiality of French imperialism.

zh: 这些看法在19世纪中、后期的“为艺术而艺术”运动中得到了最为极端的张扬。
en: These ideas received their extreme expression in the "art for art’s sake" movement in the  mid-to-late  nineteenth  century.

zh: 这是对资本主义工业化和文化商业化的出现的反应，也是对它们给艺术作品的韵味造成的威胁的回应。
en: This was a reaction to the emergence of capitalist industrialisation and the commercialisation of culture, and the threats they posed to the aura of the work of art.

zh: 本雅明最为关心的，正是“机械复制时代”的这些影响。
en: It is these effects of "the age of mechanical reproduction" with which Benjamin is most concerned.

zh: 隐匿在“宿命论”和“失败主义”指责背后的，是一种更深层次的批驳观念。
en: Implicit in the charge of "fatalism" and "defeatism" is the further notion of refutation.

zh: 将一种观点冠以“宿命论”，对许多学究来说，也就是将其宣布为错误的。
en: To brand a view "fatalistic" is, to many minds, to call it false as well.

zh: “文化决定论”是宿命论，因此是错误的”，如果要将其推理方法明确表述出来，大概就是如此。
en: "Cultural determinism is fatalistic and therefore false," is about the way the reasoning would go if it were made explicit.

zh: 如我们所见，文明社会的社会系统分裂为统治阶级与被剥削阶级。
en: The social system of civil society was, as we have seen, divided into a ruling class and an exploited class.

zh: 后者创造财富，而前者则占有绝大部分财富。以至留给后者的不过是最低限额的生存资料而已。
en: The latter produced the wealth; the former appropriated so large a portion of it as to leave the latter with but minimum means of subsistence.

zh: 通过对斯密进行症候式解读，马克思得以对“斯密著作的原始的可见的问题域，与包含在似是而非的无法回答任何问题的答案中的不可见的 问题域两者之间的冲突”进行分析（28)。
en: By a symptomatic reading of Smith, Marx is able to construct for analysis ‘the problematic initially visible in his writings against the invisible problematic contained in the paradox of an answer which does not correspond to any question posed’ (28).

zh: 马克思本人曾经如是评价斯密：“理解亚当•斯密的自相矛盾之处很重要，因为正是这些自相矛盾让我们看到了他如何通过瞒天过海的方式掩盖了自己无法解决的实实在在的问题。”（Marx，1951: 146)
en: Marx (1951) himself says this of Smith, ‘Adam Smith’s contradictions are of significance because they contain problems which it is true he does not solve, but which he reveals by contradicting himself’ (146).

zh: 而且，由于武士道曾经是国家主义者和军国主义者的口号，随着这些领导人的信誉扫地，武土道的概念也正在受到怀疑。
en: Besides, it became a slogan of the nationalists and militarists and the concept is discredited with the discrediting of those leaders.

zh: 这绝不意味着日本人今后不再“懂情义”。
en: That will by no means mean that the Japanese will no longer 'know giri.'

zh: 恰恰相反，现在正是西方人应当理解“情义”在日本的含义的更加重要的时期。
en: It is more important than ever for Westerners to understand what giri means in Japan.

zh: 对此，他解释道：“若仅将文本收编视作"空白的戏仿"是决然无法触及本质的。我们需要在混仿机制中添加各种分类，以厘清当下的流行音乐如何对其所窃文本进行反对、拥护与促进。”
en: As he explains, "textual incorporation cannot be adequately understood as “blank parody”. We need categories to add to pastiche, which demonstrate how contemporary pop opposes, celebrates and promotes the texts it steals from".

zh: 正因电视观众有能力将自己的日常生活与屏幕上那个德州豪门联系起来，我们才可言称《豪》剧体现了“情感现实主义”。
en: It is this ability to make our own lives connect with the lives of a family of Texan millionaires that gives the programme its emotional realism.

zh: 也许我们并不是有钱人，但我们和剧中的富家子弟之间存在着共通之处:悲欢离合，生老病死，诸如此类。
en: We may not be rich, but we may have other fundamental things in common: relationships and broken relationships, happiness and sadness, illness and health.

zh: 那些认为该剧现实的观众，有的将注意力集中在叙事的独特性（“外延”）上，有的则关心剧情主题的普遍性（“内涵”）。
en: Those who find it realistic shift the focus of attention from the particularity of the narrative ("denotation") to the generality of its themes ("connotation").

zh: 我们已经看到文化对新陈代谢的某个或某些需求的反应构成了一套制度。
en: We see already that the cultural response to the particular need or needs imposed by metabolism consists of a set of institutions.

zh: 此处列举的制度往往并不是仅仅关乎营养而不及其他。
en: Few of the institutions here enumerated are exclusively concerned with nutrition alone.

zh: 同时，正是家庭和家户的构造本身使得这种群体必然成为消费过程——往往也是食物制作过程——的主导场所。
en: At the same time, the very constitution of the family and of the household makes it indispensable for this group to be the predominant setting for the processes of consumption, and as a rule, also of preparation of food.

zh: 弗雷泽深深沉迷于对人类信仰和实践的心理学解释。
en: Frazer was essentially addicted to psychological interpretations of human belief and practice.

zh: 他解释巫术是观念联想的结果。他对图腾起源提出的三个连续假说，即对“灵魂外在”、“巫术诱致生育”和“动物转世投胎”的信奉，基本是受到个体心理学的影响。
en: His theory of magic, as the result of association of ideas; his three consecutive hypotheses about the origins of totemism in terms of belief in "external soul," "magical inducement of fertility," and in "animal incarnation," are essentially conceived in terms of individual psychology.

zh: 了解弗雷泽如何对待禁忌对待图腾制各方面，对待巫术、宗教和科学的人，都能看出弗雷泽在阐明其理论时几乎很少意识到社会心理学问题的存在。
en: Those who know his treatment of taboo, of the various aspects of totemism, of the development of magic, religion and science, will realize that, throughout, Frazer in his explicit theories is little aware of the problems of social psychology.

zh: 如同前述，他对心理分析怀有深刻敌意，而行为主义又从来没有进人他的话语体系。
